DESCRIPTION:
Vangie works hard to support her family. Vangie is married and has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Vangie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Vangie has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and fishing.

She would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Vangie works hard to support her family. Vangie is married and has a buying and selling of charcoal business in the Philippines.

Vangie requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

Vangie has been in this business for five years now, and also earns additional income from rice retailing and fishing.

She would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of five children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell  for her general store business.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of five children, Jenalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Jenalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to  buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell  for her general store business.

Jenalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc., to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Maria Edelin works hard to support her family. Maria Edelin is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines.

Maria Edelin requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear items to sell to her customers.

Maria Edelin has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Maria Edelin would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maria Edelin works hard to support her family. Maria Edelin is married and has a business buying and selling ready-to-wear items in the Philippines.

Maria Edelin requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional ready-to-wear items to sell to her customers.

Maria Edelin has been in this business for 22 years now.

In the future, Maria Edelin would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional ready to wear items to sell to her customers

DESCRIPTION:
Ce groupe de 20 membres fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le 16 juin 2013. Ce dernier regroupe des femmes commerçantes qui habitent dans le même quartier. Un lien de parenté, de voisinage ou d’amitié les unis.
Aissata debout sur la photo et levant la main pour se montre en tant que vedette, est âgée de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants dont 2 garçons.
Elle envisage de faire de l’embouche ovine pour l’opération de la Tabaski prochaine. Elle compte aussi vendre du pain.
 Elle va acheter avec le prêt 2 moutons à 40000f l’unité pour revendre après élevage à 70000f chacun.
Les bénéfices serviront à assurer ses besoins personnels et contribuer aux charges familiales.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This group of twenty women are all part of the 'banc villageois' which was created on 16th June 2013.  They are all retailers who live in the same neighbourhood, and are united by family, neighbourhood and friendship connections.

Aissata (standing with her hand raised in the photo) is the group representative.  She is 42 years old, married and has five children (of whom two are boys).  She plans to raise sheep for the next Tabaski festival.  Aissata plans to buy two sheep for 40,000 francs CFA a head, fatten them up and then resell them for 70,000 francs CFA a head.  She will also use her loan to buy bread.

The profits will be used to provide for her personal expenses and help with her family's costs.
LOAN_USE: to buy sheep for fattening up.
BORROWER_NAMES: FATOU, COMUBA, NDEYE AMY, KHOUDIA, GUENE, AWA, FATOU, NDEYE, AISSATTA, NDEYE, YEMOU, COUMBA, AMINATA, BINTA, NDIEME, FATMA, NDEYE, DIOUMA, MARAME, NDEYE DIOP
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Bibi's daughter, Santoshini (Bibi is pictured here with her daughter Santoshini) is a 16-year-old girl pursuing class 10 at Govt High School. She is staying with her parents in Khurda. 

Bibi is a private employee. Their family's monthly income is around Rs. 10,000 per month. The savings are not sufficient to support the educational expenses of Santoshini. But Bibi wants to provide uninterrupted education to her daughter. 

To support Santoshini‘s education, Bibi is requesting for a loan amount of Rs. 20,000 from Mahashakti Foundation, a field partner of Milaap. She will pay for Santoshini's private coaching fees and other educational expenses of her daughter. The loan will help her to pass her examinations successfully.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Bibi's daughter, Santoshini (Bibi is pictured here with her daughter Santoshini) is a 16-year-old girl pursuing class 10 at Govt High School. She is staying with her parents in Khurda. 

Bibi is a private employee. Their family's monthly income is around Rs. 10,000 per month. The savings are not sufficient to support the educational expenses of Santoshini. But Bibi wants to provide uninterrupted education to her daughter. 

To support Santoshini‘s education, Bibi is requesting for a loan amount of Rs. 20,000 from Mahashakti Foundation, a field partner of Milaap. She will pay for Santoshini's private coaching fees and other educational expenses of her daughter. The loan will help her to pass her examinations successfully.
LOAN_USE: to pay for her private coaching fees and other educational expenses.

DESCRIPTION:
Rosaura tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, está casada y tiene una hija de 2 años de edad. Su esposo se dedica a trabajar como motorista de transporte de pasajeros.

Rosaura, tiene una pequeña tienda de productos de primera necesidad desde hace dos años. Aprendió sobre el comercio por su madre. Actualmente es su única fuente de ingresos, trabaja 6 días a la semana y tiene que caminar 45 minutos desde su casa hasta donde tiene el negocio. El horario de atención a los clientes es de 5:00 am a 4:00 pm.

Rosaura necesita el préstamo para comprar frijoles, azúcar, arroz, jabones, pan, bebidas, huevos, sal, golosinas, aceite, pastillas, etc. para surtir su negocio.

Rosaura sueña con que el negocio mejore más y las ganancias que obtenga las invertirá para diversificarlo. Ella confía en que puede lograr sus metas con el apoyo de los préstamos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rosaura is 23 years old. She completed high school and is married with a 2-year-old daughter. Her husband works as a driver.

Rosaura has run a small general store for two years. She learned about running a business from her mother. Currently, this is her only source of income. Rosaura works 6 days each week and has to walk 45 minutes from her home to her business. She serves her customers from 5:00 am to 4:00 pm.

Rosaura needs this loan in order to buy beans, sugar, rice, soaps, bread, soft drinks, eggs, salt, candies, oil, pills, etc. to stock her store.

Rosaura dreams of improving her business, she will invest her profits in diversifying her products. She believes that she can reach her goals with the help of this loan.
LOAN_USE: to buy beans, sugar, rice, soaps, bread, soft drinks, eggs, salt, candies, oil, pills, etc. to stock her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Emma is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Emma has run a general store in the Philippines for 20 years. She also earns an income from a bakery shop and by selling banana. 

Emma has borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a new one for PHP 18000 to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, drinks, spices, shampoo and other personal care products. 

Emma aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Emma is 50 years old, married, and has six children. She works hard to provide for her family. 

Emma has run a general store in the Philippines for 20 years. She also earns an income from a bakery shop and by selling banana. 

Emma has borrowed and repaid six previous loans from NWTF. She is now requesting a new one for PHP 18000 to purchase additional stocks such as canned goods, noodles, drinks, spices, shampoo and other personal care products. 

Emma aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, noodles, drinks, spices, shampoo and other personal care products.

DESCRIPTION:
Tauavae is twenty-four years of age and is married with four children.

Tauavae  owns & operates a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  She has two years of experience in this business.    Tauavae  needs a loan of WST $1,000 to purchase land to raise additional crops.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 600 talas or US $250 per week) to improve the general living conditions of her family.

Tauavae  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Tauavae 's 2nd loan with SPBD.
LOAN_USE: to purchase land to raise additional crops.

DESCRIPTION:
Florence is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent bills.

For the past four years, she has operated a pharmacy business, selling wholesale and retail to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. Her dream is to establish another pharmacy shop in the future.

With the 100,000 Kenyan shillings she wants to purchase a float for mobile money transfer services (ZAP). She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: To purchase a float for mobile money transfer services (ZAP).

DESCRIPTION:
Mukaramjon was born in the year 1983. She is married and has two children. Mukaramjon always tries for the well-being of her children, and that’s why she works hard.

She works hard, and she is one of the best workers. Mukaramjon little by little with the passing of the time improves her knowledge and ability.

She needs financial support because her father is ill and she must buy medicines for his treatment. She is asking for a loan with this aim. She awaits your mercy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mukaramjon was born in the year 1983. She is married and has two children. Mukaramjon always tries for the well-being of her children, and that’s why she works hard.

She works hard, and she is one of the best workers. Mukaramjon little by little with the passing of the time improves her knowledge and ability.

She needs financial support because her father is ill and she must buy medicines for his treatment. She is asking for a loan with this aim. She awaits your mercy.
LOAN_USE: to buy medicines for her father’s treatment.

DESCRIPTION: Benon is a hardworking 47-year-old married man with six children, four of whom attend school and all are living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His primary business is cattle fattening, which he supplements with motor vehicle transport in his area. The businesses were started 10 years ago in the rural area with the intention of raising money to support his family. This gentleman says that despite facing issues of prolonged droughts, he hopes to make money and buy more land so that he can expand his farm. Benon intends to use the requested loan to buy pipes, tiles, etc. to complete construction of his toilet and bathroom.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Benon is a hardworking 47-year-old married man with six children, four of whom attend school and all are living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His primary business is cattle fattening, which he supplements with motor vehicle transport in his area. The businesses were started 10 years ago in the rural area with the intention of raising money to support his family. This gentleman says that despite facing issues of prolonged droughts, he hopes to make money and buy more land so that he can expand his farm. Benon intends to use the requested loan to buy pipes, tiles, etc. to complete construction of his toilet and bathroom.
LOAN_USE: to buy pipes, tiles, etc. to complete construction of his toilet and bathroom.

DESCRIPTION:
Esther is a 28-year-old woman living in Kitale with her two children. Her two children are currently in school.

To earn a living she has been engaged in the farming business within her rural home area. Her farm primarily produces eggs, milk, and vegetables for the local market. She runs her farm with the help of one farmhand. She explains that her main business challenge, especially during dry seasons, is the high cost of feed.

Esther has requested a loan in the amount of 41,600 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She hopes her farming business will improve so that it generates more income to meet the education needs of her family.
LOAN_USE: To expand and improve her farming business by purchasing and and insuring a dairy cow

DESCRIPTION:
As a married mother of seven children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Anita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of umbrellas and clothing such as blouses, pants, socks, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married mother of seven children, Anita works hard to support her family.

She has a clothing sales business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Anita is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of umbrellas and clothing such as blouses, pants, socks, and other ready-to-wear clothing.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stocks of umbrellas and clothing such as blouses, pants, socks, and other ready-to-wear clothing

DESCRIPTION:
Natif de Koutiala, Kassim Dembélé est un polygame de  25 ans qui  vit avec ses femmes  et son enfant dans le quartier Kouloukoro de Koutiala ( Région de Sikasso ).
 Diplômé  en comptabilité (CAP) , Kassim n’a pas croisé les bras après les études. Il s’est  vite  intéressé aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment le commerce d’articles divers  il y’a de cela 3 ans. Il a appris cette activité auprès de sa grande sœur qui est vendeuse des tasses au grand marché de Koutiala. Il est très bien connu dans le secteur et reçoit  des commandes de diverses marchandises à travers des petits détaillants de la ville de koutiala. 
Pour pouvoir satisfaire sa clientèle en qualité, il a décidé de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et est à son premier prêt  individuel.  
Avec ce financement, il compte acheter  un important  stocks de marchandises à ACCRA  (la capitale du Ghana) et effectue sa vente sur son étale sis au grand marché  de Koutiala à une clientèle  constituée de femmes et d’hommes, au comptant ou à crédit.
Il compte sur un bénéfice mensuel de 95.000FCFA qu’il envisage utiliser pour le remboursement des intérêts du prêt, contribuer à l’amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille et investir le reste dans son activités.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
A native of Koutiala, Kassim Dembélé is a polygamous man, 25 years old, who lives with his wives and son in the Kouloukoro district of Koutiala (Sikasso region). A certified accountant, he didn't just sit back and do nothing after his studies. He quickly got interesting in working to earn an income, notably in the commerce of various goods three years ago. He learned this business from his older sister, who sells tubs and basins at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Kassim is very well known in the sector and receives special orders for various goods through retailers in the city of Koutiala.

To be able to satisfy his customers quality-wise, he decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is now on his first individual loan. With this financing, he plans to buy a sizable stock of merchandise in ACCRA (capital of Ghana) and to make his sales from a display located at the grand marketplace of Koutiala. Customers are composed of women and men who pay in cash or by credit.

Kassim is counting on a monthly profit of 95,000 francs CFA that he envisions using for making loan interest payments, for helping to improve his family's living conditions, and for investing the rest in his work.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: To buy various merchadise

DESCRIPTION:
Miriam is happily married and has been blessed with two children who depend on her and her husband. She runs a grocery business selling fresh vegetables and fruits to her customers to sustain her family. Her challenge has been a lack of capital to stock her business which has led it to suffer as she has not been able to meet her demand.

Miriam believes that if you assist her with this loan she will be able to boost her business and increase her revenue through which she will be able to pay back her loan. Her dream is to educate her children and expand her business in order to improve the standard of living for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Miriam is happily married and has been blessed with two children who depend on her and her husband. She runs a grocery business selling fresh vegetables and fruits to her customers to sustain her family. Her challenge has been a lack of capital to stock her business which has led it to suffer as she has not been able to meet her demand.

Miriam believes that if you assist her with this loan she will be able to boost her business and increase her revenue through which she will be able to pay back her loan. Her dream is to educate her children and expand her business in order to improve the standard of living for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy more fruits for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Riya Y., age 51, and her husband, Hem Phun, have been married since 1979. They have five children, one son and four daughters. Three of their children are working, and the other two are studying in a local school. Riya and her family live along National Road Number Two, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She has been selling fruit since 1980. She buys the fruit from farms to resell at a market in the village. Her husband has been a house constructor since 1985. \r\n

\r\nRiya is requesting a loan from MAXIMA for the second time, in the amount of $1,000. She will use this money to repair her house.
LOAN_USE: To repair her house

DESCRIPTION:
Mr. Chamreun H. lives in Svay Pak village in Kampong Cham province. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land where he cultivates both rice and vegetables. In these plantations, he faces a problem because he does not have much money to hire laborers to work on the field.

\r\n\r\n In order to deal with this problem, he decided to ask for a loan for this purpose and he would use the rest of the loan to buy rice seeds to grow. His wife, Mrs. Keam Kort, is a pig breeder. Mr. Chamreun H. is 34 years old and the father of two children who are too young to work or study. His wife is also in the photo.
LOAN_USE: to hire laborers and buy rice seeds

DESCRIPTION:
Gulnaz is 36 years old lady and a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been running a curtain business at home for past 8 years.

Gulnaz needs to purchase curtains of different design for resale business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these curtains.

To fulfill the need of her she has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her to buy these curtains for business purpose. That will be good for her to earn more income and this income will support to fulfill her family's needs.

Gulnaz is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Gulnaz is 36 years old lady and a responsible mother of two sons and two daughters. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She has been running a curtain business at home for past 8 years.

Gulnaz needs to purchase curtains of different design for resale business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means she is unable to purchase these curtains.

To fulfill the need of her she has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her to buy these curtains for business purpose. That will be good for her to earn more income and this income will support to fulfill her family's needs.

Gulnaz is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy curtains of different designs for resale purposes.

DESCRIPTION: N. Salama is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is 35 years old and married with 5 children aged 4 to 14 years. She also takes care of her other siblings. Salama has been a tailor ever since she started working in Kitega 13 years ago and she is able to make 150,000UGX  profit a week. She says that she has been able to succeed because of the use of her loans and by giving good customer care that has helped her win more customers. \r\n\r\nN.  has a dream of becoming a wholesaler in the future. She wants to start a tailoring school and teach other people the same trade at a fee. N. also wants to educate her children to the University level. Her loans have helped her to buy a steady supply of clothes for her customers and she would like to have a loan to be able to buy more clothes for sewing and for resale.
LOAN_USE: To buy supplies of clothes for sewing and resale.
BORROWER_NAMES: Mawulo, Fildah, Grace, David, Robinah, Ibrahim, Margaret, Rosette, David, Annet, Salama, Mary, Jane
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, male, female, male, female, female, male, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION: Juana sells fish every day to earn a living. She is 57 years old and lives in Tacloban, Siquijor, Siquijor. She is married with two adult children. Juana has been in this business for three years. She has requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to purchase more fish to sell.\r\n\r\nJuana has been a member of Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative for more than one year. In the future, Juana hopes to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more fish to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Ma. Cenisa is 45 years old and married, with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. Ma. Cenisa is borrowing PHP 16,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ma. Cenisa has been in pig-fattening for ten years and she earns additional income from direct-selling Avon products.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money, so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

DESCRIPTION: Janneh is 45 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and her husband is a mason. They have three children ages 18 to 20; all of them live on their own. For the past fifteen years she has been selling slippers in the local market; sometimes she buys at a very high price and she realizes a very low profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers for her business. In the future she plans to build a house for her children.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Janneh is 45 years old and lives in Caldwell. She is married and her husband is a mason. They have three children ages 18 to 20; all of them live on their own. For the past fifteen years she has been selling slippers in the local market; sometimes she buys at a very high price and she realizes a very low profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase slippers for her business. In the future she plans to build a house for her children.
LOAN_USE: to purchase slippers for her business

DESCRIPTION:
Vard lives in Margara village in the Armavir region of Armenia with her two sons. Because of high unemployment in the region, Vard's two sons work abroad. Meanwhile, Vard runs a farm to grow cabbages, tomatoes, peppers, apricots, cherries and grapes.

Vard has applied for this loan to purchase seed and fertilizer and hire workers to harvest her crops. Vard dreams of developing her farm so that her sons will be able to get involved in agriculture and earn enough income to sustain their families in the future. This loan is important for her to develop the farm and reach this goal.

This is Vard's second loan (she applied for loan to local financial institutions but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time), and she has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Vard lives in Margara village in the Armavir region of Armenia with her two sons. Because of high unemployment in the region, Vard's two sons work abroad. Meanwhile, Vard runs a farm to grow cabbages, tomatoes, peppers, apricots, cherries and grapes.

Vard has applied for this loan to purchase seed and fertilizer and hire workers to harvest her crops. Vard dreams of developing her farm so that her sons will be able to get involved in agriculture and earn enough income to sustain their families in the future. This loan is important for her to develop the farm and reach this goal.

This is Vard's second loan (she applied for loan to local financial institutions but because of very difficult financial conditions, wasn't able to pay it back on time), and she has been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.
LOAN_USE: to purchase seed and fertilizer and hire workers to harvest her crops.

DESCRIPTION:
Tupelele is a 39-year-old married woman with seven children. She has a small plantation and grows taro, yams and taamu to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tupelele has requested a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a rake and a pickaxe. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. With her profits, Tupelele hopes to earn more profit from her plantation to help in her family matters and her kids' education.
LOAN_USE: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a backpack sprayer, a rake and a pickaxe

DESCRIPTION:
Suzan is 36 years old, married and has a child aged 6 years. She sells 'fairly used' clothes and has been in business for the past three years. She is focused on making sure she meets the demand of her customers, which she said will also lead to increase in profit. She wants to expand the size of her business and improve her living standard.

Suzan is asking for a loan of NGN 100,000 to buy more 'fairly used' clothes to sell as this will enable her to get a better discount and make more profit on each sale. She promises to pay back promptly and says thank you to all lenders.
LOAN_USE: To buy more 'fairly used' clothes to sell

DESCRIPTION: Yexi tiene 20 años, es una joven microempresaria que tiene el estado civil de unión libre con su cónyuge Cristian de 19 años y que es un joven chofer profesional y trabaja en una compañía de taxis. Tienen un hijo pequeño y viven juntos en la parroquia Abrahan Calazacón en Santo Domingo la ciudad capital de la Provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, un lugar que  tiene un comercio muy activo ya que se ha convertido en un puerto terrestre de intercambio entre sierra y costa de Ecuador. Además la visita de turistas nacionales y extranjeros aporta al fortalecimiento de las actividades de los emprendedores que desde hace algunos años han establecido sus negocios alrededor de toda la ciudad. Esta ciudad que es la tercera más habitada de la región, también contribuye con actividades como la agricultura, ganadería, pesca y manufactura. \nYexi desde hace 3 años emprendió con el establecimiento de un salón de belleza, pues durante el curso de su secundaria, se especializó en esta rama artesanal la cual disfruta mucho y además cada vez la perfecciona más con cursos que hace en diferentes casas de belleza. Invierte 12 horas cada día incluidos los fines de semana, descansa cuando la demanda del servicio es baja. Su sueño es poder ampliar su salón de belleza con servicios de spa incluidos y así poder dar trabajo a otras personas. Ella solicita un préstamo que lo utilizará en la compra de muebles adecuados para su negocio, sillas en las que pueda brindar confort a sus clientes y también con los que ella pueda desempeñar cómodamente su trabajo, además sillas para atender a niños y muebles para la sala de espera. Yexi cada día incrementa sus clientes por lo que se proyecta a crecer cada día más para el bienestar de su familia. Fundación Alternativa ha sido la institución que le abrió las puertas para poder dar ese cambio que necesita su negocio.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Yexi is 20. She is a young businessperson and is in a common-law marriage with Cristian, 19, who is a young professional driver and works for a taxi company. They have a small child and live together in the Abrahan Calazacón parish in Santo Domingo, the capital city of the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsachilas. Commerce is quite strong in the area, since it is a land port of exchange between the mountains and the coast of Ecuador. Visits from local and international tourists strengthen the local businesses, which have recently grown up all around the city. This is the third-most inhabited city in the region. The residents also work in areas such as agriculture, livestock, fishing, and manufacturing.\r\nYexi opened a beauty salon three years ago. She specialized in this art in high school, and enjoys it greatly. She is constantly honing her skills through courses at various beauty centres. She works twelve hours a day, every day, including weekends. She rests when there is lower demand for her services. Her dream is to be able to expand her beauty salon with spa services in order to be able to provide work for other people. \r\nYexi is requesting a loan which she will use to purchase adequate furniture for her business. She will buy chairs, both to provide her clients with comfort and to allow her to work comfortably. She will also buy chairs for children and furniture for the waiting room. Her clientele grows every day; she expands her business every day for the sake of her family's well-being. Fundación Alternativa opened its doors to her so that she could make this needed change to her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy beauty salon furniture.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs Mạnh is 49 years old and she is a widow, her husband died and all the difficulties of life lay on her shoulders. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry. Mạnh lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Mạnh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to repair her house.

In 2012, Mạnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mạnh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Mạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mrs Mạnh is 49 years old and she is a widow, her husband died and all the difficulties of life lay on her shoulders. She has worked in agriculture raising poultry. Mạnh lives in Nong Cong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her household was recognized by local government as poor, moreover the market need is low in this region.

The main hardship that Mạnh faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to repair her house.

In 2012, Mạnh joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Mạnh has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Mạnh hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sand, cement, bricks and equipment to repair her house.

DESCRIPTION:
John is a young farmer from Sangalo, a remote village in Bungoma, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking among Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. John is happily married, and he and his wife are blessed with five children. Her primary source of income is milk, and she also plants maize on their farm.

Although he earns handsome profits from farming, John faces one big challenge, the high prices of fertilizers, seedlings, and other farming inputs. This is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agrovet shop in his area. John is requesting a loan to start his own agrovet shop. The Sangalo area has only one agro dealer, who caters to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a big profit from farmers by charging them extra since he enjoys a monopoly.

John wants to change this and seize the business opportunity. With your loan, he will start an agrovet shop, and tap into the potential agricultural market. John will also help the smallholder farmers in his area who have, for a long time, been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs.

You can be part of this dream. Go for it, make a loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
John is a young farmer from Sangalo, a remote village in Bungoma, Kenya, who has defied the common thinking among Kenyans that agriculture is for the older generation. John is happily married, and he and his wife are blessed with five children. Her primary source of income is milk, and she also plants maize on their farm.

Although he earns handsome profits from farming, John faces one big challenge, the high prices of fertilizers, seedlings, and other farming inputs. This is a result of the monopoly that is enjoyed by the only agrovet shop in his area. John is requesting a loan to start his own agrovet shop. The Sangalo area has only one agro dealer, who caters to thousands of smallholder farmers who solely depend on him for agricultural inputs. The agro dealer has been making a big profit from farmers by charging them extra since he enjoys a monopoly.

John wants to change this and seize the business opportunity. With your loan, he will start an agrovet shop, and tap into the potential agricultural market. John will also help the smallholder farmers in his area who have, for a long time, been having a serious problem accessing affordable farm inputs.

You can be part of this dream. Go for it, make a loan.
LOAN_USE: to start an agrovet (a shop for farm inputs, such as animal feed, drugs, and pesticides).

DESCRIPTION:
Rosemarie is 40 years old and has three children.

Rosemarie is in the agricultural pig fattening business in the Philippines. Rosemarie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, piglets and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Rosemarie has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Rosemarie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

DESCRIPTION:
Julieta is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a 9,400 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Julieta knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Julieta is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Julieta requested a 9,400 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Julieta knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION: Âgée de 48  ans, Voahirana est  mariée.Le couple a quatre enfants dont deux sont déjà mariés et les deux autres sont encore scolarisés dans des écoles privées. Voahirana a une unité de gargote, et ce depuis 2004.L'unité se trouve dans l'un des grands marchés de la capitale.Son mari l'appuie dans l'activité.Pour rentabiliser l'activité , pour mieux attirer les clients et aussi pour éviter les fréquents déplacements lors de l'approvisionnement, Voahirana a décidé de rénover son unité et d'apporter des améliorations(concernant spécialement aux repas proposés aux clients).D'où son recours à un prêt pour pouvoir acheter 01 marmite, des mètres de la bâche et quelques ingrédients nécessaires pour le gargote.L’objectif est d’offrir des produits et services de qualité afin de pouvoir constituer une épargne. \n\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Voahirana, aged 48, is a married woman. The couple have four children of whom two are already married, and the other two are still students in a private school. Since 2004, she has had a food stall located in one of the major markets in the capital. Her husband supports her at work.

To attract more customers and also to avoid frequent trips for supplies, she decided to renovate her shop and make improvements (especially regarding the meals on offer), hence this loan, which will be used to purchase a cooking pot, several meters of tarp, and a few ingredients for her food stall. Her goal is to offer quality products and services in order to build up her savings.
LOAN_USE: to buy a cooking pot, some tarp, and ingredients for her food stall

DESCRIPTION:
Ligaya Fritzie is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur. She is single and has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines.

Ligaya Fritzie requested a 6,500 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Ligaya Fritzie knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Lilibeth is 37 years old, married, and has four children. With two of her children in school, Lilibeth works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Lilibeth has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items, such as personal care products, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF, in order to purchase more groceries to sell. Lilibeth has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items, such as personal care products, canned goods, and other groceries.

In the future, Lilibeth would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married mother of five children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married mother of five children, Merlyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Merlyn is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more sea foods to sell.

Merlyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more sea foods to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Analiza is a 33-year-old businesswoman from San Leonardo, Nueva Ecija. She is happily married to Arnel and blessed with two children who are still pursuing their studies.

She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business selling chips, breads, canned goods, etc. for about five years. She has been a good client of Alalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. for about six years. Analiza has been granted a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP under the business loan program of ASKI.

Her loan will be used to buy additional products to sell like candies, noodles, and condiments, to generate a higher income to support her family needs. She believes that with help of ASKI, her sari-sari store will turn into grocery store soon.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Analiza is a 33-year-old businesswoman from San Leonardo, Nueva Ecija. She is happily married to Arnel and blessed with two children who are still pursuing their studies.

She has been engaged in a sari-sari store business selling chips, breads, canned goods, etc. for about five years. She has been a good client of Alalay sa Kaunlaran (ASKI) Inc. for about six years. Analiza has been granted a loan amounting to 20,000 PHP under the business loan program of ASKI.

Her loan will be used to buy additional products to sell like candies, noodles, and condiments, to generate a higher income to support her family needs. She believes that with help of ASKI, her sari-sari store will turn into grocery store soon.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional products  to sell like candies, noodles, condiments, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Josephine is 48 years old and married with four children.

Josephine runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, sugar, soap, and other groceries to sell.

Josephine has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION: Drita wants to start a business this summer by selling items to the beachgoers in one of the most populated beaches of the northern Albania. Kindly note that this is only a summer season type of activity, yet the income that someone can generate out of it is very good, according to Drita. \r\n\r\nShe has four young aged children who attend school regularly. Prior to coming to their current location of residence, they lived high up in the very rural region where life was challenging, especially before the infrastructure started developing during these past seven years. Albania nowadays has a very developed infrastructure that makes it a favorite vacation destination for millions of foreign visitors. Last year, Albania was visited by approximately 4 million tourists throughout the year.
LOAN_USE: to stock up on items to sell to beachgoers at a populated beach.

DESCRIPTION:
La Señora. Silvia vive en la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca donde su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.
La Señora. Silvia tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y aun no ha concebido hijos, su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia.
Doña Silvia se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura, estas actividades le han permitido pasar en su casa y aportar a la economía de su hogar, esto le ha ayudado también ser una mujer independiente económicamente. 
El dinero de su crédito va a comprar ganado de mejor calidad. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad, compañerismo, unión y apoyo que tienen todas sus integrantes, quienes están luchando para salir en adelante.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Silvia lives in the Cumbe parish in Cuenca, where the people work in agriculture and cattle raising. Much of the population has migrated to various places in the world, looking for a better quality of life for their families.

Silvia is 29 years old, she is married and has not yet conceived any children. Her husband works as a day laborer, and the house they live in is their own.

Silvia works raising animals and in agriculture. These jobs permit her to to spend time at home and support the household economy, this has also helped her be an economically independent woman.

The money from the loan will purchase better quality cattle. Her credit group likes it for its solidarity, camaraderie, bond and support that all the members have, who are all fighting to get ahead.
LOAN_USE: to purchase cattle.

DESCRIPTION:
La señora Jennifer Samantha y su fmailia viven en la ciudad de Portoviejo lugar con muchos atractivos turísticos que mezclan la playa y paisajes campestres a la vez.
Ella gracias a los créditos continua mejorando su tienda de víveres que tiene en su casa allí vende gran variedad de productos de consumo masivo como arroz, azúcar, aceites, agua colas, entre otros productos, ella cuenta con buena clientela que siempre la prefieren ya que en su local encuentran gran variedad de productos, para ella los créditos le son de mucha ayuda y es por eso que repite este crédito. 
Este crédito es para surtir más su tienda. Su sueño es mejorar su tienda.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jennifer Samantha and her family live in the city of Portoviejo, a place with many tourist attractions that blend the beach and country landscapes at the same time.

Thanks to her loans, she continues to improve her food store that she has in her house. There, she sells a large variety of products for mass consumption like rice, sugar, oils, and sodas, among other products. She has a good clientele who always prefers her since they always find a big variety of products in her store. The loans are a lot of help to her and this is why she is asking for a loan again.

This loan is to better stock her store. Her dream is to improve her store.
LOAN_USE: to buy the necessary products for her store and, in doing so, provide a larger variety to her customers.

DESCRIPTION:
Le groupe  Soutoura  est constitué de 2 femmes mariées, 1 célibataire et d’1 veuve, qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans et 6 enfants. Elles vivent majoritairement dans des familles traditionnelles dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de Bougouni. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur cinquième prêt. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de poissons, de friperies, de savons (lessives et cosmétique)  et des articles divers. 
Bintou, qui est le membre du groupe papier en main, fait l’achat vente de savons cosmétiques et de savons de lessives.  Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 6 cartons de différents types de savons cosmétiques  avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 40.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The group Soutoura has four members, two who are married, one single and one widow. Their average age is 40 and they have 6 children. They live primarily in traditional families in the Massablacoura neighborhood in the city of Bougouni. 
They know each other from the neighborhood and as friends in business. In order to strengthen their businesses' working capital, they belong to the mircofinance institution Soro Yiriwaso with which they've taken five loans. They are in the business of selling fish, secondhand clothes, soap (for dishes and as cosmetics) and other products.
Bintou, the member with the paper in her hands, is in the business of selling soaps (for dishes and as cosmetics).  With the loan, she plans to purchase six boxes of various types of cosmetic soaps from wholesalers in Bamako. She sells the products at markets, door-to-door, through retail and on credit to both men and women clients.
She plans to make profits of about 40,000 cfa francs per month, which she will invest back in the business and use to repay the loan.
LOAN_USE: to purchase cosmetics.

DESCRIPTION:
Onike is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children who are aged 2 and 10. Both of her children live with their grandmother while in school.

Seven years ago, Onike established her used clothes business in order to support her children. She started to sell with her own money and her mother taught her how to sell. She uses a car to transport supplies to her business site.

Onike has had no problems with her business. She likes her business because sales are fast and it is also supportive. To maintain her business, Onike applied for a loan through BRAC Liberia the Kiva Field Partner. The loan will be used to buy more used clothes to sell in order to repay her loan and expand her business.

In the future she wants to build her house and continue to educate her children. Onike is highly appreciative of the financial support rendered.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Onike is 28 years old. She is married with 2 children who are aged 2 and 10. Both of her children live with their grandmother while in school.

Seven years ago, Onike established her used clothes business in order to support her children. She started to sell with her own money and her mother taught her how to sell. She uses a car to transport supplies to her business site.

Onike has had no problems with her business. She likes her business because sales are fast and it is also supportive. To maintain her business, Onike applied for a loan through BRAC Liberia the Kiva Field Partner. The loan will be used to buy more used clothes to sell in order to repay her loan and expand her business.

In the future she wants to build her house and continue to educate her children. Onike is highly appreciative of the financial support rendered.
LOAN_USE: to buy more used clothes to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Jhovy Rhina works hard to support three children. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Jhovy Rhina is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health risks and hazards to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jhovy Rhina works hard to support three children. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Jhovy Rhina is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health risks and hazards to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Benvinida A. is a 52 year-old married woman who supports her family by running a general store and selling fish. She lives in Seaside North, Brgy Poblacion, Naga, Cebu City with her husband and their three adult children.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 24,000.
 
Benvinida is borrowing Php 10,000 so that she can expand her store and fish vending business. This will be her 10th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 8,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Benvinida aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon  —a title of esteem bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
LOAN_USE: Additional working capital

DESCRIPTION:
Juliet R. is from the village of Santa Felomena, Iligan City. At the age of 35 years old, she is married and has one young infant. To make a living, Juliet owns & operates a business venture making and selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling snacks especially native delicacies in the local community. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase raw ingredients for her food products. Juliet is requesting a loan of 7000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw ingredients needed to make her food products. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To purchase raw ingredients for food products
TOWN_NAME: Santa Felomena, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

DESCRIPTION: Айгул, 27 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают сына. У Айгул - среднее образование, с 2010 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Айгул на сегодняшний день есть 20 коров. Супруг Айгул во всем помогает по хозяйству. Айгул обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительного поголовья коров племенной породы. Доходы от кредита Айгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Aigul is 27 and married with one son. She has a high school education and has been working in animal husbandry since 2010 as the primary source of income for her family. Thanks to her hard work, she currently has 20 cows on her farm. Her husband helps her with everything on the farm. \r\n\r\nAigul has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase additional purebred cattle. She plans to put profits from the loan into further increasing her quantity of livestock.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional purebred cattle in order to increase her herd

DESCRIPTION: N. Robinah is a hardworking, determined and friendly lady with a retail shop business that she has been running for over 10 years, plus having a restaurant where she sells breakfast, lunch and supper. Robinah is the mother of 7 children (of which 5 are still in school) and she takes care of other siblings. She started with the retail shop and only opened the restaurant after making some savings with the help of a loan. She is seeking another loan with the hope that it will help her recapitalize her business and make more profit out of the increased stock. \r\nRobinah is the leader of her lending group in Nyanama.
LOAN_USE: To restock her retail shop with more goods and buy foodstuffs for her restaurant
BORROWER_NAMES: Prossy, Harriet, Milly, Sauda, Sarah, Robinah, Charles, Cissy, Annet, Ritah
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Ali is a 26-year-old, single, young man who works as a barber to cover his needs and expenses. He has eight years of experience in this domain.

Today, he is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to develop his business through buying new chairs and tools to provide his customers with better service.

Ali hopes to keep on expanding his business to increase his income and improve his family's living conditions.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

TAGS: #Repair Renew Replace, #Biz Durable Asset, #Single, user_favorite, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION: Nehaya, who appears in the photo, is 36 years old from a village near Jenin City in West Bank. She has two adorable children and she is trying so hard to provide them with all the things they need.  Her husband works as a construction worker where he earns a low income that is barely enough for basic needs. She decided to help him with the living expenses. She started sewing  clothes to sell. She is taking a US Dollar loan from Palestine for Credito and Development  (FATEN) to buy a sewing machine, yarns, and fabrics until she can improve her work and increase her family income. She is very grateful for your help.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Nehaya, who appears in the photo, is 36 years old from a village near Jenin City in West Bank. She has two adorable children and she is trying so hard to provide them with all the things they need.  Her husband works as a construction worker where he earns a low income that is barely enough for basic needs. She decided to help him with the living expenses. She started sewing  clothes to sell. She is taking a US Dollar loan from Palestine for Credito and Development  (FATEN) to buy a sewing machine, yarns, and fabrics until she can improve her work and increase her family income. She is very grateful for your help.
LOAN_USE: to buy a sewing machine, yarns, and fabrics.

DESCRIPTION: La socia Eliana, continua dedicándose al negocio de venta de ceviche, la socia vende su ceviche a todos sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.\nLa socia solicita el crédito para la compra de pescado, limón, sal entre otros.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Eliana is still running her ceviche business.  She sells her ceviche to all her customers who order it.  She's grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her payments punctually, because this is how she gets her family ahead.

Eliana's requesting the loan to buy fish, limes, salt, and other ingredients.
LOAN_USE: to buy fish, limes, salt, and other ingredients

DESCRIPTION:
Teresita is 48 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies needed in her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Teresita is 48 years old and has five children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Teresita is in the agricultural business, farming seaweed in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy plastic bags and other supplies needed in her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 11 years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Teresita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy plastic bags and other supplies needed in her business.

DESCRIPTION: Deddeh is 40 years old and lives in the  community surrounding the Airport of Liberia. She stopped her education at the ninth grade, and she is married and has five children between 2  and 8 years old. They are living with her and going to school. \r\n\r\nFor the past ten years she been selling oil, onions, etc., in the local market. The problem that she is facing is the rainy season. She likes her business because it provides her needs. She  is requesting a loan to purchase more oil, onions, etc., for her business. Her  plans are to send her children to college  and build her house.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more oil, onions, etc., for her business,

DESCRIPTION: Gloria Catalina de 50 años es oriunda de la ciudad de Santa Marta e inició su negocio de rancho, víveres y licores en el año 2010. En sus inicios abrió su primer punto de venta en su lugar de nacimiento y con el apoyo de su esposo, se trasladó a la ciudad de Barranquilla en donde hace dos años abrió un nuevo punto de atención. Ella posee una tienda muy bien surtida que le representa muy buenas ventas. Actualmente está gestionando su primer credikiva para invertir en la compra de víveres y útiles escolares para estar aprovisionada al inicio del año escolar. Apóyale en su préstamo de negocio con el que espera tener muy buenas utilidades. \t
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Gloria Catalina is 50 years old and originally from the city of Santa Marta. She started a business of selling snacks, provisions, and liquor in 2010. At the beginning, her first retail shop was located in her birthplace and she started it with the help of her husband. When she moved to the city of Barranquilla two years ago, she opened a new shop. She now has a well-stocked business that generates good sales.

Gloria Catalina is applying for her first Kiva loan in order to invest in the purchase of provisions and school supplies so that she can be stocked for the start of the school year. Please support her business loan in hopes that she will earn good profits.
LOAN_USE: to buy provisions and school supplies so that she will be stocked for the start of the school year.

DESCRIPTION:
Jennifer is a single woman. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

DESCRIPTION:
Elizabeth is 47 years old and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with 11 children. 

Elizabeth is engaged in a fish-vending business and earns approximately 1,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional fishing nets. 

Elizabeth has been a member of PMPC since just this year. In the future, Elizabeth hopes to save more for her children.
LOAN_USE: To purchase additional fishing nets.

DESCRIPTION: Elmira P. makes a living by selling seafood products including crabs in her community of Taguitic, Lanao Del Norte. She is 34 years old, married and has four school-age children. Elmira has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2008, Elmira joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Elmira has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to to purchase products to sell. Elmira is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To invest in expanding the business

DESCRIPTION:
Eden is a married woman, 52 years old with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Eden has a buy-and-sell oyster business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of oysters to sell.

Eden has been in this business for 8 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

She had this business for 10 years.\r\n\r\nMarissa has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Marissa hopes to have another stall outlet for display.

DESCRIPTION:
Radharani is a 32-year-old married woman residing in the Murshidabad district of West Bengal.

She is engaged in fire-wood business. She sells firewood which is used as a fuel for cooking in her village. She has a household of 4 members and a monthly household income of 13,000 INR.

She wants to purchase more firewood to increase her supply and to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of 50,000 INR from BJS, one of Milaap's field partners. She and her family will be thankful to their lenders.

DESCRIPTION:
Janet is a 30-year-old single woman who describes herself as honest. She operates a salon where she provides beauty services and sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Janet will use the 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more beauty products and hire another hairdresser. Her business goal is to have more salons in other outlets within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more braids.

DESCRIPTION: John is requesting a loan to buy more more maize for selling. He is a hardworking man who is 33 years old. He is married with 4 children and 3 of them are in school residing in Kagadi Uganda. He is involved in a buying and selling business of agricultural produce for over 12 years and that is how he has been raising income to pay school fees for his children and provide for his family's other basic needs. He also does farming to supplement his income to meet his needs. He was inspired by the need to generate income to educate his children. John only works hand in hand with his wife to better the family's living conditions when seasonal crops are affected by price changes at times. When the prices are too low, they limit their income. But he is determined to earn a living from agricultural produce selling alongside farming.

But he is determined to earn a living from agricultural produce selling alongside farming.
LOAN_USE: to buy more maize for selling.

DESCRIPTION: La señora maria es habitante del departamento de chinandega es soltera tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 2 tiene a su cargo en edades escolares es una mujer trabajadora que inicia su dia  a las 6 am en el barrido de las calles de la ciudad  y finaliza  a las 12 pm .\n\nla señora esta solicitando financiamiento para la dar la prima de un proyecto que le construiran su casa de habitacion ya que su casita es de plastico ella es una persona alegre con deseo de superacion.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maria lives in the Chinandega region. She is single and has 6 children, 2 of which are still under her responsibility and in school. She is a hardworking woman works sweeping the city streets. Her day starts at 6:00 a.m. and ends at noon.

Maria is requesting a loan to give a deposit for a construction project in her home, as she lives in a plastic house. She is a happy person who wishes to get ahead in life.
LOAN_USE: for household expenses.

DESCRIPTION: Chem C., 31, is married and resides with her husband and three children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. She is employed at a local garment factory for an income of about USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 3 per day to help cover the family expenses.  \r\n\r\nC. is requesting a loan of USD 700 to purchase wood to repair their old house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.
LOAN_USE: to repair house

DESCRIPTION:
Célestin K. is the president of the Community Bank named Tuwisana Plus, which is composed of 17 microentrepreneurs. These members are united by the same goal:  To grow their businesses by loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Célestin is 60 years old. His main activity is selling packages. He buys them in bulk and resells them via retail at a profit. He sells his products daily at the market in his area, west of Kinshasa.

Célestin started his business in 1990. He is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and repaid loans. His next loan will allow him to buy packages in larger quantities to increase his sales in order to make a better profit. Célestin makes a profit of about US $180 per week. With this increased profit, he plans to buy food and  and pay school fees for his children. He is married and the father of eight children between 11 and 31 years old. Four of them attend school. He is also responsible for another child left by his relative.
LOAN_USE: To buying packages in larger quantities to resell
COUNTRY_NAME: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

DESCRIPTION:
Yet’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yet makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yet’s group live in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Yet makes a living cultivating rice and she also does extra work as a seller to support her family.

In their village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these borrowers to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
LOAN_USE: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for their family.

DESCRIPTION:
Jose is 40 years old and married with 4 children. He has a farming business that he started in 2002, and grows corn to sell to a local market and generate income to support his family. Running his farming business has helped Jose provide a better life for his family.

He would like a loan of $500 from KIF to help grow his farming business. He plans to use this loan to buy seeds and equipment for his farming business.

Jose hopes to run a bigger business in the future and wants to thank lenders for the opportunity.

Sreyneang is 20 years old. She is a single factory worker who lives in Kandal province in Cambodia. She has been working as a factory worker since 2013, earning around $5 per day.

Now Sreyneang would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work. With this loan, she will be able to have enough finances to buy a motorcycle.

In the future, she wants to save money to run her own business.

DESCRIPTION: Hiba is a 25-year-old married woman who opened her beauty salon to cover her needs and expenses. She gained experience in this domain from intensive training sessions. She is working hard to develop her business, thus today she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy manicure and pedicure tools in additions to some bags to better satisfy her customers' demands. Hiba hopes to keep on expand her business to stay capable of providing her family with better living conditions.

DESCRIPTION:
MY PERSONAL STORY

I was born in Colombia, and since a young age I have been involved in trading. I have always bought and sold different products as a way of increasing my income.

I started with trading quartz stones as a hobby. It all began when someone told me about them and I became interested in learning more. I read books until I knew about the biggest fair in the US, which is held in Arizona and lasts for 15 days. I went to visit and work there to learn more about this fascinating world, and then I fell completely in love with quartz until they became my main livelihood.

MI HISTORIA PERSONAL

Nací en Colombia, y desde muy joven he ejercido la profesión de comerciante. Siempre he comprado y vendido diferente productos como una forma de aumentar mis ingresos.

Empecé con los cuarzos como un pasatiempo, alguien me habló de ellos y me interesé en conocer mas, en leer libros, hasta que supe de la feria mas grande de los EEUU, que se realiza en la ciudad de Arizona y dura 15 días. Fui a visitarla y a trabajar en ella para conocer más de cerca este fascinante mundo, y ahí me enamore completamente de los cuarzos hasta convertirlos en el medio para ganarme el sustento diario.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
MY PERSONAL STORY

I was born in Colombia, and since a young age I have been involved in trading. I have always bought and sold different products as a way of increasing my income.

I started with trading quartz stones as a hobby. It all began when someone told me about them and I became interested in learning more. I read books until I knew about the biggest fair in the US, which is held in Arizona and lasts for 15 days. I went to visit and work there to learn more about this fascinating world, and then I fell completely in love with quartz until they became my main livelihood.

MI HISTORIA PERSONAL

Nací en Colombia, y desde muy joven he ejercido la profesión de comerciante. Siempre he comprado y vendido diferente productos como una forma de aumentar mis ingresos.

Empecé con los cuarzos como un pasatiempo, alguien me habló de ellos y me interesé en conocer mas, en leer libros, hasta que supe de la feria mas grande de los EEUU, que se realiza en la ciudad de Arizona y dura 15 días. Fui a visitarla y a trabajar en ella para conocer más de cerca este fascinante mundo, y ahí me enamore completamente de los cuarzos hasta convertirlos en el medio para ganarme el sustento diario.
LOAN_USE: Our aim is to continue assisting people who, like us, accept and understand the value of each quartz and recognize the spiritual value in them. This credit will allow us to buy more products directly from the producers so we can offer a better price to our customers.

DESCRIPTION: Friday sells motorcycle spare parts at retail prices to his customers. He loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that he has with his customers. He is 40 years old and married with four children. He is a hardworking man. His wife is a trader, and she sells groceries to support her home. Friday hopes to own a big stall in the future. He needs a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more motorcycle spare parts to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To purchase motorcycle spare parts to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Agnes is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as honest.

Agnes operates a farm where she grows bananas and also keeps cows. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be climate change. Agnes will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy farm inputs to boost production. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

DESCRIPTION: La señora Sonia se dedica a la venta de distintos productos de belleza y ropa para dama; es así como consigue sus ingresos para la manutención suya y la de su hijo que está en la Universidad. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de estudios universitarios para su hijo. Vive en casa propia  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Miraflores en la ciudad de La Paz; Sonia es separada y tiene un  hijo. Ella es cliente des IMPRO desde el año  2008 y siempre ha cumplido con sus obligaciones financieras.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: \r\nSonia sells various beauty products and women’s clothes; this is how she earns income to support herself and her son who is in university.  She needs the loan to pay her son’s university expenses.  She lives in her own house located in the city of La Paz’s Miraflores zone.  Sonia is separated and has a son.  She has been an IMPRO client since 2008 and has always met her financial obligations.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to pay for her son's university tuition.

DESCRIPTION: Kennedy is a married man with five children. He describes himself to be honest and hardworking. He operates a retail business where he sells fish net. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more materials for making fish net in order to meet demand in Bondo, where fishing is the main activity, since it is  located near Lake Victoria. His business goal is to have more helpers in making fish net within five years. He hopes that in the future he will be able to provide for his family effectively. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more materials for making fish net.

Mary Jane has been in this business for two years.
