DESCRIPTION: Ali is a married man with 7 children, and five are enrolled in school. He operates a tailoring business and has been in this business for the last 6 years. His customers are mostly students. He intends to use the loan of Ksh20,000 to buy clothing materials. He has rented a house that has electricity but no piped water. Ali aspires to open a wholesale shop in the future. His greatest monthly expense is school fees.
LOAN_USE: to buy clothing materials.

DESCRIPTION:
Elvina lives in the Changamwe area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a married business lady who owns a green grocer, a business she has been operating for less than a year. She started the business from the income she received while selling buns. She sells tomatoes, sugar, onions, and more in this business.
She learned about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Her main challenge is the high costs of transport while sourcing the goods. 
Elvina is applying for a loan of 41,900 Kenya shillings to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale and some bags of sugar. Her extra income from the loan will be added to her savings to construct a rental house and improve the living standards of her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy vegetables and fruits wholesale and some bags of sugar.

DESCRIPTION:
Edna works hard to support nine children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet. Edna is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Edna works hard to support nine children. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet. Edna is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

Tuileva needs a loan to buy rolling materials, paint color, paint brush, elei design, and printing machine to assist hert to run the business. She has been doing this for more than a year. She became a member of SPBD in 2013

DESCRIPTION: Carla tiene 32 años, ella es casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños. Carla es la dueña de un pequeño negocio de serigrafia, su esposo trabaja como empleado en una oficina. Sin embargo, Carla nos dijo que el contrato de su esposo pronto va a terminar, por eso es importante que el negocio de serigrafia sea mas estable, Carla quiere un credito para compra de equipos para su negocio
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Carla is 32 years old. She is married and has two small children. Carla is the owner of a small silk-screen printing business. Her husband works as an employee at an office. However, Carla told us that her husband's contract will end soon and that is why it's important for her silk-screen printing business to be more stable. Carla wants a loan to buy equipment for her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy equipment for her business.
TAGS: #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Parent, #Biz Durable Asset

DESCRIPTION:
Analyn is a married woman. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Analyn is 36 years old.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years. Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Analyn requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell.

She has been in this business for 5 years. Analyn would like to save money to expand her business.

DESCRIPTION: Antoinette est une femme d’affaires qui commerce l’habillments dans la rue animée de la ville, membre de la banque villageoise «Mwito», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, mariée et âgée de 42 ans mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle va s’approvisionner en robes, tricots et habits enfants pour renforcer ses activités et satisfaire tant soit peu aux besoins de ses clients. Elle commença ses activités par le capital reçu d’un crédit, il y a 12 ans. Elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Antoinette is a businesswoman who sells clothing in a bustling street in her city. She is a member of the banque villageoise "Mwito" and a client of the microfinance institution Hekima. She is 42 years old, married, and the mother to 6 children who are all in school.

She will stock up on dresses, sweaters, and children\'s clothes in order to strengthen her business and improve customer satisfaction by better catering to their needs. She began this activity with capital received as a loan 12 years ago. She hopes to grow her business, as well as educate and provide for her children. Antoinette thanks Hekima for supporting entrepreneurs without access to traditional bank loans.
LOAN_USE: to buy dresses, sweaters, and children's clothing for resale.
COUNTRY_NAME: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Ramatu, she is a 48-year-old woman from Aberdeen, in the western area of Freetown, Sierra Leone. She is single and has 2 children.

For some years now, Ramatu established her electronics business. She began her business because she thought it was an easy way to earn income and improve the standard of living for her family. She works at the business from 8:00am until 5:30 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is dollar inflation.

Ramatu requires a loan to purchase more TV's, DVD's and glass tables to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to improve her living and increase her business.

In the future, Ramatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

DESCRIPTION:
Janet is 40 years and is blessed with three teenagers.

She runs a shop to provide for her family. She is on her first loan and will use her profits to pay her loan. If you assist her with the loan, she will use it to add stock to her shop to boost her sales, which will go a long way in improving her livelihood and that of her family.

She looks forward to opening a wholesale shop in the future.

She looks forward to opening a wholesale shop in the future.

DESCRIPTION:
Samuel is 44 years old and married with six children. He has a retail shop selling assorted spare parts and has been in business for the last 10 years.

Samuel will be using the loan to purchase more motorbike tires and helmets to add stock to his shop. His dream for the future is to open a garage to repair cars.

DESCRIPTION:
Jackline is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kitintale in the Kireka region of Uganda. For the past two years, Jackline has been working hard to manage her florist business, which sells flowers.

To help expand her business, Jackline has requested a loan of 1,300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more flower seeds to expand her flower garden, and will help Jackline to generate greater profits. The higher profits from expanding her business will enable Jackline to afford the basic needs of life, improve her standard of living and cater for her siblings as well, at the same time paying the respective school dues. Jackline hopes that in the future, she will be able to start up her own flower garden.

Jackline is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

DESCRIPTION: Nhung, 34, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. She lives with her daughter and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. \r\n\r\nNhung and her husband have been in business for ten years. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail polish

DESCRIPTION:
Mirna es una madre de familia soltera de 25 años de edad, tiene un hijo de 3 años de edad que juntos viven en la aldea Lolemi, Sector Centro.
Ella con el afán de sacar adelante a su hijo se dedica a la c/v de abarrotes desde hace 3 años  y está ubicada en la misma aldea de su residencia, también cuenta con un puesto de papas fritas el cual le genera unos ingresos extras y así poder cubrir los gastos del hogar. Ella busca un crédito el cual lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería y así poder contar con variedad de productos en su abarrotería y así generar más ingresos económicos.
Su mayor anhelo es poder mejorar su calidad de vida y lograr pagar los estudios de su hijo en el futuro.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mirna is a 25-year-old single mother who has a three-year-old son. Together, they live in the village of Lolemi, Sector Centro.

She, with the desire to support her son, has made a living buying and selling groceries for three years. Her store is located in the same village as her home. It also includes a french fry stand, which generates some extra income to cover the household expenses.

She is looking for a loan to invest in purchasing more merchandise, and, in this way, she will have a variety of products in her grocery store and generate more economic income.

Her greatest desire is to improve her quality of life and be able to pay for her son's studies in the future.
LOAN_USE: to purchase merchandise for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Vegetarians avert your eyes! This is Osteria M. and she runs a butcher’s shop in the rural town of Mlandizi, about 30km outside of Dar es Salaam. In Swahili, a butcher business is called ‘kuchinja ngombe”, which literally translated means ‘the slaughter or ruthless killing of animals’. Ruthless killing? Maybe I’ve just managed to change the minds of a few meat-eaters!

Osteria established the business in 2006 and requires a loan of $375 to purchase additional equipment and stock. She is married to husband Leonadi with whom she has three children, Grace, 14, Ronado, 9, and Devota, 2.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation for women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from said client extending a loan to her and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement.
LOAN_USE: To purchase additional equipment and stock for her butcher's shop

DESCRIPTION: Marcelina is engaged in buying and selling fruits in the market. She has been in her business for 19 years and she usually received P10,000 monthly from it. Marcelina wants to buy more fruits to sell, but she lacks the necessary capital. Thus she is taking out this loan PHP 10,000 to buy apples, oranges and mangoes to sell in the market.  She believes that her sacrifices will lead her to reach her goal, which is to increase her profit and save money for future emergency purposes.
LOAN_USE: to buy apples, oranges and mangoes to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
David is 57 years old, residing in Dipolog city. He is a hardworking father who always supports his family. He is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home.

David hopes to live comfortably with a house with good roofing, supported by his loan. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with a good repayment record. David has given priority as a Micro finance member of PMPC. This is what he is thankful for when all his financing needs for his retailing business are supported by PMPC.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
David is 57 years old, residing in Dipolog city. He is a hardworking father who always supports his family. He is juggling a business and supervising the renovation of their home.

David hopes to live comfortably with a house with good roofing, supported by his loan. He hopes to maintain his membership in good standing with a good repayment record. David has given priority as a Micro finance member of PMPC. This is what he is thankful for when all his financing needs for his retailing business are supported by PMPC.
LOAN_USE: for house renovation

DESCRIPTION: \nAna Dolores de 37 años de edad, reside en casa de su propiedad junto con su compañero de vida y su hijo el cual ya es mayor de edad. La señora Ana se dedica al comercio de café, pan dulce, pan con huevo, pan con frijoles, atol, etc. Tiene aproximadamente 11 años de dedicarse a este negocio y gracias a Dios y a su esfuerzo ha logrado mantenerlo activo y es el que le ha permitido llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar ya que los ingresos de su esposo no son suficientes para cubrir los gastos de las principales necesidades, las cuales cada vez son mayores. Es muy conocida en la zona ya que siempre ofrece calidad y buenos precios en sus productos, para ella lo más importante es que sus clientes estén satisfechos con su servicio. La ubicación del negocio es muy estratégica ya que se encuentra en el centro de la ciudad donde ella reside, lugar que es muy concurrido y visitado. Últimamente ha estado notando que la demanda de sus ricos panes ha aumentado y muchas veces se queda escasa de producto. Esto la ha llevado a tomar la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en su negocio en la compra de insumos  (frijoles, pan dulce, pan francés, huevos, café, etc.) que le permitan cubrir una mayor demanda y de esta manera espera obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. \n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
37-year-old Ana Dolores lives in a house that she owns together with her life partner and her adult son.  Her business is selling coffee, sweet bread, egg sandwiches, bean sandwiches, 'atol' (a corn-based hot drink), etc.  She has been in this business for approximately 11 years and, thanks to God and her own efforts, she has managed to keep it running.  This has allowed her to provide her household with their daily bread as her husband's income is not enough to cover the cost of their main necessities which become more and more expensive.  

Ana Dolores is very well known in her area as she always offers good-quality products at good prices.  As far as she is concerned, the most important thing is for her customers to be happy with her service.  Her business is in a very strategic location, in the city center, where she lives.  This area is very busy and has lots of visitors. 

Ana Dolores has recently noticed that the demand for her delicious breads has risen and she often runs out.  For this reason, she has taken the decision to request a loan from INTEGRAL, to invest in her business, buying supplies (beans, sweet bread, French bread, eggs, coffee, etc.) that will enable her to cope with higher levels of demand.  In this way, she hopes to make more income which will allow her to improve her own quality of life as well as that of her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy beans, sweet bread, French bread, eggs, coffee, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Florife is thankful for the financial assistance extended to her, as she was able to buy more products for her business. Her loan also helped in her everyday expenditures at home. She also used her loan in her other businesses such as frozen foods and a fruits and vegetables stand. She and her husband are both working hard to provide for their family's needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add in her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Florife hopes to have another branch and dreams to be successful in life. She meets with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week, allowing her to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

DESCRIPTION:
Evangeline is a sari-sari store owner from Pappat, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 36 years old, married and a mother of one child.

She aspires to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 that she will use for the improvement of their house. She plan to buy 40 bags of cement, tie wire, four pieces of plywood, 90 pieces 9 mm RSB (reinforcement steel bar / "rebar") and 70 pieces of 10 mm RSB.

Evangeline is thankful to the lenders for continued support their render to her.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Evangeline is a sari-sari store owner from Pappat, Angadanan, Isabela. She is 36 years old, married and a mother of one child.

She aspires to borrow a loan of PHP 50,000 that she will use for the improvement of their house. She plan to buy 40 bags of cement, tie wire, four pieces of plywood, 90 pieces 9 mm RSB (reinforcement steel bar / "rebar") and 70 pieces of 10 mm RSB.

Evangeline is thankful to the lenders for continued support their render to her.
LOAN_USE: to buy 40 bags of cement, six kilograms of tie wire, 4 pieces plywood, 90 pieces of 9 mm and 70 pieces 10 mm RSB (reinforcing steel bar).

DESCRIPTION:
Mr. Pha S. is a 28-year-old married man with a child who is six years old and not in school yet. He and his wife, Mrs. Samnang Meas, are farmers who own 2-hectares of land upon which they cultivate rice for a living. Aside from farming, Pha is also a construction worker who receives a small salary to support his family.

Pha was selected to be the village bank president by fourteen members who all live in Samraong K'aer village, Kandal province. With the loan the members of this village hope to increase their income to improve their families’ living standards. Pha owns some farm machinery that they use to work their field. The machinery broke, so Pha decided to ask for a loan from AMK to repair it.
LOAN_USE: To repair some farm machinery

DESCRIPTION:
Sobia is a 29-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. 

Her husband is a chef by profession; he provides services cooking food for marriage ceremonies, parties and funfair programs. He cooks delicious Pakistani food such as biryani, qorma, roast chicken & fish and from sweet dishes he prepares firni and kheer. He is very famous chef in his town and most of the people like get him to cook food for their ceremonies. Sometimes he has to cook many dishes at a time, and as a result he has a problem due to a shortage of cauldrons. 

Therefore Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a new cauldron, spices and fire wood for cooking food.

Therefore Sobia has requested a loan from Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy a new cauldron, spices and fire wood for cooking food.
LOAN_USE: To buy a cauldron, spices and fire wood for a cooking business.

DESCRIPTION:
Peurt is 19 years old. She lives in Kratie province and is the mother of a child.

She is growing cashews for her income. Peurt has run her business for around ten years and saves about 5 USD per day. She also lacks the capital to support her cashew growing, and nowadays she has a lot of competitors so it makes her crop get a low price.

This is her first loan with VisionFund. She is the leader of the group, which consists of two members. She will use her loan portion to buy more land to expand her plantation to be larger than before.

Peurt believes that her loan will return the best results and increase her income to support her family.

TAGS: user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset, #Vegan, #Parent, #Trees, user_favorite, #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
Marco tiene 43 años, vive con su esposa y tienen 4 hijos, siendo 3 de ellos estudiantes y uno mayor de edad, quien lo apoya en todo.
Desde hace 13 años se dedica a la agricultura, cuenta con 4 hectáreas de arroz  y 2 de yuca, y justamente ahora está en época de cosecha, para lo que tiene que contratar personal para la recolección de su producto. 
Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es mantenerse ocupado y tener en buenas condiciones su chacra; a su vez, le es muy rentable porque sus productos los vende a un buen precio en el mercado de su localidad. 
Para Marco, su motivación de esfuerzo son sus hijos a quienes quiere brindarles lo necesario. 

Este es su 3er préstamo con MFP y lo que le gusta de ser parte de un banco comunal es que sus compañeros son personas responsables y muy trabajadoras. Con el dinero que ahora solicita comprará más granos de arroz para seguir sembrando en su chacra,  con lo que le reste contratará personal para la cosecha de su arroz y yuca.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marco is 43 years old, and he lives with his wife. They have four children; three are students, and one who is grown helps him in everything. For the last 13 years he has farmed. He has 4 acres of rice and 2 of yucca. Right now it is harvest time, so he needs to hire people to harvest his farm products.

What he likes most about his work is keeping busy and keeping his farm in good condition; in turn, the farm is very profitable because he sells his products at a good price in the local market. For Marco, the motivation for his efforts are his children, for whom he would like to provide the necessities.

This is his third loan with MFP, and what he likes about being part of a communal bank is that his fellow members are responsible and very hard working. With the money that he is asking for now, he will buy more rice to continue planting on his farm, and with the rest he will hire people for the rice and yucca harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Pam McMurry, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Buy seeds for planting

DESCRIPTION: Tamella N. is a happy mother of four children. She is 60 years old and married. Tamella is a grocery store owner. For more than 15 years she has been selling foodstuff such as sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, tea, coffee, and many other products in her grocery store. Tamella’s wish is to expand her business, offering various types of foodstuff to customers who pass through this market. She works with one aim in mind, to provide the best possible example and way of life for her beloved children, who are the apple of her eye and the reason for her daily efforts. With this opportunity, with the immense love Tamella feels as a mother, and with her desire to succeed, she is appealing to your generosity and is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN in order to increase the range of her goods. You can be an important link in the growth of this business by supporting Tamella. \r\n
LOAN_USE: To purchase more merchandise

DESCRIPTION:
Celenia is 70 years old and single.

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Celenia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Celenia has been in this business for one year. She also earns additional income from roasting pigs, a business she has been doing for 11 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

She earns a living by fattening pigs in the Philippines. Celenia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Celenia has been in this business for one year. She also earns additional income from roasting pigs, a business she has been doing for 11 years. She successfully repaid her previous loan, and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

LOAN_USE: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs

DESCRIPTION: El es un hombre casado de 62 años casado, es agricultor se dedica a sembrar la tierra. A causa de una enfermedad crónico degenerativa presenta daño en los vasos sanguíneos de la retina, por lo que el ha dejado de trabajar. La perdida de su vista fue repentina. El especialista le dice que esto es a consecuencia de su enfermedad mal controlada. Tiene mas de dos meses los cuales no ha podido trabajar por lo que esto le preocupa por que esta es su única fuente de ingresos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
He is 62 years old and married. He is a farmer who sows the land.

Due to a chronic degenerative illness there is damage to the blood vessels of the retina. Because of this he has stopped working. There was a sudden loss of vision. The specialist tells him that this is a consequence of his poorly controlled illness.

It has been over two months since he has been able to work. This worries him because this is his only source of income.
LOAN_USE: to recover his sight.

DESCRIPTION: Maribel is running a variety store selling different grocery items. She is 41 years old, married, and raising two children. She has managed her business for 19 years now. In managing this business, they have encountered many problems, but they have not given up because they want the business to be successful to support the education of their children. Maribel wants to sell more groceries to satisfy her costumers' needs. Thus, she wants to obtain 40,000 PHP to purchase groceries like canned goods, bread, bottled drinks, and condiments to sell. The couple will continue to be strong in all of life's challenges.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Maribel is running a variety store selling different grocery items. She is 41 years old, married, and raising two children. She has managed her business for 19 years now. In managing this business, they have encountered many problems, but they have not given up because they want the business to be successful to support the education of their children. DESCRIPTION:
Philomena is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Philomena will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased sales. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Philomena is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be obedient. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

Philomena will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be prosperous within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have increased sales. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stock of clothes

DESCRIPTION:
This is Ma. Aurita, 41, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. Her partner is Mark and they have a child. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. She and her partner work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ma. Aurita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands, such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 37,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Ma. Aurita dreams of having her own store for her products and hopes to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This is Ma. Aurita, 41, a resident of Malibay, Pasay, Philippines. Her partner is Mark and they have a child. She, together with her partner, manages their household while operating the business. She and her partner work hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Ma. Aurita maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands, such as Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk and Marikina Shoe Exchange. A customer's order is paid for in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. Dealers' prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are investing in as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 2,000 PHP in sales every week.

To help her continue the operation of her business, she is requesting a 37,000 PHP loan. She will utilize the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments and other products needed in her business. 

Ma. Aurita dreams of having her own store for her products and hopes to give her child a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.
LOAN_USE: to pay for additional supplies and merchandise products needed in her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Josephine is 48 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 7 and 26.  Four of them go to school.  She works with her husband selling food and has been running her business for 10 years. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and beans to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy land to build on.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Josephine is 48 years old. She is married with 5 children between the ages of 7 and 26.  Four of them go to school.  She works with her husband selling food and has been running her business for 10 years. 

With this loan, she would like to buy more potatoes and beans to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to buy land to build on.
LOAN_USE: To buy more potatoes and beans to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Benson is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with two children.

Benson's business is farming, which he has operated for 15 years. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy fertilizers and seeds.

He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a high income farming business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Benson is 30 years old. He is married and blessed with two children.

Benson's business is farming, which he has operated for 15 years. This is his first loan with VisionFund Kenya, which he will use to buy fertilizers and seeds.

He will use the profits from expanded business to educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to have a high income farming business.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers and seeds.

DESCRIPTION: Бактыгул 51 год, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 2 детей. У Бактыгул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Бактыгул занимается животноводством, стартовав 32 года назад, с покупки скота на 1,000 сом KGS. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 дойные коровы, 4 овцы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бактыгул обратилась в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом - на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на улучшение благосостояния семьи.\n\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Bakhtygul is 51 years old, married, and raising two children with her husband. Bakhtygul has a secondary education. The primary source of income for the family is Bakhtygul's work in livestock and farming. She started this business 32 years ago when she bought 1,000 KGS worth of cattle. Because of Bakhtygul's hard work, her farm now has four dairy cows and four sheep. Her monthly income is 12,000 KGS. In order to further develop her farm,  Bakhtygul approached the microfinance bank Bai-Tushum and Partners for a loan to buy a cow for breeding. Bakhtygul plans to invest profits she earns from the loan into increasing her livestock and she plans to save enough money to raise her family's standard of living.
LOAN_USE: buy cows

DESCRIPTION:
Lourdes, 61, is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.  

Lourdes joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her fruit and vegetable selling. Helping the family survive, she gives her best efforts to get enough sales daily to provide their basic needs. 

Lourdes is now trying to expand her resources by increasing her inventory to raise more income. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well-known and to build a good business for her loyal customers. 

With her extra income, she wishes to have a good standard of living with her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Lourdes, 61, is from Mansabay Bajo, Lopez Jaena, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married with 4 children.  

Lourdes joined PMPC and she appreciates the programs and services of the co-op. The co-op supported her by providing the capital to start her fruit and vegetable selling. Helping the family survive, she gives her best efforts to get enough sales daily to provide their basic needs. 

Lourdes is now trying to expand her resources by increasing her inventory to raise more income. She is thankful to Paglaum MPC for financing her capital needs. In addition, she wanted her business to be well-known and to build a good business for her loyal customers. 

With her extra income, she wishes to have a good standard of living with her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stock of fruit and vegetables for selling
TOWN_NAME: Plaridel-Mansabay Bajo Lopez Jaena Misamis Occiden

DESCRIPTION: Duc is requesting a new loan to buy new furniture and better food. This purchase will help him to better attract and satisfy his customers. His previous loan enabled him to improve his business. He hopes that his new loan will assist him in increasing the size of his food stall and his sales, and will help him to improve his living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to buy new furniture and better food

DESCRIPTION:
Yober es un joven campesino, humilde y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su bebé de dos años de nacido.
A sus 24 años de edad, se dedica a criar y comercializar cerdos, actividad que aprendió por medio de su hermano, con el que trabaja actualmente, lleva 6 meses realizando la actividad y ha generado buenos ingresos con los que sustenta las necesidades de su hogar. Su clientela está conformada por vecinos, familiares y algunos establecimientos de venta de carne que hay en el municipio donde reside.
Con el ánimo de fortalecer su negocio, solicita el apoyo del crédito para comprar más lechones y concentrado para alimentar los animales, esto le permitirá aumentar su producción y mejorar la rentabilidad del negocio, satisfaciendo la demanda actual del producto.
Yober, con su entusiasmo  y espíritu emprendedor, manifiesta que su mayor anhelo es aumentar la cantidad de animales para así lograr tener una producción escalonada, que le permita generar ingresos y rentabilidad durante todos los meses del año, así podrá brindar una mejor calidad de vida y bienestar a su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Yober is a young, hardworking farmer who is 24 years old and lives with his wife and 2-year-old child. Yober makes a living raising and selling pigs, a trade that he learned from his brother. He currently works with his brother and has 6 months experience raising pigs. He uses the income from this job to support his family. His customer base is comprised of neighbors, extended family and a few resale locations in his community.\r\n\r\nWith the support from this loan, Yober plans to purchase pigs and feed to continue with his business. He hopes this investment will help him to strengthen and expand his business to meet customer demand. Yober's dream is to increase the quantity of pigs under his care and generate more income to provide a bright future and better quality of life for his family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase pigs and feed to support his business.

DESCRIPTION: Rebeca is 39 years old, and is single. Rebeca is a snacks seller in the Mwanjelwa neighborhood in Mbeya. She is a member of the Kabwe group loan. She currently earns an average monthly profit of $39. Every day she works at her business for 8 hours. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items for her business. She is hoping that this loan will help her increase her profit and grow her business.  \r\n\r\n
LOAN_USE: Buy more items to sell in her business

DESCRIPTION:
Try’s group lives in a rural village in Oddar Meanchey province in Cambodia. Try makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Try’s group lives in a rural village in Oddar Meanchey province in Cambodia. Try makes a living cultivating rice to support her family.

In their village, there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
LOAN_USE: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Zuhran baji wants a loan to buy construction supplies to sell. Razia baji wants a loan to buy embroidering materials (colored thread, beads and patterns) for preparing embroidered dresses. Hajra baji wants a loan to buy lentils, cooking oil and spices for her food-selling business. Rubina baji wants a loan to buy washing powders and bleach for her laundry business. 

Suraiya baji is the group leader of the aforementioned ladies. She is a very hardworking and caring lady. She gets up early in the morning and performs her duties very effectively. Her husband's name is A. H. and he works as a fruit seller. He has been doing this work for more than three years. He is also a very hardworking person. He treks to different communities and sells his fruits by announcing in a loud voice. Suraiya baji appreciates his struggle and gives him more attention when he comes back home. She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits to advance her husband’s fruit-selling business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: Suraiya baji is seated first on the right side in this photo.
LOAN_USE: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Gertrudes works hard to support her family. Gertrudes is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gertrudes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gertrudes has been in this business for 6 years now.

Gertrudes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Gertrudes works hard to support her family. Gertrudes is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gertrudes requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Gertrudes has been in this business for 6 years now.

Gertrudes would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy ingredients for her food production business

DESCRIPTION:
Bimala is 38 years old; she is married and has three children.  Many years ago, she established her grocery store business.  Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she supports her family.  She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW, and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business.  

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy.  Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home.  Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins.  By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, the owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability.  While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

In the future, Bimala plans to uplift the economic condition of her family.  She thanks you for your support.
LOAN_USE: to buy grocery goods

DESCRIPTION:
Irma is 28 years old and in a relationship, and, like her partner, she runs a small business. She is dedicated to selling clothing, shoes, and DVDs and CDs. Irma is always looking for ways to improve her business and increase her inventory. She's requesting a loan to acquire more merchandise to help her keep improving and growing her business. She has three children, ages 7, 9 and 11, for whom she wants to provide a good life and the ability to get ahead.\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

\r\nIrma tiene 28 años de edad, es acompañada y su comprañero al igual que ella es un pequeño comerciante. Irma se dedica aa la venta de ropa, zapatos, DVD y CD. Irma siempre está en busca de mejorar su negocio y aumentar el inventario que actualmente posee. Requiere del préstamo para adquirir su mercadería para ir mejorando y agradando su negocio. Tiene 3 hijos de 11, 9 y 7 años a los cuales quiere darles una vida digna y con posibilidad de salir adelante
LOAN_USE: Purchase merchandise for her business / Comprar mercadería para su negocio

DESCRIPTION:
Heghine is a young and very nice lady aged 27 who for the second time wants to deal with a generous Kiva lender. She lives in the village of Tsovagyugh which is in the Gegharkunik region. Her mother is alone and is very skillfully engaged in farming: her father still lives and works in the Russian Federation from where he supports his family. Heghine works at a school and is still studying at the State Pedagogical University of Armenia to receive her master's degree, which is very important so she can always have constant and well-paid work.
 
Heghine is asking for a loan of 150,000 Armenian drams in order to pay her tuition fee, since the savings that she has managed during several months are still not enough.
LOAN_USE: to pay her tuition fee since her savings over several months are still not enough

DESCRIPTION:
Lilian is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a salon where she provides hairdressing services and sell beauty products. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase additional stock of beauty products for more income. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a new outlet.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Lilian is a 40-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be industrious. She operates a salon where she provides hairdressing services and sell beauty products. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to purchase additional stock of beauty products for more income. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open a new outlet.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional stock of beauty products for more income.

DESCRIPTION:
Brenda de 32 años de edad,  es casada y madre de tres hijos de 13, 9 y 6 años respectivamente, se encuentran estudiando educación básica. 

Su esposo es albañil, y ella por su parte, desde hace tres años se dedica a la venta de ropa americana; esta actividad la realiza debido a que su empleo de medio tiempo no le genera los suficientes ingresos para cubrir las necesidades de su familia. La ropa la vende de forma ambulante aproximadamente recorre 9 kilómetros, en horarios de 7:30 a 12:30 de la tarde.


El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar más cantidad de ropa. Actualmente la adquiere una vez a la semana; pero no le es suficiente para abastecer la demanda, desea comprar unas tres veces a la semana, a fin de disponer de mercadería variada y reciente. 

Su sueño, es instalar una tienda en su casa y ya no hacerlo de manera ambulante; con el objetivo de que sus ingresos mejoren y brindar a sus hijos el estudio que se merecen.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Brenda, 32 years old, is married and the mother of three children aged 6, 9, and 13 years, respectively. They are students in primary school.

Her husband is a construction worker, and she, for her part, has sold American clothing for the last three years. She does this work because her part-time job does not generate sufficient income to cover her family's needs. She sells the clothing door-to-door and covers approximately 9 kilometers. Her schedule is from 7:30 a.m. to 12:30 p.m.

The loan she is requesting is to buy more clothing. Currently, she gets it once a week, but that is not sufficient for her to meet demand. She wants to buy three times a week, with the goal of having varied and recent merchandise available.

Her dream is to install a store in her house and no longer go door-to-door, with the goal of improved income and giving her children the education they deserve.
LOAN_USE: to buy more clothing

DESCRIPTION:
Ruth works hard to support four children. She is married and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Ruth requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Ruth is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ruth works hard to support four children. She is married and has an abaca-weaving business in the Philippines.

Ruth requested a loan of 6,000 PHP through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Ruth is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, but she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION: La señora Maria, habita en el municipio de Masaya, su esposo la apoya en todo ya que su mayor sueño es terminar su casa y mejorar de condiciones, sus hijas tambien tambien la apoyan, ella trabaja como laboratorista en el Hospital del Municipio, con este nuevo credito comprara los materiales necesarios para continuar  con la construccion: Cemento, Arena, Hierro con esto realizara parte del muro de su casa ya que  requiere de seguridad y privacidad. Agradece el Apoyo incondicional que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: María lives in the city of Masaya. Her husband supports her in everything, and her biggest dream is to finish their house and improve their conditions. Their daughters are supportive of her, too. María works as a laboratory technician in the municipal hospital. \r\n\r\nWith this new loan, María will buy the necessary materials to continue with the construction: cement, sand, and rebar. With those, she will build part of the wall around her house, since they need security and privacy. She is grateful for the unconditional support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided to her.
LOAN_USE: to purchase construction materials.

DESCRIPTION:
Susanna has a request already for her second Kiva loan, and she is also thankful for her first Kiva loan. She lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. With her pedagogical education and for 35 years already, Susanna has been working at the school as a German language teacher. She mentions that during the years she always worked with great pleasure and devotion and she never hesitated to help and support her pupils.

Unfortunately she has had some health problems lately and she has to have surgery in order to get rid of her health problems. She will be very thankful for this loan of 950,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her surgery at the hospital.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Susanna has a request already for her second Kiva loan, and she is also thankful for her first Kiva loan. She lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. With her pedagogical education and for 35 years already, Susanna has been working at the school as a German language teacher. She mentions that during the years she always worked with great pleasure and devotion and she never hesitated to help and support her pupils.

Unfortunately she has had some health problems lately and she has to have surgery in order to get rid of her health problems. She will be very thankful for this loan of 950,000 Armenian drams in order to pay for her surgery at the hospital.
LOAN_USE: to pay for her surgery at the hospital.

DESCRIPTION:
Gulniso was born in 1977. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a builder. Gulniso is a farmer. She is also a very responsible seamstress and has great experience. She works hard to earn a living and provide her children with all they need.

Gulniso has always wanted to see her children receive higher education. Now, her daughter is a student in her third year at the Kulob State University. She studies well. Guljahon must pay for her daughter’s university tuition. She is asking for a loan with this aim. Gulniso and her lovely daughter await your mercy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Gulniso was born in 1977. She is married and has three children. Her husband is a builder. Gulniso is a farmer. She is also a very responsible seamstress and has great experience. She works hard to earn a living and provide her children with all they need.

Gulniso has always wanted to see her children receive higher education. Now, her daughter is a student in her third year at the Kulob State University. She studies well. Guljahon must pay for her daughter’s university tuition. She is asking for a loan with this aim. Gulniso and her lovely daughter await your mercy.
LOAN_USE: to pay for her daughter’s tuition at the University to complete her studies and find well-paying job in future.

DESCRIPTION:
Gertrudes is 52 years old and has four children. Gertrudes is married and has one child still in school.

Gertrudes is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gertrudes requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gertrudes has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Gertrudes is 52 years old and has four children. Gertrudes is married and has one child still in school.

Gertrudes is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Gertrudes requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Gertrudes has been raising pigs for 13 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Gertrudes would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

DESCRIPTION: Mrs. Narantsetseg is 46 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger in Hentii province, Mongolia. Her husband Zorigtbaatar, age 47, runs a taxi service business in town. Her children Nandin-Od, age 25 and Altan-Od, age 23 have just graduated from their university and now are looking for job. Her younger daughter Odmaa, age 14 studies in a local secondary school. The borrower has been running a business buying recyclable materials from households and selling it to recycling companies at a little higher price. She is now requesting 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of recyclable materials from households to sell to recycling companies. She is a hardworking, open-minded and modest woman.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a large amount of recyclable materials

DESCRIPTION:
Clara is 53 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with eight children. 

Clara has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan for PHP 15,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

Clara has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Clara hopes to improve her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Yayah. She is 55 years old, married, and has 1 son. She is a housewife and takes care of her family. Her husband has been working as a toy trader in the Tangerang District of Indonesia for 5 years. Her husband is the only breadwinner in the family. Still, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their family.

Yayah has asked for a loan of 10,000,000 IDR from KBMI.
This loan will be used to build a better bathroom and well for her family. Today her family has no access to a toilet or water source in their home and must rely on the river for bathing.
Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet and a water source, but Yayah will be able to repay the loan received.

Yayah and her family want to live a healthy life with clean sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Yayah. She is 55 years old, married, and has 1 son. She is a housewife and takes care of her family. Her husband has been working as a toy trader in the Tangerang District of Indonesia for 5 years. Her husband is the only breadwinner in the family. Still, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their family.

Yayah has asked for a loan of 10,000,000 IDR from KBMI.
This loan will be used to build a better bathroom and well for her family. Today her family has no access to a toilet or water source in their home and must rely on the river for bathing.
Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet and a water source, but Yayah will be able to repay the loan received.

Yayah and her family want to live a healthy life with clean sanitation and water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
LOAN_USE: to build a better bathroom and well for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Hoa is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She has been in the fish processing business for more than 10 years. Hoa lives in Hoang Hoa District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the area. In addition, this region often suffers from natural disasters, such as floods and drought.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution in order to improve her business. She successfully repaid five loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hoa is a reputable person in her community. The main hardship that Hoa faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools for fishing.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hoa is 32 years old, married, and has two children. She has been in the fish processing business for more than 10 years. Hoa lives in Hoang Hoa District, a rural area in Thanh Hoa Province. Her family is a low-income household in the area. In addition, this region often suffers from natural disasters, such as floods and drought.

In 2014, Hoa joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution in order to improve her business. She successfully repaid five loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hoa is a reputable person in her community. The main hardship that Hoa faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools for fishing.

With her business profit, Hoa hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase tools for fishing.

DESCRIPTION: Yazmin tiene 23 años de edad, de estado civil casada su esposo le ayuda en el negocio se dedica hace 4 años a vender camisas, pantalones, buzos  y conjuntos es amable, tranquila, trabajadora  tiene clientes quienes le visitan todos los jueves y domingos este pequeño negocio le ha permitido obtener el único sustento para satisfacer las necesidades básicas del hogar. Yazmin  con el dinero comprara hermosos conjuntos, camisas, buzos, pantalones en distintos tipos de tela buscando obtener mayores ventas y mejores ingresos para seguir satisfaciendo los principales gastos de este humilde hogar.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yazmin is a 23-year-old, kind, quiet, and hard-working woman. She has worked for 4 years selling shirts, pants, tracksuits, and two-piece outfits. She is married and her husband helps her with the business.

Some of her customers visit on Thursdays and Sundays. This small business provides the only mean to satisfied the basic needs of the household.

With the loan, Yazmin will buy beautiful two-piece outfits, shirts, tracksuits, and pants in different fabrics, looking to make higher number of sales and a better income to continue to cover the main expenses of this humble home.
LOAN_USE: to buy beautiful two-piece outfits, shirts, tracksuits, and pants in different fabrics.

DESCRIPTION:
Diana is 35 years old, and she lives in the municipality of Medellin. She’s a very talented woman, who has a beauty salon. She started it five years ago after deciding to become independent and because her economic situation wasn’t good. She loves her work, and she’s very good at it.

She dreams of having a huge and successful business that can be sustainable and profitable. To achieve that goal, she wants to invest in it. Therefore, she’s asking for a loan to buy nail polish, a new chair, and more supplies to hire a new employee and to expand her business.

Support this talented woman and loan now.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Diana is 35 years old, and she lives in the municipality of Medellin. She’s a very talented woman, who has a beauty salon. She started it five years ago after deciding to become independent and because her economic situation wasn’t good. She loves her work, and she’s very good at it.

She dreams of having a huge and successful business that can be sustainable and profitable. To achieve that goal, she wants to invest in it. Therefore, she’s asking for a loan to buy nail polish, a new chair, and more supplies to hire a new employee and to expand her business.

Support this talented woman and loan now.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia
LOAN_USE: to buy nail polish, a new chair, and more supplies to hire a new employee and to expand her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Ce Banc Villageois mis en place depuis février 2000 regroupe ces bonnes femmes qui sont du même village et sont liées par parenté, par amitié et sont très solidaires.Elles ont bénéficié de plusieurs prêts qu'elles ont remboursé à l'échéance.Leurs principales activités sont l'agriculture et le commerce.
Madame Fatou la représentante est âgée de 48 ans, debout à l'extrémité droite sur la photo et levant la main.Elle est mariée et mère de huit enfants: quatre filles et quatre garçons qui sont tous scolarisés.
Elle mène une activité d'embouche ovine et travaille en collaboration avec son mari.Elle achète ses sujets dans les marchés hebdomadaires et revend dans sa localité.Elle est expérimentée de plusieurs années dans ce secteur.
Son crédit va lui permettre d'acheter 4 moutons et de l'aliment pour bétail.Elle va écouler ses bêtes 3 ou 4 mois après les avoir engraissés.

Avec ses bénéfices, elle envisage de prendre en charge les frais scolaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargnes.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This Banc Villageois was established in February 2000. It includes these fine women who are from the same village and connected as parents and friends, and are very supportive of each other. They have had several loans that they have repaid at maturity. Their main activities are farming and sales.

Fatou, standing at far right in the photo, raising her hand, is the representative. She is 48 years old, married and the mother of eight children, four girls and four boys who are all in school.

She runs a sheet-fattening business and works together with her husband. She buys her sheep at the weekly markets and resells them in her area. She has several years of experience in this field.

Fatou will use her loan to buy four sheep and animal feed. She will sell her animals three or four months after fattening them. She plans to use her income to pay for her children's education expenses and increase her savings.
LOAN_USE: to buy sheep to fatten.
BORROWER_NAMES: Ami, Khonane, Marie, Rama, Adama, Bineta, Ndoumbé, Fatou, Mariétou, Khady, Bigué, Bineta, Ryma, Astou Malick, Sokhna, Fatou, Marie, Fatou, Yadicone, Fatou , Khémesse Nar, Marie, Khady, Ngondiane, Guignane, Mame Daba
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
En la parroquia crucita del cantón Portoviejo, se reúnen las socias del Grupo De Crédito Crucita, esta localidad se la conoce por sus hermosas playas que rodean este lindo lugar y que son muy visitadas por turistas nacionales y extranjeros, se la conoce con el nombre de  “Crucita la Bella”.
En este lugar vive la señora Mariana, tiene 70 años de edad, hace tiempo atrás su esposo falleció pero de esta relación tienen dos hijos mayores de edad e independientes. 
Doña Mariana es una mujer que siempre le ha tocado trabajar para salir adelante, y más después de la muerte de su querido esposo que siempre le ayudaba en sus actividades, ella tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa allí ella se gana la vida vendiendo una gran variedad de productos como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, productos de bazar, helados, etc. Ella cada vez que recibe los créditos surte aun mas su negocio razón por lo cual cuenta con mucha clientela que siempre visitan su local.  Lleva más de 32 años con su tienda y agradece que la institución le ayude con los créditos ya que es su forma de financiarse y salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite,  licores y otros productos de primera necesidad.  Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son tener buena salud.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The ladies of the “Crucita” Credit Group meet in Crucita Parish, in the Portoviejo Canton.  This town is known for its beautiful beaches, which surround this lovely place, and are much visited by domestic and international tourists. It is known by the name, “Crucita la Bella” [Crucita the beautiful].

Señora Mariana lives here.  She is 70 years old, and her husband passed away a while ago, but they have two children from their marriage, who are grown up and independent. Mariana is a woman who has always worked to make progress, even more so after the death of her beloved husband, who had always helped her with her activities. She has a grocery store in her house, and there, she earns a living selling a great variety of products, such as rice, sugar, oil, detergent, legumes, market products, ice cream, etc.

Every time she receives a loan, she stocks her business even more, which is the reason that she has many customers who always visit her store.  She has had her store for more than 32 years, and she is thankful that the institution helps her with the loans, as that is her way of financing herself and making progress. She is going to use this loan to further stock her store; she will buy rice, sugar, oil, spirits, and other basic products. 

She is a founding member of the credit group, and she likes it for the services that the institution offers.  Her dream is to have good health.
LOAN_USE: to buy rice, sugar, oil, spirits, and other basic products.

DESCRIPTION:
Abdallah is a farmer in Kitale area of Western Kenya and has been in mixed farming for 17 years. He is aged 37 and married with four children  with the last two still schooling. He sells his farm produce of maize, milk and horticultural products within the local market. He gets additional income from his bicycle repair.

Abdallah has requested a loan of 60,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds .He says the new venture will help him spread his farming risk and offer better nutrition for his family. He is optimistic and says he will have a stable source of income to be able to take good care of his family.

Abdallah laments the high cost of feed and other inputs, coupled with  lack of enough capital.
LOAN_USE: To buy poultry birds.

DESCRIPTION: Francis is married and has four children. For the past six years, he has operated a tailoring shop, where he makes clothes. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. Francis describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Francis is married and has four children. For the past six years, he has operated a tailoring shop, where he makes clothes. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. Francis describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stock of tailoring materials.

DESCRIPTION:
Dilore has four children; 20, 17, 15 and 13 years of age. The oldest one study in university and three of them are attending the secondary school. Dilore and her husband have been in the livestock business for over seventeen years. They are passionate about the whole process: raising cattle and producing cheese, cottage cheese and butter. 
Their business was doing very well, especially over the past almost five years. They sold dairy products and cattle in small cities and villages around their living location. Unfortunately, this past winter, the snow and extreme cold hit North Albania very harsh and thousands of animals died including Dilore's cows. 
The demand for dairy products is high throughout Albania, thus, like many others who are involved in the same business, they were fortunate enough to generate some income through it. With that money they were able to feed the children and build a house and improve living conditions. When Dilore started describing the living conditions they were in before, she became very emotional.
Now, she plans to add three more cows to the once they already have and build a little stable so that animals no longer live outside during the cold and snowy winters. This is the fourth time that Dilore is applying for a loan. Thanks to her responsible actions, she remains an excellent client of VFA.
LOAN_USE: To purchase three cows and repair stable

DESCRIPTION:
Marilou is 47 years old, married, and has two children. One of her children attends school.  Marilou works very hard to provide for her family.

Marilou runs a general store in the Philippines and is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. Marilou has been in this business for 23 years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods, and other groceries. 

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money to ensure financial stability for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy more groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
This is 39-year-old Lydia from Liberia. She is married with two children. She attended school up to 12th grade. Both of her children are currently attending school while living at home.

Lydia runs a business which sells milk, sardines, mosquito coils and other items. She has been in this business for the past 12 years and works 12 hours per day, six days a week. She has had no problem with her business.

Lydia requested this loan from BRAC to purchase more milk, sardines, mosquito coil and other items to sell and increase her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve their standard of living. In the future she wants to improve her business and continue sending her children to school. She says thanks and gives appreciation to BRAC and the Kiva community for their support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This is 39-year-old Lydia from Liberia. She is married with two children. She attended school up to 12th grade. Both of her children are currently attending school while living at home.

Lydia runs a business which sells milk, sardines, mosquito coils and other items. She has been in this business for the past 12 years and works 12 hours per day, six days a week. She has had no problem with her business.

Lydia requested this loan from BRAC to purchase more milk, sardines, mosquito coil and other items to sell and increase her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help improve their standard of living. In the future she wants to improve her business and continue sending her children to school. She says thanks and gives appreciation to BRAC and the Kiva community for their support.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more milk, sardines, mosquito coils and other items to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Sahar is a 30 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child still attending school. Her husband is the main income source and works untiringly to satisfy the necessities of life and till now he earns a fair revenue. That’s why, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him with the coming school year what makes her very satisfied.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Sahar is a 30 year old Lebanese married woman living with her husband and one child still attending school. Her husband is the main income source and works untiringly to satisfy the necessities of life and till now he earns a fair revenue. That’s why, today, she is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Vitas s.a.l to pay her child’s educational fees. She said that the loan will surely help her to register him with the coming school year what makes her very satisfied.
LOAN_USE: to pay her child’s educational fees

DESCRIPTION:
Catherine is a 34-year-old maize farmer in Igoji East, Kenya. She historically struggles to access credit for high quality seeds and fertilizer, which compromises the quality of her harvest. Catherine is excited to have access to high quality inputs, advice and insurance from an Apollo Agriculture loan, to increase her yields.

With this bundled package, Catherine expects higher profits this season, which she hopes to invest back into her farm in subsequent seasons.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Catherine is a 34-year-old maize farmer in Igoji East, Kenya. She historically struggles to access credit for high quality seeds and fertilizer, which compromises the quality of her harvest. Catherine is excited to have access to high quality inputs, advice and insurance from an Apollo Agriculture loan, to increase her yields.

With this bundled package, Catherine expects higher profits this season, which she hopes to invest back into her farm in subsequent seasons.
LOAN_USE: to access premium seeds and high quality fertilizer for 1.5 acres of maize, in addition to advice and insurance.

DESCRIPTION: Ablavi est une commerçante de pagnes de diverses qualités. Elle  est jeune, âgée de 33 ans, mariée avec deux enfants. Elle fait ses commandes deux fois par mois au marché. Elle cherche à avoir un fonds pour acheter des variétés de pagnes à la satisfaction de sa clientèle. Avec ce micro crédit elle compte augmenter ses achats en pagnes et avoir plus de bénéfices et mieux gérer les charges de la maison.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Ablavi is a merchant of 'pagnes' [the colorful cloth of western Africa] of diverse kinds. She is young, 33 years old, and married with two children. She orders supplies twice a month from the market and is seeking funding to purchase a variety of ‘pagne’ cloth to satisfy her customer base. With this micro-loan, she plans to increase her purchase of ‘pagne’ cloth, earn more, and do better at managing household expenses.
LOAN_USE: to pay for 6 lengths of 'pagne' cloth

DESCRIPTION:
el sr. Jorge Humberto O. tiene 38 años de edad, vive en la colonia Sempe de la ciudad de Tegucigalpa, tiene un pequeño comedor en el cual vende desayunos, almuerzos y la especialidad del negocio es la carne asada. Don Jorge cuenta con 4 empleados. Jorge se levanta a las 5 de la mañana todos los dias ya que tiene un contrato de servicio de alimentacion con la policia Municipal.
Jorge es casado y tiene 4 hijos, 3 de ellos estan estudiando y uno es recien nacido.
el credito que solicita lo necesita para invertirlo en su negocio ya que las ventas estan mejorando y no se da abasto para cubrir las necesidades de todos sus clientes.
las ganancias las necesita para cubrir con todos los gastos de su familia y de su hogar. dice sentirse muy feliz ya que tuvo la bendicion de Dios de darle otro hijo que nacio sano. su hijo apenas tiene dos semanas de haber nacido.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jorge Humberto O., 38, lives in Tegucigalpa's Sempe neighborhood. He has a small eatery where he sells breakfasts and lunches; his specialty is grilled meat. Jorge has 4 employees. Jorge gets up at 5am every day because he has a contract to prepare food for the municipal police department. Jorge is married and has 4 children, three of whom are students and one, who is a new-born. He needs funding to invest in his business because sales are improving and he does not have enough supplies to meet all customer demand. He needs the profits to cover family and household expenses. He states that he is very happy because God blessed him with another son who was born healthy; his son is barely two weeks old.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: To buy beef, pork, chicken, vegetables, soft-drinks, lard, cooking oil, spices, tortillas, bread, beans, rice, sugar, disposable plates and drinking glasses, coffee, water, juices, potatoes, cabbage, yucca, eggs. butter, cheese, quesillo (a type of cheese similar to cottage cheese)

DESCRIPTION:
Constance is a 25-year-old young woman living in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She is married with two children. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community. The goal of a Learner Guide is to help boost the academic achievement of students in local high schools as well as teach them life skills. Over the last three months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing approximately 100 broiler birds every six weeks – while selling to local residents. 

Poultry production is a successful business in her community. Constance is seeking to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use this Kiva loan to purchase more broiler birds and feed in order to increase production. Her hope is to raise enough money to continue her education.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Constance is a 25-year-old young woman living in the Mt. Darwin District of Zimbabwe. She is married with two children. She volunteers as a Camfed Learner Guide at schools in her community. The goal of a Learner Guide is to help boost the academic achievement of students in local high schools as well as teach them life skills.
