Over the last three months, she has grown her poultry business to its current capacity – producing approximately 100 broiler birds every six weeks – while selling to local residents. 

Poultry production is a successful business in her community. Constance is seeking to increase her sales and become a supplier to major supermarkets. She will use this Kiva loan to purchase more broiler birds and feed in order to increase production. Her hope is to raise enough money to continue her education.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more broiler chicks and chick feed

DESCRIPTION:
Gulbodom is 28 years old. She is not married and lives with her parents. She took the "to get ahead" course at a women's organization and learned business skills. She wants to organize her own business sewing women's dresses because she sews very beautiful women's dresses. 

Gulbodom is asking for a loan of 5,000 somoni to buy a sewing machine for setting up her new business. She promises to make her payments on time. She awaits your support.
LOAN_USE: To buy sewing machine for organizing new business

DESCRIPTION:
Setra is a 41-year-old married father of three children, all of whom are still in school. He and his beloved family reside in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2010, Setra has been operating a cashew and rubber plantation to generate income to support his family. His wife also helps him provide for their family by working in a vegetable farm for extra income. Setra and his wife are able to earn around 25 USD per day.

Setra's cashew farm has been severely affected by insects and pests. He is leading his group of two members to apply for a loan. Setra (pictured right) is going to use his portion of the loan to pay for herbicides and pesticides to support his farm.

He hopes these purchases will help him take care of his crops and boost his productivity in order to better support his family's living standards and, especially, to help his children earn a bachelor’s degree.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Setra is a 41-year-old married father of three children, all of whom are still in school. He and his beloved family reside in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. Since 2010, Setra has been operating a cashew and rubber plantation to generate income to support his family. His wife also helps him provide for their family by working in a vegetable farm for extra income. Setra and his wife are able to earn around 25 USD per day.

Setra's cashew farm has been severely affected by insects and pests. He is leading his group of two members to apply for a loan. Setra (pictured right) is going to use his portion of the loan to pay for herbicides and pesticides to support his farm.

He hopes these purchases will help him take care of his crops and boost his productivity in order to better support his family's living standards and, especially, to help his children earn a bachelor’s degree.
LOAN_USE: to pay for herbicides and pesticides.

DESCRIPTION:
Paul is a married man. He operates a retail business where he sells belts, shoes, wallets, and mobile accessories. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals.

Paul will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of belts, shoes, wallets, and mobile accessories. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. His previous loan was repaid successfully.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Paul is a married man. He operates a retail business where he sells belts, shoes, wallets, and mobile accessories. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals.

Paul will use the KES 120,000 loan to buy more stock of belts, shoes, wallets, and mobile accessories. His business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. His previous loan was repaid successfully.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stock of belts, shoes, wallets, and mobile accessories for his retail business.

DESCRIPTION:
Cosmas, who is 26 years old, is happily married and blessed with 2 children. His wife takes care of the home and they support one another.

As a sugarcane and fruit seller, Cosmas likes his business very much. Interacting with clients is his hobby and he makes many friends everyday.

Cosmas will use this loan to buy sugarcane and fruits to grow his business. His profits will be used to clear his loan quickly so that he may take another loan. His dream is to grow his business and educate his children to university.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cosmas, who is 26 years old, is happily married and blessed with 2 children. His wife takes care of the home and they support one another.

As a sugarcane and fruit seller, Cosmas likes his business very much. Interacting with clients is his hobby and he makes many friends everyday.

Cosmas will use this loan to buy sugarcane and fruits to grow his business. His profits will be used to clear his loan quickly so that he may take another loan. His dream is to grow his business and educate his children to university.
LOAN_USE: to add stocks of sugarcane and fruits to grow his business.

DESCRIPTION:
Murabo is a group from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. Their village has no electricity and the group is seeking a loan to purchase a solar panel and equipment that will enable them create of a mobile phone charging business.

There are an estimated 100 mobile phones in this village, a critical tool for villagers to communicate with their families and to conduct business. Without electricity, people have resorted to dangerous alternatives such as using car batteries to recharge their mobile phones. With the proper equipment, the group will be able to provide a safer and affordable option to recharge phones.

They will repay the Kiva loan over a period of three years by charging USD 0.13 per phone recharge, a price similar to the current car battery solutions. With the money they make from recharging mobile phones and rechargeable LED lights, the members of the group will be able to improve their homes.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Murabo is a group from Rulindo District in the Northern Province of Rwanda. Their village has no electricity and the group is seeking a loan to purchase a solar panel and equipment that will enable them create of a mobile phone charging business.

There are an estimated 100 mobile phones in this village, a critical tool for villagers to communicate with their families and to conduct business. Without electricity, people have resorted to dangerous alternatives such as using car batteries to recharge their mobile phones. With the proper equipment, the group will be able to provide a safer and affordable option to recharge phones.

They will repay the Kiva loan over a period of three years by charging USD 0.13 per phone recharge, a price similar to the current car battery solutions. With the money they make from recharging mobile phones and rechargeable LED lights, the members of the group will be able to improve their homes.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a solar powered recharge station to charge mobile phones and LED lights for rural households without electricity.

DESCRIPTION: Virgilia, a 48-year-old married woman, lives in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines where she has cultivated bananas for sale to make a living for 10 years now. It normally gives Virgilia a monthly income of 8,000 PHP. Having joined GDMPC in 2011, she has requested a loan of 12,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. She's dreaming of augmenting her business one day.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise.

DESCRIPTION:
Sabrina is 40 years old and lives in Estrella Sinacaban, Philippines. She is married with 3 children.
To earn a living, Sabrina has a business selling street foods. She earns about PHP 1400 each month doing this type of work. Sabrina has requested a loan to purchase additional foods such as bread, buko juice, etc.
Sabrina has been a member of PMPC for 1 year. In the future, Sabrina would like to be able to support the education of her children.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional foods to sell such as bread, buko juice,etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Antonieta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like new fish net, gasoline for her boat, rope, and other materials needed for her business.

Antonieta dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Antonieta is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children. She runs a fishing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like new fish net, gasoline for her boat, rope, and other materials needed for her business.

Antonieta dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fishing materials like new fish net, gasoline for her boat, rope, and other materials needed for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs Nguyệt is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She has had a retail business selling\xa0dry food and general things for more than 10 years. Nguyệt lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

In 2014, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Nguyệt is a reputable person in the community.

The main hardship that she faces is lack of money to keep sending her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies and pay the tuition fee for her children.

Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mrs Nguyệt is 46 years old and married with 3 children. She has had a retail business selling\xa0dry food and general things for more than 10 years. Nguyệt lives in Quang Xuong district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover the market need is low in this region.

In 2014, Nguyệt joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nguyệt has successfully repaid 4 loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Nguyệt is a reputable person in the community.

The main hardship that she faces is lack of money to keep sending her children to school. She is requesting a loan to purchase school supplies and pay the tuition fee for her children.

Nguyệt hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase school supplies and pay the tuition fee for her children.

DESCRIPTION:
Conchita is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Conchita is 70 years old.

Conchita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Conchita has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Conchita is a widowed woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Conchita is 70 years old.

Conchita has a food vending business in the Philippines. Conchita requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. Conchita has been in this business for 3 years.

In the future, Conchita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy ingredients for her food production business

DESCRIPTION:
Ana, se dedica a la venta de tamales, su negocio lo instala en el mercado municipal, ella vive con sus tres hijos menores. Ana administra el negocio desde hace varios años, en un horario de 8:00am hasta que los vende todos, aprendió a elaborarlos porque su madre le dedico tiempo para enseñarle.
Actualmente Ana solicita un préstamo para la compra de maíz (en elote), para hacer tamales de maíz tierno, el préstamo le ayudara para comprar varios canastos de maíz, para poder preparar tamales y tener disponibilidad de materia prima.
La aspiración de ella es continuar trabajando, poco a poco ganar más clientes, mejorando así las condiciones económicas de la familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ana sells tamales from her business at the municipal market. She lives with her three young children. Ana has managed her business for several years. Her schedule starts at 8am and continues until she sells everything. She learned how to make tamales from her mother who took the time to teach her.

Ana is currently requesting a loan to buy fresh corn for making tamales. This loan will help her to buy several baskets of corn so that she can prepare the tamales and have enough supplies on hand. She aspires to continue working, gradually gaining more customers, and improving her family’s financial condition.
LOAN_USE: to buy corn.

DESCRIPTION: Mariée de 35 ans avec un  enfant en charge , Maditchekina est revendeuse de  pastèque , fruits qu'elle réceptionne une fois par semaine au marché pour venir couper en morceau afin de revendre aux clients. Elle veut avoir un crédit pour augmenter sa commande de pastèque. Son souhait c'est de bien vendre pour avoir assez de revenus pour bien participer aux besoins de la famille.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: 35 years old and married, she has a child. Maditchekina is a seller of watermelon. She gets the fruit once a week at the market, and cuts it into pieces in order to sell to customers. She wants a loan for increasing her watermelon order. Her wish is to sell more, in order to have enough income to participate in meeting the needs of her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy 3 baskets of watermelons.

DESCRIPTION:
Sajida is a 45-year-old woman who is married with two daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For many years, Sajida’s husband has been running a crockery store where he sells utensils and he is solely responsible to feed the entire family. Her husband is a trained utensil-maker who uses marble stones to create grinding utensils for herbs, spices, and other uses. He buys raw marble stone and, by using his machinery, manufactures marble utensils. People like his marble utensils a lot and his current business is running well and increasing day by day. 

Sajida is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more stock of raw marble to manufacture utensils. She will use her loan to increase her husband’s business and help him to meet customer demand. Sajida’s husband will use the profit from her loan to save for future needs as well. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sajida is a 45-year-old woman who is married with two daughters and two sons. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. For many years, Sajida’s husband has been running a crockery store where he sells utensils and he is solely responsible to feed the entire family. Her husband is a trained utensil-maker who uses marble stones to create grinding utensils for herbs, spices, and other uses. He buys raw marble stone and, by using his machinery, manufactures marble utensils. People like his marble utensils a lot and his current business is running well and increasing day by day. 

Sajida is requesting a loan through the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more stock of raw marble to manufacture utensils. She will use her loan to increase her husband’s business and help him to meet customer demand. Sajida’s husband will use the profit from her loan to save for future needs as well. She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to purchase marble to make utensils and crockery

DESCRIPTION: Agbeguida G. is 36 years old and runs a hardware store called “ETS. Mon Seigneur” in Lomé, Togo. Mr. G. is married and has two children. He began his business in 2000 and is asking for his second loan from WAGES, which he will use to replenish his stock of nails, paints and other hardware supplies. With your help, Mr. G.’s business will continue to grow.
LOAN_USE: To restock hardware supplies

DESCRIPTION:
La señora  Esmara de 27  años  de edad,  es casada   tiene 2 hijos que dependen de ella, vive en casa propia  ubicada en una aldea de Amapala,  se dedica desde hace 3 años al negocio de venta de arroz, frijoles, manteca, maíz, maseca, frescos, agua, etc. es una mujer trabajadora con deseos de salir adelante con su familia y su esposo le apoya en sus gastos.
Doña Esmara está solicitando el préstamo para compra de una refrigeradora de segunda ya que  no tiene donde helar sus frescos y sus carnes, con el apoyo del préstamo pretende mejorar su negocio y tener más utilidades, es un cliente nuevo..
Su sueño es mejorar su negocio y su casa.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Noviembre del 2015.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Esmara is 27 years old, is married and has two children who depend on her. She lives in her own home located in a small town of Amapala. For three years she has made a living in the business of selling rice, beans, butter, corn, flour, sodas, water, etc...She is a hard-working woman who desires to come out ahead with her family and her husband supports them with the expenses.

Esmara is requesting a loan for the purchase of a second refrigerator as she doesn't have a place to cool her soda and meat. With the assistance from the loan she intends to improve her business and have more services for attract new customers. Her dream is to improve her home and business.
LOAN_USE: with the purchase of a refrigerator for her business.

DESCRIPTION: Quirina is 51 years old, married and has eight children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use when raising her livestock. Quirina has been in her current line of work for three years, and has borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.\r\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Quirina is 51 years old, married and has eight children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan from NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to use when raising her livestock. Quirina has been in her current line of work for three years, and has borrowed and repaid two prior loans from NWTF. In the future, she would like to save enough money to send her children to college.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy feed and other supplies for her livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Diosa A. is from the village of Duka, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 49 years old. Diosa is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Diosa owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling hotdogs & sausages from PUREFOODS in the local community. Diosa has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Diosa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Diosa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Diosa is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell, like hot dogs & sausages. This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Diosa from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To purchase additional products to sell, like hot dogs & sausages

DESCRIPTION:
Angelina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelina is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Angelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

Angelina has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Angelina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Angelina is 48 years old and has three children who are in school.

Angelina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Angelina requested a 14,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

Angelina has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Angelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy a variety of fish to sell and other supplies needed in her business.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married mother of seven children, Maria works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from general store. Maria has requested to borrow PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

Maria has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more fish to sell in her food stall.

DESCRIPTION: Dellanira una mujer que junto a su madre inicio un negocio de venta de arepas y comidas los fines de semana hace aproximadamente dos años, ya que todos sus procesos los hace empíricamente se ve en la necesidad de solicitar un crédito para la compra de un asador, un molino eléctrico y el resto en materia prima no perecedera como papa, chocolate, maíz etc. Este crédito la beneficiara enormemente ya que agilizara sus procesos y lo más importante tendrá más tiempo para dedicarle a su familia conformada por sus 3 hijos o los cuales lucha incansablemente para brindarle todas las comodidades que estén a su alcance
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Together with her mother Dellanira started a business about two years ago selling corn tortillas and meals at weekends. Now that time has passed she sees a need to buy a BBQ, an electric flour grinder, and other non-perishable  items like potatoes, chocolate, corn etc. The loan will help her enormously as it will speed up preparation time, and more importantly give her more time to spend with her family. She has three children for whom she works very hard to provide them with as good a life as she is able.
LOAN_USE: buy a BBQ, an electric flour grinder, and ingredients such as corn
TAGS: #Biz Durable Asset, #Woman Owned Biz, #Parent, user_favorite, #Woman Owned Biz, #Supporting Family

DESCRIPTION:
Marlyn is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 45 years old and five of her children are still in school.

Marlyn has a crab meat vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crab meat to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marlyn is a married woman with ten children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Marlyn is 45 years old and five of her children are still in school.

Marlyn has a crab meat vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more crab meat to sell.

Marlyn has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, Marlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy more crab meat to sell

DESCRIPTION: Юсуп молодой человек в возрасте 54 года. Живет он со своей семьей и занимается животноводством. Юсуп имеет высшее образование. Юсуп работал в милиции и любил свою работу, но по выслуге лет он вышел на пенсию. Сегодня он рад, что может уделять больше внимания своей семье. Работая он чувствует себя спокойнее и знает, что не будет никому обузой. Его семья его поддерживает во всем. Его жена государственный служащий и она работает надзирателем. Его сын работает мастером резьбы по дереву, а невестка преподает в младших классах. Юсуп хочет купить еще несколько голов скота и ему нужны для этого средства. Он обратился в Арванд за помощью. Он благодарит KIVA за поддержку.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yusup is 54 years old. He lives with his family and works with livestock. Yusup has a higher education. Yusup worked in the police and loved his work, but after he reached a certain age he retired. Today he is glad that he can pay more attention to his family. When he is working, he feels calmer, knowing that he's not a burden to anybody.

His family supports him in everything. His wife is a public servant and she works as a supervisor. His son works as a carpenter, and his daughter-in-law teaches in elementary education. Yusup wants to buy a few more heads of cattle and for this, he needs money. He applied to Arvand for help. He is thankful to Kiva for the support.
LOAN_USE: to buy a couple of cattle to increase the herd.

DESCRIPTION:
Carmelita has a business that serves like a small grocery store in the community of Jagna, Bohol. Sari-sari stores are common businesses in most rural places in the Philippines.

She is asking for a loan to improve her inventory. She is asking for a loan to buy drinks, detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and cooking oil.

Her income will be for family daily consumption, savings and business expansion.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Carmelita has a business that serves like a small grocery store in the community of Jagna, Bohol. Sari-sari stores are common businesses in most rural places in the Philippines.

She is asking for a loan to improve her inventory. She is asking for a loan to buy drinks, detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and cooking oil.

Her income will be for family daily consumption, savings and business expansion.
LOAN_USE: to buy drinks, detergent, bath soap, seasoning, shampoo, canned goods, noodles, and cooking oil

DESCRIPTION: Mr. Raphael I. sells wine. He started this business in 2005, after 8 years of training from his master. According to him, if the loan of $800 is given to him, it will enable him to buy more wine for sale. He is 31 years old and lives in Benin City. He is a LAPO member.
LOAN_USE: To buy more wine for sale.

DESCRIPTION:
Humaira is the age of 33; she is the mother of three children and lives in Lahore, Pakistan. Her husband has been running a general store in which he sells rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. 

He manages his household necessities from his own store as well. Some of his relatives like to purchase from his general store. He speaks with a monotonous tone, which is impressive, and he easily wins the trust of others. Due to his behavior and tone, he has built up a very good relationship with his customers. 

His general store is very famous in the town; that is the reason his business is running well. Due to good relationships, his sales have increased a lot, but he does not have sufficient stock to cope with the demand. Therefore, Humaira requested a loan for her husband so that he can buy more stock of wheat, rice, flour, pulses, soap, shampoo, detergents, biscuits, etc. 

Humaira hopes that her husband will utilize the loan in a positive way; this amount will help him to cope with the demand. 

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.

She thanks Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, detergent, soap, biscuits, etc. for the general store.

DESCRIPTION:
Eva is married, and she works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns income from a cafeteria. Eva is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF in order to buy more fish for her fish vending business to sell.

Eva has been sustaining her business activities through her past 15 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION:
Sindy tiene 23 años de edad, estudió hasta bachillerato, es madre soltera de un hijo vive con su madre y hermanos en casa familiar.

Sindy se dedica a la venta de tamales ya sea de elote, pisques (con frijoles) y de gallina. Ella vende dos veces por semana debido a que es madre soltera y surgió la necesidad de sacar adelante a su hijo ella sola. Su madre es quien le ayuda a cuidar de su hijo y a vender los tamales.
 
A pesar de las adversidades Sindy siempre busca la manera de salir adelante, fue apoyada con dos préstamos en Kiva para su negocio de los cuales uno ya lo pagó y el más reciente lo está pagando muy puntual. Ahora necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar maíz, pollo, papas, aceite, elotes, frijoles y condimentos para la venta de tamales ya que es madre soltera y debe crecer a su hijo. 

Ella sueña con que su hijo crezca sano y darle lo mejor en la vida y espera también que el negocio siga siendo rentable.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sindy is 23 years old. She studied through high school. She is a single mother with one child, living with her mother and siblings in the family home.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Sindy works selling tamales: corn, "pisque" (filled with beans), and chicken. She sells two times per week because she is a single mother and the need arose to get her child ahead on her own. Her mother helps her to care for the child and to sell the tamales.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Despite adversity, Sindy always looks for the way to get ahead. She was helped with two Kiva loans for her business. One was paid off and she is making very punctual payments on the recent one. Now she needs a new loan to buy corn, chicken, potatoes, oil, corn on the cob, beans, and condiments to sell tamales because she is a single mother and must care for her child.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
She hopes for her her child to grow up healthy and to give him the best in life. She also hopes that her business will continue being profitable.
LOAN_USE: to buy corn, chicken, potatoes, oil, corn on the cob, beans, and condiments for the sale of tamales; she is a single mother raising a child.

DESCRIPTION:
Zamira was born into a family where all of the females learned and practiced sewing. She got married when she was only 18 years old in a village where the main activity was agriculture and has not had the possibility of practicing this craft until now.

She has come to Kiva lenders to support a loan to buy a sewing machine. "I will at least repair my families\' clothes and in the future I would probably regain all the learned skills and maybe even make an income by sewing for the villagers here!"-said she hopefully during the interview.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Zamira was born into a family where all of the females learned and practiced sewing. She got married when she was only 18 years old in a village where the main activity was agriculture and has not had the possibility of practicing this craft until now.

She has come to Kiva lenders to support a loan to buy a sewing machine. "I will at least repair my families\' clothes and in the future I would probably regain all the learned skills and maybe even make an income by sewing for the villagers here!"-said she hopefully during the interview.
LOAN_USE: to buy a sewing machine so she can practice a craft she has learned since she was a teenager and hopefully start her own business.
TAGS: #Woman Owned Biz, #Repeat Borrower, #Parent, #Biz Durable Asset, #Fabrics, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
Riaz is a 39-year-old man who established a low-cost private school in a marginalized community. The aim of the school is create learning experiences of high standards; it would help the students to get prepared for a better future.

At present, he is planning to construct additional classrooms in the vacant space available in the school. However, there's a lack of money for bearing the expenses related to construction. He has requested an amount of PKR 60,000 for constructing additional classrooms and also for purchasing furniture.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

He has requested an amount of PKR 60,000 for constructing additional classrooms and also for purchasing furniture.
LOAN_USE: to construct additional classrooms and also to purchase furniture.

DESCRIPTION:
Tinh is 37 years old and lives in an old, small, traditional Thai house with her husband and two children. Tinh and her husband have had to work so hard to cover their living expenses for the family.

Tinh works in agriculture, cultivating rice, working with ducks, pigs, chickens and fish, while her husband works for local construction employers.

This is her seventh loan in the Anh Chi Em Program and she will use a portion of the loan to buy goats.

Tinh hopes that, through the loan and training support from Anh Chi Em, she will improve her family's income so that she can afford to invest in her pig farming business.

Tinh dreams that her children will be successful and abundant in life and that they will escape from poverty. In the picture, she is standing first on the right.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION: Marilyn is 38 years old and married with seven children, five of whom are in school. She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Marilyn has been farming rice for 2 years and also earns additional income from pig fattening.\r\n\r\nMarilyn is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional fertilizers. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional fertilizers

DESCRIPTION:
Esther is a 41-year-old farmer from a remote village in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. She resides with her husband and family. She has been actively involved in farming for the last five years and has never regretted or looked back. She practices mixed farming and sells milk, eggs, and various food crops at the local market. Esther passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is a lack of capital to buy quality breeds of poultry that are resistant to diseases and lay more eggs.

Esther is seeking a loan to purchase additional poultry. She will use her excess maize to feed the poultry and will provide sorghum to give the poultry energy and green grams (beans) for protein. Through better feeding, the poultry will increase their egg production and will lay more eggs that are of good quality, which will translate to more income. Apart from an increase in egg production, she will get increased output from poultry meat, and this will further increase her income and profit margins. Through increased profits, she intends to turn around her living conditions and live a better life.

In addition to profits, Esther will benefit from chicken manure, which contains the highest amount of nitrogen of any livestock manure and is very valuable as fertilizer. She will be able to save money that would have been spent to buy fertilizer.

Thanks to your support, Esther will succeed in making her dreams come true; take action and give a loan!

DESCRIPTION: In 2011, Vicenta learned about Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative and the financial assistance it gives. She tried her luck doing a business focusing on her farming activities. She feels she owes her fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted her with the money she used as capital. Vicenta borrowed an amount to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer. This will give her farming income a big boost. Vicenta is looking for better business opportunities and would love to be in a position to help others.

LOAN_USE: to buy 10 sacks of fertilizer

DESCRIPTION:
Sina is a 19-year-old single woman with no children. For three years, she has run a business selling vegetables (cabbage and cucumbers) in her community to earn a living.

A Samoan citizen, Sina works very hard to satisfy her customers with her fresh vegetables. Every day, except for Saturday and Sunday, she delivers her vegetables to villages using a wheelbarrow, an implement she believes is also making her strong, happy and healthy.

Sina became a member of SPBD in 2019. To help take her business to the next level, she needs a loan to purchase more equipment, including a water tank, rake, chemicals, vegetable seeds and soil,

Sina's dream is to one day earn more to buy her own vehicle to help her run the business and help her family.

DESCRIPTION: Erinah is a single mother of four children. All of her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family members.\r\n\r\nErinah has a restaurant. She has been in this business for 8 years. She sells, on retail, to all categories of people. She has applied for a loan of 700,000 Uganda shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more rice, beans, charcoal, beef, and bunches of bananas. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever increasing prices of food stuffs in Uganda. She aspires to own a fully stocked restaurant and to buy a plot of land to build her own house. She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.
LOAN_USE: To buy more rice, bunches of bananas, charcoal and beef

DESCRIPTION:
Marie has a passion for artwork and craftsmanship. She recently retired from her career with the local police force and she has been using her newfound time to explore her hobbies.

She would frequently visit the world of flea markets, estate sales, and consignment shops, enjoying the craft work of others, while purchasing the tools to create her own artwork.

She found a local store, Odds & Ends, where independent vendors sell furniture, artwork, and other various knickknacks. She realized that she had a good eye for this market and opened a booth of her own in the shop.

Marie sells refurbished furniture, vintage clothing, personally branded t-shirts and artwork. She has seen some success in the first few months, but would like to improve her business by purchasing larger quantities of inventory and storing it before it is ready to sell.

After two impressive months, Marie has a better idea of what sells and how to keep her costs low. She will use her Kiva loan for additional inventory and for a down payment on a portable work shop.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marie has a passion for artwork and craftsmanship. She recently retired from her career with the local police force and she has been using her newfound time to explore her hobbies.

She would frequently visit the world of flea markets, estate sales, and consignment shops, enjoying the craft work of others, while purchasing the tools to create her own artwork.

She found a local store, Odds & Ends, where independent vendors sell furniture, artwork, and other various knickknacks. She realized that she had a good eye for this market and opened a booth of her own in the shop.

Marie sells refurbished furniture, vintage clothing, personally branded t-shirts and artwork. She has seen some success in the first few months, but would like to improve her business by purchasing larger quantities of inventory and storing it before it is ready to sell.

After two impressive months, Marie has a better idea of what sells and how to keep her costs low. She will use her Kiva loan for additional inventory and for a down payment on a portable work shop.
LOAN_USE: to pay for additional inventory and for a down payment on a portable work shop.

DESCRIPTION: Ms. Saliga is a low income person which makes her vulnerable. She is 50 years old, married with four children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of Azerbaijan Republic in Caucasus region. Saliga owns a herd of milk cows. Every day she sells milk to the local milk processing shop. Her children help her breed these cows in the nearby grazing fields. The income from four cows is too low to support the family and she needs to increase the number of cows in the herd - that’s why Saliga applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli. A loan of $500 will help her buy one more pure-breed cow which will make her monthly income higher. The price of a milk calf is $300 and the cost of breeding is $100. The other $100 she plans to save for unexpected expenditures.
LOAN_USE: To buy milk cow

DESCRIPTION: Эту талантливую женщину зовут Зарина. Она дома занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды на заказ. Ей удобно шить на дому. Зарина добрая и шустрая женщина, которая хорошо справляется со своей работой. Она научилась шить и кроить женскую одежду 17 лет назад и по сей день продолжает свое любимое дело. Зарина в этом году исполнилось 34 лет. Она проживает в городе Душанбе. К сожалению, она с  мужем  в разводе и одна воспитывает 2 летнего сына. Благодаря своему умению Зарина зарабатывает на жизнь и чувствует себя независимой женщиной. В швейном деле ей нравится ежедневный доход и общение с новыми людьми. Зарина берет кредит, чтобы купить стройматериалы для ремонта дома.Она хочет  улучшить условия в квартире для себя и для ребенка. Ее мечта - в будущем открыть свое ателье по шитью национальной женской одежды.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This talented woman is named Zarina. She works from home as an independent seamstress and she sews traditional Tajik dresses. She really enjoys her job. Zarina is a kind and clever woman who handles all aspects of her work very well. She learned how to design and sew clothes 17 years ago and she is still involved in her favorite activity. This year she celebrated her 34th birthday. She lives in the city of Dushanbe. Unfortunately she is divorced and raising her two-year-old son on her own. Thanks to her sewing business, Zarina manages to make a living and feels like an independent woman. What she likes the most about her job is the fact that she makes a daily income and gets to interact with many people.

Zarina is taking a loan to buy some construction supplies to renovate her apartment. She wants to improve her living conditions (for herself and her son). Her dream is to open her own workshop one day and to continue to sew women's traditional Tajik dresses.
LOAN_USE: to purchase construction materials to renovate her apartment and provide better living conditions for her family.

DESCRIPTION: Meet 36 years old Dorris from Liberia. She is living together with her partner along with 3 children, ages between 9 and 17 years. Two of whom are schooling and all live at home. Dorris never had the opportunity to attend school. She deals in a business where she bakes short bread, cake donuts and also sells cold juice.  She learned how to sell from her mother and started to sell with her own savings. She has been in this business for the past 7 years now and works Monday through Saturday. She requested this loan from Brac and KIVA Field Partner to purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients that will be used to prepare short bread, cake donuts and cold juice to sell to her good clients. She likes her business because it helps to sustain her family. In the future Dorris wants to open a big shop. She says thanks and appreciation to Brac and Kiva community for their support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Meet 36 years old Dorris from Liberia. She is living together with her partner along with 3 children, ages between 9 and 17 years. LOAN_USE: to purchase more flour, sugar and other ingredients that will be used to prepare short bread, cake donuts and cold juice to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Silma, estudió hasta octavo grado en la escuela, está casada y su esposo es agricultor. Tiene 3 hijos los cuales asisten a la escuela.

Silma, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pupusas, tiene 5 años de experiencia en esta labor y lo aprendió de una amiga suya. El negocio está ubicado en su casa y trabaja de 3:00 a 7:00 pm.

Ella necesita un préstamo para comprar una cocina para la elaboración y venta de pupusas.

Silma, sueña con que sus hijos estudien en la universidad y sean profesionales.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Silma studied through to 8th grade at school. She is married and her husband is a farmer. She has three children who go to school.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Silma makes a living making and selling pupusas. She has five years experience with this work which she learned from a friend. The business is located at her house and she works from 3 to 7 pm.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
She needs a loan to buy a stove to make and sell pupusas.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Silma dreams of her children studying at university and becoming professionals.
LOAN_USE: to buy a stove to make and sell pupusas.

DESCRIPTION:
Meet 43 year-old Mercy from Liberia. She is a single mother with three children aged 12 through 20 years. All of her children are in school and live at home. Currently, Mercy earns her living by selling oil, rice, and charcoal. For the past four years, she has been managing her sales. She learned how to sell from her friend and started the business with some funds from her sister. She sells six days a week. She uses a car to transport supplies to her business site.

To maintain her business, she applied for a loan through BRAC Liberia and Kiva Field Partner to buy more oil, rice, and charcoal to sell in order to generate greater profits. She likes her business because it gives her profits and she is proud of her business because it provides her basic needs. In the future, Mercy wants to continue her children's education. She wishes to say thanks to BRAC and Kiva.

She wishes to say thanks to BRAC and Kiva.
LOAN_USE: to buy more oil, rice, and charcoal to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Mary is 18 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes.



To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more clothes for her boutique, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and more profits will be generated from expanded business. Mary will be in a position to provide more basic needs at home and improve the general welfare, as well pay the respective school dues for her siblings. Mary hopes that in she will be able to invest in maize growing in the near future.



Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mary is 18 years old and lives in the town of Namutumba in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Mary has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes.



To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more clothes for her boutique, and will help Mary to generate greater profits and more profits will be generated from expanded business. Mary will be in a position to provide more basic needs at home and improve the general welfare, as well pay the respective school dues for her siblings. Mary hopes that in she will be able to invest in maize growing in the near future.



Mary is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to stock more clothes for her boutique.

DESCRIPTION:
Cesar tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y junto a su esposa tiene 5 hijos a los cuales quiere muchísimo y se esfuerza cada día para que ellos tengan una vida digna y honrada y sobre todo con ejemplo de dedicación y luchan. Vive en la ciudad de Ica, ciudad que se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y acogedor, asimismo se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial el cultivo de algodón, uva, esparrago, paprika, entre otros. Cesar es muy trabajador, pero cuando tiene un tiempito libre le gusta mucho ver televisión, peor lo que más le gusta es comer uno de sus platillos favoritos el cual es el riquísimo “Ají de Gallina”. Debido a sus pocos recursos económico el solo pudo estudiar hasta el quinto grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar Ingeniería Civil. 

Dia a  día Cesar trabaja en su vehículo como chofer de taxi, ya que con el fruto de su trabajo puedo solventar los gastos de su hogar con mucho esfuerzo; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y sobre todo tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante cada día.

Cesar está agradecido con la ayuda que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, compra de llantas y renovación de documentos de licencia de conducir; de esta manera su vehículo será más seguro y sobre todo tendrá los documentos necesarios para seguir trabajando y podrá seguir luchando cada día por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y formar una empresa de taxis”.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cesar, 56, is married and he and his wife have five children he loves very much and strives for daily so that they will have a dignified, honorable life and above all an example of dedication and work to follow.  He lives in the city of Ica, a city noted for its hot, welcoming climate.  Agriculture is prevalent here too, especially cotton, grapes, asparagus and paprika, among others.  Cesar is very hardworking but when he has a little free time he enjoys watching television very much but what he likes best is enjoying one of his favorite dishes, the delicious “Ají de Gallina.”  Because of his limited economic resources he was only able to study up to fifth year of secondary school but would have liked to have studied civil engineering.

Day to day Cesar works driving his car providing taxi services because with the fruits of his labor and with much effort he’s able to cover household expenses.  He believes he does well in his business because he’s very kind and above all because he very much wants to get ahead every day.

Cesar is very grateful for the support Kiva lenders have given him because thanks to it he will be able to service his vehicle, to buy tires and to renew his driver’s license.  In this way, his vehicle will be safer and above all he’ll have the necessary documents to continue working and he will be able to continue striving towards making his greatest dream reality: to give his children a good education and to establish a taxi firm.
LOAN_USE: to buy tires, service his car and renew his driver's license.

DESCRIPTION:
Hang was born in 1968. She has four children. Her oldest daughter has graduated from school. Two other daughters are studying at university or in high school. Her son is learning at primary school. Her husband is a guard. His income is about 3,000,000 VND per month. 

Hang is a farmer. Her income is about 3,000,000 VND. She has done this job for 20 years. Her family’s total earnings are about 6,000,000 VND per month.
 
She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2003. In the last cycle she borrowed 9,374,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 10,682,000 VND to buy feed for her chickens.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed for her chickens.

DESCRIPTION:
Nafije and her retired husband, seen in the photo with her, are farmers from a small village in south Albania. They are parents of a son who lives and works in Italy and a 21- year-old daughter who is applying for post-graduate studies to improve her chances in the future for a better job. Nafije and her husband really want to support their daughter so they are asking for the first time in their life for a loan.

Nafije and her husband are hard-working villagers. They have two cows from which they sell milk and two calves per year. They also plant their land with different vegetables, mostly onions, as their village is very famous for growing one delicious variety of onion. They have tried to support their children during their life and do not want to fail now with something that is so important to their daughter and for her future.

Nafije thanks you all for the support and wishes all the best to all Kiva lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nafije and her retired husband, seen in the photo with her, are farmers from a small village in south Albania. They are parents of a son who lives and works in Italy and a 21- year-old daughter who is applying for post-graduate studies to improve her chances in the future for a better job. Nafije and her husband really want to support their daughter so they are asking for the first time in their life for a loan.

Nafije and her husband are hard-working villagers. They have two cows from which they sell milk and two calves per year. They also plant their land with different vegetables, mostly onions, as their village is very famous for growing one delicious variety of onion. They have tried to support their children during their life and do not want to fail now with something that is so important to their daughter and for her future.

Nafije thanks you all for the support and wishes all the best to all Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: to pay for her daughter's first fee of her post-graduate studies to improve her chances in the future for a better job.

DESCRIPTION:
Nasceu no Distrito de Chibuto, Provincia  de Gaza, sul  de Moçambique, casado e pai de 4 filhos  dos quais 3 frenquentam a Escola. Fez 8ª classe e parou por falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta a sua mae que vive com ele. 

Saiu de Chibuto para Boane a procura de emprego, trabalha no centro de Saude de Boane ha mais de 8 anos como conselheiro de HIV e SIDA e tem um salario de 4.000.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria (BIM).
Nunca solicitou emprestimo noutros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de um familiar que tambem é cliente desta instituição. Este é o seu terceiro emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt, com qual pretende comprar material de construcao da sua casa (cimento, ferro, areia, pedra, barrotes e outros) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua obra.
Compromete se a pagar devidamente e no futuro pretende abrir um estaleiro para venda de material de construcao, para tal ira solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
He was born in the district of Chibuto, province of Gaza, southern Mozambique. He is married and has four children, three of which attend school. He completed 8th grade and quit for lack of financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns. He also supports his mother, who lives with him.
He left Chibuto for Boane in search of a job. He has worked as an HIV and AIDS counselor for the health center in Boane for over eight years. He earns a salary of 4.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never requested loans from other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through a relative who is also a client of this institution. This is his third loan with Hluvuku. It is for 25.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase construction supplies for his house (cement, iron, sand, stone, rafters, etc.) so that he can keep building.
He promises to make the repayments as scheduled. In the future, he intends to open a storehouse for selling construction supplies. For that purpose he will request more loans from Hluvuku.
LOAN_USE: to purchase construction supplies for his house (cement, iron, sand, stone, rafters, etc.).

DESCRIPTION:
Mme MARIE PAULINE  est responsable du groupe ZEKOURA. Mariée, elle est mère de 04 enfants. Le plus âgé a 38ans et le moins âgé a 28ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a 03 personnes en charge.
Mme vend du bois de chauffe et du charbon de bois depuis plus de 07ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environants.
Elle veut s’acheter 01 demi camion de bois de chauffe.
Avec ses bénéfices, elle veut réinvestir dans son commerce. Elle ambitionne pouvoir s'acheter un camion pour le transport de son bois de chauffe et assurer la scolarité de ses petits fils dont leur mère est décédé.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ms. MARIE PAULINE is the official of the group ZEKOURA. A married woman, she is the mother of four children. The oldest is 38, and the youngest is 28. None goes to school. She has three persons to support.

She has been selling firewood and charcoal for over seven years and gets her supplies from nearby markets. She wants to purchase a half-truck load of firewood.

With the profits, she wants to reinvest in her business. Her ambition is to purchase a truck to transport her firewood and to ensure schooling for her grandsons whose mother has died.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a half-truck load of firewood

DESCRIPTION: El Banco Comunal Nuevo Amanecer está conformado por diez emprendedores que ya han venido trabajando con fundación león 2000, estos emprendedores tiene cada uno sus negocios, durante el  crédito otorgado han demostrado ser personas con metas en la vida y deseos de superación. Yolanda es parte de este grupo y su actividad a la que se dedica es la venta de tortilla, está solicitando financiamiento para la compra de productos como maíz, cal, leña, bolsas entre otros productos para la elaboración de las tortillas.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: The communal bank "Nuevo Amanecer" [New Dawn] is made of of ten entrepreneurs that have been working with Fundación León 2000.  They each have their own business.  Through the loans they have been offered, they have proven themselves to be people with goals in life and desires of getting ahead.  Yolanda is a part of this group, and she sells tortillas.  She is requesting financing to buy products like corn, lime, firewood, bags, and other items to make her tortillas.
LOAN_USE: to buy supplies.
BORROWER_NAMES: PAULA CRISTINA, MARIA ELENA, DEMETRIA, YOLANDA, OTILIA, NELSON GABRIEL, YISEL D E LA CARIDAD, JESSENIA DEL SOCORRO, Alba Justina, ELKI FRANCISCA
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
This photograph depicts a woman by the name of Firuza. She is 58 years old. Firuza is a medical worker. She lives with her husband and two sons in the Balkhi district. Her husband is retired.

Her oldest son is 24 years old and works as a painter. Her youngest son is 18 years old and attends university. Firuza and her family see her son's efforts and want to help him. Because he has to pay for his studies, and the family is unable to pay the tuition, Firuza cannot allow her son to be dismissed from the university. Firuza took matters into her own hands and requested a loan. The whole family will work hard to ensure that their son can complete his education.

Firuza relies on your help and expresses her gratitude to you in advance.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This photograph depicts a woman by the name of Firuza. She is 58 years old. Firuza is a medical worker. She lives with her husband and two sons in the Balkhi district. Her husband is retired.

Her oldest son is 24 years old and works as a painter. Her youngest son is 18 years old and attends university. Firuza and her family see her son's efforts and want to help him. Because he has to pay for his studies, and the family is unable to pay the tuition, Firuza cannot allow her son to be dismissed from the university. Firuza took matters into her own hands and requested a loan. The whole family will work hard to ensure that their son can complete his education.

Firuza relies on your help and expresses her gratitude to you in advance.
LOAN_USE: to pay for her son's university tuition.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Nunung. She is 37 years-old and married with two sons. Nunung has been a trader for ten years. Her husband has been working as a driver in the Tangerang District for seven years. Still, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their children.

Nunung has asked for a loan of 6,500,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to renovate a clean bathroom for her family. Today her family has no access to a toilet in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet source but Nunung will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean sanitation. Nunung is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LAS MERCEDES DE KATAÑIRAY,el banco esta ubicad en el distrito de Cusco, provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 53 años de edad es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende diferentes tipos de productos como arroz, azucar, leche, golosinas entre otros, la socia desea poder seguir y trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de azúcar para su negocio.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The borrower belongs to the "Las Mercedes de Katañiray" communal bank, whose members live in Cusco District, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is 53 years old, lives with her partner and has a son. 

She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells various kinds of products such as rice, sugar, milk, candy and other items. She wishes to be able to keep working so that she can continue supporting her family. The member is requesting a loan so that she can buy sugar for her business. She feels grateful for the loan granted and promises to make her installment payments.
LOAN_USE: To buy sugar for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Bekzod is 33 years old and comes from Gonchi, Tajikistan. He is married and a caring father of a small child. For over 10 years, he has been working by doing house repairs. Bekzod knows all aspects of his job and is respected by his colleagues. He also engages in animal husbandry and earns a good income from this business.

Unfortunately, his mother’s health has worsened and she urgently needs to begin medical treatment. Bekzod is requesting a Kiva loan from IMON to buy medicines so that she can begin treatment. He believes that with the help of the lenders, his mother’s health will improve. Bekzod hopes to receive the understanding and kindness of the lenders.

He is a returning borrower with a positive credit history. This is the fifth time he has requested a loan from IMON. He hopes to have the support from the lenders.

LOAN_USE: to purchase medicines for his mother's medical treatment.
TAGS: user_favorite, #Parent, #Health and Sanitation, #Repeat Borrower, #Supporting Family, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION: Mrs. Nga was born in 1980. She has three children in her family. One girl is in the seventh grade, one boy is in the fourth grade, and one little baby girl is at home. Her husband works as a porter. His income is about 3,000,000 Vietnamese dong (VND) per month. To help support her family, she sells chickens in the market to get 4,000,000 VND every month. She has participated in SEDA's crediting program since 2006. The last cycle, she borrowed 7,194,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she wants to borrow 9,374,000 VND to enlarge her business in the market. Then she would be able to let her three children go to school.
LOAN_USE: to increase her chicken sales in the market

DESCRIPTION:
Ms. Afiwa A. is born on January 5, 1978 in the region of Lomé. She is a single mother of one child. She has a very minimal level of education, but is well-skilled in the hardware store business which she inherited from her uncle. During the last 10 years she has invested herself in this business and manages it with rigor and passion.

She is a very ambitious person, and is asking for a loan of $1200 in order to strengthen her business by renting a storefront and building up a vast inventory of construction materials and other hardware supplies. Once this dream has been realized she will be able to vastly improve her living situation/conditions.

Translated from French by Chloé Tuot, a Kiva Volunteer.

Mademoiselle A. Afiwa est née le 05 janvier 1978 à Lomé. Elle est célibataire avec un enfant. D’un niveau d’étude très moyen mais très expérimentée dans le commerce de quincaillerie qu’elle a hérité de son oncle depuis dix ans, elle s’est investi dans ce domaine et le gère avec rigueur et passion.

Très ambitieuse, elle sollicite un crédit de $1200 pour renforcer son commerce par la location d’un magasin et la constitution d’un stock important de matériaux de construction et des articles de quincaillerie. Une fois se rêve réalisé son bénéfice sera maximisé source de l’amélioration de ses conditions de vie.
LOAN_USE: Sale of hardware/construction materials

DESCRIPTION: Kayi est une femme mariée âgée de 37 ans. Elle habite le quartier Avépozo et a en charge trois enfants. Kayi est une revendeuse ambulante de friperie. Elle s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Kayi sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des ballots de friperie. Kayi compte rentabiliser son activité commerciale et réaliser de bénéfices afin de subvenir aux besoins quotidiens de la famille et sortir de la vulnérabilité
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Kayi is a 37-year-old married woman. She lives in the Avépozo district and provides for three children.

Kayi retails second-hand clothing door-to-door. She procures supplies once monthly from the market.

Kayi is requesting this loan to purchase bundles of second-hand clothes. Kayi plans on making her business more profitable and using profits to meet her family's daily needs and get out of poverty.
LOAN_USE: buy three bundles of second-hand clothes.

DESCRIPTION:
John is a member of the Kiserian Victory group in Faulu Kenya. He sells food, milk and eggs to earn a living. He was previously employed before he started the business. He has become more focused in his business since he joined Faulu Kenya.  

So far, he has serviced one loan from Faulu Kenya. He hopes to expand his food kiosk in the future. He has requested 40,000 Kenyan shillings to build a food kiosk.
LOAN_USE: To build a food stall

DESCRIPTION:
Abdul is 25 years old. He is married and blessed with two school-going children. He is an owner of a grocery store that sells tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, carrots, green peppers, cabbages and fruits. He has been into this business for one year. He works from 8 a.m. up to 9 p.m. daily, and he earns a good profit.

This will be Abdul's first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He is applying for this loan to add more stock of tomatoes, onions, carrots, green peppers, fresh vegetables and seasonal fruits to sell. His dream is to establish other businesses in the near future.

Abdul will share a portion of this loan with his fellow loan group member of Upendo Group - Lumumba.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Abdul is 25 years old. He is married and blessed with two school-going children. He is an owner of a grocery store that sells tomatoes, onions, Irish potatoes, carrots, green peppers, cabbages and fruits. He has been into this business for one year. He works from 8 a.m. up to 9 p.m. daily, and he earns a good profit.
