Abdul will share a portion of this loan with his fellow loan group member of Upendo Group - Lumumba.
LOAN_USE: to add more stock of tomatoes, onions, carrots, green peppers, fresh vegetables and seasonal fruits to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
36-year-old Tomasa would like to ensure that her children's needs are met. She has 2 children aged 13 and 16. Her husband drives their motorcycle in Trinidad, Bohol, and she also works running a sari-sari store business. She also farms rice for additional income.

Tomasa is asking for a loan to increase her inventory, and to buy items in bulk to maximize her profit. She will use her loan to buy canned food, shampoo, detergent, bath soap, cooking oil, soy sauce, candies and biscuits.

Tomasa's main goal is to send her children to higher education.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
36-year-old Tomasa would like to ensure that her children's needs are met. She has 2 children aged 13 and 16. Her husband drives their motorcycle in Trinidad, Bohol, and she also works running a sari-sari store business. She also farms rice for additional income.

Tomasa is asking for a loan to increase her inventory, and to buy items in bulk to maximize her profit. She will use her loan to buy canned food, shampoo, detergent, bath soap, cooking oil, soy sauce, candies and biscuits.

Tomasa's main goal is to send her children to higher education.
LOAN_USE: to buy canned food, shampoo, detergent, bath soap, cooking oil, soy sauce, candies and biscuits

DESCRIPTION:
Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business. Liza has been in this business for 7 years, and she earns more income from selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Liza is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice farming business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice farming business. Liza has been in this business for 7 years, and she earns more income from selling vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

DESCRIPTION: Blanca de 52 años de edad, se ha convertido en un ejemplo de vida para su familia. Desde su infancia ha trabajado y luchando por ganarse el sustento diario y hacerse un lugar en la sociedad. Siempre soñó con tener una vivienda y asegurar un futuro de calidad para sus seres queridos. Hoy Blanca se encuentra trabajando su negocio confección de prendas directa. Su sueño no para acá, pues desea convertirse en la principal proveedora en el mercado de su municipio y ampliar la variedad de productos, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que destinará para la compra de telas y mantenimiento de máquinas. Espera con esta inversión mejorar la productividad en su negocio y mejorar las condiciones económicas de la familia.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Blanca, age 52, has become an example of good living for her family. From childhood, she has worked and fought to earn her daily bread and make her way in society. She always dreamed of having a house and securing a quality future for her loved ones.

Today, Blanca is working in her business producing retail clothing items. Her dream doesn't stop there, as she wants to become the main producer in her town's market and increase the variety of products. Therefore, she is requesting a loan that she will put towards the purchase of fabric and maintenance of her machines.

With this investment, she hopes to improve her business's productivity and improve her family's economic conditions.
LOAN_USE: to buy fabric and to maintain her machines

DESCRIPTION:
Elizabeth is 39 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She operates a cosmetics shop, which she has operated for 10 years.

This is Elizabeth's first loan which she will use to buy stock of cosmetics to sell to her customers. She will use profits from expanded business to support her domestic budget and channel the rest into the business to increase the stock to make it earn more income.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve her family's standard of living.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elizabeth is 39 years old. She is married and blessed with two children. She operates a cosmetics shop, which she has operated for 10 years.

This is Elizabeth's first loan which she will use to buy stock of cosmetics to sell to her customers. She will use profits from expanded business to support her domestic budget and channel the rest into the business to increase the stock to make it earn more income.

Her hopes and dreams are to improve her family's standard of living.
LOAN_USE: to buy stock of cosmetics to sell to her customers.

DESCRIPTION: Momo is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 40,000 to start a new clothes selling business.  With the loan, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. \r\n\r\nThe previous loan had a lot of impact upon her business and her family is now living a better life and her children are gaining a good education.
LOAN_USE: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

DESCRIPTION:
Fatuma is a 40-year-old married woman with two children, both of whom are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is transportation. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbours and passers-by. She faces high costs for transportation. She dreams of expanding her business.

With this loan of KES 20,000, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

DESCRIPTION:
With her hard work partnered with the loan lent to her, Lani's business is continuously growing. She would like to thank everyone who helped and supported her business. She was able to buy the materials needed in sewing business and more customers asked for her service. She earned income that she used in paying their household bills and in saving for the future.

To have additional capital, she would like to ask for financial assistance again that will be used in buying fabric, needles, thread, lace, zippers and other materials for her sewing business. She hopes to have more branches for her sewing business and dreams to have a better living condition.

Lani is a member of the Center for Community Transformation and meets weekly with her fellowship partners to share her life’s testimony and business experience with her fellowship members. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 20 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship among partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
With her hard work partnered with the loan lent to her, Lani's business is continuously growing. She would like to thank everyone who helped and supported her business. She was able to buy the materials needed in sewing business and more customers asked for her service. She earned income that she used in paying their household bills and in saving for the future.

To have additional capital, she would like to ask for financial assistance again that will be used in buying fabric, needles, thread, lace, zippers and other materials for her sewing business. She hopes to have more branches for her sewing business and dreams to have a better living condition.

Lani is a member of the Center for Community Transformation and meets weekly with her fellowship partners to share her life’s testimony and business experience with her fellowship members. She also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listening to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 20 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship among partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.
LOAN_USE: to buy fabric, needles, thread, lace, zippers and other materials for her sewing business.

DESCRIPTION:
Esther L. is from the village of Villa Verde, Iligan City. She is 54 years old. Esther is married and has four adult children. 

To make a living, Esther runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits and beverages in the local community. Esther has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Esther joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Esther has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Esther is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Esther from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional products to sell like canned goods and snack foods
TOWN_NAME: Villaverde, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

DESCRIPTION: Ahmed is a kind hardworking young man who tries his utmost to be self-reliant and provide his family with a decent life. He is a 21 years old, living with his family in Jenin, West Bank. He works in construction where he earns a low income; this income is barely cover all the family needs. He wants to open a grocery store in order to enhance his income and his family's living standards. For that, he went to Palestine for Credit and Development FATEN to request a loan to buy grocery goods and products for his grocery store. He hopes you will help by funding his loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Ahmed is a kind hardworking young man who tries his utmost to be self-reliant and provide his family with a decent life. He is a 21 years old, living with his family in Jenin, West Bank. He works in construction where he earns a low income; this income is barely cover all the family needs. He wants to open a grocery store in order to enhance his income and his family's living standards. For that, he went to Palestine for Credit and Development FATEN to request a loan to buy grocery goods and products for his grocery store. He hopes you will help by funding his loan.
LOAN_USE: to buy grocery goods and products for his grocery store.

DESCRIPTION: Баходур неженатый молодой человек. Ему 28 лет. Он живет с родителями в районе Хамадони. Его брат занимается торговлей овощей на рынке. Сам Баходур зарабатывает на жизнь предоставляя услуги такси. У него среднее техническое образование. Баходур уже год как работает в сфере  маршрутного такси. Он обеспечивает семью за счет полученного дохода от деятельности. Баходур берет кредит для закупа запасных частей для ремонта своей автомашины, на котором он развозит пассажиров. За счет прибыли с деятельности он планирует провести ремонт в доме.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Bahodur is a young bachelor at 28 years old.  He lives with his parents in the Hamadoni region and he has a secondary technical education.  His brother sells vegetables at the market.  Bahodur earns his own living by providing taxi services.  He drives a fixed route and has been doing this for a year.  He uses the money he earns to support his family.\r\n\r\nBahodur is taking out this loan to buy repair parts for his taxi.  He plans to use the profits from his work to do home repairs.
LOAN_USE: to buy repair parts for his taxi

DESCRIPTION: Clara tiene 39 años, esta casada con José, con quien tiene tres hijos; de 23, 18 y 15 años. Juntos, viven en su casa propia construida a base de material rústico y se ubica en un anexo rural.Clara es una mujer de apariencia frágil pero de gran fuerza y coraje para el trabajo. Ella se dedica a la agricultura , razón por la cual tiene sus propios terrenos de cultivo y aprovecha los buenos suelos que posee su localidad para sembrar maíz , papas de distintas variedades y arvejas. “A veces también siembro flores y verduras, pero solo en mayo y noviembre”, menciona. Lo que le conviene más es la producción de arvejas y maíz ya que ha logrado dominar muy bien estas siembras . Solo cultiva las variedades más especiales y requeridas por el mercado y aunque necesiten más cuidados, ella no se hace problemas y se esmera cada dia más. Ésta vez tendrá que sembrar arvejas por ello requiere de su apoyo financiero ya que los S/. 2000 soles los invertirá en la compra de abono orgánico y semillas para la siembra.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Clara is 39 years old, married to José, and they have three children who are 23, 18, and 15 years old. The live together in their own home, which is constructed with rustic materials and is located in a rural annex. Clara is a woman with a fragile appearance but with much strength and courage for work. She works in agriculture, the reason for which she has her own land for cultivation. She takes advantage of the good ground that the land has to sow corn, potatoes of distinct varieties, and peas. 

"Sometimes I also sow flowers and vegetables, but only in May and November, " she mentioned. What is better for her is the production of peas and corn, since she has gained control over sowing these crops. She only cultivates the varieties that are special and most needed for the market, even though they need to be watched over more carefully. She does not have problems and she goes to a lot of efforts every day. This time she will have to sow peas, for which she requires financial support. She will invest the 2000 soles in the purchase of organic fertilizer and seeds for sowing.
LOAN_USE: to buy organic fertilizer and seeds.

DESCRIPTION:
Fatu is a 47-year-old business woman who is married with 4 children. She attended school up to 8th grade. All of her children are presently in school while living at home.

She sells bread in the general market. She is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients that will be used to bake bread to sell. With the resulting earnings, she is planning to invest more in her business. She is so proud of her business in that it helps support her children. She has been selling for the past 19 years. She has had no problems with her business. She started selling with her own money and learned the trade from her mother.

In the future she would like to become a big businesswoman and continue educating her children. She says thanks for your support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Fatu is a 47-year-old business woman who is married with 4 children. She attended school up to 8th grade. All of her children are presently in school while living at home.

She sells bread in the general market. She is requesting this loan to buy more ingredients that will be used to bake bread to sell. With the resulting earnings, she is planning to invest more in her business. She is so proud of her business in that it helps support her children. She has been selling for the past 19 years. She has had no problems with her business. She started selling with her own money and learned the trade from her mother.

In the future she would like to become a big businesswoman and continue educating her children. She says thanks for your support.
LOAN_USE: to buy more ingredients that will be used to bake bread to sell

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of five children, three of whom are in school, Adoracion works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Adoracion is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like paints, fishing net, wood, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Adoracion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of five children, three of whom are in school, Adoracion works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Adoracion is borrowing 30,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like paints, fishing net, wood, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Adoracion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

TAGS: #Parent, #Repair Renew Replace, user_favorite, #Woman Owned Biz, #Repeat Borrower

DESCRIPTION:
Maria (Ma.) Racil works hard to support her family. She is married, lives on Cebu island in the Philippines and has had a business selling clothing and footwear for 10 years now.

Ma. Racil has requested a 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of goods for her business like sandals, slippers, blouses and shorts. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maria (Ma.) Racil works hard to support her family. She is married, lives on Cebu island in the Philippines and has had a business selling clothing and footwear for 10 years now.

Ma. Racil has requested a 21,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of goods for her business like sandals, slippers, blouses and shorts. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: buy more stocks of clothing and footwear

DESCRIPTION:
Mouykea is aged 55 years and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their big family by selling grocery items in the local area and planting cassava. Low cassava crops have been the main challenge for her business.

This is the fifth loan for Mouykea from VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of 2,000,000KHR, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to buy grocery items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to generate more income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mouykea is aged 55 years and married with four children, one of whom is in school. She and her husband have worked very hard for years to support their big family by selling grocery items in the local area and planting cassava. Low cassava crops have been the main challenge for her business.

This is the fifth loan for Mouykea from VisionFund. Now requesting a loan of 2,000,000KHR, she is going to use this loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava and use a portion of it to buy grocery items. She hopes that this loan will enable her to generate more income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her rice field in order to increase her rice products.

DESCRIPTION:
Majeedan is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband remains sick most of the time and sits idle at home. Her daughter runs a small boutique at home where she sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from a market at a low price, sews it and then sells it for a higher price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing has increased due to attractive designs and colors. Her son affords all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

She wants to increase the variety of clothing on daily basis. Majeedan has requested a loan so that her daughter can buy a wider variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Majeedan wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Majeedan is a 53-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children. Her husband remains sick most of the time and sits idle at home. Her daughter runs a small boutique at home where she sells garments at very reasonable rates. She purchases clothing from a market at a low price, sews it and then sells it for a higher price in her community. The ladies of town like her garments collection and selection a lot. The demand for clothing has increased due to attractive designs and colors. Her son affords all the household expenses from his earnings and she contributes her earnings only for savings.

She wants to increase the variety of clothing on daily basis. Majeedan has requested a loan so that her daughter can buy a wider variety of garments to fulfill the demand. Majeedan wishes for a bright future for her children and her dream is to provide better education to her children. She is very thankful to Kiva and field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy a variety of garments for her daughter's boutique.

DESCRIPTION:
Evelyn J. is a married woman who lives in Poblacion Taloot, Sibonga, Cebu. She earns her living by operating 3 business ventures: an Internet cafe, a general store, and a fishing business.Her husband Elmer J., who is 50 years old, works as a seaman to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have 4 children who are 20 to 25 years old. 

Evelyn  joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 5 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Evelyn has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) helped her earn a monthly profit of 12,000 PHP, bettering the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her sixth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 25,000, which she intends to use as additional capital to purchase another computer so that she can continue to save up for the future of her children. Evelyn J. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the  NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
LOAN_USE: buying a computer

DESCRIPTION:
Regina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Regina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Regina is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a fishing in the Philippines and requested a PHP 40000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her fishing business.

Regina dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase new fishnet, rope, gasoline and other materials for fishing.

DESCRIPTION: Ernest, who is a farmer, used his previous loan to buy more chicks for his farm.  The chicks matured and later produced eggs from which he made good profits; he used the additional income to buy chicks' mash. Ernest has requested another loan of 35,000 KES to buy more chicks and animal feeds.
LOAN_USE: to buy chicks.

DESCRIPTION:
Ana Sylvia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with two children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc. .

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buy and sell rice.

Ana Sylvia dreams that one day She will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

DESCRIPTION:
Jocylyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Jocylyn has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Jocylyn has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

Jocylyn has a pig-fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her pigs.

DESCRIPTION: Doña Jenny se dedica a la venta de comidas locales, ella necesita un préstamo de ₡ 1 050 000 para la compra de equipo y utensilios necesarios para dar un mejor servicio a su clientela, ya que sus ingresos dependen de esta actividad.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Jenny sells local food. She needs a loan of  ₡1,050,000 to buy equipment and tools she needs to give her customers a better service, because her income depends on this activity.
LOAN_USE: to buy equipment and tools to make food.
TAGS: #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset

DESCRIPTION: ELLA ES UNA JOVEN MADRE DE FAMILIA QUE TRABAJA POR SU CUENTA VENDIENDO ARTÍCULOS DE CATALOGO PARA AYUDAR EN EL GASTO FAMILIAR. PRESENTA PROBLEMAS DENTALES LOS CUALES LE HAN PROVOCADO FUERTES DOLORES E INFLAMACIÓN EN LAS ENCÍAS POR LO QUE REQUIERE DE UN TRATAMIENTO QUE LAMENTABLEMENTE PARA SU ECONOMÍA LE RESULTA COSTOSO.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
She is a young mother who works independently selling catalog items in order to help with the family expenses.

She has dental problems, which have caused severe pain and gum inflammation. This requires a treatment that, sadly, is very expensive for her.
LOAN_USE: to pay for dental treatment.

DESCRIPTION:
Many rural farmers in Kenya struggle because they lack a reliable source of financing to fund their farming operations. Rose is a mom and a smallholder farmer who always believes that life’s ups and downs should not be viewed as the end, but as an opportunity to learn to improve in life. She lives in the Kerugoya area of Kenya. Her family are the greatest thing in her life and something that makes her feel accomplished.

Access to modern, quality farm inputs is the pillar of agricultural revolution. However, in Kenya, a developing country, fertilizer and seed allocation by the government is way below the needs of farmers. Since Juhudi Kilimo, which is in partnership with Kiva, ventured into the affairs of smallholder farmers in Kenya, farmers can attest that there has been a significant improvement in input availability from earlier before.

Rose is humbly seeking this loan to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and seeds, so that she can expand her horticulture farm, increase her output, and make a profit.

This dream will be accomplished when you click that button.

This dream will be accomplished when you click that button.
LOAN_USE: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizers and seeds, so that she can expand her horticulture farm, increase her output, and make profits to improve her living conditions.

DESCRIPTION:
Lucia is 57 years old, married, and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 34 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Lucia is 57 years old, married, and has two children.

She is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucia requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucia has been raising pigs for 20 years now, and has borrowed 34 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

DESCRIPTION: Paula C.'s main source of income comes from manufacturing and selling clay products to local businesses and community members. She is 50 years old, married and has nine school-age children. They are from the village of Mozzozzin Norte. Paula has been in her business for over 30 years and earns approximately 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Paula joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI which was used to purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products. Paula is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase more raw materials. This will be her second loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To purchase raw materials to manufacture additional products

DESCRIPTION:
Paulino de 32 años de edad, es soltero vive con sus padres en una aldea del municipio de Intibucá. quien desde muy joven se ha dedicado a la agricultura cultivando maíz, frijoles, papas y hortalizas. Tiene 10 años de realizar cultivos de papas.  Esta producción la vende en el mercado local. Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo de Lps.20,000.00, siendo este el cuarto préstamo solicitado a ODEF, y lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de papa, fertilizantes, fungicidas, herbicidas e insecticidas necesarias para el mantenimiento del cultivo de papas, esperando con esta inversión ampliar su cosecha para sacar mas producción. Su meta es trabajar más para obtener una mejor cosecha y mejorar la economía de su familia.
Es integrante de un grupo solidario denominado Futuro Mejor, formado por 3 miembros, todos se dedican al cultivo de papas y viven en la misma comunidad. El préstamo grupal  que solicitan es por Lps.60,000.00. En la foto se identifican así: a la izquierda Pedro, en medio Paulino y a la derecha esta Guillermo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Paulino, age 32, is single and lives with his parents in a village in the Intibucá municipality.  Ever since he was very young he has devoted himself to growing corn, beans, potatoes, and vegetables.  He has been growing potatoes for ten years.  He sells his production at the local market.

He is currently requesting a loan for 20,000 lempiras, which is his fourth loan with ODEF.  He will use the loan to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, fungicides, herbicides, and insecticides that he needs to maintain his potato crops.  He is hoping that with this investment he will increase his crops and get greater production.  His goal is to work more in order to get a better harvest and to improve the family’s finances.

He is a member of the “Futuro Mejor” (Better Future) communal bank, which is comprised of three members.  All of the members grow potatoes and lives in the same community.  The group loan they are requesting is for 60,000 lempiras.

In the photo Pedro is on the left, Paulino is in the middle, and Guillermo is on the right.
LOAN_USE: to buy potato seeds, fertilizers, fungicides, herbicides, and insecticides that he needs to maintain his potato crops.

DESCRIPTION:
Nesia is a 25-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her brother in the Wedza district in Zimbabwe. She is requesting a Kiva loan in order to start her own grocery business selling products like sugar, soft drinks and cooking oil.

Nesia plans to use the profit she earns to purchase school stationery for tertiary education. She will repay the ‘social interest’ on her loan by volunteering 4 hours per week as a Further Education Guide, checking on the welfare of new tertiary students and linking them to necessary support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nesia is a 25-year-old entrepreneur who lives with her brother in the Wedza district in Zimbabwe. She is requesting a Kiva loan in order to start her own grocery business selling products like sugar, soft drinks and cooking oil.

Nesia plans to use the profit she earns to purchase school stationery for tertiary education. She will repay the ‘social interest’ on her loan by volunteering 4 hours per week as a Further Education Guide, checking on the welfare of new tertiary students and linking them to necessary support.
LOAN_USE: to purchase grocery products

DESCRIPTION:
Vitaliana is 64 years old and is married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vitaliana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as biscuits, vegetables, breads, canned goods, etc. to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Vitaliana is 64 years old and is married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vitaliana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items such as biscuits, vegetables, breads, canned goods, etc. to sell in her store. She has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items. Her goal is to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

DESCRIPTION:
Ibrahim is 26 years old and lives in the town of Kinubi in the Hoima region of Uganda.  He is married and has one child, who isn't currently in school. Ibrahim is involved in a grocery business since one year.         

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 1000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used for purchasing grocery items for resale. With the help of the loan from BRAC, Ibrahim hopes to generate greater profits and buy food for his family.  In the future, Ibrahim hopes to expand his business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more grocery items for resale.

DESCRIPTION:
Menecia's main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 41 years old, married, and has three grown-up children. She is from the village of Santa Cruz, Benito Soliven, Isabela. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP (~$166) monthly.

She joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Menecia is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase hog feed and breeding livestock. 

In the future, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase hog feed and breeding livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Editha is 50 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Editha's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Editha is taking out a PHP 9,300 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Editha has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Editha is 50 years old and married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Editha's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and is committed to regaining what she lost. Editha is taking out a PHP 9,300 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Editha has been with NWTF since 2010 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. Editha would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

DESCRIPTION:
Srun S.,  51, is married and lives with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has five children. 

She produces Cambodian traditional baskets and earns approximately US$11 gross per day. By doing this she is able to cover her family's expenses, particularly her children’s education. She has been with this business since 2000. Her husband grows mushrooms for sale, earning an income of US$7 per day. Their standard of living has improved since S. has been running her business. 

S. is requesting a loan of US$1,000 to expand her husband’s mushroom growing business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, partnered with Kiva.
LOAN_USE: to expand her husband's mushroom growing business

DESCRIPTION: Eloisa is a family woman with a loving husband and three children.  On the day we visited, two of her children were at school, so the picture includes only one daughter.  Eloisa operates a "colomado" that sells fresh food products.  Many of her products she cooks with her daughter.  This loan will finance an addition to the house that includes a kitchen and another room.  This renovation will greatly enhance the family\'s daily life and the business.  Please help finance Eloisa\'s dream!  Thank you!
LOAN_USE: a new kitchen

DESCRIPTION: Gloria is 60 years old and married with three children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gloria has been raising pigs for 10 years, and earns some additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.\r\n

She is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gloria has been raising pigs for 10 years, and earns some additional income from buying and selling rice. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of two children, Fedelina works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from charcoal retailing. Fedelina is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of rice to sell.

Fedelina has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

As a married parent of two children, Fedelina works hard to support her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Get to know Diana, a hardworking farmer from Kornidzor village. There she lives with her husband, two children (ages 4 and 16), and mother-in-law. For 12 years already, the family has owned a little farm of livestock such as cows, bulls, and chickens. Diana is the one responsible for the daily farm work, and she puts all her efforts into keeping the farm at a productive level. With her husband's support, she trades all the agro-products in the nearby villages. This is their main source of income.

Dianna applied for financial support to purchase high-quality forage. This will surely help to have a more productive farm and therefore increased income. Diana is full of hope to reach her desired outcome and create a better living for her two lovely kids.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Get to know Diana, a hardworking farmer from Kornidzor village. There she lives with her husband, two children (ages 4 and 16), and mother-in-law. LOAN_USE: to purchase high-quality forage to have a more productive farm and increased income so that her two kids get a better living.

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Rehema, a 40- year-old mother of two school-going daughters. She's a very hard-working woman who has operated a clothing sales business for five years. She runs her own clothing store that sells second-hand female clothes and shoes. She opens her shop at 7 a.m. and closes at 8 p.m. daily and she's happy that she's making some great profit.

This will be Rehema's and the Kilangalanga Group's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. Rehema is applying for this loan to improve her business. She plans to buy more bundles of female clothes to restock her shop. Once her profit increases, Rehema dreams of opening a wholesale shoe store.

She will share this loan with her two group members and they will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan in full at maturity.

She will share this loan with her two group members and they will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan in full at maturity.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more bundles of used clothes for sale.

DESCRIPTION:
Joahna works hard to support two children. She is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Joahna requested a PHP 5,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Joahna is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Joahna works hard to support two children. She is single and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Joahna requested a PHP 5,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Joahna is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

DESCRIPTION: Thuy is requesting a new loan to buy many kinds of fruits to sell at her stall. Thuy's previous loan enabled her to expand her business and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attracting new customers and increasing her sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.\r\n
LOAN_USE: To buy many kinds of fruits to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Rovina is 46 years old, a married mother of 4 school-going children, 2 boys and 2 girls. She is a nursery school owner, she opened her school 4 years ago. Her school is normally open from 7:00 a.m to 7:00 p.mm, her business is doing well and she earns a profit.

Rovina is applying for charcoal stove loan so that she can prepare food for her students. The charcoal stove from Tujijenge Tanzania will help her prepare porridge for her students faster and use very small charcoal for cooking. Her dreams is to have a big and modern school in the future.

Rovina will be responsible for paying back the loan successfully.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rovina is 46 years old, a married mother of 4 school-going children, 2 boys and 2 girls. She is a nursery school owner, she opened her school 4 years ago. Her school is normally open from 7:00 a.m to 7:00 p.mm, her business is doing well and she earns a profit.

Rovina is applying for charcoal stove loan so that she can prepare food for her students. The charcoal stove from Tujijenge Tanzania will help her prepare porridge for her students faster and use very small charcoal for cooking. Her dreams is to have a big and modern school in the future.

Rovina will be responsible for paying back the loan successfully.
LOAN_USE: to prepare porridge for her students using Tujijenge Tanzania\'s charcoal stove loan knows as "jiko koa".

DESCRIPTION:
Daisy is a hardworking single agribusiness manager in her farm. She is among the most respected women in her village, which is in Kericho, Kenya. Here you will find a lot of small farmers who work on their land and raise animals. Unfortunately, these farmers face many challenges, including the high cost of farm inputs.

Daisy has experienced these challenges, but she always seeks a solution and moves ahead. She has been farming for the last five years. She has been selling crops, milk, and eggs in the local market. Access to modern-quality farm inputs is the pillar of agricultural revolution. However, in Kenya, a developing country, fertilizer and seed allocation by the government is way below the needs of farmers. Since Juhudi Kilimo, which is in partnership with Kiva, ventured in the affairs of smallholder farmers in Kenya, farmers can attest that there has been a significant improvement on inputs availability than earlier before.

Daisy requested a loan, which she will use to buy farm inputs and purchase high-quality seeds and good fertilizer to improve and get a bumper harvest and eventually build a modern house with the profits. She hopes to generate more income and improve her family's living thanks to her farm. She is very thankful in advance for your support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Daisy is a hardworking single agribusiness manager in her farm. She is among the most respected women in her village, which is in Kericho, Kenya. Here you will find a lot of small farmers who work on their land and raise animals. Unfortunately, these farmers face many challenges, including the high cost of farm inputs.

Daisy has experienced these challenges, but she always seeks a solution and moves ahead. She has been farming for the last five years. She has been selling crops, milk, and eggs in the local market. Access to modern-quality farm inputs is the pillar of agricultural revolution. However, in Kenya, a developing country, fertilizer and seed allocation by the government is way below the needs of farmers. Since Juhudi Kilimo, which is in partnership with Kiva, ventured in the affairs of smallholder farmers in Kenya, farmers can attest that there has been a significant improvement on inputs availability than earlier before.

Daisy requested a loan, which she will use to buy farm inputs and purchase high-quality seeds and good fertilizer to improve and get a bumper harvest and eventually build a modern house with the profits. She hopes to generate more income and improve her family's living thanks to her farm. She is very thankful in advance for your support.
LOAN_USE: to buy farm inputs and purchase high-quality seeds and good fertilizer in order to improve and get a bumper harvest and eventually build a modern house with the profits

DESCRIPTION:
Yaa B. is forty-one years old. She is married and has given birth to one child, a daughter. She says her daughter who is a hairdresser is currently married and lives with her husband.

Yaa lives with her husband and two other dependents in a rented apartment in a farming/commercial town called Takorase, near Akim Oda in the Eastern Region of Ghana. She is a businesswoman. She sells second-hand textiles – clothes for both sexes and also bedsheets.

Yaa procures bales of textiles from Accra and sells in her community by hawking. She says she also treks to other towns to sell on their market days. She has been in business for five years and desires to expand her business. Yaa is hopeful to improve her standard of living.
LOAN_USE: To procure second-hand textiles for re-sale

DESCRIPTION: Helina is divorced and has 3 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Helina is a successful businesswoman. She sells fried and fresh fish in Adentem (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Helina uses her income to provide for the entire family. Helina will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Helina plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.
LOAN_USE: to purchase increased amounts of fish, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales.

DESCRIPTION:
Jessa is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jessa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and snack foods.

Jessa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jessa is 57 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Jessa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and snack foods.

Jessa has been in this business for 5 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, and snack foods.

DESCRIPTION:
She is married and is the mother of four children. She lives with them in a 3-bedroom apartment in Bamenda, North West Region of Cameroon. She has faced some challenges in life such as the death of loved ones and sickness.

She joined GHAPE in 2005, and has taken and successfully repaid eight loans. With the new loan requested, she will buy cabbages, carrots, cocoyams (a root crop), potatoes and lots more in bulk.

She has a positive attitude and believes that the business will succeed because she already has a mastery of this activity and a ready market. She says her activity will help the community provide basic food items at moderate prices.

She will plough back some of the profit to be gotten from the loan into her activity, pay the children’s school fees and provide basic necessities for the family.

She prefers getting a loan from GHAPE because of the moderate repayment schedule, low interest rates, the business knowledge she gets before receiving loans and no collateral.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION:
Ludybel is a 52-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ludybel has operated a fish vending business for 30 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Ludybel would like to save enough money  to send her children to college and expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ludybel is a 52-year-old married woman with two children, both attend school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Ludybel has operated a fish vending business for 30 years and requests 14,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more fish to sell.

In the future, Ludybel would like to save enough money  to send her children to college and expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more fish to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal LOS SOLIDARIOS, él banco está ubicado en la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
El socio Julio Cesar tiene 22 años de edad y es soltero, él socio alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa que vende cerámicas, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia, él socio es una persona responsable.
El socio solicito el crédito para la compra de víveres para su hogar como arroz, azúcar, leche entre otros.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Julio Cesar belongs to the community bank LOS SOLIDARIOS (SOLIDALITY). Bank is located in the province of Urubamba in Cusco region.

Julio Cesar is 22 years old and single. He works in a company that sells ceramics. He enjoys his work and it’s been going well due to the effort he puts every day. He wants to continue working so that he can continue to support his family. He is a responsible person.

He requests a loan to buy necessities at home, such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

He is grateful for the loan and promises to meet the agreement.
LOAN_USE: to buy necessities at home, such as rice, sugar, milk and others.

DESCRIPTION: Manuchar is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his pensioner mother in Zugdidi district. Manuchar works physically and gets a daily income. He decided to start a taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,700 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will serve locals as a taxi driver. This will give him a chance to increase the family income and with the increased income Manuchar will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Manuchar is 35 years old. He is married and lives with his wife and his pensioner mother in Zugdidi district. Manuchar works physically and gets a daily income. He decided to start a taxi business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables him to get a loan of 3,700 GEL. With the received credit he will purchase a car and will serve locals as a taxi driver. This will give him a chance to increase the family income and with the increased income Manuchar will be able to provide better living conditions for his family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a car and start taxi business.

DESCRIPTION:
Gemma is 51 years old. She is married with five children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Gemma is 51 years old. She is married with five children.

Gemma works hard to provide for her family. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

Gemma has borrowed and paid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for six years.

Gemma aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Чынар, 33 года, замужем, есть 2 сына и дочь. У Чынар среднее образование, по характеру она трудолюбивая. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством с 2005 года. Чынар благодаря своему упорному труду, ответственному подходу к делу, и помощи мужа, смогла развить своё хозяйство до 4 коров, 75 овец и 4 лошадей. Так же в её хозяйстве есть земельная доля мерою 2,0 Га на которой она выращивает ячмень и клевер. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Чынар обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота и корма для скота с целью увеличения доходов от животноводства. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего сельскохозяйственного бизнеса, а часть доходов использовать на ремонт дома.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Chynar is 33 years old, married, and has two sons and a daughter. Chynar has secondary education, and is hardworking by nature. She has been engaged in animal husbandry and crop agriculture since 2005, for her family's main source of income. Thanks to Chynar's persistent hard work, her responsible handling of the business, and her husband's help, she has been able to develop her farm to have four cows, 75 sheep, and four horses. Her farm also has a land plot of 2.0 hectares on which she cultivates barley and clover.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Chynar has applied to Bai Tushum Bank for aloan of 150,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock and livestock feed with the goal of increasing her income from animal husbandry. She plans to invest the funds from the loan in the further development of her farming business, and use part of the funds to renovate her home.
LOAN_USE: to buy livestock and livestock feed to increase her income from animal husbandry.

DESCRIPTION:
Purity is a mother dedicated to her work. At age 42, she spends every day of the week, Monday through Sunday, in her mixed farm, tirelessly working. Purity is one of the most hardworking and dedicated women on planet earth. She is based in Karumathi, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. She is happily married to Nicholas, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three lovely children. For the past five years she has been engaged in mixed farming, and through selling milk, eggs and a variety of food crops she has earned a decent income. Like many farmers in her village, she also plants trees on her farm to complement the region's natural forests.

Although Purity makes profits selling her farm produce at the market, the biggest challenge she faces is lack of water to irrigate her farm and water for home consumption. Purity comes from an area where there is no water connection and she is always forced to walk for a long distance for this precious commodity. Purity faces challenges carrying water on her back because of her failing health. Purity is seeking a loan to buy a water tank and water pipes. Most of the farmers in Kenya depend on rain-fed agriculture but Purity wants to change that notion and start irrigation farming. Through the loan she intends to harvest rain water (which always goes to waste) and store it in the tank. She intends to buy pipes that will be used to pump water from the river directly to her farm. With your loan, Purity will be saved the trouble of walking a long distance in search of water, and she will have enough water for home consumption. Irrigating her farm will boost productivity since water is an important requirement in the germination of crops.

Purity is very excited about this project and hopes her dream will be achieved through the loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders. Increased productivity means increased income and this will translate to improved living standards. She will use the additional income to improve and secure the future of her children. Purity’s hope for the future is to live a fulfilling life.

DESCRIPTION:
Rafiqan bibi is very supportive of her family. She does embroidery work to help her husband fulfill the basic needs of their family. 


Her husband is a tailor and operates a tailor shop in the market. They live in a city called Vehari in Pakistan.They are both very hard working and manage their work efficiently. 


As inflation is increasing day by day, it is becoming hard for them to pay for utilities and manage their work. Therefore, Rafiqan has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her embroidery business. She will buy clothes in bulk and sell finished embroidered products rather than embroidering clothes supplied by her customers. She is hopeful that she can double her income and improve their financial situation.

Note: "In this photo, Sakina, a group member, is showing her chair filling business".
LOAN_USE: to purchase clothes in bulk to embroider
BORROWER_NAMES: Sakina, Avainia, Rafiqan bibi, Sharifan, Anwar

DESCRIPTION: Julie, 47, is a widow and a mother of six children. Her children are all grown up and independent, and they are between the ages of 19 and 26. Julie lives in the Paynesville South community, called Kpelle town. For the past ten years, she has been selling pepper, vita, salt, onions, and rice at the community market. She loves to do this business because she feels self-reliant.  She received help from her sister to start in this  business. She will use the loan given to her to purchase more vita, salt, onions, and palm oil to increase her sales. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to purchase more vita, salt, onion, and palm oil to increase her sales

DESCRIPTION:
Glory is 30 years old and married with one child.

Glory works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Glory has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Glory aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Glory is 30 years old and married with one child.

Glory works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products.

Glory has borrowed and paid back five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Glory aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, bread, milk, coffee, drinks, spices, noodles, soap, shampoo and other personal care products

DESCRIPTION:
Nelson is a 23-year-old man. Not too long ago he got married, and he hopes to have a baby in the near future. To make a living, he works as a handyman. He works with his uncle. His wife also earns an income. She sells clothes in a stand that is placed in a street market. On the weekends, Nelson helps his wife with the stand.

They are both hard-working people, who want to create a solid business of their own. They want to offer a wider variety of clothes. To get the extra clothes, Nelson is applying for a 5,000 MXN loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nelson is a 23-year-old man. Not too long ago he got married, and he hopes to have a baby in the near future. To make a living, he works as a handyman. He works with his uncle. His wife also earns an income. She sells clothes in a stand that is placed in a street market. On the weekends, Nelson helps his wife with the stand.

They are both hard-working people, who want to create a solid business of their own. They want to offer a wider variety of clothes. To get the extra clothes, Nelson is applying for a 5,000 MXN loan.
LOAN_USE: to invest in his wife's clothes stand.

DESCRIPTION: Hiep was born in 1968. She has seven children. The two older children are married and the others are in university, the 12th grade, the 9th grade, the 5th grade and the 3rd grade. Her husband raises chickens and earns about 6,000,000 VND per month. Hiep also raises chickens, grows vegetables and sells food in the market to earn a living. Her income is also about 6,000,000 VND per month, making her family’s total earnings about 12,000,000 VND per month. Hiep has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2010. In the last cycle she borrowed 7,392,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 7,392,000 VND to buy chicken feed. She always wants to raise her children well.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy chicken feed.

DESCRIPTION:
Jessica N. is 22 years old and lives in the town of Zanna in the Kampala central region of Uganda. She is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school. Jessica has a tailoring business, which she has run for two years.
To help expand her business, Jessica has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from Kiva partner, BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase another electric sewing machine. With the help of her loan from BRAC, Jessica hopes to generate greater profits, buy clothes for her children and provide for some other basic needs at home. In the future, she hopes to expand her business into a training center.
Jessica is a member of BRAC’s Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program, which has helped her prospects for the future by helping her secure start-up capital to buy her first sewing machine. She is now going to buy a second machine with her second loan.
LOAN_USE: To purchase another electric sewing machine

DESCRIPTION:
Jordan is married and has 4 children whom all attend school. According to Jordan, being a responsible father means that he should always take care of the needs of his family. Jordan did not get a higher education due to poverty, but he does not see that as an excuse to not earn a living.

Jordan manages a rolling business from which he sells soft drinks and eggs around villages. To earn additional income, Jordan and his wife also run a sari-sari store in their village. Jordan wants to sell more eggs and drinks to increase his profit. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy groceries, eggs, and soft drinks to sell. Jordan wishes to develop his current business to continue to care for his family's needs.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jordan is married and has 4 children whom all attend school. According to Jordan, being a responsible father means that he should always take care of the needs of his family. Jordan did not get a higher education due to poverty, but he does not see that as an excuse to not earn a living.

Jordan manages a rolling business from which he sells soft drinks and eggs around villages. To earn additional income, Jordan and his wife also run a sari-sari store in their village. Jordan wants to sell more eggs and drinks to increase his profit. To do this, he is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP to buy groceries, eggs, and soft drinks to sell. Jordan wishes to develop his current business to continue to care for his family's needs.
LOAN_USE: to buy groceries, eggs, and soft drinks to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Аскарали деятельный и энергичный молодой человек из района Вахш. Ему 31 год. Он в жизни достиг своих целей, главное из которых является открытие собственного бизнеса. Четыре года назад Аскарали в своем районе открыл лавку по продаже продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Ему в бизнесе помогает его младший брат. Они работают ежедневно без выходных и каждый день получают выручку от продаж. У них очень большая семья, состоящая из 12 человек, в частности: мать, отец, трое братьев, двое сестер, невестка, три племянника и сам Аскарали. Аскарали все еще холост. Он усердно работает, чтобы обеспечить себя и обзавестись семьей. Для реализации этой цели Аскарали устремлен на расширение бизнеса. Он просит кредит, на сумму которого собирается приобрести аппарат мороженного, холодильник и аппарат по охлаждению воды. Он нуждается в этих принадлежностях, так как приближается лето - сезон мороженного и прохладительных напитков. Аскарали очень надеется на поддержку для развития своего малого бизнеса.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Askarali is an active and energetic young man from the Vakhsh region. He is 31 years old. He has set himself goals in life, the most important of which was starting his own business. Four years ago Askarali opened a shop where he sells food products and household goods. His younger brother helps him with the business. They work seven days a week and earn money every day from sales. He has a large family of 12 people: his mother, father, three brothers, two sisters, sister-in-law, three nephews, and himself. Askarali is still single. He works hard in order to provide for himself and to someday start a family. In order to achieve his goals, Askarali is expanding his business. He has asked for a loan in order to buy an ice cream machine, a refrigerator, and a water cooler. He needs this equipment for summer because it is the season of ice cream and soft drinks. Askarali hopes for support so that he can develop his small business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase an ice cream machine, a refrigerator, and a water cooler

DESCRIPTION: Eliza is a business minded woman. At a young age she was involved in the selling of different foods within their school. She is now 46 years old, married and blessed with three children. Two of her children had settled for marriage while the other one is still studying. \r\n\r\nIn 1990 Eliza and her husband started their variety "sari-sari" store business and then later they are involved in the plasticware business. Now, Eliza wants to be involved in another business that is the Piso Net or what they call computer games. She’s asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. This loan is used to buy stocks of grocery items, plastic wares and investment in another kind of business to keep it profitable and progressive.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Eliza is a business minded woman. At a young age she was involved in the selling of different foods within their school. She is now 46 years old, married and blessed with three children. Two of her children had settled for marriage while the other one is still studying. \r\n\r\nIn 1990 Eliza and her husband started their variety "sari-sari" store business and then later they are involved in the plasticware business. Now, Eliza wants to be involved in another business that is the Piso Net or what they call computer games. She’s asking for a loan of PHP 50,000. This loan is used to buy stocks of grocery items, plastic wares and investment in another kind of business to keep it profitable and progressive.
LOAN_USE: to buy stocks of grocery items, plastic wares  and investment in another kind of business.

DESCRIPTION: Sok M., 49, and his wife, Ong Sophat, 47, live with their four children in the Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. They earn a living by selling chickens in the local market. This is their second loan from Kiva, and they will use the loan to expand their business and run a new business of selling children’s shoes. Their first loan from Kiva was used for buying more chickens for sale, and that loan had helped them increase their daily income to over $10 and support their family’s food needs adequately.
LOAN_USE: To expand their business and to start a new business of selling children's shoes

DESCRIPTION: Mary Ann is 34 years old and from Oroquieta City.  She is married and supporting her family.  Mary Ann has to work hard to provide for the needs of her children.  She availed a loan for the purpose of obtaining a check-up for her child.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mary Ann is 34 years old and from Oroquieta City.  She is married and supporting her family.  Mary Ann has to work hard to provide for the needs of her children.  She availed a loan for the purpose of obtaining a check-up for her child.
LOAN_USE: to pay for a check-up for her child.

DESCRIPTION:
Maximiliana es socia del Banco Comunal Wiñarisun, es madre soleta, tiene 33 años y 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años de edad. Maximiliana es feriante. El crédito que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para surtir su mercadería, vende ropas como: buzos, blusas, faldas, entre otros para damas caballeros y niños.
Viaja a la feria de Seccelambras los días sábados, a Allpachaca los días jueves y Pampa cangallo los días miércoles. Le gusta Finca, porque le capacitan en negocio, familia, salud, le dan créditos y ahorra.
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maximiliana is a member of the Wiñarisun Communal Bank, is 33 years old, married, and has 2 children ages 15 and 12. Maximiliana is a saleswoman.  

The loan that she seeks will be invested in buying clothing to stock her merchandise; she sells clothing such as : track suits, blouses, skirts and other items for men, women and children.

She travels to the Seccelambras market on Saturdays, to Allpachaca on Thursdays, and Pampa Cangallo on Wednesdays. She likes Finca because Finca educates her about business, family, health, provides loans and she can save money.

Her dream is that her business grows and that her children become professionals.
LOAN_USE: Buy a variety of seasonal clothing

DESCRIPTION:
In 1998, Hurricane Mitch devastated large regions of Guatemala, with torrential downpours leading to landslides and flooding. Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan, built on the steep hillsides of the Sierra Madre mountain range in the western highlands of Guatemala, was one of the most affected towns, with many houses carried away and destroyed. Lasting effects from the damage in 1998 continue to contribute to extremely high (90%) rates of poverty in Santa Catarina (44.7% of the population in extreme poverty). 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Estrellas de Belen,” is made up of seven women from Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan. All seven women of the trust bank create and sell colorful traditional Maya textiles typical to the region. The handcrafted and designed “hupiles y cortes” (blouses and skirts), are made in Santa Catarina and then sold in surrounding cities and states. Manuela is one of the talented textile artisans and members of “Estrellas de Belen.” 

Manuela, 28-years-old, has been working with hand woven and embroidered textiles for over four years, originally learning the trade from her mother.  Manuela has a degree in teaching, but because of the lack of employment opportunities, she has had to adapt and take advantage of other skills to support her young son. Currently, Manuela weaves and embroiders “hupiles,” often custom orders, and sells them to established clients and door-to-door in a nearby city.  Manuela is applying for this loan to buy the necessary materials to create traditional textiles, including threads and dyes. Manuela hopes to use this loan to continue producing beautiful textiles and reach a wider base of clients. In the future, Manuela hopes to accumulate enough capital to open a small storefront in Nahuala, to attract a steadier and wider range of customers for her artisanal textiles. 

Thank you, Kiva investors, for supporting Manuela in her business pursuits. With your support, Manuel and the other six members of her Trust Bank “Estrellas de Belen,” will have the opportunity to create a better future for themselves and their families.
