BORROWER_NAMES: ANTONIA JOSEFINA, MANUELA TAHAY, MARIA REINA, MANUELA IXTOS, CATARINA TAHAY, MANUELA, MANUELA MARTINA
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Josie is married and works hard to support her family. For the past three years she has had a food vending business in the Philippines.

Josie is applying for a 5000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, rice, etc. for her business. In the future she would like to have saved enough money to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, milk, flour, rice, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Factor Emilio es una persona que siempre se ha preocupado por ofrecerle a su familia una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que se esfuerza diariamente en su trabajo para generar ingresos suficientes que le permitan ofrecerle a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Factor Emilio se encuentra casado y es padre de 4 hijos, a quienes siempre les ha querido ofrecer una buena educación. Factor Emilio, debido a las pocas oportunidades de empleo que se le presentan, decidió montar desde hace aproximadamente 10 años una tienda general donde ofrece todo tipo de productos de la canasta familiar. Al principio montar la tienda fue un gran reto, pues Factor Emilio no contaba con el capital suficiente para esto, sin embargo, sus ganas de trabajar le permitieron poco a poco ir aumentando la variedad de productos que ofrece. Factor Emilio tiene el sueño de poder llegar a tener un supermercado, por lo que cada vez que su tienda se lo permite le aumenta la variedad de productos que ofrece y le realiza mejoras locativas para cumplir este sueño. En esta oportunidad Factor Emilio busca que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para aumentar la variedad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes.

Factor Emilio espera que con el préstamo su tienda pueda ofrecer mayor variedad y cada vez pueda estar más cerca de cumplir su sueño de tener un supermercado. Además, Factor Emilio espera que con ingresos extras pueda ofrecerle a su familia mayores oportunidades de progresar y pueda generar empleo en su tienda para las personas más necesitadas.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Factor Emilio is someone who has always focused on providing his family with a good quality of life.  It is for this reason that he strives on a daily basis with his work to earn sufficient income that will allow him to provide his family with everything they need.  Factor Emilio is married and the father of four children, whom he has always wanted to provide with a good education.

Owing to the few employment opportunities that presented themselves, Factor Emilio decided to set up a general store approximately ten years ago, where he offers all types of everyday products for the family for sale.  At first, setting up the store was a huge challenge, as Factor Emilio didn't have sufficient capital for it.  However, his desire to work allowed him bit by bit to increase the variety of products that he offers for sale.  

Factor Emilio has the dream of being able to have a supermarket, so every chance that his store allows, he increases the variety of products that he offers for sale and undertakes improvements to his store location to achieve his dream.

On this occasion, Factor Emilio is looking for a loan that will provide him with the possibility of purchasing everyday products to increase the variety of products that he offers for sale to his customers.

Factor Emilio hopes that with the loan, his store will be able to provide more variety, and each time he gets closer to accomplishing his dream of having a supermarket.  In addition, Factor Emilio hopes that with the extra income, he will be able to provide his family with better opportunities to progress in life, and he will be able to create employment in his store for those who most need it.
LOAN_USE: to purchase everyday household products to increase the variety of products that he offers for sale to his customers.

DESCRIPTION: Ami est une femme mariée âgée de 45 ans résidant dans les environs de baguida avec quatre enfants en charge. Ami est une vendeuse de fripperie. Elle s’approvisionne deux fois par semaine au marché. Ami sollicite ce prêt pour acheter des bals de fripperie pour femme et pour bebe. Ami utilisera les recettes de sa vente pour subvenir au besoin de sa famille au côté de son mari.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ami is a married, 45-year-old woman who lives in a neighbourhood around Baguida with four dependent children.

Ami sells second hand clothes. She gets her stock twice a week in the market. She is asking for this loan to buy bales of second hand clothing for women and babies. Ami will use the proceeds of her sales to meet the needs of her family along with her husband.
LOAN_USE: to buy two bales of women's second hand clothes and one bale of baby second hand clothes.

DESCRIPTION: Dorn P., age 26, is married and lives in the Kampong Cham province. She is a farmer and typically earns about $2.30 each day. Her husband, Keo Rath, 22, raises ducks for eggs and sells them to the market to earn around $10 each day. This couple has a young child.\r\nRaising ducks is the main income for the family, so Keo would like a loan to raise many more ducks. (Dorn is pictured at the duck farm)
LOAN_USE: To raise more ducks.

DESCRIPTION:
38-year-old Khin, standing in the middle, has been running a food stall for the last 3 years to make a living. Khin’s most popular dishes are meat sticks and fried vermicelli. Khin is married with three young children.

People in the neighborhood often visit her shop and she is hoping to better serve the increasing number of customers with the help of this loan. “With this loan I will buy more chairs and add them to my stall,” Khin says.

Khin and the other group members are grateful for this loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
38-year-old Khin, standing in the middle, has been running a food stall for the last 3 years to make a living. Khin’s most popular dishes are meat sticks and fried vermicelli. Khin is married with three young children.

People in the neighborhood often visit her shop and she is hoping to better serve the increasing number of customers with the help of this loan. “With this loan I will buy more chairs and add them to my stall,” Khin says.

Khin and the other group members are grateful for this loan.
LOAN_USE: to buy more chairs for her food stall
BORROWER_NAMES: Phyu, Khin , Myo, San , San San

DESCRIPTION:
Pov is 41 years old and is a married woman with two children. She makes and sells soup. Her husband is a farmer. She has been making and selling soup for two years.

She will use this loan to purchase more tables, chairs and other materials for her food store. By selling these goods she can earn enough money to expand her business and change her family's living standards.

More competitors and the rainy season are her major challenges.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Pov is 41 years old and is a married woman with two children. She makes and sells soup. Her husband is a farmer. She has been making and selling soup for two years.

She will use this loan to purchase more tables, chairs and other materials for her food store. By selling these goods she can earn enough money to expand her business and change her family's living standards.

More competitors and the rainy season are her major challenges.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more tables, chairs and other materials for her food store.
TAGS: user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset, #Parent, #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION: Jeremiah is a married man. He has 6 children with ages ranging from 21 year to 30 years. He describes himself to be ambitious and optimistic. He operates a retail store where he sells items such as maize flour, cooking fat, salt, royco, etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a conducive business environment and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high prices of items. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase more home products. His business goal is to expand his business and venture into a new business of motorcycle transportation within 5 years.
LOAN_USE: buy products to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Living in a rural area located in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sakhorn is 53 years old and widowed. To make a living, she has been farming rice on four hectares of farmland for fifteen years. From the current business, she can earn about 23,000 KHR per day and can save about 14,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Sakhorn has been with VisionFund for five cycles. She completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she and her group of four members are applying for a loan. Sakhorn is the leader, and she wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to grow rice well so as to make a living better.
LOAN_USE: To buy fertilizer, rice seeds and pesticides for her farmland

DESCRIPTION:
Stephen is a single business man and through his business he is able to support his family. He hawks boiled eggs and sausages around town which makes him determined and focused to achieve his daily bread. His dream is own a restaurant where he can offer different foods for his customers. He also want to go back to school to pursue a degree in hotel management.

He is requesting a kiva loan of Ksh 30,000 to pay rent for a stall where he can sell his eggs and sausages without facing difficulties like weather changes and others that may destruct his business. He would also purchase eggs to sell to his customers and the profits earned he would repay his loan on time.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Stephen is a single business man and through his business he is able to support his family. He hawks boiled eggs and sausages around town which makes him determined and focused to achieve his daily bread. His dream is own a restaurant where he can offer different foods for his customers. He also want to go back to school to pursue a degree in hotel management.

He is requesting a kiva loan of Ksh 30,000 to pay rent for a stall where he can sell his eggs and sausages without facing difficulties like weather changes and others that may destruct his business. He would also purchase eggs to sell to his customers and the profits earned he would repay his loan on time.
LOAN_USE: to rent a permanent place for his business and purchase eggs for business continuity.

DESCRIPTION:
Bonita is 43 years old and has seven children.  Bonita is married and all of her children are currently in school.

Bonita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bonita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bonita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bonita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Bonita is 43 years old and has seven children.  Bonita is married and all of her children are currently in school.

Bonita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Bonita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Bonita has been raising pigs for three years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Bonita would like to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

DESCRIPTION:
This marks Pilister's second time borrowing to finance her business. She is grateful for loans from VisionFund Kenya to improve her living standards and help her meet her family's basic needs.

Her retail business has grown, and she is now requesting more money to purchase sacks of cereals during this harvest season to keep in anticipation of good prices ahead.

Pilister's hopes and dreams for the future are to own a successful business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This marks Pilister's second time borrowing to finance her business. She is grateful for loans from VisionFund Kenya to improve her living standards and help her meet her family's basic needs.

Her retail business has grown, and she is now requesting more money to purchase sacks of cereals during this harvest season to keep in anticipation of good prices ahead.

Pilister's hopes and dreams for the future are to own a successful business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sacks of cereals during harvest season to keep in anticipation of good prices ahead.

DESCRIPTION:
Nilda is 44 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like home care products and groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nilda is 44 years old and married with four children. With three children in school, Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Nilda runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store like home care products and groceries.

Nilda has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Nilda would like to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell in her general store like home care products and groceries

DESCRIPTION:
Ngome owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for her children.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years selling household consumables such as wheat flour and maize flour from home to her neighbors. She dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 50,000 KES loan, Ngome wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to sell at her shop.
LOAN_USE: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, and cooking fat to sell at her shop.

DESCRIPTION:
Mwanasiti is a married woman who has been blessed with five children, four of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a fish selling business for over three years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mwanasiti also operates a farming business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mwanasiti is a married woman who has been blessed with five children, four of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity but has piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Mwanasiti has operated a fish selling business for over three years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mwanasiti also operates a farming business that earns her another source of income.

With the loan she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

DESCRIPTION:
Carmen Josselyn y su familia viven en Montecristi un hermoso lugar donde sus habitantes son personas muy humildes y trabajadoras que se dedican a la artesanía. 
Carmen Josselyn es una humilde mujer que está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le brindan, ya que gracias a los créditos ella logro invertir en su salón de belleza en casa permitiendo ofrecer todos servicios de belleza, la cual pudo mejorar y a la vez incrementar sus ganancias, ella nuevamente está repitiendo su crédito para abastecerse de productos de belleza, aprovechando las ofertas de temporada y asi continuar con su actividad laboral.
Este crédito lo invertirá para surtirse de tinte, nuevos maquillajes, entre otras herramientas de trabajo. Su sueño es tener otro salón de belleza bien adecuado.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Carmen Josselyn and her family live in Montecristi, a lovely place where its inhabitants are very humble and hard-working people who make a living from crafts.

Carmen Josselyn is a humble woman who is very thankful for the support that is provided to her. Thanks to the loans, she managed to invest in her home beauty salon, allowing her to offer all beauty services, which she managed to improve and at the same time increase her profits.

She again is repeating her loan to stock up on beauty products, taking advantage of the seasonal sales and thus continue with her work activity.

She will invest this loan in order to stock up on dye and new makeup, among other work tools. Her dream is to have another beauty salon that is well-equipped.
LOAN_USE: to stock dye and new makeup, among other work tools.

DESCRIPTION:
Ana, está acompañada y su pareja es comerciante. Tiene tres hijos de los cuales uno depende de ella.

Ana, vende productos de uso personal como toallas húmedas, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico, entre otros. Tiene muchos años de experiencia en el negocio. Se desplaza 10 kilómetros en transporte público desde su casa hasta donde vende y trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7:00 de la mañana a 4:00 de la tarde. Además, ella vende comida típica.

Ana, usará el préstamo para comprar productos de uso personal como toallas húmedas, toallas sanitarias, papel higiénico, entre otros para vender.

Ana, sueña con seguir adelante en su negocio y dar mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ana has a partner, who is a merchant. She has three children, of whom one depends on her.

Ana sells personal use products, such as wet wipes, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, etc. She has many years of experience in this business. She travels 10 kilometers on public transportation from her house to where she makes sales. She works Monday to Saturday from 7:00 in the morning to 4:00 in the afternoon. She also sells traditional foods.

Ana will use the loan to purchase personal use products, such as wet wipes, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, etc., to sell. She dreams of moving forward with her business and giving her family a better quality of life.
LOAN_USE: to purchase personal use products, such as wet wipes, sanitary napkins, toilet paper, etc., to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Nawal is a 26-year-old married woman who has two family members. She is from Al Bayader, Amman, Jordan. She is requesting a loan of 400 Jordan dinar (JD) to pay for her home improvements. She would like to buy a new wardrobe cabinet, and in the future, she wants to buy a new home. \r\n\r\nSince Nawal is under 30 years old, her loan is considered a youth loan.
LOAN_USE: to pay for her home improvements.

DESCRIPTION:
Corazon is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a a sanitary toilet.

She knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Corazon is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Corazon requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a a sanitary toilet.

She knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

DESCRIPTION: Vineta is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Vineta needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter, and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2018.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Vineta is a 27-year-old married woman with one child. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Vineta needs a loan to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter, and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She has been a member of SPBD since 2018.
LOAN_USE: to buy flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter, and a large stove for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Maricel is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maricel has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maricel is 33 years old and has four children. She is married and has two children who are still in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Maricel has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Timotea comes from a humble family. Several years ago, she decided to leave her home town, Chupa, in search of a better future. Since then, she has sold red meat as a traveling vendor in the Santa Bárbara market in the city of Juliaca. In addition to this work, she raises pigs, and she obtains extra income from their sale. While she is doing this work, her enterprising husband works as a mechanic. Both are looking to save up and to construct the house that they want so much to offer well-being and security to their five beloved children. Timotea's wish is to have a larger quantity of money to use as investment capital with the aim of selling a larger quantity of pigs, a business which has a lot of demand in this season. She is turning to your support and requesting a loan. Timotea is anxiously awaiting your response.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer

\r\nTimotea, proviene de una humilde familia, hace algunos años decidió salir de su pueblo natal, Chupa, en busca de un mejor porvenir, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de carnes rojas en forma ambulatoria en el mercado Santa Bárbara de la ciudad de Juliaca, adicionalmente a este trabajo se dedica a la crianza de Cerdos, de los cuales obtiene ingresos económicos extras luego de su comercialización.Mientras ella se dedica a esta labor, su emprendedor esposo trabaja como mecánico y entre ambos buscan ahorrar y construir su tan anhelada casita para ofrecerles bienestar y seguridad a sus cinco queridos hijos.El deseo de Timotea es contar con mayor cantidad de dinero para utilizarlos como capital de inversión a fin de comercializar mayor cantidad de cerditos, negocio que por estas temporadas tendrá mayor demanda. Recurre a tu apoyo y solicita un préstamo. En estos momentos Timotea espera ansiosa tu respuesta.
LOAN_USE: Purchase of a larger quantity of pigs.

DESCRIPTION:
Najla is a 46-year-old married woman and a mother of seven children. She has been working in a tailoring business for 25 years. In 1990, she started her own business to help her husband, who works as a taxi driver, in covering their big family's expenses and paying for their needs.

Najla is a hard-worker with an excellent reputation in her area, and she is recommended by all of her customers. She tailors almost all types of wedding and special occasion dresses, in addition to special requests.
 
She is applying for her third loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua, in order to buy a new tailoring machine that costs $500 and pay for the necessary maintenance for her husband's car, which will cost him $500, and this is the only business he knows how to do.

Najla is a good-standing borrower with a special reputation. She hopes to keep on developing her business and increasing her income.
LOAN_USE: To buy a new tailoring machine and pay for the necessary maintenance for her husband's car

DESCRIPTION:
Patricia is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetic selling shop business, selling retail to her neighbors and passerby. Potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of cosmetics and food stuff for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Patricia is a married woman with one child, who attends school. She lives in a rental that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a cosmetic selling shop business, selling retail to her neighbors and passerby. Potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of establishing a retail shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase stocks of cosmetics and food stuff for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business
LOAN_USE: to purchase stock of cosmetics and food stuff for resale.

DESCRIPTION:
Leonita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a buy and sell gasoline in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy gasoline to sell for her business.

Leonita dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Leonita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She runs a buy and sell gasoline in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy gasoline to sell for her business.

Leonita dreams that one day she will be able to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: buy gasoline to sell for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Elmer thanks Kiva and Kiva lenders that extended him his previous loan. The amount enabled Elmer to buy biscuits, cupcakes, and sandwiches, which complemented the refreshments he was mainly selling.

Elmer was able to pay back his loan on time and save some money. He has gone a long way and was even able to buy a secondhand motorcycle with a passenger carriage.

Elmer plans to have this motorcycle driven by one of his neighbors who doesn't have employment, and who will charge only a percentage from the earnings for the use of his tricycle.

He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to have the motorcycle tuned up, re-upholster the seating and provide rain covers for the passenger carriage of his tricycle.

He hopes that with this loan he will be able to get his tricycle in good condition for transport and to help his neighbor earn as well.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elmer thanks Kiva and Kiva lenders that extended him his previous loan. The amount enabled Elmer to buy biscuits, cupcakes, and sandwiches, which complemented the refreshments he was mainly selling.

Elmer was able to pay back his loan on time and save some money. He has gone a long way and was even able to buy a secondhand motorcycle with a passenger carriage.

Elmer plans to have this motorcycle driven by one of his neighbors who doesn't have employment, and who will charge only a percentage from the earnings for the use of his tricycle.

He is requesting a loan of 12,000 PHP to have the motorcycle tuned up, re-upholster the seating and provide rain covers for the passenger carriage of his tricycle.

He hopes that with this loan he will be able to get his tricycle in good condition for transport and to help his neighbor earn as well.
LOAN_USE: to have the motorcycle tuned up, re-upholster the seating and provide rain covers for the passenger carriage of his tricycle.

DESCRIPTION:
Sabina tiene 58 años edad ella resiD. en San Francisco Gotera, Departamento D. Morazán, vive con el esposo y sus dos nietos, Kenia D. 7 años, Cesar D. 14 años, tiene un negocio D. venta D. comida y pupusas.
Ella venD. almuerzos D. 11:00 am -1:00pm todos los días y D. 6:00pm en adelante ven pupusas (tortilla D. maíz y queso con carne), acompañadas D. bebidas frías y calientes, actualmente solicita un préstamo para compra D. materiales para la elaboración D. alimento como son Carne D. pollo, carne D. res, vegetales, queso, maíz, aceite, esto contribuirá a contar con los materiales necesarios para continuar con el negocio y mejorar los ingresos D. esta familia.
Sus sueños en crecer ver crecer los nietos apoyarlos con los estudios, para que estos tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sabina, age 58, lives in San Francisco Gotera in the Morazán department. She lives with her husband and their two grandchildren. Kenia is seven years old, and Cesar is 14 years old. She has a business selling food and “pupusas” (corn tortilla stuffed with cheese and meat). She sells lunch from 11:00 a.m. until 1:00 p.m everyday. She sells pupusas, accompanied with hot and cold drinks, starting at 6:00 p.m. She is now requesting a loan to buy materials to make her food. She will buy things like chicken, beef, vegetables, cheese, corn and oil. This will contribute to her having the materials that are necessary to continue in her business and improve the family income. Her dream is to see her grandchildren grow and to support them with their education so that they can have better opportunities in life.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Buy chicken, beef, vegetables, cheese, corn and oil to make food

DESCRIPTION:
Joyce is 45 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She sells foodstuffs at Panpaper in Eldoret.  She was introduced to KADET by another group member.

With the loan she is taking from KADET, Joyce intends to add more inventory, including flour, cooking fat, and rice.  Her dreams are to grow her business and educate her children.

b>About KADET:  The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: http://www.kadet.co.ke/
LOAN_USE: To increase  shop inventory

DESCRIPTION: Fadhil R. is a Tanzanian micro entrepreneur business man.  He runs a business to provide transport services at Chanika, in Dar es Salaam.  He owns a taxi and receives 30,000 Tshs per day, equivalent to four hundred thousand Tshs per month.  He has been in the business for three years and plans to extent his services by buying more taxis.   He needs a loan of Tshs 1,000,000 to extent his business.
LOAN_USE: Expand taxi business.

DESCRIPTION:
Raed is a single Iraqi youth client. He is 24 years old and lives with his parents and his brother, all of whom provide the income of the family together.

Raed owns a small shop for selling mobile phones and accessories. After working for many years in several mobile shops, Raed, after gaining good fame and experience, finally decided to open his own shop in 2011 and hired an employee. 

He is requesting sum of $1,800 USD for a youth loan to renovate his shop and to increase his mobile inventory.

Raed is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide himself with better life conditions.
LOAN_USE: to renovate his shop and to increase his mobile inventory.

DESCRIPTION:
Aleksandra is 29 years old woman and a mother of three children in between 2 and 7 years old. Coming from minority community it is hard for her to find a serious job.

Her husband is the only one who works in her family and he does odd jobs, mainly in construction. She and her husband also receive a social assistance and this helps them provide for the family.

Aleksandra has applied for a small loan to renovate her bathroom by changing the tiles and other appliances because the old ones are corroded.

She wants to improve her family’s welfare and wants to raise her child in a healthy home. She is very grateful for the help from all the lenders!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Aleksandra is 29 years old woman and a mother of three children in between 2 and 7 years old. Coming from minority community it is hard for her to find a serious job.

Her husband is the only one who works in her family and he does odd jobs, mainly in construction. She and her husband also receive a social assistance and this helps them provide for the family.

Aleksandra has applied for a small loan to renovate her bathroom by changing the tiles and other appliances because the old ones are corroded.

She wants to improve her family’s welfare and wants to raise her child in a healthy home. She is very grateful for the help from all the lenders!
LOAN_USE: to change the tiles and other appliances because the old ones are corroded

DESCRIPTION:
Cresilda is married, with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in Lorenzo Tan, Tangub City. Cresilda sells bread to earn a living and has had this business for three years. 

Cresilda has requested a loan to add for her capital. She has been a member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) for two years. In the future, Cresilda hopes to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to add to her business capital.

DESCRIPTION: Luis hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para continuar trabajando en el campo y cubrir las necesidades familiares, así como también para atender mejor a sus clientes, comprara insumos agrícolas para sembrar granos básicos y de esta manera tener una cosecha más abundante.\nCon el respaldo económico que le dio el préstamo anterior pudo ejecutar las actividades agrícolas de la temporada, el resultado fue una mayor producción de maíz con lo que las ventas e ingresos mejoraron.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Luis makes a request for another loan to continue working on his farm and cover household necessities, as well as to better serve his customers. He will purchase agricultural supplies in order to plant basic grains and have a more abundant harvest.

With the financial backing he was given by the previous loan, he was able to carry out the season's agricultural activities. This resulted in a better crop of corn, which improved both sales and income.
LOAN_USE: to purchase agricultural supplies so he can plant basic grains and have a more abundant harvest.

DESCRIPTION: Lydia B. sells fish and although she is married, her husband's income from fishing is not sufficient for her and her two children. Since demand for her goods is high, Lydia is requesting a loan of $400 to expand her business in order to increase profits.
LOAN_USE: To expand her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Ishrat Bano, from Gujranwala, Pakistan, is a 40-year-old hardworking mother of two young children. She is working hard to ensure a good life for them.

Her husband’s income is very limited, so he cannot cover all the needs of his family. Ishrat Bano wanted to help him in any way she could and so started her cloth stitching and designing business two years ago.

Having had a good experience in this business, Ishrat Bano has decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore, she has requested a loan from JWS Pakistan to buy a new sewing machine, threads, laces and fabrics to increase her income.

Ishrat Bano and her family are thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan for this opportunity.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ishrat Bano, from Gujranwala, Pakistan, is a 40-year-old hardworking mother of two young children. She is working hard to ensure a good life for them.

Her husband’s income is very limited, so he cannot cover all the needs of his family. Ishrat Bano wanted to help him in any way she could and so started her cloth stitching and designing business two years ago.

Having had a good experience in this business, Ishrat Bano has decided to expand and develop her work. Therefore, she has requested a loan from JWS Pakistan to buy a new sewing machine, threads, laces and fabrics to increase her income.

Ishrat Bano and her family are thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan for this opportunity.
LOAN_USE: to buy a new sewing machine, threads, laces and fabrics for her tailoring business.

DESCRIPTION:
Vivian is 40 years old and married with two school-age children, who she works very hard to provide for. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, hair conditioner and coffee. 

Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Vivian is 40 years old and married with two school-age children, who she works very hard to provide for. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 11,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional groceries to sell. She has been in this business for 19 years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, hair conditioner and coffee. 

Vivian would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional groceries for her store, like canned goods, shampoo, bath soap, hair conditioner and coffee.

DESCRIPTION:
Jenelyn is 43 years old and has four children. She is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattles.

Jenelyn has been in raising cattle for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jenelyn is 43 years old and has four children. She is married, and one of her children is currently in school.

She is in the agricultural business of raising cattle in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattles.

Jenelyn has been in raising cattle for 10 years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her cattle

DESCRIPTION: Viviano tiene 50 años, vive con su esposa y sus tres hijos, los tres estudian,su negocio es de elaboración, repación y venta de zapatos el cual lo inicio hace 19 años. El crédito que el solicita es pra comprar material para la elaboración de los zapatos y un mostrador. El sueño de Don Viviano es aumentar su negocio tener mas ventas para brindarle un mejor futuro a su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Viviano is 50 years old and lives with his wife and three children who are in school. He has been producing, repairing, and selling shoes for 19 years. The loan he is requesting will be used to buy a countertop and materials for making shoes. Don Viviano dreams of expanding his business so that he can generate more sales to provide his family a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Purchase materials for making shoes & a work countertop

DESCRIPTION: Ирода молодая женщина в возрасте 29 лет. Она очень добрая и трудолюбивая. Ирода замужем, имеет двоих детей. Ирода родилась и выросла в селе, где дети с детства приучаются к труду. Ирода после замужества переехала жить в район. Муж Ироды Низомиддин работает в России. Сама Ирода в течение шести лет занимается торговлей, она продает не дорогие женские и мужские обуви на рынке. Так как Ирода стремительная девушка она справляется со всеми делами, и с домашними и с воспитанием детей, а также с маленьким бизнесом. У нее достаточно клиентов, хорошее место. Ирода хочет расширять свой бизнес, разнообразить виды товаров. Ведь у нее место хорошее и она думает, что трудности в торговле не будет. Но Ироде для покупки и привозки товаров не хватает денежных средств и она, подумав, обратилась в МДО Арванд за финансовой помощью. Ирода очень надеется на поддержку организации и заранее выражает свою благодарность.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Iroda is a young woman of 29.  She is very kind and hardworking.  Iroda is married and has two children.  Iroda was born and grew up in a village where children from childhood are accustomed to hard work.  After her wedding, Iroda moved to her current home.  Iroda's husband, Nizomidine, works in Russia.  Iroda has been working in sales for six years.  She sells inexpensive women's and men's shoes at the market.  Iroda is able to meet all of her responsibilities, including those in the home and related to raising her children, as well as those associated with her small business.  She has a sufficient number of clients, and her shop is in a good location.  Iroda hopes to expand her business and diversify the goods that she sells.  Because she has such an advantageous location, she does not think that there will be any difficulties in selling her products.  However, Iroda lacks sufficient funds to purchase new goods.  For this reason, she has turned to Arvand for financial help.  Iroda is hoping for support and expresses her gratitude in advance.
LOAN_USE: to buy shoes

DESCRIPTION: El  Sr. Noel  tiene 34 años de edad, habita en un barrio de asentamiento de los Laureles Norte en la capital de Managua, su esposa le tiene dos hijos de 10 y 14 años de edad, los dos están estudiando la primaria, y ella es ama de casa, y apoya a su esposo en las ventas, pues el negocio de don Noel es la electrónica y vende CD y video juegos y comida rapidas como amburguesa, reposteria, desde hace seis años inicio reparando televisores y teléfono, lo cual ha venido invirtiendo y creciendo en inventario para obtener mejores utilidades. Con la solicitud de préstamo la quiere para invertir en la compra de  disco y herramienta de trabajo para la reparación de los equipos. A futuro su objetivo es ofrecer una variedad de productos para incrementar las ventas, hacer mejoras a su vivienda y seguir dando estudios a sus hijos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Noel is 34 years old and lives in a neighborhood of the Laureles Norte zone in the capital city Managua. He and his wife have two children of 10 and 14 years of age, both of whom are studying in primary school. She is a housewife and helps her husband with the business; Noel has been selling electronics, CDs and video games for six years and started repairing televisions and telephones, investing in and growing his inventory to obtain greater profit. He would like to use the loan to invest in the purchase of CDs and work tools for repairing equipment. In the future his objectives are to offer a variety of products in order to increase his sales, make improvements to his house and continue providing an education to his children.

Translated from Spanish by Donald Allen, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Purchase of CDs and work tools

DESCRIPTION: Jessica una joven de 27 años de edad que estudia la carrera de educación inicial. Ella ha logrado obtener buenas calificaciones en sus estudios. Actualmente labora en un centro de educación y al cuidado de niños. Su mayor deseo es terminar satisfactoriamente sus estudios y de esta manera poder insertarse al mercado laboral. El crédito que solicitó lo destinará para el pago de su pensión y materiales de estudio. Agradece a los inversionistas Kiva por apoyar a jóvenes con ella.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Jessica is 27 years old and is studying for a degree in elementary education. She has achieved good grades in her studies. She currently works in an education center and cares for children. Her greatest desire is to finish her studies satisfactorily and in this way be able to enter the labor market.\r\n\r\nThe loan that she requested will be used to pay for her housing and study materials. She is thankful to the Kiva lenders for supporting young people with her.
LOAN_USE: to pay for her housing and study materials.

DESCRIPTION: Esther is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are of all kinds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. \t\t\t\r\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Esther is a married woman. She has four children. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and also does farming. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a convenient place and her primary customers are of all kinds. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs. \t\t\t\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy farm inputs

DESCRIPTION: Agée de 36 ans, Chifaou est une femme mariée avec ses trois enfants. Elle vit seule à Sanguéra et cherche vigoureusement à améliorer sa condition de vie par son petit commerce de produits cosmétiques. Chifaou vend les produits de beauté dans son quartier et se déplace à la demande de ses clients. Elle s’approvisionne trois fois par mois au grand marché de Lomé et trouve une bonne rentabilité. Chifaou demande ce crédit pour acheter des mèches et des produits de qualités répondant aux goûts de ses clients.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Chifaou is a 36-year-old married mother to three children. She lives alone in Sanguéra and is putting in a lot of effort to improve her standard of living through the sale of cosmetic products. Chifaou sells her beauty products in her local area and delivers to her customers. She gets her supplies three times a month from the main market in Lomé and makes a decent profit. Chifaou is requesting this loan in order to purchase weaves and quality products which meet her customers' needs.\r\n\r\n
LOAN_USE: to purchase six weaves and nine bottles of shampoo

DESCRIPTION:
Janet, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of nine farmers in Alego District. She is 51 years old, married, and has two children.

Janet likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2016 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Janet says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Janet plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Janet’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.5 acres of land.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Janet, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 20 years and is now proud to represent her group of nine farmers in Alego District. She is 51 years old, married, and has two children.

Janet likes to think of herself as a very experienced farmer. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2016 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Janet says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has been able to consistently feed her family. Janet plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Janet’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 4.5 acres of land.
LOAN_USE: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the\xa0cultivation\xa0of maize\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
BORROWER_NAMES: Janet, James, Millicent, Joice, George, Jenipher, Sylvester, James, Milka
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, male, female, female, male, female, male, male, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Arlene has managed a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities for 10 years now. She is married and has two children ages 9 and 13 years old respectively. In addition, she also raises hogs.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI and will use it to buy assorted supplies like canned goods, noodles, edible oil and soap. In this way, she hopes to improve her financial income, and thus improve the family's living conditions and finance the schooling of her two dependents.

Arlene is asking your support to carry out her plan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Arlene has managed a sari-sari (variety) store, selling basic commodities for 10 years now. She is married and has two children ages 9 and 13 years old respectively. In addition, she also raises hogs.

She is asking for a loan from CEVI and will use it to buy assorted supplies like canned goods, noodles, edible oil and soap. In this way, she hopes to improve her financial income, and thus improve the family's living conditions and finance the schooling of her two dependents.

Arlene is asking your support to carry out her plan.
LOAN_USE: to buy assorted supplies like canned goods, noodles, edible oil and soap

DESCRIPTION:
Shazia is a 40-year-old woman who has been running a school in a small community. There are 120 students enrolled in the school, and 66% are female students. The aim of her school is to provide all students with equal learning opportunities. Students are encouraged to be successful academically by performing as highly as possible.

Presently, she has planned to enroll more students but the lack of furniture is the major hindrance. Therefore, she has requested a PKR 60,000 loan to purchase furniture and doors for the school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Shazia is a 40-year-old woman who has been running a school in a small community. There are 120 students enrolled in the school, and 66% are female students. The aim of her school is to provide all students with equal learning opportunities. Students are encouraged to be successful academically by performing as highly as possible.

Presently, she has planned to enroll more students but the lack of furniture is the major hindrance. Therefore, she has requested a PKR 60,000 loan to purchase furniture and doors for the school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase furniture and doors for the school.
TAGS: #Biz Durable Asset, #Schooling, user_favorite, #Woman Owned Biz, #Female Education

DESCRIPTION:
Merlie is 49 years old and married with nine children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Merlie has a piña weaving business in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8000 loan through NWTF to buy materials needed for her piña weaving.

Merlie has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, Merlie would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy materials needed for her piña weaving.

DESCRIPTION: Мавлудахон благодарна за поддержку и заботу. Она целенаправленно воспользовалась кредитом и получила прибыль. Мавлудахон хочет еще раз обратиться за поддержкой и купить новую сезонную детскую одежду. Мавлудахон уверена. что и в этот раз вы ее поддержите. Она заранее благодарна вам.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mavludakhon is grateful for the support and care. She used the loan as intended and made a profit. Mavludakhon wants to request support again and buy new seasonal children's clothing. Mavludakhon is sure that you will support her this time, too. She thanks you in advance.
LOAN_USE: to buy children's clothing in order to expand her business and make a profit.

DESCRIPTION:
Meet 31-year-old Kadiatu from Calabatown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. Some years ago, Kadiatu established her bread business.

She began her business because she wants to educate her children. She is married to a man who offers taxi services to people on his motorbike. These drivers are known as ‘okada drivers’. There are many okada drivers down in Calaba town. Even though the job carries a high risk of injury on the poor roads, okada driving became a good way for young men to make a living for themselves after the war.

Kadiatu works at her business 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that she faces the challenge of price inflation.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar and oil to make her bread. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees. In the future, she plans to open a bread shop. She thanks you for your support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Meet 31-year-old Kadiatu from Calabatown in Sierra Leone. She is married with 3 children. Some years ago, Kadiatu established her bread business.

She began her business because she wants to educate her children. She is married to a man who offers taxi services to people on his motorbike. These drivers are known as ‘okada drivers’. There are many okada drivers down in Calaba town. Even though the job carries a high risk of injury on the poor roads, okada driving became a good way for young men to make a living for themselves after the war.

Kadiatu works at her business 9 hours per day, 6 days per week. She says that she faces the challenge of price inflation.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase flour, sugar and oil to make her bread. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her children school fees. In the future, she plans to open a bread shop. She thanks you for your support.
LOAN_USE: to purchase flour, sugar and oil to make her bread.

DESCRIPTION:
Leonarda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonarda is 59 years old now.

Leonarda has a internet café business in the Philippines. Leonarda requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy monitor, mouse, keyboard for the maintenance of her business.

Leonarda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Leonarda is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Leonarda is 59 years old now.

Leonarda has a internet café business in the Philippines. Leonarda requested a PHP 50000 loan amount through NWTF to buy monitor, mouse, keyboard for the maintenance of her business.

Leonarda has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Leonarda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy monitor, mouse, keyboard for the maintenance of her internet cafe business.

DESCRIPTION:
La señora María de 56 años vive junto a sus hijas en la Aldea de Agua Fría, Nacaome Departamento de Valle, es una Mujer muy trabajadora y con deseos de salir adelante, se dedica al negocio de Compra y Venta de Ropa Americana  desde hace varios años sus clientes son los vecinos, amigos y familiares  también cuenta con una importante clientela quienes le prefieren por su calidad de atención, también la señora María vende por encargo a sus clientes y personas de diferentes barrios y colonias del Centro de Nacaome.
En está ocasión está solicitando un crédito para la compra de 3 Fardos Ropa Americana Mixto, para poder generar ganancias y así generar ingresos y sacar adelante su negocio aprovecha por este medio a darle las gracias a Kiva y a Prisma por el apoyo brindado en todo este tiempo y espera cambiar su vida notablemente.
También vende tortillas. 
Su sueño es instalar una tienda en el centro de la ciudad.
San Lorenzo, Honduras Marzo del 2018.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
María, who is 56 years old, lives with her daughters in the village of Agua Fría in Nacaome, in the Department of Valle. She is a very hard-working woman with a desire to get on in life. For several years she has been making a living buying and selling American clothing. Her customers are neighbours, friends and family members. She also has a large clientele who choose her because of the quality of her service. María also takes orders for her customers and people in different districts and neighbourhoods in the centre of Nacaome.

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy 3 bundles of mixed American clothing, so she can generate earnings and so make an income and move her business forward. She takes this opportunity to thank Kiva and Prisma for the support provided over all this time and she hopes to significantly change her life. She also sells tortillas. Her dream is to set up a shop in the city centre.

San Lorenzo, Honduras March 2018.
LOAN_USE: to buy 3 bundles of clothing.

DESCRIPTION:
Juan se ha caracterizado entre sus clientes como un hombre amable y carismático, con 66 años de edad, se dedica a atender su propio negocio, pues tiene una venta de pescado.

El crédito que solicita es un apoyo para comprar surtido al por mayor de pescado al por mayor, así tendrá más variedad para ofrecer a sus clientes y satisfacer los diferentes gustos y necesidades; lo que le generará mejores ventas e ingresos para seguir luchando para cumplir su propósito a mediano plazo, que es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Juan is characterized among his customers as a friendly and charismatic man, 66 years old, who works tending his own business since he sells fish.

The loan he requests is support to purchase an assortment of fish in bulk, so to have more variety to offer his customers and satisfy their different tastes and needs. This will generate more sales and income to continue struggling to meet his goal in the medium term, which is to improve the condition of his house.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia
LOAN_USE: to purchase an assortment of fish in bulk.

DESCRIPTION:
Elsa signed up for membership with PMPC and obtained the necessary capital to open a sari-sari (variety) store. She is grateful for the capital and has been able to turn the tide in her favor by making good sales.

Elsa wants to take advantage of this good fortune, so she recently applied for another loan in order to buy basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and sauces. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elsa signed up for membership with PMPC and obtained the necessary capital to open a sari-sari (variety) store. She is grateful for the capital and has been able to turn the tide in her favor by making good sales.

Elsa wants to take advantage of this good fortune, so she recently applied for another loan in order to buy basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and sauces. In the future, she hopes to build a decent home for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy basic commodities such as canned goods, oil, and sauces to sell at her store.

DESCRIPTION:
Tarida is 42 years old. She is happily married and has been blessed with 4 children. She also supports 3 other members of her extended family.

Tarida's husband works in a poshomill, while she runs a carwash business to support her family. She is seeking a loan to boost her business and repair her broken carwash machines.

With her profits, Tarida will settle her loan and use the rest to improve her business. Her dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Tarida is 42 years old. She is happily married and has been blessed with 4 children. She also supports 3 other members of her extended family.

Tarida's husband works in a poshomill, while she runs a carwash business to support her family. She is seeking a loan to boost her business and repair her broken carwash machines.

With her profits, Tarida will settle her loan and use the rest to improve her business. Her dream is to expand her business and improve her living standards.
LOAN_USE: to repair her carwash machine and boost her carwash business.
TAGS: user_favorite, #Parent, #Woman Owned Biz, #Repair Renew Replace, #Supporting Family

DESCRIPTION:
Marife has one child and is 42 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marife has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy variety of fish to dry and sell.

Marife has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marife has one child and is 42 years old. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Marife has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) to buy variety of fish to dry and sell.

Marife has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy a variety of fish to dry and sell.

DESCRIPTION:
This is 39-year-old Firdous. She is married, with five children, and she lives in the area of Lahore, Pakistan.

For a few years now, her husband has conducted a business of selling clothes in a nearby town, in which he sells both ladies' and gents' clothes. His customers now demand embroidery dresses also, so he has decided that he should offer embroidery dresses too. 

Now their children are growing older, and their needs are growing as well. With the rapid increase in the family's necessities, her husband wants to grow his business. He does not have any other source of income to fulfill the needs of his family.  He wants to grow his current business but he does not have sufficient money.

So Firdous has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so her husband can buy a variety of embroidery dresses for ladies to sell.

Firdous hopes that this loan will bring positive changes in her husband's enterprise and in her family as well.

Firdous is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: To buy embroidery dresses for resale.

DESCRIPTION:
Oun is 39 years old and is a widow with two children. She sells groceries and beverages.One of her children is selling medicine and another one is working at photo-printing shop. She has been running this business for two years.



She will use this loan to purchase more orange juice and other beverages to sell in her store.This loan would help her to buy more goods to meet client demand and improve here current business smoothly. Her goals are to get more income from this business and expand this business bigger in the future.



Her major challenges are more competitors and insufficient capital to buy more goods to meet client demand.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Oun is 39 years old and is a widow with two children. She sells groceries and beverages.One of her children is selling medicine and another one is working at photo-printing shop. She has been running this business for two years.



She will use this loan to purchase more orange juice and other beverages to sell in her store.This loan would help her to buy more goods to meet client demand and improve here current business smoothly. Her goals are to get more income from this business and expand this business bigger in the future.



Her major challenges are more competitors and insufficient capital to buy more goods to meet client demand.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more orange juice and other beverages to sell in order to change her family's living standard.

DESCRIPTION: Lafwa has a grocery store. Her journey was a difficult one that is crowned with her two boys, whom she lives for. She is a widow and is in need of an income to face the financial needs of her family. She makes an income from her grocery store but it is serious work with long hours. She is in need of a loan to buy groceries to fill her store with. Her town has seen its share of the nearby war as the host of the largest human exodus of refugees in history.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Lafwa has a grocery store. Her journey was a difficult one that is crowned with her two boys, whom she lives for. She is a widow and is in need of an income to face the financial needs of her family. She makes an income from her grocery store but it is serious work with long hours. She is in need of a loan to buy groceries to fill her store with. Her town has seen its share of the nearby war as the host of the largest human exodus of refugees in history.
LOAN_USE: to buy groceries for her grocery store to sell to make an income.

DESCRIPTION:
Sebastiana es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace cinco años atrás, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, grado de instrucción primaria completa, tiene tres hijos de: 16, 12 y 7 años de edad.
Sebastiana se dedica a la venta de frazadas, esta actividad la realiza de lunes a sábado en La Paz - Bolivia. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un crédito de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar un poco más de mercadería, comprará frazadas al por mayor.
Su visión es crecer en su negocio y llevar a otros departamentos de Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las ganancias que genera sus ahorro.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sebastiana has been a member of the “”Chojchoni” communal bank for five years. She is from the Copani district, located in the Yunguyo province, and Puno department. She is 37 years old, married, and has three children, ages 16, 12, and 7. She has an elementary school education. Sebastiana sells blankets from Monday through Saturday in La Paz, Bolivia. Her first loan of 300 PEN, through “Movimiento Manuela Ramos” allowed her to increase her working capital. She is asking for this loan of 300 PEN ($125) so that she can increase her inventory a bit by buying blankets in bulk. Her vision is to grow her business and sell her merchandise in more Bolivian departments. The things she likes most about her communal bank are the earnings that her savings generate.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Blankets

DESCRIPTION: Dituben is a 30-year-old married woman residing in Dahod district, Gujarat. She is engaged in the grocery business. She sells rice, pulses, flour, etc. in her grocery store. She has a household of 4 members and a monthly income of INR 25,000. She wants to purchase more rice, pulses, flour, etc. to sell in the local market to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of INR 30,000 from Prayas, one of Milaap's field partners. She and her family will be thankful to their lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Dituben is a 30-year-old married woman residing in Dahod district, Gujarat. She is engaged in the grocery business. She sells rice, pulses, flour, etc. in her grocery store. She has a household of 4 members and a monthly income of INR 25,000. She wants to purchase more rice, pulses, flour, etc. to sell in the local market to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of INR 30,000 from Prayas, one of Milaap's field partners. She and her family will be thankful to their lenders.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more stock of items such as rice, pulses, and flour to expand her grocery business.

DESCRIPTION:
Harriet N. lives in the Mulago neighborhood, in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 2 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (a sister and brother). 

Harriet has a business of selling second-hand clothes. She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. She sells her products from home, by means of retail. Harriet has requested for a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of second-hand clothes. She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenge(s) for Harriet include rainy season and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to see her business grow and she would like to start importing clothes herself. Harriet lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity, but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food, school fees and medication.
LOAN_USE: To buy more bales of second-hand clothes.

DESCRIPTION: Мехри 53 года. Она замужем и имеет 4 детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина и старается всегда найти источника дохода и таким образом улучшить условию проживания. Мехри более 12 лет занимается скотоводством. Она очень хорошо справляется с бизнесом, так как имеет большой опыт. Ее муж помогает ей введение бизнеса. Дополнительно они занимаются выращиванием сельхоз культуры. Она хочет развивать бизнес дальше, но не имеет денег для покупки скота, чтобы увеличить количество скота. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mehry is 53 years old, married and has four children. She is a hardworking woman who is always looking for new ways to make money and improve the life of her family. Mehry has been raising cattle for 12 years. She excels at taking care of her animals because she has a lot of experience. He husband helps Mehry with the herd. In addition they also grow crops on their plot. Mehry wants to expand her business but does not have enough savings to buy more animals. She is requesting 6000 somoni to purchase more cattle. Mehry awaits your kindness.
LOAN_USE: to buy cattle for expanding her herd

DESCRIPTION: JOSEFINA ES UNA PERSONA DE 28 AÑOS DE EDAD, ES SOLTERA Y TIENE UN HIJO DE 8 AÑOS Y DESDE HACE UN AÑO TRABAJA EN UNA EMPRESA DE EMPLEADA, ELLA HA NOTADO QUE NO ESCUCHA MUY BIEN, PORQUE DONDE TRABAJA TRATA CON MUCHA GENTE Y SE TIENE QUE AISLAR DE SUS PROPIOS COMPAÑEROS DE TRABAJO, ELLA NECESITA DE UN APARATO AUDITIVO, PERO LAMENTABLEMENTE NO LO PUEDE COMPRAR DE CONTADO, PORQUE TIENE OTROS GASTOS, LE SUGIRIERON SOLICITAR UN PRÉSTAMO PARA QUE DE ESTE MODO PODER COMPRARLO, YA SE PODRÁ RELACIONAR CON SUS COMPAÑEROS DE TRABAJO SIN NINGÚN PROBLEMA.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Josefina, age 28, is single and has an eight year old child. She has worked for a company for one year.

She has noticed that she is not hearing very well because where she works there are a lot of people, and she has to isolate herself from her own work colleagues.

She needs a hearing aid, but sadly, she is not able to buy it for cash because she has other expenses. It was suggested to her that she request a loan in order to buy a hearing aid. This way she will be able relate to her work colleagues without any problem.
LOAN_USE: to get a hearing aid.

DESCRIPTION:
Thanks to you lenders! Recently, Norafil was granted a PHP 14,000 loan for her inventory. Having this amount, she ably bought more quantities of stocks of ingredients and products associated with her food stall business. Having been able to induce greater sales, Norafil found a better source of income for the family. Thus, she was able to support the household's basic needs. 

However, she still needs a certain amount this time that will help her maintain the business operations. She is requesting to take a loan worth PHP 19,000 that she will use to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables an other ingredients needed in her food stall. Your help today can be a great start for a better business and life that awaits to Norafil. This is why she is very hopeful that you will allow her request. 

She simply dreams of being successful someday in her business.She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Thanks to you lenders! Recently, Norafil was granted a PHP 14,000 loan for her inventory. Having this amount, she ably bought more quantities of stocks of ingredients and products associated with her food stall business. Having been able to induce greater sales, Norafil found a better source of income for the family. Thus, she was able to support the household's basic needs. 

However, she still needs a certain amount this time that will help her maintain the business operations. She is requesting to take a loan worth PHP 19,000 that she will use to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables an other ingredients needed in her food stall. Your help today can be a great start for a better business and life that awaits to Norafil. This is why she is very hopeful that you will allow her request. 

She simply dreams of being successful someday in her business.She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.
LOAN_USE: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken and vegetables.

DESCRIPTION:
Regina is 35 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Regina fattens pigs in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Regina has been in the pig fattening business for 15 years and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Regina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Regina is 35 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

Regina fattens pigs in the Philippines. Regina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Regina has been in the pig fattening business for 15 years and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Regina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

DESCRIPTION:
Jane is 34 years old, a hard working woman who has lived in Kasoa for 4 years. She has been a client of ID Ghana for some years now and this is her first loan with ID Ghana.

She is applying for a loan to buy more used clothing items to meet customers' demands. Her greatest strength as an entrepreneur is her determination.

Her dream for the future is to expand her business in order to buy and sell on a wholesale basis. She would like to thank all of her Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jane is 34 years old, a hard working woman who has lived in Kasoa for 4 years. She has been a client of ID Ghana for some years now and this is her first loan with ID Ghana.

She is applying for a loan to buy more used clothing items to meet customers' demands. Her greatest strength as an entrepreneur is her determination.

Her dream for the future is to expand her business in order to buy and sell on a wholesale basis. She would like to thank all of her Kiva lenders for their generosity and support.
LOAN_USE: to buy more used clothing items to meet customers' demands.

DESCRIPTION:
Deborah's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Deborah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kiyinda in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is single and has one child. For the past 2 years, Deborah has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells rice, juice, cooking oil and beans.
To help expand her business, Deborah has requested a loan from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell, and will help Deborah to generate greater profits and improve her family’s standard of living. Deborah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house of her own.
Deborah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more maize, rice, sugar, and soap to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Wonderful Kiva community, meet Mary (pictured in her house above). She is a humble mother whose main dream is to improve the conditions of her home. Mary has a lovely family that she really adores. She will do anything good to prevent them from ever having to go to bed with hungry stomachs. Mary comes from the Kerugoya area of Kenya.

She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but that reality did not stop her dream of wanting to succeed in life. Mary has been farming for the past seven years. During this time, she has gathered much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Mary practices mixed farming (dairy, animal, and crop farming). With her profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs.

She is very enterprising and is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES to buy seeds so that she can begin horticulture farming. Mary wants to take advantage of the favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products. This will increase her profit.

This loan will be a true help for this hardworking family!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Wonderful Kiva community, meet Mary (pictured in her house above). She is a humble mother whose main dream is to improve the conditions of her home. Mary has a lovely family that she really adores. She will do anything good to prevent them from ever having to go to bed with hungry stomachs. Mary comes from the Kerugoya area of Kenya.

She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white-collar job, but that reality did not stop her dream of wanting to succeed in life.
