Mary practices mixed farming (dairy, animal, and crop farming). With her profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs.

She is very enterprising and is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES to buy seeds so that she can begin horticulture farming. Mary wants to take advantage of the favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil, and a ready market for horticulture products. This will increase her profit.

This loan will be a true help for this hardworking family!
LOAN_USE: \tto buy seeds so that she can begin horticulture farming.

DESCRIPTION:
Ms Hợp is 55 years old and she is a widow. Her husband died a number of years ago and she now lives with her two children. She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years. Hợp lives in Thanh Hoa city, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2016, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hợp has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hợp is a reputable person in the community.

The main hardship that Hợp faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Hợp hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ms Hợp is 55 years old and she is a widow. Her husband died a number of years ago and she now lives with her two children. She has worked in agriculture raising cattle for more than 10 years. Hợp lives in Thanh Hoa city, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

In 2016, Hợp joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Hợp has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Hợp is a reputable person in the community.

The main hardship that Hợp faces is the lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

With her business profit, Hợp hopes for her business to do well, to be able to buy more supplies and equipment for her business, and for her family to be healthy and happy.
LOAN_USE: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in the future.

DESCRIPTION: Bernardino resides in the village of San Guillermo in the province of Isabela. He is 56 years old, married and blessed with three children. He is a hard-working and responsible father. He owns and operates a general store in his village and it is his main source of income. He has been engaged in this business for almost two years and earns approximately PHP 5,000 a month. Bernardino has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase items for his retail store such as noodles, canned goods, bakery bread, curls, and daily-use products. He hopes that his requested loan will be granted so that he can utilize it properly in his business. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to save as a reserve for future emergencies.
LOAN_USE: to purchase items for his retail store such as noodles, canned goods, bakery bread, curls, and daily use products

DESCRIPTION:
Khalida is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in the small village of Gujranwala, Pakistan. A few years ago, she started her business of raising sheep in her area to sell it for meat. She earns a good profit for her services.

She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market for higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from JWS Pakistan to buy fodder for the animals in order to raise them and be able to increase production and improve her income considerably.

She is thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Khalida is a 34-year-old woman. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. She lives in the small village of Gujranwala, Pakistan. A few years ago, she started her business of raising sheep in her area to sell it for meat. She earns a good profit for her services.

She buys animals (baby goats and calves) at low prices, raises them, and then sells them in the market for higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. Therefore, she is requesting a loan from JWS Pakistan to buy fodder for the animals in order to raise them and be able to increase production and improve her income considerably.

She is thankful to Kiva and JWS Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy good quality fodder for her animals.

DESCRIPTION: Daniela tiene 20 años de edad, es de estado civil soltera, es una joven responsable y trabajadora, vive con su madre a quien la apoya con lo necesario en su hogar, Daniela se dedica hace 2 años a la compra, crianza y comercialización de chanchos, para ella se ha convertido en una gran fuente de ingresos económicos, solicita el crédito para invertir en mas crías, que cuando ya sea tiempo de comercializarlos, obtenga una buena ganancia para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y por ende seguir aumentando sus ganancias, para el sustento de ella y de su madres.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Daniela is aged 20, is single, and is a responsible and hard working young woman. She lives with her mother whom she supports with important household tasks.

For two years, she has been buying, rearing and selling pigs, work which has become a great source of economic income for her.

She is requesting a loan to buy more piglets, for which, when the time comes to sell them, she can earn enough to continue investing in her business. This way she can keep increasing her income, and support herself and her mother.
LOAN_USE: to buy, rear and sell pigs.

DESCRIPTION: Moses is 35 years old married with 3 children.He operates a retail shop selling sugar, salt, soap and other groceries and has been in this business for 8 years. He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations, inflation,high fuel and transportation costs. His business goal is to build a house for his business and his personal goal is to educate his children.\r\nMoses needs a loan to buy sugar, soap, salt and other groceries for sell.
LOAN_USE: to buy  sugar , salt, soap and other groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION: El es Oscar, es soltero y cuanta con apenas educación básica, se dedica a trabajar al jornal y se apoya con la crianza de cerdos en unas chancharas que arrienda, Oscar gusta de su trabajo ya que  no es de mucho tiempo y es de pronta recuperación.  El desea mejorar su negocio solicita un préstamo de 1000 dólares el cual le permitirá comprar: cerdos, balanceado papas, suero y vitaminas para el adecuado desarrollo de los animales, Oscar aspira a hacerse de un capital para entrar al negocio de ganado seco así podrá rotar y mejorar sus ingresos para poder vivir.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This is Oscar. He is single and has just a basic education. He works as a day laborer and supports himself by raising pigs at some pig pens that he rents. Oscar likes this business since it does not take much time and has a quick return.

He wants to improve his business, so he is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD, which will allow him to purchase pigs, balanced feed, potatoes, whey, and vitamins for the adequate development of the animals. Oscar aspires to having the capital needed to enter into the beef cattle business. This way he will be able to rotate and improve his income in order to live.
LOAN_USE: to purchase pigs, balanced feed, potatoes, whey, and vitamins.

DESCRIPTION:
Esther has been selling a variety of used clothes in Olkalou Town for the last three years. She is 49 years old, and a single mother of five school children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and this will be her third loan. She plans to use the loan amount to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell.  She will use the anticipated profits to cater for her family's needs.

In the future, Esther hopes to grow her business and move into a more permanent shop from which to sell, as she currently sells from the roadside.
LOAN_USE: to buy more jackets and sweaters to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Mrs Chỉnh is 50 years old and married with two children. Chỉnh lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover, her job is unstable. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to use. But her income is not enough to get a new system.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to install a clean water system. This is Chỉnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her new water system, Chỉnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mrs Chỉnh is 50 years old and married with two children. Chỉnh lives in Bim Son town, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover, her job is unstable. One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean water to use. But her income is not enough to get a new system.  She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to install a clean water system. This is Chỉnh's first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. With her new water system, Chỉnh hopes for her family to be healthy and happy.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to install a clean water system.

DESCRIPTION:
Cerila is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 

Cerila has a shop that makes and sells snacks like banana and sweet potato cue (sweet snacks). She has had this business for 15 years. She  has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks.

Cerila has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy raw ingredients needed for making snacks

DESCRIPTION:
Taddy is age 23 and married. She has three children and they all live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She grows and trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies, and gets additional income from selling rice in the markets.

She started her rice business in the year 2011 to raise income for the family and pay school fees for the children. Her main challenge is limited capital. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs.

Her family dream is to educate all her children and this compels her to work extra hard. She has asked for a loan to buy rice for resale to customers at her stall.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Taddy is age 23 and married. She has three children and they all live in Bundibugyo, Uganda. She grows and trades in cocoa, mainly buying and selling to agents and cocoa companies, and gets additional income from selling rice in the markets.

She started her rice business in the year 2011 to raise income for the family and pay school fees for the children. Her main challenge is limited capital. She hopes to expand the business, educate her children and support the family in getting basic needs.

Her family dream is to educate all her children and this compels her to work extra hard. She has asked for a loan to buy rice for resale to customers at her stall.
LOAN_USE: To buy rice to sell to her customers.

DESCRIPTION: Chimgee lives with her parents and son in own house in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her son attends secondary school and her mother is retired. Chimgee operates and manages a traditional shoe making business with her father. She makes two different types of traditional shoes, one called Buriad and the other is called Mongol. She started her business in 2006 and at that time only produced the Buriad shoes. As she began gaining more experience and customers, she expanded her product line to include the Mongol shoes. Through her hard work, she has been able to buy tools and rent a small work area. One day, she would like to own her own store where she can sell her products, expand her product line and also attract new customers. She is requesting a 1,000,000 tugrug (~700 USD) loan to purchase more supplies and tools for her shoe making business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more supplies and tools

DESCRIPTION:
O senhor António tem 37 anos de idade,vive maritalmente e pai de 03 filhos com 13, 10 e 5 anos todos a estudarem sustenta seu irmão de 14 anos que vive com ela na casa própria.
Diz que com este crédito pretende adquirir chapas de zinco, barrotes, varrões para dar continuidade a construção de sua casa.
É o nono empréstimo na Hluvuku, com os anteriores empréstimos pagou propinas, iniciou a construção de sua casa e fez a canalização na sua casa e diz que ira solicitar mais empréstimos para concretizar o seu sonho.
O seu maior sonho é de melhorar as condições de sua casa e ter uma vida estável
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mr. Antonio is 37 years old, married, and has 3 children of 13, 10, and 5 years of age, all of whom attend school. He supports his 14-year-old brother who lives in his house.

He says that with this loan he will buy zinc sheets, bars, and rods to continue building his house. This is his ninth loan with Hluvuku. With previous loans, he paid fees, started building his house, and did the plumbing.

He says he will apply for more loans to make his dream a reality. His biggest dream is to improve the conditions of his home and have a stable life.
LOAN_USE: to buy construction materials.

DESCRIPTION: Sylvia lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children who all go to school. She has one additional family member (brother). \r\n\r\nSylvia operates a retail shop which she rents. She works six days a week. She has been in this business for the last 4 years. Sylvia has requested for a loan of 400000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more bags of sugar, 50kg of rice, soap, and cooking oil. Her major challenges include transportation and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations are to expand her retail shop into a wholesale shop and also to educate her children to university level. She lives in her own house. Her family does not have access to electricity or piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent for the business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more bags of sugar, 50kg of rice, soap and cooking oil.

DESCRIPTION: Jovy is 46 years old and married to a carpenter. They're blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost eight years from which she earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her income from this business is usually spent on their daily living expenses. Jovy is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase cooking oil, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and canned goods to sell in her store. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Jovy is 46 years old and married to a carpenter. They're blessed with two children. She has owned and managed a retail store in their village for almost eight years from which she earns a net income of 300 PHP daily. Her income from this business is usually spent on their daily living expenses. Jovy is asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase cooking oil, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and canned goods to sell in her store. She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.
LOAN_USE: to purchase cooking oil, coffee, sugar, detergent soap, and canned goods to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.  She earns more income from selling vegetables.

She requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy wood, nails, and paint for her furniture business.

Helen has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Helen is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a furniture making business in the Philippines.  She earns more income from selling vegetables.

She requests 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy wood, nails, and paint for her furniture business.

Helen has sustained her business  through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy wood, nails, and paint.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KSPPS BMI’s clients, Ikah, who is 51 years old, married, and has two sons. Ikah has been selling uduk rice for forty years. Her husband works very hard and he is a cow cutter in the Tangerang District for forty years. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their kids.

She has requested for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KSPPS BMI. This loan will be used to build a clean water source facility at their home to improve access to water for their family. Today her family has no access to a water in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build water sources, but Ikah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KSPPS BMI’s clients, Ikah, who is 51 years old, married, and has two sons. Ikah has been selling uduk rice for forty years. Her husband works very hard and he is a cow cutter in the Tangerang District for forty years. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their kids.

She has requested for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KSPPS BMI. This loan will be used to build a clean water source facility at their home to improve access to water for their family. Today her family has no access to a water in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build water sources, but Ikah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
LOAN_USE: to build a clean water source facility at their home to improve access to water for their family.

DESCRIPTION:
Crisanta C. is from the city of Maquilao Tangub City. She is 46 years old. Crisanta is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Crisanta owns & operates a business making & selling banana cue. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from GDMPC. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

DESCRIPTION:
Geronima, aged 61, is a married woman and a mother of nine grown-up children. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. 

Geronima has been engaged in a pig raising business for more than eleven years now. She also earns additional income through farming. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

She is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm. This loan will be a great help for Geronima in augmenting her income and profit.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Geronima, aged 61, is a married woman and a mother of nine grown-up children. She lives with her family in Talibon, Bohol. 

Geronima has been engaged in a pig raising business for more than eleven years now. She also earns additional income through farming. Her husband works as a carpenter. 

She is asking for a loan to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm. This loan will be a great help for Geronima in augmenting her income and profit.
LOAN_USE: to buy animal feed for the pigs and fertilizer for the farm.

DESCRIPTION:
Jiya is a 22-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of a daughter. Jiya has been running her own cosmetics selling business for many years and earns the income to contribute to managing the household.
 
She needs different kinds of cosmetics and other relevant accessories for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit.

Jiya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jiya is a 22-year-old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. She is the mother of a daughter. Jiya has been running her own cosmetics selling business for many years and earns the income to contribute to managing the household.
 
She needs different kinds of cosmetics and other relevant accessories for her business purpose, but due to insufficient financial means, she is unable to purchase these accessories. Therefore, she has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan. This loan will enable her to purchase these above accessories and also be helpful for her to increase her monthly sales and profit.

Jiya is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: To buy different kinds of cosmetics for reselling purposes.

DESCRIPTION:
Elizabeth B. is from the village of Tumpagon, a barangay of Cagayan De Oro City on Mindanao Island. She is 47 years old, married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Elizabeth sells firewood to the local community. She has been in business for over ten years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Elizabeth joined HSPFI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan, her fourth, from HSPFI of 11000 PHP (she successfully repaid her third loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI). Elizabeth will use this loan to purchase additional firewood to sell. She plans to use all additional revenue to expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that one-on-one translations of entrepreneur profiles are costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow it to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To buy additional firewood to sell.
TOWN_NAME: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

DESCRIPTION: Sarun, a parent of seven children, is a resident of Moung Russey district of Battambang province. To sustain her family, she practices rice farming and pineapple planting as her main business to generate income. With her current business, she is able to earn up to 30,000 KHR per day.  Having completely repaid her previous two loans, she feels confident that she can improve her living condition at a good pace. She is now leading a group of three to apply for a new loan. She plans to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farm. She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop output and triple her yield.
LOAN_USE: To buy fertilizer for her farm

DESCRIPTION:
Phibian is 32 years old, she is married and blessed with three children who are below the age of eighteen years. She is running a dairy farm. She has been in the business for eleven years, and earns an average income of KES. 10,000 per month.



She has applied for the first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy hay supplemented with soy dairy meals and grain. This will enable the cows to gain weight, and produce more milk that will fetch more money.



With the anticipated profits she plans to repay the loan, and also expand the business.

In the near future she hopes to further her business, and also be able to provide for her family on time.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Phibian is 32 years old, she is married and blessed with three children who are below the age of eighteen years. She is running a dairy farm. She has been in the business for eleven years, and earns an average income of KES. 10,000 per month.



She has applied for the first loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable her buy hay supplemented with soy dairy meals and grain. This will enable the cows to gain weight, and produce more milk that will fetch more money.



With the anticipated profits she plans to repay the loan, and also expand the business.

In the near future she hopes to further her business, and also be able to provide for her family on time.
LOAN_USE: to purchase dairy feeds to boost the production of milk.

DESCRIPTION: At 54 years old, Mr. A. Chima is married with five children, and lives in Benin City, in Edo state of Nigeria. He wants a loan amount of $400 to buy more provisions, wines, and dry gins. He learned this business for three years and started his own in 2000. And has been with LAPO for three years and is a dedicated client.
LOAN_USE: To buy more provisions, wines, and dry gins

DESCRIPTION:
Saba D. is married with 5 children. He is 40 years old. He has an ice cream shop. He started this business 3 years ago; it is still going very well. He requested and repaid his first loan; it was very useful for Saba D.. He is not alone; one of his sons is working with D.. Some times other members of his family help him.

Now he wants to take out a second loan of 40000 Afghani (US$ 850) with a term of 18 months to buy two new machines for ice cream. This summer he wants to make his business bigger to stand on his feet in the future.

He is happy with the process of loans in Afghanistan. He hopes to help better his family's situation and make a better future for them. He wishes to grow his business in Kabul and open many shops in the next few years. He would like to thank both Kiva and AFSG.
LOAN_USE: To buy two new machines for ice cream

DESCRIPTION:
Ana, es casada, tiene tres hijos, vive en casa propia se dedica a la venta de lácteos, el negocio inicio por la necesidad de tener más ingresos para cubrir los gastos familiares, atiende su negocio ella misma con un poco de ayuda de sus hijos, por el momento no ha tenido ninguna en administrarlo.
El capital lo utilizara para adquirir crema y quesos de distinta clase de esta manera su negocio tendrá producto fresco y de calidad, espera aumentar sus ventas, tener más clientes satisfechos, tener más ganancias con las que cumplirá con sus compromisos económicos.
Sueña con que su negocio crezca poco a poco y mejorar su economía.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Ana is married with three children. She lives in her own house. She makes a living by selling dairy products. She started her business because of the necessity to have more income to cover family expenses. She looks after the business herself with a little bit of help from her children. For the time being she has not had any of them managing it. She will use the loan to buy cream and cheeses of a different type. This way, her business will have fresh and quality product. She hopes to increase her sales, have more satisfied clients, and make more profits with which she will fulfill her economic commitments. She dreams about her business growing little by little and improving her money situation.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy cream and cheeses

DESCRIPTION:
Cecille is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecille is 41 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Cecille has a farming coconut business in the Philippines. Cecille requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Cecille has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cecille would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cecille is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cecille is 41 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Cecille has a farming coconut business in the Philippines. Cecille requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers, and other farm supplies.

Cecille has been in this business for 3 years. In the future, Cecille would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers, and other farm supplies

DESCRIPTION:
Josephine is 29 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables, which she has done for five years.

This is her second loan, which she will use to buy tomatoes, onions, avocados, cabbages, kale, etc. for selling. She will use the profits from her expanded business to grow her business stock to increase her profits.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Josephine is 29 years old. She is married and blessed with three children. Her business is selling fruits and vegetables, which she has done for five years.

This is her second loan, which she will use to buy tomatoes, onions, avocados, cabbages, kale, etc. for selling. She will use the profits from her expanded business to grow her business stock to increase her profits.

Her hopes and dreams are to have a successful business.
LOAN_USE: to buy tomatoes, onions, avocados, cabbages, kale, etc. for selling.

DESCRIPTION:
Segundina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Segundina has been in this business for 5 years. Segundina earns more income from dried fish vending and general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Segundina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Segundina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 9000 through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Segundina has been in this business for 5 years. Segundina earns more income from dried fish vending and general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Segundina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more vegetables to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Amina is 19 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her produce store, which deals in food produce.

To help expand her business, Amina has requested a loan of 1,100,000 UGX (Ugandan Shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy enough sacks of beans, peas, maize flour, and millet, and will help Amina to generate greater profits.

Working hard she will have a good life by providing for herself whatever she needs without depending on her parents. Amina hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land and build a bigger house for her family and also have a bigger market for her business.

Amina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Amina is 19 years old and lives in the town of Pallisa in the Iganga region of Uganda. For the past three years, she has been working hard to manage her produce store, which deals in food produce.

Amina is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to buy enough sacks of beans, peas, maize flour, and millet.

DESCRIPTION:
Hello caring community. Nancy is 32 years old. She is happily married and has been blessed with four children who are between the ages of 12 and 3 years old. Her husband is a tailor while she is an education provider.

She owns a school in the Sikhendu area in Kitale. The school has 67 children and 4 teachers. The school is profitable and she is happy to provide the much needed good education for the children in the area. The children who study at her school are from humble backgrounds and not all are able to pay the school fees on time but a good number of them are. This does not discourage her as she finds this a calling and is motivated to be setting a bright future for the children.

Her dream is to expand her school more in the future and she is currently seeking a loan that will help her with the construction of a new classroom. She plans to pay for the loan through the profits she makes from the school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hello caring community. Nancy is 32 years old. She is happily married and has been blessed with four children who are between the ages of 12 and 3 years old. Her husband is a tailor while she is an education provider.

She owns a school in the Sikhendu area in Kitale. The school has 67 children and 4 teachers. The school is profitable and she is happy to provide the much needed good education for the children in the area. The children who study at her school are from humble backgrounds and not all are able to pay the school fees on time but a good number of them are. This does not discourage her as she finds this a calling and is motivated to be setting a bright future for the children.

Her dream is to expand her school more in the future and she is currently seeking a loan that will help her with the construction of a new classroom. She plans to pay for the loan through the profits she makes from the school.

DESCRIPTION: Эту  портниху зовут Навдагул. Ей 36 лет. Она еще замужем и живет в доме мужа  в районе Яван. Так как Навдагул по характеру упорный и усердный человек, она самостоятельно научилась профессии швеи у своих соседок и теперь собирается начать собственное дело. У нее есть место для шитья и старая швейная машинка, однако машинка очень изношена и причиняет ей много неудобств во время работы. Поэтому Навдагул хотела бы приобрести новую швейную машинку, но для этой цели ее начального капитала не хватает. Навдагул просит Вас о поддержке и будет очень благодарна за оказанную помощь. Ведь открыв свой швейный бизнес, она обеспечит себя работой, а семью дополнительным источником дохода.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: This seamstress is called Navdagul. She is 36 and married and lives in her husband's home in the Yavan district. Since she is a persistent and diligent person, she learned to sew from her neighbours, on her own, and now is planning to start her own business. She has a place to sew in and an old sewing machine; however, her sewing machine is very worn out and causes her a lot of problems while working. Therefore, she would like to buy a new sewing machine, but she doesn't have the money to do so. She is asking you for support and will be very thankful for any help. After all, opening her own sewing business means providing for herself with her work and bringing another source of income to her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a new sewing machine.
TAGS: #Biz Durable Asset, #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite, #Technology, user_favorite, #Fabrics, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
Nora is 43 years old and is married and the mother of four children. She lives in Bunawan, Calamba Misamis Occidental. For the past six years, she has run a general store and she earns a monthly income of 3,000 PHP. Nora’s general store is a great help to her family and helps sustain their day-to-day needs. 

Nora is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan to expand her business and buy more products to sell. In the future, she plans to be more progressive with the help of GDMPC.
LOAN_USE: to purchase merchandise

DESCRIPTION:
Abed is from Iraq. He is 56 years old, married and has three children. Abed is the only provider for the family.

Abed owns a small shop for selling fresh chicken. He established his business in 2000, and now he has an employee. He built a good experience in this field and he is well known in the surrounding area with an excellent reputation.

Abed is requesting a $2,400 loan to renovate his shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his children better living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to renovate his shop

DESCRIPTION:
Samina is a responsible mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 9 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Samina's husband needs to make repairs on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to cover the cost. Therefore Samina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Samina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And her husband can provide better transport services and earn more income. Samina also plans to save some of the profits from her husband's income so they can meet their family's needs in the future.

Samina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Samina is a responsible mother of 1 child. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her husband has been providing transport services by driving a taxi for 9 years. Her husband is responsible for fulfilling the needs of his entire family.

Samina's husband needs to make repairs on his taxi because its current condition is not good. It requires more maintenance on a daily basis. Due to insufficient financial means, her husband is unable to cover the cost. Therefore Samina has applied for a Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

With the help of this loan Samina's husband can afford the maintenance cost easily. And her husband can provide better transport services and earn more income. Samina also plans to save some of the profits from her husband's income so they can meet their family's needs in the future.

Samina is very grateful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to repair her husband's taxi.

DESCRIPTION: Adjowa vit avec son conjoint artiste et leur seul enfant de 18ans à Lomé. Agée de 40ans, elle exerce comme activité la vente des cartes de recharge et des produits d’alimentation générale. Elle s’y plait bien dans l’exercice de son activité car cela lui procure des revenus lui permettant  de prendre soin de sa famille. Vues que les demandes augmentent et n’arrivant plus à satisfaire les besoins de clients, elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour achat des cartes de recharges et des produits d’alimentation générale.  Elle veut ouvrir une boutique car son activité se fait dans une baraque et assurer au mieux aux besoins de sa famille. Elle a une ancienneté de 10ans.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Adjowa lives in Lomé with her husband who is an artist, and their only child, aged 18.  Adjowa is 40 years old and she sells rechargeable phone cards and general food products.  She likes her job because the income it brings allows her to take care of her family.

Faced with an increased demand from her customers, Adjowa can no longer meet their needs.  This is why she is taking this first loan with WAGES and plans to buy rechargeable phone cards and general food products.

Adjowa wants to open a shop, since she currently works in a shed.  She also wants to do her best to meet the needs of her family.  She has ten years of experience in this field.
LOAN_USE: to buy rechargeable phone cards and general food products.

DESCRIPTION: Emmanuel is 30 years old and married to a businesswoman. He has four children aged between 2 and 13; all are enrolled in school. \r\n\r\nHe sells different items such as rice, beans and soaps in the shop that he has been running for the period of seven years. With the loan, he will buy more rice and beans to sell. Emmanuel plans to use the profits for savings, to pay school fees for his children and to provide food for his family.
LOAN_USE: To buy more rice and beans to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Living in a rural area located in the Kampong Trolach district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Phally, 32, is a married mother of one small kid. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and fishing, and they have been in these businesses for almost 10 years.

This is the first loan for Phally with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Phally will use her portion to get a passport for her husband to migrate to work in Malaysia, working in a factory there. She hopes this loan will allow her husband to work in Malaysia successfully so he can earn and help to earn extra income for better supporting the family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Living in a rural area located in the Kampong Trolach district, where crop farming is a common way to make a living, Phally, 32, is a married mother of one small kid. The sources of her family’s income are from rice farming and fishing, and they have been in these businesses for almost 10 years.

This is the first loan for Phally with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. Now leading her group to ask for a loan, Phally will use her portion to get a passport for her husband to migrate to work in Malaysia, working in a factory there. She hopes this loan will allow her husband to work in Malaysia successfully so he can earn and help to earn extra income for better supporting the family.
LOAN_USE: to get a passport for her husband to migrate to work in Malaysia.
TOWN_NAME: Kampong Chhnang Province, Kampong Tralach District

DESCRIPTION:
Firas is a 33-years-old married man who lives with his wife and two adorable kids in a village near Tulkarem, West Bank. He works in farming, which is the family's only source of income. He is an enthusiastic and active man, full of hope and energy. He is a hard worker, serving his family by facing life's challenges.

He turned to Palestine for Credit and Development FATEN to request a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide for his farm. This will enhance his work and improve his family living standards. He thanks all the Kiva lenders for their help in advance.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Firas is a 33-years-old married man who lives with his wife and two adorable kids in a village near Tulkarem, West Bank. He works in farming, which is the family's only source of income. He is an enthusiastic and active man, full of hope and energy. He is a hard worker, serving his family by facing life's challenges.

He turned to Palestine for Credit and Development FATEN to request a loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide for his farm. This will enhance his work and improve his family living standards. He thanks all the Kiva lenders for their help in advance.
LOAN_USE: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticide for his farm.

DESCRIPTION: Annonciate is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of the Twitezimbere Acb Need Photo Group. The group name means “Let us support each other.” Annonciate is a tailor, which she has been doing for 20 years. \r\n\r\nThe group members sell different items in order to have better standards of living. Annonciate will use her portion of the loan to buy another sewing machine to increase her profits. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Annonciate is 46 years old, married, and has two children. She is the leader of the Twitezimbere Acb Need Photo Group. The group name means “Let us support each other.” Annonciate is a tailor, which she has been doing for 20 years. \r\n\r\nThe group members sell different items in order to have better standards of living. Annonciate will use her portion of the loan to buy another sewing machine to increase her profits. The profits from the business will be used to renovate her house.
LOAN_USE: to purchase another sewing machine

DESCRIPTION:
La Señora. María es socia fundadora del banco comunal Feria Libre, es socia desde hace 14 años. Vive por la parroquia de Cumbe en Cuenca, lugar que goza de una accidentada geografía la que le da paisajes hermosos, su gente aun mantienen su cultura y tradiciones de sus padres, se dedican a laborar en la agricultura, crianza de animales y comercio.

Doña María tiene 60 años de edad, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 9 hijos, 8 de ellos son casados y viven independientes, su hijo soltero estudia en un colegio de la localidad. Su esposo labora como jornalero, la casa en la que viven es propia. 

La Señora María tiene un local propio en donde se dedica a la venta de verduras, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años y trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo, en su casa se dedica a la cría de cuyes, gallinas y cerdos, también trabaja en la agricultura y lo que cosecha es para el consumo de su casa y también lo vende. 

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de hortalizas para continuar con su negocio. 

Su meta es seguir creciendo en su negocio.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
María is a founding member of Feria Libre Communal Bank.  She has been a member for 14 years.  She lives in the parish of Cumbe in Cuenca, a place of rugged geography and pretty scenery.  The people there still maintain the culture and traditions of their parents, and they work in agriculture, raising animals, and in business.

María, 60, is married and has conceived nine children, eight of whom are married and live on their own.  Her single son studies in a school in the town.  Her husband works as a day laborer.  The house they live in is their own.

María has her own place where she makes a living selling vegetables.  She has done this work for five years and she works every day without a fixed schedule.  At home she raises guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She also works in agriculture; what she harvests is for home consumption as well as to sell.

She's going to invest her new loan in buying vegetables to continue with her business.

Her goal is to continue growing in her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy vegetables

DESCRIPTION: Raul tiene 62 años de edad es soltero vive solo, después de terminar sus estudios emprendió su negocio de confección de prendas de vestir, puso en marcha este negocio gracias a la experiencia que tenía anteriormente decidió colocar su propio talle, quiere seguir con su negocio pero le hace falta comprar más tela, hilos, encajes, remaches, botones, gracias a su negocio puede cubrir sus propias necesidades, su aspiración es tener una maquina más de confección para mejorar su servicio y a futuro poder tener un ahorro que le permita estar preparado ante cualquier situación.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Raul is 62 years old. He is single and lives alone. After he finished school, he opened his own business making clothing. He started this business and, thanks to the experience that he previously had, he decided to open his own shop.  Raul wants to continue running his business but he needs to buy more fabric, thread, lace, clasps and buttons.  Thanks to his business, Raul is able to cover his own expenses. His aspiration is to have another sewing machine to improve his service and, in the future, be able to save enough money to be prepared for any situation.
LOAN_USE: to buy more fabric, thread, lace, clasps and buttons.

DESCRIPTION:
Achille is a 19-year-old Kepler student in his first year. He was born and raised in a town in a family of five children. Achille is the first person to attend university in his family.

He believes that Kepler provides a higher level of education, so he will be able to develop professionally. He intends to major in logistics and operations.

After graduating, he will be able to support his brothers' and sisters' education. He also wants to create a business in order to provide job opportunities.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Achille is a 19-year-old Kepler student in his first year. He was born and raised in a town in a family of five children. Achille is the first person to attend university in his family.

He believes that Kepler provides a higher level of education, so he will be able to develop professionally. He intends to major in logistics and operations.

After graduating, he will be able to support his brothers' and sisters' education. He also wants to create a business in order to provide job opportunities.
LOAN_USE: to pay for a laptop, required for a US college degree.

DESCRIPTION:
Imran is a 37-year-old man, who has been running a school. There are 93 students enrolled in the school, and 56% are female students. The aim of the school is to provide high quality teaching and better opportunities for underprivileged students to reach their full potential.

He wishes to have a well resourced school. However, lack of funds is the major limitation. He has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase school furniture.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Imran is a 37-year-old man, who has been running a school. There are 93 students enrolled in the school, and 56% are female students. The aim of the school is to provide high quality teaching and better opportunities for underprivileged students to reach their full potential.

He wishes to have a well resourced school. However, lack of funds is the major limitation. He has requested a loan of PKR 60,000 to purchase school furniture.
LOAN_USE: to purchase school furniture.

DESCRIPTION:
Starting a home-based business is within the reach of almost anyone who wants to take a risk and work hard. Violet, 51 years old, is married to a kava farmer. People come and buy kava at a wholesale price from him and resell it at a higher price.

Violet sees that she can start her business by doing the same. She wishes to take a loan of 1000FJD to buy raw kava roots, packaging materials and a scale.

The extra income will contribute to her family's well-being and her church obligations.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Starting a home-based business is within the reach of almost anyone who wants to take a risk and work hard. Violet, 51 years old, is married to a kava farmer. People come and buy kava at a wholesale price from him and resell it at a higher price.

Violet sees that she can start her business by doing the same. She wishes to take a loan of 1000FJD to buy raw kava roots, packaging materials and a scale.

The extra income will contribute to her family's well-being and her church obligations.
LOAN_USE: to buy raw kava roots, a scale and packaging materials.

DESCRIPTION:
This is Guldasta. She is 43 years old. Guldasta lives in the city of Khuroson with her family. She has a small family consisting of her husband and four children. Her eldest daughter is married and works as a teacher. Her youngest son works with livestock breeding.

Despite her age, Guldasta stated breeding livestock about 15 years ago. She manages her work well. She likes breeding livestock and is confident that she can handle this business and become one of the best entrepreneurs in her town.

Guldasta would like to increase the amount of livestock she has and expand her business. She is taking a loan for this reason. Please help Guldasta reach her goal.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This is Guldasta. She is 43 years old. Guldasta lives in the city of Khuroson with her family. She has a small family consisting of her husband and four children. Her eldest daughter is married and works as a teacher. Her youngest son works with livestock breeding.

Despite her age, Guldasta stated breeding livestock about 15 years ago. She manages her work well. She likes breeding livestock and is confident that she can handle this business and become one of the best entrepreneurs in her town.

Guldasta would like to increase the amount of livestock she has and expand her business. She is taking a loan for this reason. Please help Guldasta reach her goal.
LOAN_USE: to buy livestock to increase her animal husbandry business and to improve her family’s living conditions.

DESCRIPTION:
Basma is 21, married, and has 2 children. Her husband installs tile for a very small income, and she wants to start a small business to help him with the income of the family.

So, Basma received coaching from Together Association for Development and Environment (TADE) on raising poultry, feed mixtures, project management, and marketing. She later received a grant to start her project.

Basma is requesting a loan to buy birds, such as chickens, to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Basma is 21, married, and has 2 children. Her husband installs tile for a very small income, and she wants to start a small business to help him with the income of the family.

So, Basma received coaching from Together Association for Development and Environment (TADE) on raising poultry, feed mixtures, project management, and marketing. She later received a grant to start her project.

Basma is requesting a loan to buy birds, such as chickens, to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy birds, such as chickens, to expand her poultry business.

DESCRIPTION: Liezel P. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 33 years old and is married with three school-aged children. Liezel owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Liezel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional fish to sell. Liezel is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and used as working capital. This loan will be her 2nd from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To purchase additional inventory and to use as working capital

DESCRIPTION:
This is Marivic, 37, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ernesto and they have children. She and her husband manage their household while operating the business. They both work hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Marivic operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5-pesos-worth of cooking oil or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP (Philippines pesos) in sales every day.

She is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan to help her continue in the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Marivic dreams to expand her business and hopes to give a good life to her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and this is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.
LOAN_USE: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of eight children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending.

Fe is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials and maintenance for her business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of eight children, Fe works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns income from fish vending.

Fe is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials and maintenance for her business.

Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy fishing materials and maintenance for her business

DESCRIPTION:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86590&_tpos=15&_tpg=2
Juana es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas
Juana es separada, tiene 51 años su hijo está terminando la universidad.
Juana empezó llevando almuerzo a la universidad D. su hijo y sus amigos le  pidieron que también trajeran para ellos, ella empezó a ofrecer al personal administrativo, han pasado los años y ella lleva 80 menús a la universidad , tuvo que alquilar un cuarto cerca a la universidad, para cocinar, cuenta con dos personas que le ayudan. 
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. una parrilla para venta D. anticuchos. 
 DesD. que Juana esta en Finca pudo lograr muchos sueños y adquirir muchas cosas para su casa.
El sueño D. Juana es tener su tienda D. llantas y poner un restaurante.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86590&_tpos=... Juana is a member of the community bank Las Orquídeas (The Orchids). Juana is separated. She is 51 years old. Her son has already finished university. Juana began taking lunch to her son and his friends, who asked her to bring it for them as well. She then began to offer it to the administrative personnel. The years have passed and she has 80 set menus at the university. She has to rent a room close to the university in order to cook, and she has two people who help her. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles for the purchase of a grill so she can sell kebabs. Since Juana has been with Finca she has been able to achieve her dreams and get many more things for her home. Juana’s dream is to have her store on wheels and to put a restaurant on it.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: To buy a grill to make kababs

DESCRIPTION:
Radka and her husband Atanas have a family walnut processing business in the Roma ghetto of Sliven, Bulgaria.  Radka and Atanas have two kids, aged 10 and 14.  Atanas drives all over Bulgaria purchasing walnuts in their shells and brings them back to Sliven.  In the family’s main room, Radka, Atanas, their two sons, and a variety of cousins, aunts and uncles shell the walnuts.  Atanas then takes the nuts to one of several walnut processing companies with whom he works, which then clean and package the nuts and distribute them into grocery markets across Bulgaria.  In a two-week processing period, the family nets 250BGN (160USD).

This loan will play a crucial role in increasing the amount of working capital available to Radka and Atanas.  Currently, they have to wait several weeks to be paid by the large companies after dropping off the shelled nuts.  During this waiting period, they do not have the funds on hand to purchase a new load of walnuts to shell… so they wait instead of work.  With this capital, they’ll be able to dramatically increase the velocity of their business, increasing by 50% – 75% the amount of nuts they can shell in a year.  

Radka is proud of the work ethic their business has instilled in their children, a laudable trait anywhere and one that is worthy of encouragement.  

The Roma, commonly referred to as gypsies, is a severely marginalized social group in the Balkans.
LOAN_USE: Working capital

DESCRIPTION: Шерали проживает в районе Джиликул. Ему 33 года. Он женат. У него четверо детей. Шерали имеет небольшой участок земли, где сеет зерновые культуры. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 17 лет. Целью получения кредита является закуп минеральных удобрений для посева озимой пшеницы.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Sherali lives in the Djilikul area. He is 33 years old, married and has four children. Sherali has a small plot of land where he sows crops. He has been engaged in this kind of activity for 17 years. The purpose of the loan is to purchase fertilizer for the planting of winter wheat.
LOAN_USE: To purchase natural fertilizers

DESCRIPTION:
Saren is 31 years old, and his wife, Navin (pictured), is 29 years old. They live in a village about 28 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have two young sons. 

Saren is a lathe operator, while his wife sells grocery items. He is applying for his first Kiva loan in the amount of $1,300 to purchase two cows to raise. He will get extra income from selling the cows for beef or selling a calf when the cow gives birth to a baby.
LOAN_USE: to buy two cows to raise.

DESCRIPTION: El Banco Comunal Cristo Rey, está formado por 9 emprendedoras que se unieron desde hace tiempo para formar este grupo. Este Banco Comunal, ya son clientes de Fundación León 2000, desde hace mucho tiempo y han demostrado ser personas responsable y con buenos principios y con un record crediticio excelente. Natividad del Socorro tiene 54 años de edad, y se dedica al destace de cerdos en lo cual ya tienen varios clientes que le ofrece, ella actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de cerdos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: The 'Cristo Rey' communal bank consists of 9 entrepreneurs who joined together long ago to form this group. This communal bank has been a customer of Fundación Leon 2000 for many years, and they have proven themselves to be responsible people with good principles, and with an excellent credit record. \r\n\r\nNatividad del Socorro is 54 years old, and is a pig butcher. She already has several customers that she serves, and she is currently seeking a loan to invest in her business and in the purchase of pigs.
LOAN_USE: to purchase pigs
BORROWER_NAMES: Amparo Del Socorro, Tania De La Concepcion, Delbi Maria, Teresa Rosibel, Alicia Del Socorro, Marcia De Fatima, Natividad Del Socorro, ALBA SONIA, Aracelis Del Socorro
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true

DESCRIPTION:
On is 49 years old. She is married and resides with five children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been involved in growing rice and fattening up pigs for more than twenty years, earning approximately $4 per day. Her husband is a tax imposer (one who imposes tax on merchants). He earns about $2 per day.

 In order to improve her family’s finances, On is requesting a loan of $750 to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops. By doing so, she would earn more income to support the family. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business and help her children earn Bachelor’s degrees. Moreover, she hopes to rebuild her present house to make it more comfortable for her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase farmland to use for cultivating agricultural crops.

DESCRIPTION:
Leonisa is 59 years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonisa runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, and other groceries.

Leonisa has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Leonisa would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION:
Elena S. is from the village of Tinabalan, Gingoog City. She is 44 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Elena owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Elena has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month from it.

In 2009, Elena joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elena has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Elena is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Elena from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Amal! She is a 24-year-old married Lebanese woman who is living in a rented apartment in Bekaa area. She runs her rented store where she sells food products. It has been 4 years since she began running her business. She is well-known in the area and is trying her best to be professional by developing her skills.

She is asking for a loan from Ibdaa, a Kiva partner, for the first time. She has requested this loan to buy additional food products to improve her trade and satisfy her clients' needs.

She is an honest person and is doing her best to improve her lifestyle and her quality of life, both socially and financially.

This is a loyal woman who is trying to achieve her dreams and goals. She is ambitious, hardworking, enthusiastic, and humble. She is full of hope, energy, and good manners.

She thanks you for your support!

Meet Amal! She is a 24-year-old married Lebanese woman who is living in a rented apartment in Bekaa area. She runs her rented store where she sells food products. She is asking for a loan from Ibdaa, a Kiva partner, for the first time. She has requested this loan to buy additional food products to improve her trade and satisfy her clients' needs.

She is an honest person and is doing her best to improve her lifestyle and her quality of life, both socially and financially.

This is a loyal woman who is trying to achieve her dreams and goals. She is ambitious, hardworking, enthusiastic, and humble. She is full of hope, energy, and good manners.

She thanks you for your support!

DESCRIPTION: Afi est une femme qui vit  à Tokoin avec deux enfants. Mariée et âgée de 33 ans, elle est une revendeuse de l'eau et de jus qu’elle fait avec soin et s’approvisionne une fois par mois  au marché. Elle revend son produit dans le quartier et demande ce crédit pour commander des sachets de pure water,des sacs de citrons,d'orange et de sucre afin de répondre aux attentes de ses clients.  \n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Afi is a woman who lives in Tokoin with her two children. Married and 33-years-old, she sells water and juices that she makes with care. She buys supplies once a month.

She sells her products in her neighborhood and is requesting this loan to buy bags of purified water, lemons, oranges, and sugar so that she can meet her customers' expectations.
LOAN_USE: to buy 25 bags of purified water, 25 bags of lemons, 5 bags of oranges, and 6 bags of sugar.

DESCRIPTION:
Felisa is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. 

Recently, Felisa requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. 

Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pig for commercial sale and plans to working on swine production for her business expansion. 

Someday Felisa hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Felisa is a strong-willed woman who pushes her ability when it comes to her piggery business. She is a hands-on businesswoman and mother who never gets tired of working to support her family. 

Recently, Felisa requested a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her growing hogs in order to boost her income. 

Aside from her project of building additional pig pens, she has thought of adding heads of pig for commercial sale and plans to working on swine production for her business expansion. 

Someday Felisa hopes to open a meatshop in a nearby town.

DESCRIPTION:
Salvacion is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Salvacion has a business selling snack foods in the Philippines. Salvacion requested a 15,000 Philippine Peso (PHP) loan amount through NWTF to purchase more snack foods to sell.

Salvacion has been in this business for six years. In the future, Salvacion would like to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more snack foods to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Cathyrine is 36 years old, married and has two children.

Cathyrine is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cathyrine requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Cathyrine has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cathyrine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cathyrine is 36 years old, married and has two children.

Cathyrine is in the pig fattening business in the Philippines. Cathyrine requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase sacks of feeds, vitamins, vaccine and other supplies needed to raise her pigs.

Cathyrine has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Cathyrine would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

DESCRIPTION:
Mwanamisi is a married woman who lives at a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past year, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality and high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 15,000 she wants to purchase one bundle of green vegetables, sacks of ground nuts and potatoes. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: To purchase a bundle of green vegetables, sacks of ground nuts and potatoes.

DESCRIPTION: EL HADJI est un homme marié et père de famille  qui évolue dans la commercialisation des denrées alimentaires et de l’aliment de bétail.il détient une boutique mais la vente de foin(aliment de bétail) est très prisée après l'hivernage. Etant à son 11ème prêt, il sollicite ce crédit pour acheter du foin et des denrées alimentaires comme le riz, le sucre, l’huile et le lait pour ensuite les revendre. Il a comme charges particulières toutes les dépenses quotidiennes de sa famille. Il commence sa journée à 7h pour la terminer à 22h. Avec ce crédit il pourra diversifier et épargner de l’argent. A l’avenir il voudra   avoir d’autres boutiques d’alimentation générale. Ainsi il pourra augmenter ses revenus et améliorer les conditions de vie sa famille.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Hadji is a married man and father of a family who is developing the marketing of groceries and animal feed.  He has a shop, but the sale of hay (animal feed) is highly valued after winter. He is on his 11th loan and he is requesting this credit to buy hay and groceries such as rice, sugar, oil and milk to sell them on.  \r\n\r\nHe has to meet all the daily expenses of his family.  He starts his day at 0700 and finishes at 2200.  With this loan he will be able to diversify and save some money.  In the future, he would like to have more general food stores.  He will then be able to grow his income and improve his family's living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to buy livestock feed and groceries to resell

DESCRIPTION:
Janeth is 48 years old and married to a carpenter. They're blessed with five children.

She has owned and operated a retail store in their village for almost 10 years and earns a net income of 250 PHP daily. Her net income from this business was spent on the school allowances of their one daughter who is still studying. Due to insufficient capital, she would like to access a loan amounting to 15,000 PHP to purchase food ingredients, canned goods, eggs, beverages, coffee, milk, and sugar to sell.

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Janeth is 48 years old and married to a carpenter. They're blessed with five children.

She's hoping that her business will continue to improve and become more profitable.

DESCRIPTION: Pauline is 47 years old. She is married with six children. She has had a tea, milk and maize business for 31 years. She will be using the loan to stock more maize and buy milk for sell and hopes this will help her pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are have good and happy family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Pauline is 47 years old. She is married with six children. She has had a tea, milk and maize business for 31 years. She will be using the loan to stock more maize and buy milk for sell and hopes this will help her pay school fees for her children. Her hopes and dreams for the future are have good and happy family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase green tea leaves to sell to the factory.

DESCRIPTION: Issa is a talented man from Ramallah city. He is a father of one daughter (Luna) and one son (Awni). Issa is an employee of Al-Ayyam daily newspaper. \r\n\r\nIssa makes wallpaper out of children's cartoons as shown in the picture here. He makes the wallpaper to order for families. Issa wants to increase production to meet demand. He took out a loan from FATEN to purchase a larger amounts of materials needed to execute his work.
LOAN_USE: to buy raw materials to produce more art work.

DESCRIPTION:
Winnie is a 38-year-old lady, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2017 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

She does maize farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy seeds. She hopes this will increase her production, hence increasing her income. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Winnie is a 38-year-old lady, married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2017 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training.

She does maize farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy seeds. She hopes this will increase her production, hence increasing her income. She will use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.
LOAN_USE: to buy seeds for increased production.

DESCRIPTION:
Jessie is 67 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school, Jessie works very hard to provide for them.

Jessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, spices, coffee, bread and other snack foods.

Jessie has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future Jessie would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jessie is 67 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school, Jessie works very hard to provide for them.

Jessie runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, drinks, spices, coffee, bread and other snack foods.
