DESCRIPTION:
Nhàn is 36 years old and she is married with two children.

Nhàn lives in Nong Cong, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling\xa0snacks for more than ten years. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, this job is unstable. She does not have enough money to keep sending children to school.

The main hardship that she faces is lack of money to continue sending her children to school, so she is requesting a loan to purchase books, school supplies and a bicycle and pay school fees for her children.

In 2010, Nhàn joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Nhàn has successfully repaid five loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profits, Nhàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

Nhàn lives in Nong Cong, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling\xa0snacks for more than ten years. Her family is a low-income household in village; moreover, this job is unstable. She does not have enough money to keep sending children to school.

The main hardship that she faces is lack of money to continue sending her children to school, so she is requesting a loan to purchase books, school supplies and a bicycle and pay school fees for her children.

With her business profits, Nhàn hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her children to do well in school, and for her business to do well.
LOAN_USE: to purchase books, school supplies and a bicycle and pay school fees for her children.

DESCRIPTION:
Thành has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Thành is 34 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Thành has been involved in her business for two years. The main hardship that Thành faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In 2013, Thành joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now the group leader of the 05 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In the future, Thành hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Thành has a retail business selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business.

Thành is 34 years old and is married with two children. She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, an urban area in Thanh Hoa province. Thành has been involved in her business for two years. The main hardship that Thành faces in her business is a lack of capital.

In 2013, Thành joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to improve her business. She has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She is now the group leader of the 05 Đông Sơn solidarity group, which consists of three members. 

In the future, Thành hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more clothes to resell.

DESCRIPTION:
María, vive con sus dos hijos y su esposo, ambos trabajan, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas los fines de semana junto a su madre, este negocio lo realiza sábados y domingos, tiene ocho años de experiencia. 
Ella solicita un préstamo para invertirlo en los materiales que son necesarios para la producción de las pupusas como chicharrón, aceite, quesillo, maíz, condimentos, entre otros que le ayudaran a mejorar la capacidad del negocio, con este préstamo lograra mejorar el servicio a los clientes.
La aspiración de María es poder crecer en el negocio a través del uso de los préstamos, ser buen cliente para poder lograr su desarrollo comercial con este servicio de financiamiento.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: María lives with her husband and two children.  Both she and her husband work. María's business is selling pupusas on a weekend together with her mother.  She works Saturdays and Sundays and has eight years experience.  She is requesting a loan to invest in the materials she needs for making her pupusas such as 'chicharrón' (cooked pork), oil, 'quesillo' (soft cheese), corn, seasonings and other products which will help her to improve the capacity of her business.  This loan will enable her to provide her customers with a better service.\r\n\r\nMaría's goals are to grow in her business by using loans and to be a good client so that she can develop her business through this loan service.
LOAN_USE: to buy cooked pork, oil, soft cheese, corn and seasonings

DESCRIPTION:
Ma. Elvie, a 33-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Ma. Elvie has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ma. Elvie, a 33-year-old married mother of one, works hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippines for four years and also earns an income from charcoal retailing.

Ma. Elvie has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Melodia is 33 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melodia has a business buying and selling oysters in the Philippines. Melodia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

Melodia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Melodia would like to save enough money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Melodia is 33 years old, married with one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Melodia has a business buying and selling oysters in the Philippines. Melodia requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

Melodia has been in this business for five years. In the future, Melodia would like to save enough money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more oysters to sell to customers.

DESCRIPTION:
Ilia is 38 years old. He lives in the Tetritskaro district with his mother, who is provided with a retirement pension. Ilia requested loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have pigs and sell piglets locally. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the 'subsistence poor' category. 

Ilia requested a loan from Credo to start a family business. Ilia has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high risk borrowers because of their low income. 

With his credit, Ilia will open a bakery. He will purchase a kneader for dough and all the needed equipment for starting bakery. This will increase the income of the family. Part of the income will be reinvested in the same business, and with another part he will provide better living conditions for his family.
LOAN_USE: to start a bakery and purchase a kneader for dough.

DESCRIPTION:
Carmelita is 56 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmelita has been in the pig fattening business for seven years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Carmelita is 56 years old and married with five children. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Carmelita requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Carmelita has been in the pig fattening business for seven years now and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Catalina T. dedicates herself to the business of selling all types of home decor and personal items, such as invitations for birthdays and other activities. Her business began twelve years ago with her traveling to sell her items, but after rebuilding her house, she established her business in the location its current locale.

She is a single mother taking care of her one son who fights to bring him education and a dignified roof over his head. The need Mrs. Catalina is going through is that, due to her economic situation, she has requested credits from CEPRODEL to improve her business. She currently has a total of 7 credits that she has used for the purchase of more products so that she can support her young son.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Catalina T. es una dama que se dedica al negocio de la venta de todo tipo de productos decorativos de casa y personales como tarjetas para invitaciones de cumpleaños y otras actividades. Su negocio nace desde hace 12 años ambulantemente pero al reconstruir su casa de habitación establece su negocio en este local donde se encuentra actualmente.

Es madre soltera y con un hijo a su cargo quien lucha por brindarle educaron y un techo digno. Una necesidad que atraviesa la señora Catalina es que debido a su situación económica ha solicitado créditos en Ceprodel para mejorar su negocio. Actualmente tiene un total de 7 créditos que los ha utilizado par la compra de los productos y así mantener a su pequeño hijo.
LOAN_USE: Compra de sus productos personales decorativos\r\nPurchase of personal and decorative products

DESCRIPTION:
Fati F. is thirty seven years old.  She is married and has given birth to three children – two girls and a boy.  She says that currently, all of her children are in the basic school.  

She lives with her family in a rented apartment at Offinso in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  Offinso is a farming and commercial town.  The majority of the inhabitants are either farmers or trade in farm produce.  Few dwellers of Offinso are in an official occupation. 

Fati trades in maize.  She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages.  She distributes to food vendors in her community and those who come from the cities to buy in the local market where she sells.  Fati has been in business for over seventeen years. 

She wants a loan to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to more customers and increase her profit margin.  She aspires to improve upon the standard of living of the family.  It is also Fati’s desire to help her children climb the academic ladder to higher levels.
LOAN_USE: To buy maize in bulk

DESCRIPTION: Marcelina tiene 56 años, es divorciada y madre de 3 hijos que viven junto a ella en su vivienda hecha a base de madera. Marcelina se dedica a la venta de frutas. Todas las mañanas y desde muy temprano apertura su negocio que esta ubicado en el terminal terrestre de su localidad teniendo como principales consumidores a viajeros y conductores que acostumbran a llevar consigo una buena variedad frutas locales como naranjas, plátanos, papayas; entre otros. Suele contar co el apoyo de sus hijos quienes la reemplazan en ocasiones y apoyan en otras tareas. Le agrada mantener su puesto con frutas variadas que es traído por los mismos agricultores hasta su puesto ofreciéndolo a buen precio y con una calidad optima. Es el primer préstamo que solicita a Kiva y espera contar con la confianza necesaria para seguir con su negocio. Desea en esta ocasión solicitar 1,000 nuevos soles para usarlos como capital en la compra de frutas la por mayor como naranjas y mandarinas de temporada y mantener su negocio bien abastecido.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marcelina is 56 years old. She is divorced and is the mother of 3 children who live with her in her house made out of wood. Marcelina sells fruit. Every morning, very early, she opens her business which is located in the bus station of her area. Her customers are mainly passengers and drivers who normally take away a good variety of local fruits with them like oranges, bananas, papayas, etc. She usually has the help of her children who stand in for her at times and help her with other tasks. She is happy to have her stand filled with a variety of fruits which are brought by the growers themselves to her stand and sold at a good price and top quality.

This is the first loan Marcelina has requested from Kiva and she hopes to have the necessary confidence to carry on with her business. At this time she is requesting 1,000 PEN to use as capital to buy fruit wholesale like oranges and mandarins while they are in season and keep her business well stocked.
LOAN_USE: to buy fruit wholesale.

DESCRIPTION:
Ngan, 27, is single and lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh. She earns money by running a general store in front of her house.

Ngan is applying for a new loan through CEP, this one for 15,000,000 VND, to buy a range of new products such as food and beverages to restock her shop. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She feels this loan will help her to continue bettering her ability to meet the needs of her customers.

Ngan hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing sales and the size of her store and will also help her to improve her living conditions.
LOAN_USE: To buy food and beverages to stock her store.

DESCRIPTION:
Feliciana is 57 years old, married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Feliciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Feliciana is 57 years old, married and has five children.

She is in the agricultural business of raising livestock in the Philippines. Feliciana requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Feliciana has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Doña María Amparo tiene 45 años de edad, es madre de familia de 1 hijo el cual vive en su casa de habitación  junto a su esposo. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completado cursado hasta el 6 grado gracias al apoyo por parte de sus padres y al esfuerzo que ellos pusieron para que ella estudiara. Ella se dedica al cultivo de café hace más de 10 años actividad inculcada por sus padres ya que es una actividad practicada por su familia por muchos años y generaciones. Ella se traslada en compañía de su esposo y su hijo hasta el lugar donde están sus cultivos diariamente para dar asistencia técnica y evitar que sean dañados por la roya o por bichos. 

Ella solicita ayuda para comprar insumos y dar mantenimiento a sus cultivos los cuales necesitan de limpieza, fertilización y abonarlos para cuidar la planta en su totalidad y el grano. 

Las metas es poder fertilizar y mantener sus cultivos como hasta hoy en día para obtener una cosecha de calidad y segura. Sus sueños como madre son los de seguir apoyando a su hijo para que el logre seguir estudiando y pueda graduarse a nivel universitario.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Doña María Amparo is 45 years old and the mother of one child. She lives with her husband and son in a house of their own. María Amparo completed her primary school education through the sixth grade, thanks in part to the support of her parents and also to the effort she put into her studies. She has been growing coffee for more than 10 years. María Amparo learned this business from her parents since her family has done this for many years and over several generations. She travels every day with her husband and son to the place where their crops are located. They must maintain the crops in order to prevent damage caused by diseases and pests.

María Amparo is requesting assistance so that she can buy supplies for maintaining her crops. She needs to weed, fertilize, and feed the coffee plants, which will provide total care for producing coffee beans. Her goal is to fertilize and maintain her crops in the same manner that she has always done to this point. This will help her achieve a secure and quality harvest.

Her dreams as a mother are to support her son as he continues his studies and to see him graduate to the university level.
LOAN_USE: to buy farming supplies for her coffee crops.

DESCRIPTION: Héctor es un joven emprendedor de 25 años, comerciante, tiene su propio negocio en el que oferta variedad de productos (accesorios de teléfonos celular, gorras, juguetes, cojines, etc.) desde hace siete años, inicio brindando servicio de barbería y con sus ahorros logro establecer su negocio el que posee un buen inventario, es un joven muy esforzado. Solicita un crédito en FUNDENUSE para invertirlo en capital de trabajo ya que requiere comprar variedad de artículos para ofrecer mayor demanda de los productos que vende. Tiene como planes futuros mejorar su vivienda para darle mayor seguridad a su casa y al negocio.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Héctor, age 25, is a young entrepreneur. He is a merchant, and he has his own business selling a variety of products (cell phone accessories, toys, caps, and cushions, etc.). He has been doing this for seven years. He started by providing barber service, and with his savings he managed to establish his business in which he has a good inventory. He is a very hardworking young man.

He is requesting a loan from FUNDENUSE in order to have working capital. He needs to buy a variety of items to have a greater demand for the products that he sells. His future plans are to improve his house in order to make the house and the business safer.
LOAN_USE: to buy cell phone accessories, toys, caps, and cushions, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Divorciada e mãe de 5 filhos 1 ainda frequenta Escola, vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta sua irmã que vive com ela.	
É comerciante vende roupa diversa, com o presente empréstimo pretende comprar fardos de roupa (cortinas, mantas, duvetes e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria.
No futuro deseja mobilar a sua casa e oferecer mais conforto a sua família, para tal compromete-se a pagar devidamente o empréstimo para solicitar mais a Hluvuku. 
O desafio é construir um estabelecimento comercial e aumentar a sua mercadoria para responder a demanda da sua clientela.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Reselia is divorced and the mother of 5 children, 1 of whom still goes to School. She lives in her own house with her family and supports her sister who lives with her.

She is a trader selling various types of clothing and with this loan she plans to buy bundles of clothing (curtains, blankets, duvets and others) to increase the quantity of her merchandise.

In future she would like to furnish her house and offer her family more comfort, to which end she commits to duly paying off her loan in order to solicit further loans from Hluvuku.

Her challenge is to build a commercial establishment and increase her stock so that she can keep up with the demand of her clientele.
LOAN_USE: buy bundles of clothing (curtains, blankets, duvets and others) to increase the quantity of her merchandise

DESCRIPTION:
Mari's Group es una sociedad de mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras que desean mejorar su calidad de vida, en esta sociedad María es la presidenta ya que es una mujer alegre, responsable y trabajadora. María tiene 38 años, es soltera y tiene dos hijos, vive en Otavalo en la provincia de Imbabura al Norte de Ecuador.

María tiene un local de comidas, negocio que le ayuda a mantener y dar el estudio a sus dos hijos ya que es el único ingreso económico de su familia. Es el primer crédito que solicita a Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de un horno para asar pollos ya que quiere innovar y variar las comidas en su negocio, esta inversión ayudará a que gane más clientela y así incrementar sus ventas e ingresos.

Su sueño es que su negocio sea más grande y mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mari’s Group is a society of women workers and entrepreneurs who want to improve their quality of life. 

María is 38 years old. She is single and has two children. She lives in Otavalo in the province of Imbabur in northern of Ecuador.

María  has a food stand. Her business helps her to support and pay for the studies of her two children and is the only source of income for her family. This is the first loan that she has asked for through Fodemi. She is going to use the money to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food in her business. The money from the loan would help her to win more customers, increasing her sales and profits.

Her dream is that her business grows and she wants to have a better quality of life for her and her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy an oven to cook chickens as she wants to innovate and vary the food

DESCRIPTION: Ernest is 33 years old, married and has two children. He has been in the welding business for the past four years and earns a monthly income of KES. 7,000. He is requesting his first loan, for KES. 20,000, from KADET LTD. He plans to use this loan to buy welding metals and a welding machine. He will use the profits he expects to earn to repay this loan and improve his business. His dream for the future is to manage his business so well that he can ensure good profits.
LOAN_USE: to buy metals and a welding machine for his business.

DESCRIPTION:
Luisa is a 43-year-old woman who is married with six children and lives in a rural community outside Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She runs a clothing sales business selling secondhand clothing in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Luisa has requested a loan to pay for additional bales of mixed secondhand clothing to increase her stock to meet her customer demands and assist her in running her business.

She hopes to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses and pay for her children's school fees.

She became a member of SPBD in 2016 to gain access to financial services for her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Luisa is a 43-year-old woman who is married with six children and lives in a rural community outside Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands.

She runs a clothing sales business selling secondhand clothing in her community to earn a living. She has been doing this for one year.

Luisa has requested a loan to pay for additional bales of mixed secondhand clothing to increase her stock to meet her customer demands and assist her in running her business.

She hopes to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses and pay for her children's school fees.

She became a member of SPBD in 2016 to gain access to financial services for her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy bales of mixed secondhand clothing for her clothing sales business.

DESCRIPTION:
Hafisa is 21 years old and lives in the town of Lugazi in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past one year, Hafisa has been working hard to manage her clothes store, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Hafisa has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more clothes for selling, and will help Hafisa to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Hafisa hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her clothes business into a wholesale shop. 

Hafisa is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more clothes for selling.

DESCRIPTION:
Marina tiene 31 años de edad, está acompañada y su pareja de dedica a la agricultura y pesca artesanal. Tienen 3 hijos y dos de ellos estudian en la escuela.

Marina se dedica a la agricultura con su esposo. Además cuida ganado y vende mariscos. Otra de sus fuentes de ingresos es una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad.

Gracias el préstamo anterior que recibió de Kiva, Marina fue capaz de surtir su tienda, logrando así mejorar su vida y logró pagar con éxito la deuda. Ahora necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar 3 terneras para la crianza.

Su sueño más grande es brindar estudios a sus hijos para que tengan una carrera universitaria ya que ella no pudo lograrlo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marina is 31 years old and in a relationship. Her partner works in agriculture and as a small-time fisherman. They have three children, two of whom are in school.

Marina works in agriculture alongside her husband. In addition, she raises livestock and sells seafood. Another source of income is a store where she sells basic necessity products.

Thanks to the previous loan she received from Kiva, Marina was able to restock her store. She was able to improve her life and successfully repaid her debt. At the moment, she needs a new loan in order to buy three calves to raise.

Her greatest wish is to provide an education for her children so that the can achieve a university degree, something that she does not have.
LOAN_USE: to buy three calves to raise.

DESCRIPTION: Sanjragchaa is 66 years old and lives his wife in an apartment in Tosontsengel province of Mongolia. His wife sews and makes clothes. He is retired and in pension at the moment. His family started a tailoring business in 2002. He supports his wife in every aspect that is related to the family business. His family is planning to expand their business operation and build a house. He is a diligent and hard working man who says "With the bank loan, I want to develop and improve my business to a certain degree. I and my wife are planning to open a tailoring house in our hometown." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase sewing materials for their business and to complete the construction of a new house. \t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\r\n
LOAN_USE: To purchase sewing materials

DESCRIPTION:
Rodelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodelina is 56 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Rodelina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Rodelina requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetable to sell.

Rodelina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rodelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rodelina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rodelina is 56 years old and all four of her children are in school.

Rodelina has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Rodelina requested a 8,000 PHP loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of vegetable to sell.

Rodelina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Rodelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy a variety of vegetables to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Jenefer works hard to support two children. She is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Jenefer requested a 7,400 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Jenefer is aware that, by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks and hazards to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jenefer works hard to support two children. She is single and has a general store in the Philippines.

Jenefer requested a 7,400 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Jenefer is aware that, by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health risks and hazards to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION: Мунарбу, 59 лет, замужем, есть 2 сына. У неё среднее образование, по характеру она трудолюбивая, целеустремленная и предприимчивая. Она хорошо знает технологию ведения сельскохозяйственной деятельности и умеет вкладывать средства по назначению. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством с 1995 года. Благодаря своему упорному труду и ответственному подходу к делу, она смогла развить свое хозяйство до 15 коров и 15 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Мунарбу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 200,000 сом (KGS) на покупку нетелей, с целью увеличения продаж экологически чистого молока и доходов от разведения скота. Доходы от кредита Мунарбу планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего хозяйства.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Munarbu is 59 and married with two sons. She has a high school education and is a hardworking, purposeful and entrepreneurial person. She has been working in animal husbandry since 1995 as the primary source of income for her family. She has a good understanding of the technical aspects of running an agricultural business and knows how to manage a budget. Thanks to her hard work and responsible approach to her tasks, she has been able to develop her farm to having 15 cows and 15 sheep.

With the goal of further developing her farm, Munarbu has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 200,000 KGS to buy heifers to increase her sales of organic milk and her income from raising livestock. She plans to put income from the loan toward further developing her farm.
LOAN_USE: to buy heifers  to increase her headcount of cattle and sales of organic milk.

DESCRIPTION:
Francis, pictured above, has been a farmer for 6 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Teso District. He is 61 years old, is married and has 8 children.

Francis likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Francis plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Francis’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Francis, pictured above, has been a farmer for 6 years, and is now proud to represent his group of 16 farmers in Teso District. He is 61 years old, is married and has 8 children.

Francis likes to think of himself as a very friendly person. He has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2013 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to be more active in his community. He says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that he has been able to consistently feed his family. Francis plans to use the profits from this coming season to send his children to school.

In total, Francis’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8.5 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of 8 solar lights.
LOAN_USE: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers to improve harvests of maize.\t\t\t\t
BORROWER_NAMES: Linda A, Agneta, Jesca, Josephine, Edwin, Concephtah, Joylyne, Consolata, Francis, Florence, Rebecca, Eluid, Annah, Florence, Elizabeth, Felix N
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female, male, female, female, male, female, female, female, male

DESCRIPTION: Jose es un hombre trabajador de 25 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en la localidad de Chala que esta ubicado en Arequipa. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte urbano, actividad que realiza desde la mototaxi que logro alquilar, pero necesita mejorar su trabajo por eso solicita el microcrédito para poder comprar una mototaxi para contar con su propia herramienta de trabajo aumentando sus ingresos. Jose espera en un futuro mejorar su casa para que su familia pueda vivir cómodamente y seguir contando con bienestar.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jose is a hard-working, 25-year-old man. He lives with his parents in a town called Chala, which is located in Arequipa. He makes a living providing urban transportation services. Jose does this using a mototaxi he was able to rent, but needs to improve his business. Therefore, Jose is requesting a microloan to buy a mototaxi, in order to own his own business equipment and increase his income.

In the future, Jose hopes to improve his house so that his family can live comfortably and maintain their well-being.
LOAN_USE: to buy a mototaxi, so the Borrower can own his own business equipment and increase his income.
TAGS: #Supporting Family, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset, #Single, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
En el municipio de Somotillo de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ernestina M. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio con el propósito de llevar a cabo la remodelación de su vivienda por la cual requiere de los materiales de construcción para así realizar su tarea y seguir adelante en el negocio.

Con gran esfuerzo ha logrado salir adelante y hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de los materiales ya que requiere mejorara sus condiciones y brindarle un techo digno a sus tres pequeños hijos. Con este crédito logrará continuar con la obra ya que iniciará con la puesta del techo de la vivienda y así continuará poco a poco hasta finalizar.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hailing from Chinandega, Somotillo, Ernestina Martinez is a hard-working woman who is very interested in improving the lives of her children and the success of her business by remodeling the home out of which she runs her store. It is only with great effort that she has been able to get to where she currently is, and today she is coming to Ceprodel in search of a loan to cover the cost of the materials necessary to put a roof on her house, an improvement that she believes will push her business forward and finally allow her to offer a fitting home to her three young children.

Translated from Spanish by Cyrus Maher, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Purchase of construction materials

DESCRIPTION:
Samuel K. is 32 years old and is single. He is an entrepreneur who lives in the Northern Province of Rwanda where he has a photo-studio and a cafeteria plus movies to rent. His business is open from 5 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day and he has operated his business successfully for several years.

Samuel is requesting his first loan from Vision Finance Company in order to expand his business through purchasing some new computers and other new accessories to attract more customers to his business.

Through accessing this loan, Samuel hopes to earn more profit, which will help him to set aside money to buy his own house.
LOAN_USE: To buy additional computers and equipment

DESCRIPTION: Mariam is a married woman. She has 3 children with ages ranging from 2 to 5 years. She describes herself to be customer friendly and understanding. Previously, she was involved in tailoring activities. She operates a retail store where she sells juice. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located within a busy market and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low purchasing power during cold seasons. She will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy fruits for blending juice to sell. Mariam's dream and business goal is to be a supplier of juice to institutions like schools.
LOAN_USE: to buy fruits for blending juice to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Edith works hard to support her family. Edith is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

Edith requested a PHP 10,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

Edith has been in this business for 20 years now. In the future, Edith would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional boxes of fish to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Lucia M. is currently in the business of selling charcoal and is requesting a loan to open a shop. Lucia is 35 years old and is married with a husband who is a chief. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, Lucia M. hopes to be able to employ some workers in the charcoal-burning industry. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.
LOAN_USE: To open a shop

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Thu has a retail business selling cattle feed. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed to resell.

Thu is 50 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thu is the group leader of the 030917030004.thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thu has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mrs. Thu has a retail business selling cattle feed. She is requesting a loan to purchase cattle feed to resell.

Thu is 50 years old and she is married with three children. She lives and works in Thieu Hoa district, a rural area in Thanh Hoa province.

Thu is the group leader of the 030917030004.thiệu Dương solidarity group, which consists of four members. In 2009, Thu joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Thu has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Thu has been involved in this business for six years. The main hardship that Thu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Thu hopes for her business to do well, for her children to find a good job, and for her family to be healthy and happy.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more cattle feed to resell

DESCRIPTION:
Susanita is 55 years old and a married woman with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

Susanita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Susanita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

In the future, Susanita would like to save enough money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Susanita is 55 years old and a married woman with six children. Two of her children are in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.   

Susanita has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years. Susanita requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

In the future, Susanita would like to save enough money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more clothing to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Joseph is married and blessed with children. He joined Hand in Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2018 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training. He is a dairy farmer. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed. He hopes this will increase his production hence increasing his income. He will, therefore, use the anticipated income to provide food and clothing for his family. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Joseph is married and blessed with children. He joined Hand in Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2018 and has benefited from enterprise development and financial management training. He is a dairy farmer. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy dairy feed. He hopes this will increase his production hence increasing his income. He will, therefore, use the anticipated income to provide food and clothing for his family. He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support and promises to repay promptly.
LOAN_USE: to buy dairy feed.

DESCRIPTION:
Wisdel est le coordinateur de son groupe Christophiens. Il est mariée et elle a deux enfants. Il habite dans la region nord est d`Haïti ou de électricité est rare et de Léau portable est très limité. Il dirige son commerce de vente de sandales pendants les 10 derniers années.

Avant de ce commercer ce commerce Il était une étudiant. Il espère que cet emprunt l’aidera à grandir son commerce. Des autres membres de Chrisophiens ont besoin d’un emprunt pour le commerce telque ventes produits cosmétiques boissons gazeuses etc. 

Il dit que son défit principal est de devenir une plus grande commerçante. Il dit son but principal c’est d’avoir un plus grande commerce qui lui facilitera à construire une plus grande maison avec prêt de Esperanza Int.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Wisdel is the coordinator of Les Christophiens Group. He's married and has two children. He lives in northeastern Haïti, were electricity is scarce and drinking water supply is very limited.

He's been running his sandal retail business for the last ten years. Before starting it, he was a student. He hopes that this loan will help him expand his business.

Other members of the group need a loan for their retail businesses (cosmetics, beverages, etc).

Wisdel says that his main challenge is to become a bigger reseller, and that his main goal is to have a larger business, which will make it easier for him to build a larger home thanks to this loan from Kiva's partner, Esperanza International.
LOAN_USE: to buy sandals

DESCRIPTION:
Haydee R. is a young mother who aims to become successful someday by developing her fishing business. Her husband works as a fisherman. They work together for the future of their family. Since joining ASHI, Haydee has been improving her quality of life. With the additional income from her business, Haydee has funded the education of her children. Haydee believes sending her kids to school will set them up for continued success in their college studies and future careers.

She has used her Kiva loan to purchase fishing materials needed of her business. With the profits from her business venture, Haydee has been encouraged to continued her fishing operation. She has also used her profits to help other relatives from her community and neighborhood. 

She expresses her deepest and sincerest gratitude to ASHI and Kiva lenders for the support of her business venture, the education of her children, and supporting members of her community.

At 34-years-old Haydee is determined to work hard and achieve continued success with her business ventures. Haydee thanks you in advance for funding her loan as it has helped her family greatly.
LOAN_USE: To purchase fishing materials needed of her business.

DESCRIPTION: Mr. Vandan is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their Ger, a nomadic yurt, in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Vandan's wife has run a small retail clothing business in the local market for several years. His daughters attend local public schools. Vandan works at a local company as a doorman.\n\nVandan's wife is providing affordable yet fashionable clothes to local residents in her rental stall at the local market. She purchases inventory from Erlian, China, once or twice a month. Mr.Vandan is now requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase more clothing inventory to increase his wife's clothes retail business's turnover and sales. She is to provide qualified and affordable clothing to local residents and expand her business further to support her children's education. Vandan's family is happy and supportive of their mother and wife in running their family business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mr. Vandan is 38 years old and lives with his wife and three children in their Ger, a nomadic yurt, in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Vandan's wife has run a small retail clothing business in the local market for several years. His daughters attend local public schools. She is to provide qualified and affordable clothing to local residents and expand her business further to support her children's education. Vandan's family is happy and supportive of their mother and wife in running their family business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more clothing inventory

DESCRIPTION: Jose Miguel de 35 años de edad es casado, tiene 3 niños, el mayor Willi de 16 años estudia la secundaria, y los menores de 8 y 6 años estudian la primaria, su esposa Fanny trabaja como vendedora en la tienda Novia Linda para obtener ingresos adicionales que le permitan apoyar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.  En su familia el es conocido por Miguel, y trabaja como carpintero de su propio taller ubicado en su casa desde hace mas de 20 años, en donde elabora muebles de todo tipo.  Esta solicitando su 1er credito a esta institucion para mejorar la vivienda en que vive levantando 3 paredes, pues actualmente habitan en un pequeño cuarto de madera, por lo que solicita el apoyo de Kiva para bridarle a su familia mayor seguridad y comodidad.  El mayor sueño que tiene es que sus hijos estudien y sean hombres de bien y poder brindarles las condiciones de vida que se merecen.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jose Miguel is 35 years old, and is married with 3 children. The oldest, Willi, is 16 years old and studies at secondary school. The younger ones, 8 and 6, study at primary school. Jose Miguel's wife Fanny works as a sales assistant in the shop Novia Linda to obtain additional earnings which permit her to support her husband with the household costs. In his family he is known as Miguel, and has worked for over 20 years as a carpenter in his own workshop located in his house, where he makes all type of furniture. He is seeking his first loan from this institution to improve his home, constructing 3 walls. He actually lives in a small wooden room, for which he is seeking Kiva's support to give his family better security and comfort. Jose's biggest dream is that his children study and be good men, and that he can grant them the standard of living that they deserve. \r\n\r\n

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Build 3 concrete walls

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of one child, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell in the market.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of one child, Mary Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending.  Mary Jane is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell in the market.

Mary Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more boxes of dried fish to sell in the market

DESCRIPTION:
Rose is 43 years old and is married with three children. She lives in a rural area in Honiara, the capital city of Solomon Island.

She owns and operates a general store, selling items such as eggs, sausages, noodles, canned foods, biscuits, snacks and cigarettes, she also provides cash power which consist of electricity prepayment services and phone recharge services. She has been doing this for one year.

Rose needs a loan to buy for cigarettes, sausages, eggs, cash power recharge and telekom phone recharges to increase her stock to assist her in maintaining her business.

She plans to use her profits to help cover up her family's weekly expenses and pay for her children's school fees.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2015.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rose is 43 years old and is married with three children. She lives in a rural area in Honiara, the capital city of Solomon Island.

She owns and operates a general store, selling items such as eggs, sausages, noodles, canned foods, biscuits, snacks and cigarettes, she also provides cash power which consist of electricity prepayment services and phone recharge services. She has been doing this for one year.

She plans to use her profits to help cover up her family's weekly expenses and pay for her children's school fees.

She has been a member of SPBD since 2015.
LOAN_USE: to buy cigarettes, sausages, eggs, cash power recharge and telekom phone recharges for her business.

DESCRIPTION: Efua O. sells cooking utensils, tomatoes and children’s wear at Abura.  Efua has received education up to a Junior High School level. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a farmer. She assists her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Her loan will be used to buy more clothing to sell in order to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.\r\nOn the table in front of her in the picture are a little of everything that she trades in for display.
LOAN_USE: To buy more clothing to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Hi, I’m David Pastran, Owner of River City Upholstery LLC in Chester, VA. Upholstery is a longstanding family tradition and personal dream of mine. My family owned an upholstery business in El Salvador for 20 years before the breakout of the Civil War forced us to relocate in 1980. Together, we endured a treacherous trip across Mexico into to the United States under refugee status. There, I was raised in Long Island, NY until I was 12, before we moved to Virginia.

At 20, I joined the United States Marine Corps as a food subsistence specialist and proudly served my country for eight years. Doing so allowed me the opportunity to travel around the world and get to know many diverse people and cultures. Today, I am a proud father of two boys, a business owner, and a full-time student of Business Administration at John Tyler community college in Chester VA.

The key to my happiness comes from serving others, resulting in my passion for helping the community. Starting a business cannot simply be about money; its foundation is strongest when it is based on purpose and meaning. My goal is to launch an apprenticeship-based upholstery program aimed at high school students with ADD/ADHD, and adults returning from addiction rehabilitation or prison, in developing a practical new skill set.

Together, we endured a treacherous trip across Mexico into to the United States under refugee status. There, I was raised in Long Island, NY until I was 12, before we moved to Virginia.

At 20, I joined the United States Marine Corps as a food subsistence specialist and proudly served my country for eight years. Doing so allowed me the opportunity to travel around the world and get to know many diverse people and cultures. Today, I am a proud father of two boys, a business owner, and a full-time student of Business Administration at John Tyler community college in Chester VA.

LOAN_USE: us purchase tools and supplies to grow our repair services

DESCRIPTION: Benjamín se dedica a la venta de pan. Tiene mucho tiempo de tener este negocio. Benjamín ha trabajado fuertemente todos los días por proporcionar el pan de cada día actualmente tiene ciertos pedidos que sus clientes le realizan.  \nEl desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y de esa manera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar un crédito que será utilizado en la compra de materia prima. Benjamín es un joven bastante trabajador y que gusta mucho de colaborar con los demás, los ingresos que percibe de su negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. \n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Benjamín's business is selling bread.  He has been in this business for a long time.  Benjamín works hard every day making his bread.  He currently has a number of orders that his customers make.  He would like to acquire more merchandise so that he can expand his business and thereby be able to meet his customers' demands.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy raw materials.\r\n\r\nBenjamín is quite a hard-working young man who very much likes to work with other people.  He uses the profits that he makes in his business to help his family get ahead.
LOAN_USE: Working capital

Mary Jean has a buy and sell citrus business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of citrus to sell.

Mary Jean has been in this business for 6 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like milk, coffee, shampoo, etc. to sell.

Elsa has been in this business for 25 years.

DESCRIPTION:
This is Christina from Liberia. She lives at Caldwell with her two children, age 7 and 9, and her husband, who is a driver. Christina stopped her education at grade 9. 

For the past 16 years Christina has been selling lappa, (fabric) chain and watches in the local market. Her friends call her a business woman. Christina has asked for a 30,000 LD loan to buy additional lappa, nickel and watches for her business. 

Sometimes buying is slow and she stays at her business 10 hours each day. She uses a taxi often to get her goods to her table.  She admires her business because it helps in supporting her home. Her dream is to own a store and educate her children. She blesses you all for the assistance.

LOAN_USE: to buy additional lappa, (fabric) nickel and watches for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs Huệ is 29 years old and she is married with 1 child.

Huệ lives in Thanh Hoa city, a urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling fruit for 8 years.

In 2014, Huệ joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Huệ has successfully repaid 3 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

The main hardship that Huệ faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to pay for tuition and school supplies for her child.
With her business profit, Huệ hopes for her business to do well, for her child to do well in school, and for her family to be healthy and happy.

DESCRIPTION:
James is happily married and has been blessed with three children. He provides for his family through the printing and photocopy business that he runs. In his printing shop he prints office and school materials, as well as clients’ documents.

He is seeking a loan to add stock of more printing materials to grow his business. His main challenge is experiencing shortages of printing materials and stationery needed to for his business.

He is of good credit character, and he plans to pay for this loan using the profits he makes from his business. His dream is to provide for his children, a bright future by empowering them.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
James is happily married and has been blessed with three children. He provides for his family through the printing and photocopy business that he runs. In his printing shop he prints office and school materials, as well as clients’ documents.

He is seeking a loan to add stock of more printing materials to grow his business. His main challenge is experiencing shortages of printing materials and stationery needed to for his business.

He is of good credit character, and he plans to pay for this loan using the profits he makes from his business. His dream is to provide for his children, a bright future by empowering them.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stationery for his printing, photocopy, and scanning services and boost his business.

DESCRIPTION: Zarife wants to thank all of the lenders for the previous loan, which has helped her to purchase windows and door frames to improve the living conditions and the family's overall health during the cold and rainy seasons. She is very satisfied with the loan process and the results that she has enjoyed thanks to the loan. \r\n\r\nShe is once again requesting a loan to repair and address the problems and condition of her toilet. With this loan, she will continue to improve her family’s lives and their standard of living, a dream that she had always had. She hopes in the future that she will be able to find a job and contribute to the finances of her family, and give her children a better education.

DESCRIPTION:
Ana de 56 años, , vive en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas), ella tiene una papelería en su casa vende bebidas, papelería, cuadernos .(en Ecuador se los llama “bazar”).   

Comenzó hace 6 años con la papelería para poder mantener a su familia, vendiendo cuadernos, plumas y papeles a sus vecinos y conocidos cuando completo el dinero para ubicar su pequeña papelería readecuo su casa y la ubico en la parte delantera de su casa ya que hay un colegio cerca de donde vive. Trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días.  

Con el préstamo quiere comprar cuadernos, bebidas y vitrinas para su negocio. En el futuro quiere triplicar su mercadería y que su hija de 17 años termine sus estudios con éxito.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ana is 56 years old and lives in Fortín de Guayaquil (a periurban area with dirt roads and hills). She has a stationery shop in her home where she sells beverages, paper, and notebooks. In Ecuador, this type of business would be called a bazaar.

She started her business six years ago in order to support her family. Ana began selling notebooks, pens, and paper to her neighbors and acquaintances. When she had enough money to set up a small store, she remodeled her house and placed her business in the front part of her home since there is a high school near where she lives. She works from 7:30am to 8pm every day.

With his loan Ana plans to buy notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets for her business. In the future, she hopes to triple her inventory and see her 17 year old daughter successfully finish her studies.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Purchase notebooks, beverages, and display cabinets

DESCRIPTION:
Rosalina is 48 years old and married. She has five children, one of whom is in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional livestock to raise.

Rosalina has been raising livestock for two years now and has borrowed from NWTF four times in the past to sustain her business. Her goal is to save enough money to expand her business in the future.
