DESCRIPTION:
Angelita is a 45-year-old-married woman from Talibon, Bohol. She has ten children, the oldest being 25 while the youngest is nine. Her husband is a fisherman.

For almost seven years now Angelita has sold tuba (a type of coconut wine) as well as soft drinks like Pepsi to make additional money for her family.

Angelita is applying for a loan of 12,000 PHP through CEVI to buy more tuba wine and soft drinks to serve her customers. She hopes that in the future she will be successful enough not only to provide her family with good food but to save for her children’s studies.
LOAN_USE: to buy more tuba wine and soft drinks to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Evelyn es una joven emprendedora, tiene la edad de 30 años, muy trabajadora además de tener su pequeño inventario ganadero que le heredo su padre, se ha esforzado por aprender una carrera técnica con la cual se desempeña como auxiliar de Fierro en Alcaldía Municipal de su domicilio.  Como hija responsable tiene el deseo de realizar un sumidero para aprovechar sus ingresos invirtiendo en la propiedad donde habita con sus padres; con el préstamo comprara cemento,  Hierro, piedras canteras, arena, tubos,  azulejos y otros accesorios para construir el sumidero en la parte de atrás de la vivienda y remodelar el baño para dar mejor higiene y comodidad en el hogar.\nSueña en formar una linda familia encontrar a la persona ideal para formar un hogar con gran responsabilidad y desde ya piensa ir mejorando y tener su propia vivienda para cuando lleguen los hijos tengan condiciones habitables y crezcan en un ambiente sano.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Evelyn, age 30, is an enterprising and hard-working young woman.  In addition to having an inventory of small livestock that she inherited from her father, she has put forth great effort to learn a technical career that she used working as an assistant for the local municipal authorities.  As a responsible daughter, she wishes to build a drain in order to take advantage of her earnings by investing in the property where her parents live.

She will use the loan to buy cement, iron, quarry rocks, sand, pipes, glazed tiles and other accessories in order to build a drain behind the house and to remodel the bathroom in order to provide her household with better hygiene and comfort.

She dreams of finding the ideal person with whom to make a beautiful family and to form a household very responsibly.  From there she plans to be improving and to have her own house so that when the children come they have livable conditions and grow in a healthy environment.
LOAN_USE: to buy cement, iron, quarry rocks, sand, pipes, glazed tiles and other accessories in order to build the drain behind the house and to remodel the bathroom.

DESCRIPTION: Tsiky est âgée de 30 ans. Elle s’occupe seule de ses deux enfants suite à l’abandon du père. Elle habite un quartier semi-rural, dans la périphérie de la ville. Tsiky exerce l’élevage de poules de chair depuis deux années. Cette activité étant son unique source de revenu. Ses gains servent à pourvoir à tous les besoins de la famille. Tsiky veut hausser le revenu, elle veut une meilleure condition de vie pour ses enfants. Elle veut avoir ses économies pour construire une maison plus tard. Elle a commencé à prendre des prêts, elle veut étendre son activité pour gagner plus de bénéfices. Elle a choisi de cheminer avec Vahatra. Ce prêt va l’aider dans l’achat de 30 poussins et 170 Kg de provendes pour les nourrir. Elle vend ses produits elle-même, les clients viennent à son domicile pour acheter. Elle espère l’appui des prêteurs. Elle va renforcer ses épargnes avec ses éventuels profits.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Tsiky is 30 years old. She takes care of her two children alone since their father abandoned them. She lives in a semi-rural area on the outskirts of town. This business is her only source of revenue. Her profits will be used to provide for all the needs of the family.

Tsiky wants to increase her income and wants better living conditions for her children. She wants to make savings so she can build a house later. She has started to take loans as she wants to expand her business to make more profits. She decided to work with Vahatra.

This loan will help her to buy 30 chicks and 170kg of feed for them. She sells her products herself - her clients come to her house to make their purchases. She hopes for the support of the lenders. She will increase her savings with the profit she makes.
LOAN_USE: to buy broiler chicks and feed.

DESCRIPTION: Латифи проживает в районе Яван. Он родился 1966 году. Латифи добропорядочный гражданин Таджикистана. Он занимается животноводством. Разводит крупнорогатый скот в дальнейшем для продажи. Этим видом деятельности занимается четыре года. Кредит берет для закупа телят.\nЛатифи живет с женой. У него семеро детей.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Latifi lives in the Yavan district.  He was born in 1966.  Latifi is a conscientious citizen of Tajikistan.  He is involved in animal husbandry and breeds cattle for subsequent sale.  He has been in this business for four years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase calves.  Latifi lives with his wife, and they have seven children.
LOAN_USE: to buy calves

DESCRIPTION:
Le groupe de solidarité est créé le 24 Mars 2001. Il  est  constitué de 14 femmes qui habitent le même quartier. Leur activité principale est le commerce.
Madame Lucie Ndèye qui est à la droite de la photo levant la main est responsable de groupe. Elle est âgée de 65 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 08 enfants. Elle a aussi en sa charge 02 autre enfants qui sont ses petits enfants.
Elle s’active dans la vente de tissus. Elle a une bonne expérience dans ce domaine d’activité, qu’elle pratique depuis plusieurs années.
Ce prêt lui permettra de renforcer son capital et de mieux développer  ses activités.
Les profits lui permettront d’améliorer les conditions de vie de la famille (santé, nourriture, habillement etc.…) et d’augmenter ses épargnes.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This solidarity group was created on March 13, 2001. It comprises fourteen women who live in the same district. Their main business involves commerce. 

Ms. Lucie Ndèye, at the right in the photo with her hand raised, is the group's official. She is 65 years old, married, and the mother of eight children. She also supports two other children, who are her grandchildren. 

Ms. Lucie Ndèye is active in selling cloth. She has good experience in this business domain which she has been working at for several years. 

This loan will enable her to bolster her capital and to develop her business further. 

The profits will allow her to improve her family's living conditions (health care, food, clothing, etc....) and to increase her savings.
LOAN_USE: to buy cloth
BORROWER_NAMES: MADELEINE, PHILOMENE, MILIANE, ANTOINETTE, PAULINE, CECILE, VIRGINIE, MONIQUE, MARIE BRIGITTE, ANNA, MARIE, GEORGETTE, AUGUSTINE, LUCIE
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Hellen is a 34-year-old married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as a focused and determined person. She operates a retail business where she sells milk, sugar, bread, washing soap, and other items. Her business is located in an urban area and her primary customers are local consumers. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be the low demand of products. She will use the KES 90,000 loan to add stock of milk, bread, sugar, and other items she sells. Her business goal is to excel within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a brighter future.

This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 50,000 was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to add more stock.
LOAN_USE: to add stock of milk, bread, sugar, and other items

DESCRIPTION:
Nelia works hard to support seven children. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.


Nelia is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nelia works hard to support seven children. She is widowed and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.


Nelia is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Rose is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kireka region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her beverage business, which sells drinks like millet (bushera) with pineapple juice.

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet and pineapples for making juice. This will help Rose to generate greater profits and enable her to cater to her family's needs, hence improving on their standards of living. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a soft drink company.

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rose is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kireka region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children, with 1 of them currently in school. For the past 3 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her beverage business, which sells drinks like millet (bushera) with pineapple juice.

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more millet and pineapples for making juice. This will help Rose to generate greater profits and enable her to cater to her family's needs, hence improving on their standards of living. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a soft drink company.

Rose is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to buy more millet and pineapples for making juice.

DESCRIPTION:
Marilou is 48 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marilou is 48 years old and has seven children. She is married and has two children who are in school.

Marilou is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock. She has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 8 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilou would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

DESCRIPTION:
Lovelyn is a 30-year-old woman who is married with five children. They live in a community in Honiara, the capital of Solomon Island.

She has a garden where she grows cabbages, potatoes, melons and tomatoes that she can sell at the market to earn a living. She has been in this business for one year.

Lovelyn has requested a loan to pay for additional melon, cabbage and tomato seedlings, bush knives and hoes to assist her with her farming activities.

She plans to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses and improve her business.

She joined SPBD in 2019 to gain access to financial services for her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Lovelyn is a 30-year-old woman who is married with five children. They live in a community in Honiara, the capital of Solomon Island.

She has a garden where she grows cabbages, potatoes, melons and tomatoes that she can sell at the market to earn a living. She has been in this business for one year.

Lovelyn has requested a loan to pay for additional melon, cabbage and tomato seedlings, bush knives and hoes to assist her with her farming activities.

She plans to use her profits to meet her family's weekly expenses and improve her business.

She joined SPBD in 2019 to gain access to financial services for her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy melon, cabbage and tomato seedlings, bush knives and hoes for her farming business.

DESCRIPTION:
Estelita works hard to support two children. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Estelita is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Estelita works hard to support two children. She is married and has a fish-vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Estelita is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Aira Mae works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Aira Mae requested a 15,400 PHP loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family. She is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting protection of the environment.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Aira Mae works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Aira Mae requested a 15,400 PHP loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family. She is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health hazard risks to her family and neighbors, as well as promoting protection of the environment.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Özlem is married and has one child. She is selling cosmetics to hair salons where she has made deals. She is also selling them to her neighbors and friends and making a contribution to the family budget.

With the help of her second loan from Maya she bought bulks of hair dyes.

She wants to increase her sales in summer season and increase her income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Özlem Hanım evli, bir çocuk annesidir. Özlem Hanım kozmetik ürünleri satışı yapıyor. Ürünlerini anlaşmalı olduğu kuaförlere satıyor. Aynı zamanda yakın çevresine de ürünlerini satarak ev ekonomisine destek oluyor. Mayadan ikinci kredisini kullanan Özlem Hanım kredisi ile toptan saç boya çeşitleri aldı. Yaklaşan yaz sezonu ile işlerinin açılmasını ve ekonomik kazancını arttırmak istiyor.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Özlem is married and has one child. She is selling cosmetics to hair salons where she has made deals. She is also selling them to her neighbors and friends and making a contribution to the family budget.

With the help of her second loan from Maya she bought bulks of hair dyes.

She wants to increase her sales in summer season and increase her income.

Translated from Turkish by Maya staff

Özlem Hanım evli, bir çocuk annesidir. Özlem Hanım kozmetik ürünleri satışı yapıyor. Ürünlerini anlaşmalı olduğu kuaförlere satıyor. Aynı zamanda yakın çevresine de ürünlerini satarak ev ekonomisine destek oluyor. Mayadan ikinci kredisini kullanan Özlem Hanım kredisi ile toptan saç boya çeşitleri aldı. Yaklaşan yaz sezonu ile işlerinin açılmasını ve ekonomik kazancını arttırmak istiyor.
LOAN_USE: to buy hair dyes

DESCRIPTION: Yadira es una mujer humilde, trabajadora y responsable con su familia y negocio, hace seis años decidió montar en su casa de habitación su negocio de pulpería, con el total apoyo de sus tres hijos, ha ido viendo como su emprendimiento se ha vuelto exitoso. Con los meses de crisis socio política  que vivió su pueblo, ella no pudo fortalecer su inventario, por lo que ha solicitado un préstamo a KIVA junto a MICRÉDITO porque siente es el momento de volver a ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de artículos. Con el préstamo comprara enlatados comestibles, refrescos envasados, granos básicos, cereales, papel higiénico y artículos de higiene personal. En un futuro le gustaria poder hacer de su negocio un pequeño mini super.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yadira is a humble and hardworking woman who is responsible with her family and her business. Six years ago, she decided to establish a grocery business in her home. She has the complete support of her three children who have seen her business become successful.

Due to months of socio-political crisis that have impacted her community, she was not able to strengthen her inventory. For this reason, Yadira has requested a Kiva loan through MiCrédito because she wants to continue offering her customers a variety of products. The loan will be used to buy canned food products, packaged soft drinks, basic grains, cereals, toilet paper, and personal hygiene products.

In the future, she would like to convert her business into a mini-supermarket.
LOAN_USE: to buy canned food products, packaged soft drinks, basic grains, cereals, toilet paper, and personal hygiene products.

DESCRIPTION:
Raphael is 29 years old. A businessman, he is married to Jennifer, a business lady. They are blessed with one child. Raphael has been running a spare parts business for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 10,000 which he uses to support his family. 

He is applying for his  loan from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Raphael will use the loan to purchase a stock of spare parts for his shop. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to expand his business which will help him improve the living standard of his family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a stock of spare parts for his shop

DESCRIPTION: Engjellushe or 'Angel' in English is back again needing your help. She wants to invest in a cooler now for the tractor that her husband uses. The season has already started for plantations.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Engjellushe or 'Angel' in English is back again needing your help. She wants to invest in a cooler now for the tractor that her husband uses. The season has already started for plantations.
LOAN_USE: To invest in a cooler for the  tractor that her husband uses

DESCRIPTION:
Elia, está acompañada y tiene 2 hijos. Su pareja se dedica a la agricultura.

Elia, se dedica a la crianza y venta de gallinas, cerdos y vacas. Además, cultiva granos básicos. Su pareja e hijos se involucran en sus trabajos aunque también paga a personas particulares.

Elia, necesita un préstamo para pagar mano de obra para recolectar la cosecha de granos básicos.

Elia, sueña con mejorar su casa y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elia is in a relationship and has two children. Her partner works in agriculture.

Elia works raising and selling hens, pigs, and cows. She also grows basic grains. Her partner and children are involved in her work, although she also pays individuals.

Elia needs a loan to pay laborers to harvest her crop of basic grains.

Elia dreams of improving her house and getting her children ahead.
LOAN_USE: to pay laborers to harvest her crop of basic grains

DESCRIPTION:
El grupo llamado Mujeres Unidas se formó en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, con la unión de amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad, buscan mejorar sus condiciones de vida por medio del trabajo unido de todas y por medio de la ayuda que les brinda la fundación paraguaya.
Una de las integrantes es Rosa, quien se dedica al reciclado de productos plásticos, cartones, aluminio y otros productos más. Ella recoge los productos que recicla de manera ambulante y también los compra al por mayor para poder revenderlos y tener un margen de ganancia para de esa forma ayudar a su familia.
Pide ese préstamo para poder comprar productos de aluminio, cartones, papeles y otros productos, para poder seguir con sus ventas y ayudar a su familia de esa forma. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The group called Mujeres Unidas (Women United) was formed in the city of San Lorenzo by a group of women and neighbors from that city. They are seeking to improve their living conditions through the united work of all of them, and through the support provided them by the Fundación Paraguaya.

One of the members is Rosa who works recycling products such as plastics, cardboard, aluminum and other things. She gathers things to recycle on foot. She also buys them wholesale in order to resell them at a profit in order to help her family.

She seeks this loan to buy products of aluminum, cardboard, paper, etc., in order to continue with her sales and help her family. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving. It will be a great help.
LOAN_USE: to buy aluminum, cardboard, paper and other recyclable products to resell.
BORROWER_NAMES: Ana, Raquel, Ana, Germina, Faustina, Felipa, Medarda, Luz, Noelia, Rosa, Maria, Barsilisa, Griselda, Pablina, Yanina
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, false

DESCRIPTION: Sara menciona que con el otorgamiento del crédito anterior pudo mejorar su negocio, ya que basteció su inventario con lo que su negocio sea mantenido funcionando y también ha tenido ingresos estables para sacar adelante a su familia, la cual mantiene su misma estructura y hasta el momento no se le ha presentado ningún problema.\nAna nuevamente solicita un crédito para poder invertir en la compra de maíz, leña y gas propano para la producción de tortillas; esto le permitirá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y generar ingresos para la subsistencia familiar.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sara says that the previous loan allowed her to improve and her business with necessary items to keep functioning. She has also had a steady income to support her family. To date the has not had any problems.

Ana nuevamente solicita un crédito para poder invertir en la compra de maíz, leña y gas propano para la producción de tortillas; esto le permitirá satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes y generar ingresos para la subsistencia familiar.

Ana is asking for another loan to buy corn, firewood, and propane gas to make tortillas. This will allow her to satisfy her customers' needs and generate income to support her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy supplies and ingredients.

DESCRIPTION:
Marites is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur.


She requested a PHP 7,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.


Marites knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marites is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur.


She requested a PHP 7,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.


Marites knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

DESCRIPTION: Mary is a middle aged woman who works hard to feed her family. She runs a retail store that is the source of her livelihood. She enjoys her livelihood because it sustains her family. Her main challenge is lacking enough stock to meet her demand. This is her first loan which she intends to pay back using her profits. She dreams of improving her living standards and that of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mary is a middle aged woman who works hard to feed her family. She runs a retail store that is the source of her livelihood. She enjoys her livelihood because it sustains her family. Her main challenge is lacking enough stock to meet her demand. This is her first loan which she intends to pay back using her profits. She dreams of improving her living standards and that of her family.
LOAN_USE: to add stock of detergents and other commodities to her shop

DESCRIPTION:
Waleed, who appears in the photo, is a 22-year-old refugee who lives with his family in Dier Al Balah, Gaza Strip. He is studying business administration at a local university. He is studying hard to graduate and find a good job in the future.

His father is the sole provider for the family. He works in the public sector, where he earns a low income that is barely enough for the basic needs of his family. Waleed went to Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to request a US dollar loan to pay his education fees of his university. He hopes you will help and fund his loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Waleed, who appears in the photo, is a 22-year-old refugee who lives with his family in Dier Al Balah, Gaza Strip. He is studying business administration at a local university. He is studying hard to graduate and find a good job in the future.

His father is the sole provider for the family. He works in the public sector, where he earns a low income that is barely enough for the basic needs of his family. Waleed went to Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to request a US dollar loan to pay his education fees of his university. He hopes you will help and fund his loan.
LOAN_USE: to pay his education fees  to study business administration.

DESCRIPTION: Kambua is 30 years old. She is married with one child. She has had a boutique business for nine years. She will be using the loan to purchase new ladies clothes for sale and hopes this will help her expand her business and start selling cosmetics with the profit made. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Kambua is 30 years old. She is married with one child. She has had a boutique business for nine years. She will be using the loan to purchase new ladies clothes for sale and hopes this will help her expand her business and start selling cosmetics with the profit made. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to be financially stable.
LOAN_USE: to purchase new  ladies clothes for sale

DESCRIPTION:
Sarah is a hard-working lady from Muti, in Mbarara district. She is married, to a gentleman who is humble and supportive, and with him, she has three children. She is 29 years old. Together with the unemployed husband, she works hard to support their family.

She operates a small business, along a street in Mbarara. She works to meet the needs of the family. They live in town, where the cost of living is very high. She sells clothes, but the competition is very high. To beat the odds, she has to ensure that she sells clothes that are of good quality and in fashion.

She came and approached our branch at Mbarara, requesting some financial rescue in the form of a loan facility of 1,000,000. She wants the loan to help her to buy fashionable clothes for the festive season. She hopes that the loan facility will boost her sales and profits.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sarah is a hard-working lady from Muti, in Mbarara district. She is married, to a gentleman who is humble and supportive, and with him, she has three children. She is 29 years old. Together with the unemployed husband, she works hard to support their family.

She operates a small business, along a street in Mbarara. She works to meet the needs of the family. They live in town, where the cost of living is very high. She sells clothes, but the competition is very high. To beat the odds, she has to ensure that she sells clothes that are of good quality and in fashion.

She came and approached our branch at Mbarara, requesting some financial rescue in the form of a loan facility of 1,000,000. She wants the loan to help her to buy fashionable clothes for the festive season. She hopes that the loan facility will boost her sales and profits.
LOAN_USE: to buy fashionable clothes to sell, during the festive season

DESCRIPTION:
Carmen es divorciada y vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, dos de ellos se dedican a estudiar y un tercero ya cuenta con su negocio propio, ella manifiesta que no reciben ayuda económica de sus parientes. Carmen es propietaria de un comedor, el negocio lo tiene desde hace algún tiempo atrás, cuenta con una empleada para atenderlo, también sus hijos le ayudan hacerlo, trabaja de lunes a sábado con un horario de seis de la mañana a una de la tarde, ella además de su negocio se desempeña como secretaria en un Centro Escolar.
Ha solicitado un préstamo para tener disponibilidad económica que le permita comprar carnes, pastas, arroz, aceite, verduras, etc., así tendrá suficiente materia prima para preparar la venta de comida, otra parte del dinero le servirá para renovar el inmobiliario de su negocio y equipo de trabajo, pues ella comprara mesas, sillas y utensilios para preparar los alimentos, de esta manera brindara a sus clientes una mejor atención y un menú más variado. Carmen espera que la inversión le sea de ayuda para tener mejores ventas e ingresos, ya que así cubrirá gastos familiares y respaldara el pago de la deuda adquirida.
Las aspiraciones de Carmen son tener estabilidad económica, hacer crecer su negocio y seguir ayudando económicamente a su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Carmen's divorced and lives in her own home with her three children, two of whom are students and the third one already has his own business. She said they don't receive financial help from their relatives.

Carmen owns a café, a business she has owned for some time. She has one employee who helps her serve, and her children also help her with that. She works Monday through Saturday from 6 in the morning until 1 in the afternoon. In addition to her business, she also works as a secretary in a school.

She requested a loan to have the money available to buy meat, pasta, rice, oil, vegetables, etc. That way she'll have enough ingredients to make her dishes. Another part of the money will help her renovate the property and equipment for her business, because she's going to buy tables, chairs, and utensils for making the food. That way she'll provide better customer service and a more varied menu.

Carmen hopes the investment will help her have better sales and income, because that way she'll cover family expenses and support repayment of the debt.

Carmen's goals are to have financial stability, make her business grow, and continue helping her family financially.
LOAN_USE: to buy meat, pasta, rice, oil, vegetables, etc., so she has enough ingredients to make her dishes

DESCRIPTION:
Hermenia is a 59-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fresh seafood and fish to sell.

Hermenia has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hermenia is a 59-year-old married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional fresh seafood and fish to sell.

Hermenia has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional fresh seafood and fish to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Joel trabajó la caficultura, la crianza y venta de reses por muchos años. Hace 7 años comenzó a administrar su pequeña finca de 1.06 Ha. en 2016 con la ayuda de su esposa, en la Región Norte de Nicaragua en la comunidad de Bocay, donde vive con sus dos hijos, uno de ellos actualmente está estudiando en la primaria. Tiene un área destinada para la creación de viveros de material vegetativo para la siembra de Cacao.

Cuenta con áreas de Cacao en desarrollo por lo que los fondos solicitados serán invertidos para el establecimiento de 1.4 Ha. específicamente para la compra de insumos como: plantas, bolsas y el pago a sus colaboradores.

Con el apoyo de su familia, ha sido capaz de maximizar los recursos y producción de su finca, estabilizando su situación familiar y apoyando a la comunidad. Este préstamo le permitirá mejorar la baja producción, aumentando su productividad hasta en un 40%. El sueño de Joel es tener una plantación modelo, para compartir su experiencia con otros productores y mejorar el bienestar de su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Joel worked in coffee growing and raising and selling cattle for many years. Seven years ago he began to manage his small farm of 1.06 hectares. Today, with the help of his wife, in the northern region of Nicaragua in the community of Bocay, where he lives with his two children, one of whom is going to primary school, he has an area of land for growing vegetation and planting cacao trees.

He has land with developing cacao trees, and the solicited funds will be invested in the establishment of 1.4 hectares, specifically for purchasing supplies such as: plants, sacks and payment for his help.

With the help of his family, he has been able to maximize the recourses and production of his farm, settling his family situation and helping his community. This loan will allow him to improve decreased production, increasing his productivity by up to 40%. Joel's dream is to have a model plantation, to be able to share his experience with other producers and improve the well-being of his family.
LOAN_USE: to buy necessary supplies to establish new cocoa trees and in this way settle his family and help his community.
TAGS: #Eco-friendly, #Trees, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Parent, #Job Creator, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Sustainable Ag, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION: Mrs. Min Y., age 58, works with her husband on their farmland to grow rice crops and vegetables, earning about $2 per day together. They have five children, three who work and two who are students. She would like to request a loan of $1000 in order to purchase a cow to help them plow their field. Using a cow to carry heavy loads and pull the plow will increase their efficiency, allowing them to plant crops more densely and lighten the physical burden. She is pictured with her daughter in the photo.
LOAN_USE: To purchase a cow to plow the fields

DESCRIPTION:
El banco de emprendimiento Virgen del Carmen está compuesta por ocho integrantes de las cuales siete  son mujeres y un varón, todas ellas se dedican a distintas actividades como; tapizado de vehículos, personas venta de mandiles y lana, venta de jugos batidos, venta de cubiertas de celulares,  venta de jugo, venta de perfumes, venta de refrescos y venta de ropa, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios todas ellas se conocen entre sí ya que viven por la misma zona.

La presidenta del Banco es la señora Getrudes (en la foto es del vestido lila floreado) es una mujer de 40 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene cuatro hijos de las edades 14, 10, 8, y uno tres de ellos en edad escolar, ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio, ella es emprendedora, buena madre, luchadora, fuerte, constante independiente. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona Sur de su ciudad de Santa Cruz, un área caracterizada por el creciente comercio, con una temperatura que varía de los 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Getrudez es de tez morena, cabello negro largo, estatura mediana, complexión física robusta, su lengua materna es el español Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en un año que lleva con esta actividad.
Por este motivo solicita el préstamo para la compra de variedad de productos para surtir su tienda, porque estas fechas de fin de año tienen mucha demanda.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The bank Virgen del Carmen is made up of eight members: seven women and one man. They all make a living through distinct businesses such as car upholstery, wool and net sales,smoothie sales, cell phone cover sales, juice sales, perfume sales, soft drink sales, and clothing sales. They are requesting this loan in order to expand their businesses. Each of the members know one another because they all live in the same region.  

Gertrudes is the president of this bank (she is the one in a purple flowered dress). She is 40 years old and lives with her husband. She has four children ages 14, 10, 8, and 1. Three of them are school age. Gertrudes makes a living selling basic goods in a neighborhood store. She is an entrepreneurial woman and a good mother. She is a fighter, who is strong and independent. Gertrudes works in the southern zone of the city of Santa Cruz, an area characterized by its growing business. The temperatures stay between 27-32 degrees Celsius throughout the year. 

Getrudes has a dark complexion with long black hair. She is of medium height and has a robust figure. Her native language is Spanish. This is her first loan cycle through a financial institution. She is requesting this loan in order to buy a variety of products to stock her store because during the end of the year there is always much demand.
LOAN_USE: to buy a variety of products to stock her store.
BORROWER_NAMES: ISABEL, GETRUDES, MARIA ESTHER, ELIZABETH, JUAN CARLOS, SHIRLEY, DELIA, ALEJA
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, male, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Hello, Kiva Community! Meet Rosemary, a hardworking dairy and crop-farming mother in the heart of Kericho. She has a small personal business. She is a devoted mum who loves cooking for her family and providing for their basic needs. However, she has not been enjoying her cooking duties due to her old, problematic stove (jiko). Her jiko emits a lot of smoke and now takes more than a tin of charcoal, which has become quite costly, as has paraffin.

Rosemary is requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly jiko to enjoy cooking for her family and save on costs of charcoal and paraffin. Because it's eco-friendly, the jiko will also keep her from contracting any respiratory diseases that may be caused by the increased fumes emitted by her current stove. Kindly lend to her!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hello, Kiva Community! Meet Rosemary, a hardworking dairy and crop-farming mother in the heart of Kericho. She has a small personal business. She is a devoted mum who loves cooking for her family and providing for their basic needs. However, she has not been enjoying her cooking duties due to her old, problematic stove (jiko). Her jiko emits a lot of smoke and now takes more than a tin of charcoal, which has become quite costly, as has paraffin.

Rosemary is requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly jiko to enjoy cooking for her family and save on costs of charcoal and paraffin. Because it's eco-friendly, the jiko will also keep her from contracting any respiratory diseases that may be caused by the increased fumes emitted by her current stove. Kindly lend to her!
LOAN_USE: to buy an eco-friendly stove.

DESCRIPTION:
Elsy de 52 años de edad, dejo de estudiar cuando iba a tercer año de la universidad y no pudo seguir debido al embarazo que tuvo, actualmente está soltera con tres hijos, nadie vive con ellos ya que ya formaron su familia, ella vive con un pastor de la religión evangélica.

La señora desde hace 6 años se dedica al comercio de ropa y calzado y aprendió por iniciativa propia, la señora sale a vender sus productos a la ciudad y se traslada en bus; el horario de su trabajo es prácticamente en horas de la mañana.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar zapatos especialmente sandalias,  cadenas, ropa para niño y niña y ropa interior.

En un futuro desea tener un local en el centro de la ciudad, para no estarse movilizando a diario, espera vender toda la mercadería para seguirle invirtiendo con las ganancias que le quedan, además espera pagar todas las deudas que ha contraído sin ninguna dificultad.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elsy, 52, quit her education when she was about to begin her third year at university.  She was unable to continue because she was expecting a child.  She is currently single and lives with her three children and an evangelical pastor.

For six years Elsy has been selling clothing and shoes which she learned about on her own initiative.  She works as a street vendor in the city where she goes by bus.  Most of her work is done during the morning hours.

The loan she is requesting through CREDICAMPO is to buy shoes (especially sandals), bracelets, children's clothing and underwear.

In the future she wants to open a shop in the city center so she does not have to move around so much.  She hopes to sell all of her merchandise so she can continue investing the profit in her business.  She also wants to pay off debt easily.
LOAN_USE: To buy shoes (especially sandals), bracelets, children's clothing and underwear.

DESCRIPTION: Carlos a lo largo de estos años ha solicitado sus créditos tanto para mejorar su vivienda, como para invertirlo en su negocio, en todos los créditos ha demostrado ser una persona responsable pagando en tiempo sus obligaciones. En esta ocasión solicita el crédito para hacer una habitación en su vivienda. Comprará materiales de construcción como bloques, perlines, hierro y piedrín. Su esposa tiene una pulpería y le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Su siguiente meta después de este préstamo es hacer otra habitación para su hija mayor.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Over the years Carlos has asked for loans to improve his house as well as invest in his business. In all his loans he has shown to be a responsible person, paying back on time.

On this occasion he is asking for a loan to make a room for his house. He will buy construction materials such as blocks, purlins, iron and gravel.

His wife owns a grocery store and helps him with the household expenses. His next goal after this loan is to make another room for his eldest daughter.
LOAN_USE: to construct a room in his house.

DESCRIPTION: Rita G. lives in Thecho, Lalitpur. She lives with her mother-in-law, her husband and a daughter. Her daughter is in primary school. Her husband's name is Radesh G. and he opened his computer institute 7 years ago, where he teaches basic computer and graphic design courses. He has four computers at his institute, but that is not enough to meet the demands of the students. He wants to buy another computer, but due to lack of funds he cannot afford it. So, his wife is requesting her fifth loan to buy another computer to help her husband. This will also help to provide a better income for her family, and improve their standard of living. \n
LOAN_USE: To buys computers

DESCRIPTION: Linda makes a living selling cooked foods like rice, beans and plantain and also sells drinks in her shop. She wakes up in the morning as early as 5:30 a.m. to start preparing food to sell. Linda cooks all day long, every day from  Mondays to Sundays. She is 40 years old and married with four children. Linda has been in this business for a long time, and is requesting a loan to buy more drinks to sell and foodstuffs to cook for her customers. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible. \r\n\r\n
LOAN_USE: To buy more drinks and food

DESCRIPTION:
Las mencionadas mujeres son de la Compañía de la Ciudad de Caacupe.
Son Sras. que trabajan en su mayoría en la producción y venta de plantas en sus propios hogares, se dedican al cultivo y venta de plantas a gran escala, las señoras son de hogares muy humildes que con sus distintas actividades se ganan el pan diario para sus familias.
Todas realizan actividades muy sacrificadas una de ellas es la señora Salvadora Monzón quien también se dedica a la venta de plantas, ella y su marido trabajan todos los días por las planta que una vez que este en buenas condiciones para la venta salen por distintas ciudades para ofrecer sus plantas.
Es un trabajo muy pesado pero gracias a mismo sus hijos pueden estudiar y no les falta   nada. Ella desea aumentar su venta y producción para realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de semillas, abonos, y bolsas para macetas.
Todas las integrantes están muy agradecidas con la Fundación Paraguaya por tan importante oportunidad que les  brinda para poder aumentar sus ingresos y calidad de vida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The women mentioned in this description belong to a group in the city of Caacupe. Most of these ladies grow plants on a large scale at home and sell them. Through their different activities, these humble women earn the income they need every day to support their families. All of them have made sacrifices in order to run their businesses.

One of these women is Sra. Salvadora Monzón, who sells plants. She and her husband work with plants all day to provide them good conditions so that they can be sold in different cities. The work is very tiring, but it has enabled her to provide her children an education so that they lack nothing. Salvadora wants to increase her sales and production, as well as make a few improvements to her home. She is requesting a loan to buy seeds, compost, and bags for lining flowerpots.

All of the members are grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for providing an important opportunity for them to improve their income and quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Purchase seeds, compost, and bags for lining flowerpots
BORROWER_NAMES: Isabel, Hilda, Lidia, Cristina, Ascención, Maria, Esperanza, Maria, Maria, Mercedes, Celina, Ana, Cinthia, Maria, Salvadora, Zully, Maria, Rosalina, Gloria, Simeona
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, false, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION: Elenita, 33 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 13 years, Elenita has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.\r\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Elenita, 33 years old, is married and has four children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 13 years, Elenita has operated a general store business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Elenita would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy more groceries to sell

DESCRIPTION: Helen is 24 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetable seeds to sell. She has been farming vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from fishing. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional vegetable seeds to sell for her agriculture business.

DESCRIPTION: Ma. Lerma is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in her hog-raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman. \r\n\r\nMa. Lerma's hog-raising business was affected when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago. She has just started with it again. Ma. Lerma is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business thus allowing her to grow healthy pigs which she can then sell at the market. Ma. Lerma  believes that through hard work, she will be able to improve her way of living and support the schooling of her children.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Ma. Lerma is a 42-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Leyte, Philippines. She has been engaged in her hog-raising business for more than five years now. This is the source of her income. Her husband works as a fisherman. \r\n\r\nMa. Lerma's hog-raising business was affected when typhoon Haiyan hit the country several months ago. She has just started with it again. Ma. Lerma is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise, feed and food supplements for the pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her hog-raising business thus allowing her to grow healthy pigs which she can then sell at the market. Ma. Lerma  believes that through hard work, she will be able to improve her way of living and support the schooling of her children.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional piglets to raise and feed and food supplements for the pigs

DESCRIPTION: Шааникан, 57 лет, мать 2 детей, с Шааникан живут ее внуки, которые и помогают по хозяйству. У нее средне-специальное образование. Бизнесом занимается давно, более 15 лет. Начала она свой бизнес с 5,000 сом (KGS). В данный момент Шааникан продолжает заниматься полеводством и животноводством, у нее есть 3 коровы. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 30,000 сом (KGS). По характеру Шааникан очень ответственная и доброжелательная. Она обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для приобретения коров. В будущем Шааникан собирается увеличить поголовье скота.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Shaanikan is 57 and has two children. Her grandchildren also live with her and help her around the farm. She has a secondary specialized education and has been farming for over 15 years. She started her business with 5,000 som (KGS). She currently plants crops and raises livestock. She has three cows and earns around 30,000 som (KGS) per month. Shaanikan is a very responsible and friendly person. She applied for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to purchase cows. In the future she will increase her number of livestock.
LOAN_USE: to buy cows for fattening and resale

DESCRIPTION: Im is 31 years old, married, and has three children. He is from Moung Russey district of Battambang province. He grows rice and pineapples as the main source of income. He earns almost 29,500 KHR a day. \r\n\r\nIm is the leader of his group and is requesting his second loan from VisionFund for 1,000,000 KHR, which he will use to buy fertilizer for his crops. With his past loan, which he has repaid, he was able to upgrade his living conditions. His co-borrower is requesting a loan for 500,000 KHR. Im hopes that the fertilizer will boost his paddy rice with double yield in return.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fertilizer for his crops

DESCRIPTION:
Pictured in the photo are the members of the “Believe In God III” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small town in Western Sierra Leone. They are requesting a loan of 1,500,000 Sierra Leonean Leone (SLL) each in order to boost their respective businesses in both size and quality. This will lead to to more sales, better profits, and improvement in their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Ibrahim. Ibrahim is 42 years old; he was born in Mile Ninety-one in Northern Sierra Leone but is currently residing in Waterloo, together with his wife and four children. His wife is a trader as well, and his children attend primary and secondary schools. 

Ibrahim sells cigarettes and medicines and has been a businessman for ten years now. He has requested this loan in order to buy more cigarettes and medicines to add to his current stock.
LOAN_USE: to buy more cigarettes and medicines to add to his current stock.

DESCRIPTION:
MwaJ. is divorced and takes care of her three children (ages 10, 7 and 5). She makes a living by selling food at her small cafe, where she works from 8 A.M. to 5 P.M. daily. From this business, which she started just 8 months ago, she makes a monthly profit of about $70.

MwaJ. hopes for a loan to purchase more food items for her cafe. She will share this loan with her subgroup, members of loan group Tujibe Moyo. The members of this loan group guarantee one another in paying back their loans. .
LOAN_USE: To buy more food items for her cafe

DESCRIPTION:
Naghma baji has been a citizen of Lahore, Pakistan for the last 18 years. Lahore city is famous for its historical places and for Punjabi foods. She is an uneducated lady but her mother gave her the skill to sew clothes. She started a sewing clothes business to share the financial burden with her husband. Her husband's name is M. S.. He is an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) driver. Naghma baji is requesting a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle) because her husband is currently driving a rented one and pays half of his income to the owner.
 
This group loan consists of three additional people: 

Asmat baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. 
Bushra baji wants a loan to buy vehicle spare parts to sell. 
Parveen baji wants a loan to buy wood and nails for her furniture making business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible. 

Note: “Naghma baji is seated on the first left side in this photo”.
LOAN_USE: To buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle)

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Ang A. sells groceries and earns around $2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Heang Phal, charges batteries in his village and earns around $3.50 per day. They live with their four children, all of whom are single, in the Boeng Ngort Village, Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. \r\n\r\n

With a growing business and a desire to expand, A. is seeking a loan to decorate her grocery store. The remainder of loan is to purchase more groceries. This loan will help her to expand her business and to improve her family’s income.
LOAN_USE: To decorate her grocery store and purchase more groceries

DESCRIPTION:
Hello, Kiva community! Meet Jaban, a crop and dairy farmer who lives and works in the Chuka area of Kenya. 

Charcoal is the main source of energy in rural homes in Kenya. Sadly, with the harsh economic times, purchasing charcoal has become costly for Jaban. 

He is kindly requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly, efficient jiko (charcoal-burning stove) for his household. This will reduce the consumption of charcoal, which will consequently reduce household expenses. This will further enable him to better provide for other essential needs, such as food and shelter, for his family. 

Support this hardworking farmer!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hello, Kiva community! Meet Jaban, a crop and dairy farmer who lives and works in the Chuka area of Kenya. 

Charcoal is the main source of energy in rural homes in Kenya. Sadly, with the harsh economic times, purchasing charcoal has become costly for Jaban. 

He is kindly requesting a loan to buy an eco-friendly, efficient jiko (charcoal-burning stove) for his household. This will reduce the consumption of charcoal, which will consequently reduce household expenses. This will further enable him to better provide for other essential needs, such as food and shelter, for his family. 

Support this hardworking farmer!
LOAN_USE: to buy an eco-friendly cooking stove.

DESCRIPTION:
Cecil is a woman and 31 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecil has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cecil requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Cecil has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cecil would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cecil is a woman and 31 years old. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecil has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cecil requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy a variety of fish to sell.

Cecil has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Cecil would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy a variety of fish to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Maria is 54 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food, and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maria is 54 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Maria works very hard to provide for them.

Maria runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food, and other groceries.

Maria has been in this business for 5 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Maria would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk food, and other groceries

DESCRIPTION:
Welita is a married woman, 49 years old, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Welita has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Welita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Welita is a married woman, 49 years old, with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Welita has a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Welita has been in this business for five years. She would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
David is a dedicated, determined, and honest father of a lovely family. He is based in Kericho, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea growing regions, lending it the nickname of “the tea region.”

For the past 10 years, David has been involved in mixed farming. His primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed him to earn a decent income.

David passionately loves farming, but the biggest challenge he faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made him give up. He mobilized other enterprising smallholder farmers like him in his village.

David is requesting a loan to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farming. Having gone through training on loan management, he is educated on how to use the loan and save more money. Through this loan, David will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand his horticulture business to international markets.

If there is someone you should consider lending to in this 2016, then that person is David!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
David is a dedicated, determined, and honest father of a lovely family. He is based in Kericho, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea growing regions, lending it the nickname of “the tea region.”

For the past 10 years, David has been involved in mixed farming. His primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, maize, and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed him to earn a decent income.

David passionately loves farming, but the biggest challenge he faces is the lack of funds. However, this challenge has not made him give up. He mobilized other enterprising smallholder farmers like him in his village.

David is requesting a loan to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farming. Having gone through training on loan management, he is educated on how to use the loan and save more money. Through this loan, David will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand his horticulture business to international markets.

If there is someone you should consider lending to in this 2016, then that person is David!
LOAN_USE: to buy seeds and expand his horticulture farming.

DESCRIPTION:
Amelita works hard to support one child. She is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Amelita is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Amelita works hard to support one child. She is widowed and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Amelita is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Josephine 49 years old, lives in Liberia and is a widow with 9 children. Josephine attended school up to the 10th grade. Two of her children are currently attending school while living at home. Her main source of income is business, mainly selling cosmetics. She started a few years back with an objective of increasing her business.

She has applied for a loan with BRAC Liberia. The loan will be used to buy more cosmetics to sell. She is hopeful that with increased inventory, her sales will also improve, thus bettering her finances to provide for the family. She learned the trade from her mother and started selling with some financial help from her late husband.

In the future she would like to improve her business and continue sending her children to school. Josephine is grateful for the financial support from BRAC and KIVA for their support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

She learned the trade from her mother and started selling with some financial help from her late husband.

In the future she would like to improve her business and continue sending her children to school. Josephine is grateful for the financial support from BRAC and KIVA for their support.
LOAN_USE: to buy more cosmetics to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Amanda is 45 years old. She is a married woman with 3 children ranging in age from 9 through 27 years. All of them live at home while in school. Amanda went to school until 12th grade.

She deals in a business where she sells rice, water, charcoal, soap, oil and pepper. She started this business with less capital and she is proud of the process. She learned this trade from her mother. Amanda uses a car to transport supplies to her business site. She sells 5 days per week and 10 hours per day. She likes her business because it gives her more profits.

Amanda has asked for a loan through BRAC Liberia, a Kiva field partner. The loan will enable her to purchase additional rice, water, charcoal, soap, oil and pepper to sell to her regular customers.

In the future, she wants to build houses and improve her business. She wishes to say thanks.

LOAN_USE: to purchase additional rice, water, charcoal, soap and pepper to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Dieyfroza is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Dieyfroza has operated a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Dieyfroza dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Dieyfroza is a married woman and has been blessed with three kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

Dieyfroza has operated a poultry-selling business, which has been operational for over 4 years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. Dieyfroza dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future.

With the loan, she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

DESCRIPTION: Хаитгул очень благодарна за поддержку и заботу. Она  целенаправленно воспользовалась кредитом и получила прибыль. Хаитгул хочет еще раз обратиться за поддержкой, чтобы купить пару молодых бычков для расширения деятельности. Хаитгул уверена, что и в этот раз вы ее поддержите.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Haitgul is very grateful for the support and care. She used the loan as intended and made a profit. Haitgul wants to once again seek support to buy a pair of young bulls to expand her business. Haitgul is sure that you will support her this time too.
LOAN_USE: to buy a pair of young bulls to expand her business and make a profit.

DESCRIPTION: Ханифа  жительница района Гиссар, ей 58 лет. У нее двое сыновей. Ханифа  невестка занимается швейным делом. Ханифа   хочет тоже параллельно заняться шитьем. Она умеет кроить и шить таджикские женские платья. Ханифа   планирует совмещать работу с швейным делом, так как хочет улучшить финансовое положение семьи. Однако она нуждается в кредите, чтобы купить для себя вышивальную швейную машинку и принимать заказы. Ханифа   надеется, что таким образом она сможет помочь мужу в обеспечении семьи.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hanifa is a resident of the Gissar region, she is 58 years old. She has two sons. Hanifa's daughter-in-law works as a seamstress. Hanifa wants to work beside her as a seamstress. She knows how to cut and sew Tajik women's dresses.

Hanifa plans to combine her work with a sewing business, so that she can improve her family's living conditions. However, she needs a loan in order to buy an embroidery sewing machine and take orders. Hanifa hopes that in this way, she will be able to help her husband to provide for the family.
LOAN_USE: to buy an embroidery machine and start her own sewing business.

DESCRIPTION:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

Melanie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Melanie works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

Melanie requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

She has been in this business for five years.

Melanie would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy more seafood to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Lizardo de 22 años de edad es un emprendedor del municipio del Itagui, Colombia. busca montar su negocio de confección, actividad que espera convertirla en el pilar para el sostenimiento de su núcleo familiar compuesto por su pareja, no tiene hijos pero se proyecta en un futuro tenerlos. En la actualidad se dedica en cuerpo y alma a su trabajo. Con el propósito de iniciar formalmente su empresa, Lizardo se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de tela y disponer de capital para mano de obra para adecuaciones. Su mayor preocupación es la fluctuación en los precios que ocasionan constantemente pérdidas para el sector. Afectando directamente sus ganancias.  Lizardo espera poder generar una estabilidad económica para el sostenimiento de su familia.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Lizardo, age 22, is an entrepreneur in the municipality of Itagui. Colombia. He is seeking to start a start a sewing business, an activity that he hopes will become a pillar of support for his family. He and his wife have no children, but plan to have them. He puts body and soul into his work.

In order to formally begin his company, Lizardo is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of fabric and to use for capital for labor for preparations. His greatest worry is the fluctuation of prices, that can cause losses in the sector, directly affecting profits.

Lizardo hopes to be able to provide economic stability to support his family.
LOAN_USE: to start a sewing business.

DESCRIPTION:
Doña Yolanda es originario del municipio de Tecpan tiene 36 años de edad, bajo su responsabilidad están sus tres hijos menores de edad, se dedica a la Venta de productos AVON desde hace algunos años,  es una persona trabajadora y responsable que todos los días realiza su actividad con mucho dedicación para poder mantener a sus clientes.
El esposo  trabaja como costurero en una fabrica de suéteres y gracias al apoyo de el Ella sigue adelante con su negocio ya que entre los dos se están apoyando para poder salir adelante, el crédito que  esta solicitando lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería ya que aveces por falta de capital no puede atender a sus clientes.
Su sueño es ampliar mas su negocio ya que asi obtendrá mejores ganancias y poder mandar a sus hijos a estudiar y terminar su casa donde vivie.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yolanda is from the municipality of Tecpan. She is 36 years old, and three children who are minors are in her care.

She has worked selling Avon products for some years. She is a hard-working and responsible person who does her work every day with a lot of dedication to be able to maintain her customers.

Her spouse works as a tailor at a sweater factory and, thanks to his support, she gets ahead with her business since between the two of them they are supporting each other to be able to get ahead. The loan she is requesting will be invested in purchasing merchandise since sometimes, due to the lack of capital, she cannot serve more customers.

Her dream is to expand her business more since, in this way, she will get more earnings and be able to send her children to school and finish the house where she lives.
LOAN_USE: to buy and sell catalog products.

DESCRIPTION:
Khursheeda is 33 years old. She is an embroidery and sewing expert and works for her community clients. Due to her good quality work, she receives regular orders every month. Her husband sells fertilizers. His customers include farmers who purchase fertilizers from him to use on their crops.

Khursheeda is the mother of two sons and two daughters. None of them is able to attend school due to the poor financial conditions of Khursheeda and her husband.

She has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for her brother who also runs a fertilizer retail business and who is currently facing low stock problems. With the help of a loan he will purchase different brands and variety of fertilizers for his shop to generate more sales and profits. He has been operating this business for many years and Khursheeda is hopeful that a loan will help her brother increase his business profits.

Note: "In the picture, the lady holding a book called Asasah passbook is Khursheeda."
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers for her business
BORROWER_NAMES: Asia, Shahnaz, Khursheeda, Abida, Bashiraan, Naziraan
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Dilish is 22 years old and lives in the town of Ojwina, in the Lira region of Uganda. She has two children.

For the past two years, Dilish has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells green bananas (plantains), cassava, tomatoes, etc .

To help expand her business, Dilish has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more green bananas, cassava,and tomatoes to increase her sales. This will help Dilish to generate greater profits and her production will increase and attract more revenue. She will manage to buy food for her family and clothes for her children.

Dilish hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a another branch as part of expanding her business ideas.

Dilish is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
