For the past two years, Dilish has been working hard to manage her grocery store, which sells green bananas (plantains), cassava, tomatoes, etc .

To help expand her business, Dilish has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more green bananas, cassava,and tomatoes to increase her sales. This will help Dilish to generate greater profits and her production will increase and attract more revenue. She will manage to buy food for her family and clothes for her children.

Dilish hopes that in the future she will be able to start up a another branch as part of expanding her business ideas.

Dilish is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more green bananas, cassava, and tomatoes.

DESCRIPTION:
Jeremiah is a 64-year-old maize farmer in Kyeni South, Kenya. In addition to farming his core crop, he currently has 20 chickens and 4 goats on his land. Jeremiah historically struggles to access credit for high-quality seeds and fertilizer, which compromises the quality of his harvest. Jeremiah is excited to have access to high-quality inputs, advice and insurance from an Apollo Agriculture loan, to increase his yields.

With this bundled package, Jeremiah expects higher profits this season, which he hopes to invest back into his farm in subsequent seasons.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jeremiah is a 64-year-old maize farmer in Kyeni South, Kenya. In addition to farming his core crop, he currently has 20 chickens and 4 goats on his land. Jeremiah historically struggles to access credit for high-quality seeds and fertilizer, which compromises the quality of his harvest. Jeremiah is excited to have access to high-quality inputs, advice and insurance from an Apollo Agriculture loan, to increase his yields.

With this bundled package, Jeremiah expects higher profits this season, which he hopes to invest back into his farm in subsequent seasons.
LOAN_USE: to access premium seeds and high-quality fertilizer for 0.5 acres of maize, in addition to advice and insurance, optimizing for increased productivity and profits.

DESCRIPTION:
José Luis tienen 23 años de edad, reside en El Transito departamento de San Miguel, donde vive con su esposa, ambos trabajan para los gastos del hogar, el tiene el negocio de venta de ropa y lo atiende dese las 7:00am a 5:00pm, este negocio fue iniciado con ayuda de su madre ya que ella es comerciante de ropa también.
Él solicita un préstamo para la compra de prendas de vestir con modas del momento, esto le ayudara a mantener la clientela y a que nuevos lleguen también atraídos por la mercadería que ofrece,  el quiere satisfacer los gustos es por eso que en esta época que se acerca es un tiempo donde más se busca ropa para las fiestas de fin de año.
Los sueños de José Luis son como comerciante crecer cada día y brindar un buen servicio y atención a los clientes, y como persona superarse y mejorar las condiciones de vida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
José Luis is 23 years old and resides with his wife in El Transito in the Department of San Miguel. They both work to cover the household expenses. José Luis has a business selling clothes and manages it from 7am to 5pm. He started this business with the help of his mother, who is also clothing merchant.

José Luis is requesting a loan to buy articles of clothing that are currently in fashion. This will help him keep his existing customers as well as attract new ones with the arrival of more merchandise to offer. He wants to cater to the tastes of each customer since the time is coming when most people are looking for clothes to buy for the year-end festivities.

His dreams include becoming a merchant who grows each day and provides good service to his customers. In addition, he hopes to excel as a person and improve his living conditions.
LOAN_USE: Purchase clothing to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Mercy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a restaurant and a farm business. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase more stocks of ingredients used in preparing food in the restaurant as well as additional farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mercy is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a restaurant and a farm business. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 50,000 loan to purchase more stocks of ingredients used in preparing food in the restaurant as well as additional farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, her business will grow. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay her children's school fees.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more stocks of ingredients used in preparing food in her restaurant as well as additional farm inputs.

DESCRIPTION:
Khurshida is a 46-year-old honest and cheerful woman from Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is divorced and lives with her mother and her son. She is a main provider for the family and works hard provide family with best condition of the life.

She has dealt with animal husbandry for more than 8 years. She buys some cattle, feeds them for some months and sells in the local market profitably. She also has been farming to get additional income. She grows wheat and corns in her plot and sells her harvest in the local market.

Sadly, Khurshida’s mother has serious problems with her health and needs treatment.

Khurshida has not enough money to cover the expenses. She is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner IMON to treat her mother in the hospital to improve the state of her health.

Please, help Khurshida and her mother.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Khurshida is a 46-year-old honest and cheerful woman from Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is divorced and lives with her mother and her son. She is a main provider for the family and works hard provide family with best condition of the life.

She has dealt with animal husbandry for more than 8 years. She buys some cattle, feeds them for some months and sells in the local market profitably. She also has been farming to get additional income. She grows wheat and corns in her plot and sells her harvest in the local market.

Sadly, Khurshida’s mother has serious problems with her health and needs treatment.

Khurshida has not enough money to cover the expenses. She is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner IMON to treat her mother in the hospital to improve the state of her health.

Please, help Khurshida and her mother.
LOAN_USE: to treat her mother in the hospital as needed to improve the state of her health.

DESCRIPTION:
Islam is 49 years old and married with two children. His wife is a housekeeper. Islam has a door and window trading business in his city. He is very popular with his business because everybody knows him as a professional master. After making doors and windows, he sells them in the bazaar. His profit from this business is 120 AZN a month. He has 14 years of experience in this business. There are many wooden houses in his town. 

Besides this, people need wood to make houses warm. He also sells wood for this purpose. So, there is a big demand for his products. He has not enough funds for materials. Because of this, he needs a 2,000-AZN loan. He has a good loan history and this is his fourth loan.
LOAN_USE: to buy carpentry materials

DESCRIPTION:
Juah is 45 years old, and she is married and blessed with five children. The ages of her children are 7 through 23 years. All of her children are presently in school and live at home. Juah went to school and stopped in 9th grade.

She is a vendor that sells lappas in the general market. She learned how to sell from her mother, and her husband gave her money to start the business. She has been operating her sales for 20 years now. She uses car to transport to transport supplies to her business site and has had no problems with her sales.

Juah asked for a loan with BRAC Liberia, a Kiva field partner. The loan will be used to purchase more lappas to sell and expand her business and to help her family’s financial situation. She is very grateful to BRAC and Kiva for their support. In the future, she wants to build her house and continue her children’s education. She wishes to say thanks.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Juah is 45 years old, and she is married and blessed with five children. The ages of her children are 7 through 23 years. All of her children are presently in school and live at home. Juah went to school and stopped in 9th grade.

She is a vendor that sells lappas in the general market. She learned how to sell from her mother, and her husband gave her money to start the business. She has been operating her sales for 20 years now. She uses car to transport to transport supplies to her business site and has had no problems with her sales.

Juah asked for a loan with BRAC Liberia, a Kiva field partner. The loan will be used to purchase more lappas to sell and expand her business and to help her family’s financial situation. She is very grateful to BRAC and Kiva for their support. In the future, she wants to build her house and continue her children’s education. She wishes to say thanks.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more lappas to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Meet 45-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo 2 branch. She is married with children between the ages of 16 and 25 years old.

Kadiatu sells “cookery” beside a busy road. “Cookery” is a modest term for the wealth of spicy stews that are cooked by local people and served with rice. The building blocks of such stews are palm oil, cassava leaf, rice, green chilies, seasoning (like Maggi or red pepper), and chicken or fish. She has been in this business for the past 14 years now. She works eight hours per day and six days a week. Her source of income is from her husband who is a driver. Kadiatu says her business is progressing every day.

She requested this loan from BRAC to purchase more rice, palm oil, oil, ground nut, Maggi, onions, pepper, fish, meat, and chicken, etc., to increase her business. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her to educate her children. In the future she wants her business to expand into a big restaurant. She says thanks to BRAC and the Kiva community for their support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Meet 45-year-old Kadiatu from Waterloo 2 branch. She is married with children between the ages of 16 and 25 years old.

Kadiatu sells “cookery” beside a busy road. “Cookery” is a modest term for the wealth of spicy stews that are cooked by local people and served with rice. The building blocks of such stews are palm oil, cassava leaf, rice, green chilies, seasoning (like Maggi or red pepper), and chicken or fish. She has been in this business for the past 14 years now. She works eight hours per day and six days a week. Her source of income is from her husband who is a driver. Kadiatu says her business is progressing every day.

She says thanks to BRAC and the Kiva community for their support.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more rice, palm oil, oil, ground nut, Maggi seasoning, onions, pepper, fish, meat, and chicken.

DESCRIPTION:
Zaib Un Nisa is 29 and lives in Lahore with her spouse and two sons. Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He provides services such as hair cutting, hair color, groom makeover, shaving, etc. Mostly on holidays, the customers come for hair cutting.

When there is a rush for his services, he sometimes has difficulties finding good sitting arrangements for the waiting customers. He does not have a proper waiting area for new customers. For this reason, he wants to furnish his barber shop so his customers can wait their turn calmly.

Due to low savings, Zaib Un Nisa has requested a Kiva loan to furnish her husband's salon and to buy an additional piece of salon equipment: a “hair steamer machine.” His dream is to convert his barber shop into a salon so that he can attract more customers for services.

Zaib Un Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Zaib Un Nisa is 29 and lives in Lahore with her spouse and two sons. Her husband has been running a barber shop for many years. He provides services such as hair cutting, hair color, groom makeover, shaving, etc. Mostly on holidays, the customers come for hair cutting.

When there is a rush for his services, he sometimes has difficulties finding good sitting arrangements for the waiting customers. He does not have a proper waiting area for new customers. For this reason, he wants to furnish his barber shop so his customers can wait their turn calmly.

Due to low savings, Zaib Un Nisa has requested a Kiva loan to furnish her husband's salon and to buy an additional piece of salon equipment: a “hair steamer machine.” His dream is to convert his barber shop into a salon so that he can attract more customers for services.

Zaib Un Nisa is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to furnish her husband's barber shop and to buy a hair steamer machine.

DESCRIPTION:
Milagro, estudió hasta 6° grado en la escuela, está casada, su esposo se dedica a la agricultura y tiene 2 hijos.

Milagro, vende comida típica como yuca frita, enchiladas de maíz, tostadas de plátano, etc.

Necesita apoyo de un préstamo para comprar un carretón para desplazarse a vender comida típica en su comunidad.

Milagro, sueña con mejorar su negocio y dar buena educación a sus hijos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Milagro attended school until the sixth grade. She is married. Her husband works in agriculture, and she has two children.

Milagro sells typical dishes, such as fried yucca, corn enchiladas, fried banana chips, etc. She needs a loan to buy a cart so she can go out and sell typical dishes in her community. Milagro's dream is to improve her business and provide a good education to her children.
LOAN_USE: to buy a cart so she can go out to sell typical dishes in her community.
TAGS: #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION: Don Miguel de 52 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el posee un negocio de enderezado y pintura ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace mas de 10 años, con lo que obtiene de sus trabajos logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el cliente está solicitando un crédito para la compra de pintura, barniz, aceites y demás herramientas para seguir con su trabajo y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Miguel is 52 years old and lives in his own home with his family. He has a bodywork and paint shop that he has run out of his home for more than 10 years. With what he earns, he is able to pay his household's expenses.

Miguel is requesting a loan in order to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools so he can continue his work and increase his income to provide his family with a better quality of life, without limitation.
LOAN_USE: to buy paint, varnish, oils, and other tools.

DESCRIPTION:
Ivan's business is to sell food in bulk. He has two business locations. One is in Striy city, where he mainly sells flour and sugar in bags to small local retail stores. At the other location, which is in small village, he sells same products but to individual people, who prefer to buy sugar and flour in bags. This helps them to save some money as well as make sure they have enough food for several months.\r\n

\r\nIvan started this business 19 years ago. He has many repeat clients who buy from him. Ivan has good prices and offers transportation services using his private vehicle. Ivan would like to borrow 17,000 UAH to purchase 11 tons of flour. Ivan's business goal is to build his own storage place that he would not need to pay rent for. Ivan sponsors Christmas gifts for children in the village where he works.
LOAN_USE: To purchase 11 tons of flour

DESCRIPTION:
Sung is 37 years old. She is a mother of five children and resides with her husband in Kampong Cham Province, Cambodia. She has been growing rice and fattening animals for more than twenty years, earning approximately $5 per day. Sung's husband runs the business of purchasing cattle to resell. He earns about $10 per day. Two of Sung's children are employed in a garment factory. They earn about $7 per day. 

In order to improve her family's finances, Sung is requesting a loan of $1300 to purchase farmland to use for her agricultural crops cultivation. This purchase would help her expand her business and earn more income to support her family. In the future, Sung would like to run an additional business to earn more income for her family and help her children earn a higher education to get a good job.
LOAN_USE: to purchase farmland to use for her agricultural crops cultivation.

DESCRIPTION:
Marilou lives in Plaridel and supports her family by building houses from the ground up. She has applied a loan to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers.

She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marilou lives in Plaridel and supports her family by building houses from the ground up. She has applied a loan to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers.

She wants her daughters to get an education and escape the life of backbreaking work she has had to endure.
LOAN_USE: to buy building materials and paints, and to pay her workers.

DESCRIPTION: Elias es un guerrero de mil batallas que a pesar de las adversidades nunca ha desistido de sus sueños de mejorar las condiciones de vida de sus seres queridos y comprar vivienda. Elias se dedica a atender su negocio de tienda de abarrotes, actividad que nace por necesidad económica y la cual aprendió de sus padres. Elias se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para invertir en arroz, frijol, mecato, refrescos en general para surtir más su tienda. Elias reside en un sector en postconflicto por ende la gestión representa un mayor riesgo.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elias, who resides in a post-conflict sector, is a warrior of a thousand battles who, despite adversities, has never abandoned his dreams of improving his loved ones conditions of life and supplying their basic needs. His loan represents a major risk.

Elias is dedicated to attending to his grocery store business, an activity born of economic necessity, which he learned from his parents.

Elias is now requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of rice, beans, bakery goods, and soft drinks in general in order to re-stock his store.
LOAN_USE: to invest in rice, beans, cakes, pastries, and soft drinks in general to expand  his store's inventory.

DESCRIPTION: Это Бунафша,ей 30 лет. Она прекрасная жена и мама 3 детей. Многие мужчины районов уезжают на заработки в РФ и муж Бунафши не исключение. Он ежемесячно присылает деньги для своей семьи. Бунафша тоже не сидит сложа руки,она помогает своему мужу обеспечивать семью. Более 8 лет назад она обучилась кройке и шитью и все эти годы шьет на заказ национальные платья. Бунафша хочет расширить свою деятельность и закупить дорогие ткани для своих клиентов,но ей не хватает необходимой суммы. Для этой цели Бунафша обращается к вам. Она хочет удивить своих клиентов и надеется ,что вы поможете ей в этом.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: This is Bunafsha. She is 30 years old, and a wonderful wife and mother of three. Many men in the area where Bunafsha lives leave to work in Russia, and Bunafsha's husband is no exception. He sends money back to his family every month. Bunafsha doesn't sit around doing nothing, though; she helps her husband support their family. She learned how to sew clothing over eight years ago, and has been making traditional dresses to order ever since. Bunafsha wants to expand her business and buy expensive fabric for her customers, but she doesn't have enough money to do this. With this goal in mind, Bunafsha is coming to you. She would like to amaze her customers, and hopes that you will help her do this.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fabric and expand her business.

DESCRIPTION: Маъруфджон очень талантливый и целеустремленный человек. Он добрый семьянин и на воспитании имеет троих детей. Жена учительница, преподает в начальных классах. Более 10 лет он занимается услугами плотника и изготовлением окон и дверей. Он производит и продает на рынке, а также принимает заказы. Маъруфджон запрашивает займ для покупки стропила с целью пополнения оборотного капитала. Он надеется на вашу помощь и милосердие.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Marufjon is a very talented and goal-oriented man.  He is a bighearted family man and is raising three children.  His wife is an elementary school teacher.  For more than ten years he has been a carpenter manufacturing doors and windows.   He produces them and sells them at the market, and he also accepts orders.  With the goal of replenishing his working capital, Marufjon is requesting a loan for the purchase of rafters.  He is relying on your help and charity.
LOAN_USE: to purchase rafters

DESCRIPTION:
Kurbongul lives in the district of Khuroson. She is 41 years old, married and a wonderful mother of three children. She is a kind and thoughtful woman.

Kurbongul has received a secondary education. Together with her husband, she raises livestock. She is taking out a loan to buy cows and calves in order to increase her cattle head count and expand her business.

Her main challenge is lack of finance. She hopes for your understanding and support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Kurbongul lives in the district of Khuroson. She is 41 years old, married and a wonderful mother of three children. She is a kind and thoughtful woman.

Kurbongul has received a secondary education. Together with her husband, she raises livestock. She is taking out a loan to buy cows and calves in order to increase her cattle head count and expand her business.

Her main challenge is lack of finance. She hopes for your understanding and support.
LOAN_USE: to purchase cows and calves.

DESCRIPTION:
Jarsee is a 43-year-old businesswoman who is living together with her partner and their four children. She never had the opportunity to attend school, but all of her children are presently in school.

She sells charcoal and dry fish. Jarsee has been selling for the past 10 years and has had no problem with her business. She started selling with some money given to her by her friend and learned to sell from her older sister.

With this loan money, she will buy more charcoal and dry fish to sell. With the resulting earnings, she is planning to invest more in her business. Jarsee is so proud of her business in that it helps support her children. In the future, she would like to increase her business. She says thanks for your support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jarsee is a 43-year-old businesswoman who is living together with her partner and their four children. She never had the opportunity to attend school, but all of her children are presently in school.

She sells charcoal and dry fish. Jarsee has been selling for the past 10 years and has had no problem with her business. She started selling with some money given to her by her friend and learned to sell from her older sister.

With this loan money, she will buy more charcoal and dry fish to sell. With the resulting earnings, she is planning to invest more in her business. Jarsee is so proud of her business in that it helps support her children. In the future, she would like to increase her business. She says thanks for your support.
LOAN_USE: to buy more charcoal and dry fish to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Speaking with Diana, (a single, 45-year-old mom and a returning borrower with a good credit history), it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Litein. She always strives to give them a decent life and a good education.

She has been doing agriculture for the past few years now. She makes money selling products from her farm, including milk and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity.

Diana is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Diana and her family.

Like Diana, thousands of women smallholder farmers are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Speaking with Diana, (a single, 45-year-old mom and a returning borrower with a good credit history), it becomes obvious that she is a very hardworking and helpful woman and that everything she does is for her family's benefit and well-being. She lives in a humble home in the town of Litein. She always strives to give them a decent life and a good education.

She has been doing agriculture for the past few years now. She makes money selling products from her farm, including milk and crops. She enjoys plowing her farm and watering her plants. Crop diseases pose a big challenge for her and also poor productivity.

Diana is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs. With the loan, she plans to buy good quality seeds and fertilizer which will help increase soil fertility and productivity on her farm. Increased productivity will allow her to improve her quality of life and living standards. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, she has learned about the culture of saving and she plans to use the increased income to improve her farming. This loan will go a long way in changing the life of Diana and her family.

Like Diana, thousands of women smallholder farmers are waiting for your help. Take heart, make a loan.
LOAN_USE: to buy farm inputs to improve her productivity, leading to increased profits to support her children until they finish school.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Yumyati. She is 45 years old and married with two daughters. Yumyati is a housewife who takes care of her family. Her husband has been working as a driver in the Serang District for twenty-five years. Her husband is the only breadwinner in the family. Still, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their children.

Yumyati has asked for a loan of 7,900,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to build a toilet for her family. Today her family has no access to a toilet in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet but Yumyati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean sanitation. Yumyati is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Yumyati. She is 45 years old and married with two daughters. Yumyati is a housewife who takes care of her family. Her husband has been working as a driver in the Serang District for twenty-five years. Her husband is the only breadwinner in the family. Still, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their children.

Yumyati has asked for a loan of 7,900,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to build a toilet for her family. Today her family has no access to a toilet in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a toilet but Yumyati will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean sanitation. Yumyati is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all the lenders.
LOAN_USE: to build a toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Lay N., 38, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Kampong Chnang Province, Cambodia, an area known for clay and ceramic products. (N.'s husband appears in the photograph.)

She sells groceries for an income of about $7 per day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning an income of $6.90 per day to help cover the family expenses. N. is requesting a loan of $500 to purchase more groceries to stock the store. 

In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.
LOAN_USE: Buy more groceries to stock the store

DESCRIPTION: Felicia sells cooked foods and bottled water. She has been in her business for the past 22 years and she has been borrowing from LAPO for the past 2 years. Felicia lives in Lagos. She is very happy with the financial assistance from KIVA lenders. She is 47 years old, married and has 5 children. She hopes for a loan in the amount of NGN50,000. She will use the funds to purchase more food items and bottled water to sell. She thanks you.
LOAN_USE: To purchase more food items and bottled water.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Laxmi M. lives in a nuclear family with her husband and one son in Thecho, Lalitpur. Thecho is one of the developing villages of Lalitpur district. Most of the people in this region are engaged in farming.

Both Mrs. M. and her husband Cheri Babu M. are engaged in wood craft work. They make different types of wood craft according to the orders they receive.

Now Mrs. M. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs 15000.00 loan to buy timbers and tools for their woodcraft work. Mrs. M. is saving her income to provide a good education for her son because the educational cost is very high in Nepal.
LOAN_USE: To buy timber and tools

DESCRIPTION: Cau would like to take a new loan to buy a large quantity of rice and beans to make food and sell from her stall. Cau's previous loan enabled her to increase her sales and earn a higher income to support her family. She hopes that another loan will assist her in increasing the size of her business, attract new customers and increase sales. She also hopes that through the loan she can increase her income and improve her family's living conditions.\r\n
LOAN_USE: To purchase a large quantity of rice and beans to make food to sell from her food stall.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of three children, Asela works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and fishing. Asela is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails, bamboo, rope and other materials needed to make furniture to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Asela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of three children, Asela works hard to support her family.

She has a furniture making business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store and fishing. Asela is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails, bamboo, rope and other materials needed to make furniture to sell.

She successfully repaid her previous loan and now she has requested another loan to further build her businesses.

Asela has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy materials like wood, nails, bamboo, rope and other materials needed to make furniture to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Fadel is from Iraq. He is a youth client, aged 23 years, married and has two children. He is the only provider for the family.
Fadel owns a small grocery store selling soft drinks, juices, cheese, dairy products, detergents and snacks. He established his business in 2010. He has good experience in this field and a good reputation in his local community.
He is requesting $2,400 loan to renovate the window shop. He is aiming to grow his business and increase his profits so he will be able to provide his family better life conditions.
LOAN_USE: to renovate the window shop

DESCRIPTION:
Ghulam Rasool is a 43-year-old married man living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father and son; his parents like him a lot due to his caring.

Currently, Ghulam Rasool owns a dairy farm in his town since 1998. He gets milk from buffaloes twice a day, which is very hard work for a single person.  He is growing old and does not have enough energy to perform his tasks as he used to in his young age.
 
Few days ago, one of his cattle was stolen due to lack of security. There is no proper shelter for his cattle, which needs to be improved. 

He wants to buy a buffalo and buildup the shelter but he has insufficient savings, so he requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner’s BRAC Pakistan so that he can overcome these deficiencies and carry on his business smoothly.
 
From the profit amount, Ghulam Rasool will ensure the security of his cattle by building up a shelter for them so that he can avoid theft in the future. He wants to appoint an assistant to help him in his daily tasks.
 
Ghulam Rasool is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy a buffalo for getting milk and buildup a secure shelter for his cattle.

DESCRIPTION:
María, estudió hasta 4to grado en la escuela, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura. Tuvo nueve hijos de los cuales uno ya murió y los demás ya son independientes.

María, se dedica a la agricultura desde los 13 años de edad y el oficio lo aprendió de sus padres. Actualmente, siembra maíz, maicillo y pipianes. Camina un kilómetro desde su casa hasta la parcela. Además, ella cuida ganado ya que posee dos vacas.

María, necesita un préstamo para comprar una novilla para la crianza. En el pasado fue apoyada con 2 préstamos y los pagó con éxito.

María, sueña con tener muchas vacas lecheras.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
María studied up to the 4th grade in school, is partnered, and her partner works in agriculture. She had nine children, of whom one has died and the others are now independent.

María has worked in agriculture since she was 13 years old and learned the trade from her parents. Currently, she plants corn, sorghum, and pipian squash. She walks one kilometer from her house to the land. In addition, she raises livestock since she has two cows.

María needs a loan to purchase a heifer to raise. In the past, she was supported by 2 loans and paid them off successfully.

María dreams of having many dairy cows.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a heifer to raise.

DESCRIPTION:
Zareena is 35 years old and married. Many years ago she started her business of milk sales with the support of her husband. She has six buffaloes and a cow. 

Due to her efforts and her work, she is honored in her home. She helps her husband in all family matters, as well as financial matters. She uses the milk of cow for her personal use, but the milk of buffaloes her husband sells in the market, and the remaining milk she sells in the neighborhood. This way, both are earning a healthy income to support their family. 

She shared the feeling of achievement she has from sending her children to school for better education. 

She is in her third loan cycle with the BRAC Pakistan. She has some past savings, and she has applied for a loan to purchase another buffalo for getting milk to sell. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to the kiva and to its field partner BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy a buffalo for getting milk to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married mother of six children, Anafe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen food and a general store. Anafe is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Anafe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married mother of six children, Anafe works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen food and a general store. Anafe is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

Anafe has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.
LOAN_USE: to buy a new engine for her fishing boat.

DESCRIPTION:
Nelida es una madre de familia de 30 años de edad que vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector Chequén del distrito de Chepén, una zona agrícola y comercial que pertenece a la provincia del mismo nombre, ubicado en la región La Libertad, la zona se encuentra ubicada a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Nelida percibe ingresos vendiendo artículos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su vivienda, allí ella pone al alcance de la mano de sus vecinos todo tipo de artículos de uso diario por los que tendrían que dirigirse hasta el mercado de la ciudad para adquirirlos. Este negocio es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia, ya que con los ingresos que percibe ayuda a su esposo con los gastos familiares.

Nelida desea adquirir mas productos parea ampliar sus ventas y satisfacer de mejor manera la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha solicitado por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Ella es una mujer trabajadora y entregada a su familia. Su mayor anhelo es a sus hijos convertidos en profesionales y hombres de bien. En la zona donde vive sus vecinos le tienen mucha estima y respeto.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nelida is a 30 year old wife and mother who lives with her husband and children in the Chequén sector of the Chepén district. This is a commercial and agricultural area that belongs to the province of the same name, located in the La Libertad region. The area is located one hour from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the Lambayeque region. Nelida receives income from selling basic necessity items and groceries in a store set up in her house. There she offers to her neighbors all types of items of everyday use that they would have to go to the city market to buy. This business is a big financial help for her family, since her income helps her husband with the family expenses. Nelida wants to acquire more products to increase her sales and satisfy her customers' demand better. That is why, for the first time, she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles to help her acheive her goal. She is a hardworking woman who is dedicated to her family. Her greatest wish is for her children to become professionals and good men. In the area where she lives her neighbors esteem and respect her very much.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: To buy basic neccesity products and groceries to expand her store.

DESCRIPTION:
Girlie is a married woman and she is 36 years old.

Girlie has a fishing business in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like fish nets, gasoline for her boat, and pay for the maintenance cost of her business.

Girlie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Girlie is a married woman and she is 36 years old.

Girlie has a fishing business in the Philippines and she requested a PHP 6,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase fishing materials like fish nets, gasoline for her boat, and pay for the maintenance cost of her business.

Girlie has been in this business for 10 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fishing materials like fish nets, gasoline for her boat, and pay for the maintenance cost of her business.

DESCRIPTION: Lawrence is a 39 years old and a married man. His wife is a business lady and they have five children with ages ranging form 6 years to 17 years old. He runs a cafe business where he sells soft drinks, bread and cakes to the passersby at the country bus station in Nairobi. He says the business is profitable and the major challenges he has are weather changes and lack of enough capital. \r\n\r\nLawrence has future hopes of owning a permanent store as well as giving a good education to his children. He describes himself as humble and aggressive.
LOAN_USE: To add stock of bread, cakes and soft drinks.

DESCRIPTION:
Sam is a family man. He is married and has four children whom are all attending school.

He is in the agricultural field, mainly growing coffee as his main source of income. However, given the fact that agriculture is a seasonal business, sometimes Sam finds it hard to raise enough income to provide for his family and to pay for his children's school fees.

Sam has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE to buy a motorcycle. This will fetch in some supplementary income that will improve his family's livelihood. Sam also intends to use the motorcycle to transport his coffee to the markets as it will reduce his operational costs.

Sam appreciates the support that will transform him and his family economically.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sam is a family man. He is married and has four children whom are all attending school.

He is in the agricultural field, mainly growing coffee as his main source of income. However, given the fact that agriculture is a seasonal business, sometimes Sam finds it hard to raise enough income to provide for his family and to pay for his children's school fees.

Sam has applied for a loan of 5,000,000 UGX from UGAFODE to buy a motorcycle. This will fetch in some supplementary income that will improve his family's livelihood. Sam also intends to use the motorcycle to transport his coffee to the markets as it will reduce his operational costs.

Sam appreciates the support that will transform him and his family economically.
LOAN_USE: to buy a motorcycle for transportation service.

DESCRIPTION: Benjamin is 29 years old. He is married to Emily and together they have two children aged six and four. He operates a retail shop and has been in the business for the past five years. \r\n\r\nThis is his first business loan from KADET Ltd. He will use the loan to purchase more rice, sugar and cooking oil for his shop. He hopes to open a boutique for his wife.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more rice, sugar and cooking oil for his shop.

DESCRIPTION: Marta  es un orgullosa campesino de 34  años de edad, una mujer honesta, humilde, sencilla, trabajadora dedicada a la cría de aves de corral,  actividad que heredó de su familia y que ha laborado de manera independiente por cerca de 5  años. Marta reside en el municipio de Chinu un sector en postconflicto que por la violencia vivida y los altos índices de pobreza hacen que la gestión represente mayor riesgo. El cliente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar de pollos y su alimentación, también ropa para dama y hombre.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marta is a proud farmer who is 34 years old and an honest, humble, simple hard worker dedicated to raising poultry, a living which was passed down from her family and which she has now been doing independently for close to five years.

Marta lives in the province of Chinu, a post-conflict area whose greatest management risks stem from continued violence and high rates of poverty. She is requesting a loan in order to buy chickens, feed, and clothing for men and women.
LOAN_USE: to buy chickens, feed, and clothing for men and women.

DESCRIPTION:
Sangita is from the small remote village Haspatalpara in Jalpaiguri district.  Her family consists of her husband Bhajan, aged 41 years, and their only son, who is a student in grade 1.  Sangita is 25 years old, a housewife and a bachelor's degree holder, whereas her husband studied up to grade 10. They live in their own brick-built house.

Sangita's husband is engaged in a small business of selling Ayurvedic medicine.  His father was an Ayurvedic doctor, who used to make medicine from different medicinal plants and herbs.  Sangita's husband learnt it from his father.  He also purchases the raw materials of Ayurvedic medicine from the wholesale medicine market.  He prepares the medicine in his house with the assistance of Sangita. They sell these medicines to the local medicine shops.  That is how they earn their livelihood.  With the growing increase in essential goods, they want to expand their business so that they can give financial sustenance to their family.  But they lack the capital.

Sangita has applied for a loan to purchase medicinal plants and herbs. She hopes it will help her to fulfill the local demand and earn more profit through her business.  She hopes to provide better education to her son which is her major priority.  Besides, the business will help her to give a secure life to them all.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sangita is from the small remote village Haspatalpara in Jalpaiguri district.  Her family consists of her husband Bhajan, aged 41 years, and their only son, who is a student in grade 1.  Sangita is 25 years old, a housewife and a bachelor's degree holder, whereas her husband studied up to grade 10. They live in their own brick-built house.

Sangita's husband is engaged in a small business of selling Ayurvedic medicine.  His father was an Ayurvedic doctor, who used to make medicine from different medicinal plants and herbs.  Sangita's husband learnt it from his father.  He also purchases the raw materials of Ayurvedic medicine from the wholesale medicine market.  He prepares the medicine in his house with the assistance of Sangita. They sell these medicines to the local medicine shops.  That is how they earn their livelihood.  With the growing increase in essential goods, they want to expand their business so that they can give financial sustenance to their family.  But they lack the capital.

Sangita has applied for a loan to purchase medicinal plants and herbs. She hopes it will help her to fulfill the local demand and earn more profit through her business.  She hopes to provide better education to her son which is her major priority.  Besides, the business will help her to give a secure life to them all.

She gives her hearty thanks to BJS and Kiva.
LOAN_USE: To purchase raw materials for their existing business of making Ayurvedic medicine.

DESCRIPTION:
Elena is a married woman with three children. She is 47 years old and lives in San Juan, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. Elena has been selling a variety of different vegetables to earn a living for the past two years. Each month, she earns 7,000 PHP from her business. 

Elena has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to procure more vegetables to sell. In 2011, she joined GDMPC. In the future, Elena wants to build a house and to help her children to complete their studies.
LOAN_USE: to procure more vegetables to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Rubina is a 32-year-old woman who established a low-cost school in a small community. She has vast experience teaching the students. At present, there are 123 students enrolled in the school, and 54% of them are female. The aim of Rubina's school is to help the students enjoy learning. Rubina wants her students to achieve highly and become confident individuals.

Currently, there is a lack of furniture and classrooms in Rubina's school. Thus, Rubina has requested a loan in the amount of 300,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase furniture and get more classrooms constructed in her school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rubina is a 32-year-old woman who established a low-cost school in a small community. She has vast experience teaching the students. At present, there are 123 students enrolled in the school, and 54% of them are female. The aim of Rubina's school is to help the students enjoy learning. Rubina wants her students to achieve highly and become confident individuals.

Currently, there is a lack of furniture and classrooms in Rubina's school. Thus, Rubina has requested a loan in the amount of 300,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to purchase furniture and get more classrooms constructed in her school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase furniture and get more classrooms constructed in the borrower's school.
TAGS: #Schooling, #Woman Owned Biz, #Female Education, #Biz Durable Asset, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION: Maria tiene 33 años de edad, madre soltera, se caracteriza por ser, humilde, trabajadora, sociable, tiene 2 hijos, Alex de 7 años que estudia y Anderson de 3 años que pasa junto a su madre, viven en el campo tras las montañas, carecen de servicios básicos, la necesidad y falta de trabajo la llevo  a tener sus propios cultivos de frutas tropicales, pero Maria necesita comprar, semillas, abonos, fertilizantes para mejorar su productividad, por eso, está pidiendo un apoyo de capital para seguir trabajando y generando un ingreso para su familia, a futuro quiere ampliar sus cultivos, educar a sus hijos, mejorar su estilo de vida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maria is 33 years old and a single mother. She is characterized by being humble, hard-working and sociable. She has 2 children: 7-year-old Alex who is in school, and 3-year-old Anderson who stays with his mother. They live in the countryside behind the mountains, where basic services are lacking.

The need and lack of work led Maria to start her own tropical fruit crops. However, she needs to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers to improve their productivity, so she is requesting the support of a loan to continue working and generating an income for her family.

In the future, Maria wants to expand her crops, educate her children and improve their lifestyle.
LOAN_USE: to purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers.
TAGS: volunteer_pick, #Single Parent, #Sustainable Ag, #Woman Owned Biz, volunteer_like, #Vegan, #Parent, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
Carmelita is a 68-year-old married woman who works very hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippine for eight years and sells a variety of items.

Carmelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Carmelita is a 68-year-old married woman who works very hard to provide for her family. She has run a general store in the Philippine for eight years and sells a variety of items.

Carmelita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries. She would like to save money to expand her business in the future.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell such as beverages, canned goods, snack foods and other groceries.

DESCRIPTION:
Mirvat is a 40 year-old Palestinian refugee living in an area which suffers from abject poverty. She is a married woman and a mother of four. Mirvat’s husband works as an accountant while she has her own business in a rented clothes and shoes store.

Mirvat is a previous borrower from Al Majmoua and this is her third time. Her previous loans helped her improve her business and family social conditions. She wishes to use this entrepreneur loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy new winter collection stock for her store.

By funding this loan you are extending your hand to this hardworking refugee who wishes to expand her business and improve her family’s social and economic conditions.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mirvat is a 40 year-old Palestinian refugee living in an area which suffers from abject poverty. She is a married woman and a mother of four. Mirvat’s husband works as an accountant while she has her own business in a rented clothes and shoes store.

Mirvat is a previous borrower from Al Majmoua and this is her third time. Her previous loans helped her improve her business and family social conditions. She wishes to use this entrepreneur loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy new winter collection stock for her store.

By funding this loan you are extending your hand to this hardworking refugee who wishes to expand her business and improve her family’s social and economic conditions.
LOAN_USE: to buy new winter collection stock for her store

DESCRIPTION:
Rocío del Pilar con 43 años de edad,de estado civil madre soltera,vive en casa su padre,junto a su hija y su padre,en el distrito de Cayaltí,provincia de Chiclayo,departamento de Lambayeque. Ella cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura,comercio y ganadería.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de bodega como arroz,azúcar,leche,aceite,etc,y la venta de alimentos,con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 8 años. Adicionalmente brinda servicios de limpieza a empresas. Solicita préstamo para la compra de productos para su bodega como detergente,aceite,fideos,etc. De esta manera obtendrá mayores ingresos.

Rocío del Pilar es socia recurrente para Edpyme Alternativa.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rocio del Pilar is 43 years of age, a single mother living with her daughter and father in his house in the district of Cayaltí province of Chiclayo, department of Lambayeque.

She has very good character references both personals and work related from the the inhabitants of the area.

The inhabitants of this town work mostly in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

She sells store products such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, etc., and food sales.  She has more than 8 years experience in the business. Additionally, she provides cleaning services to businesses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase products for her store such as detergent, oil, noodles, etc. This way she will earn better income.

Rocio del Pilar is a recurrent partner with Edpyme Alternativa.
LOAN_USE: to purchase products for her store such as detergent, oil, noodles, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Agnes is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Agnes is a married mother of four children, all of whom attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past five years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

DESCRIPTION: Santos, está ofreciendo a sus clientes mejor variedad de productos y teniendo mayores ganancias por la buena administración del financiamiento anterior, la familia se mantiene brindándole el apoyo necesario para continuar trabajando.\nCon el propósito de continuar creciendo con su negocio se decide a solicitar más capital para invertir en bebidas, golosinas, boquitas, jabón, detergentes y nuevos productos para suplir la demanda de sus clientes.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Santos is offering his customers a better variety of products, and having greater earning dues to the good management of his prior loan, the family continues enjoying the necessary support to continue working. With the purpose of continuing to grow his business, he has decided to request more capital to invest in drinks, candies, snacks, soap, detergents, and new products to satisfy the demand of his customers.
LOAN_USE: invest in drinks, candies, snacks, soap, detergents, and new products to satisfy the demand of his customers

DESCRIPTION: Katty Tatiana es una mujer colabora y perseverante, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa región de Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es madre de un hijo menor de edad , ella se dedica a la venta de kekes, golosinas, abarrotes y gaseosas, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es Topógrafo. Forma parte del Banco Comunal “Del Futuro” desde hace un  año.  El primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que le permitió invertir en gaseosas. En la actualidad Katty necesita un crédito de 1200 soles que le permitirá invertir en la compra de abarrotes en general para luego venderlo. La meta de Katty es surtir mejor su negocio y seguir apoyando a su esposo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Katty Tatiana is a helpful and persevering woman. She lives in the city of Pucallpa, in the Ucayali region. She is 20 years old and the mother of one young son. Her business is the sale of cakes, candies, groceries, and soft drinks. She counts on the support of her husband who is a topographer.

Katty has been a member of the “Del Futuro” communal bank for one year. Her first loan, for 300 soles, was used to invest in soft drinks. Now, Katty needs a loan of 1200 soles to invest in general grocery items.

Katty’s goal is to supply her business better and to continue supporting her husband.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Buy general grocery items

DESCRIPTION:
Dexi, tiene 49 años de edad, estudió hasta sexto grado, su esposo vive fuera del país, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 viven con ella y los demás ya están acompañados.

Dexi, se dedica a los oficios domésticos desde que estaba pequeña, además ella realiza crianza de aves de corral en su casa, ahí está al pendiente de sus animales y los alimentar.

Ella necesita el préstamo para comprar 100 pollos de engorde, ya que quiere iniciar su negocio de venta de pollos aliñados, también comprará concentrado.

Ella sueña con que le dé resultados su trabajo, ahorrar para que sus hijos estudien y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Dexi is 49 years old and studied until sixth grade. Her husband lives outside of the country and she has 4 children, two of which live with her and the others now live with partners.

Dexi has worked in domestic trades since she was little. In addition, she raises poultry at her home which is where her animals and feed are.

She needs a loan to purchase 100 fattening chickens, because she wants to start a business selling seasoned chickens; she will also purchase feed.

She dreams that her work will give her results to save so that her children study and have better living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to purchase 100 fattening chickens, because she wants to start a business selling seasoned chickens; she will also purchase feed.

DESCRIPTION:
S. was born in 1986 and is a married mother blessed with a young child. She currently works sewing clothes in a factory and gets a stable salary of $90 a month. She was busy with her job when the photo was taken, so her husband is pictured instead.

As another income source, S.’s husband has the skill of making wooden statues by hand and has been a local statue carver for years. S. saw that her husband’s carving business has provided her family with much income, so she hopes to upgrade this business to be more efficient by using a loan from Kiva through HKL.
LOAN_USE: To upgrade her husband's carving business

DESCRIPTION: Nasim is a 34-year-old married woman and mother of one child. She is motivated to provide everything for her family. That is why she has been running a general store with the support of her husband for a period of about two years. She offers a variety of grocery items at a reasonable price and has retained many customers who regularly shop at her store. She makes enough to provide for her family. To fully stock her store, she requested a loan for 20,000 PKR which she will use to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates. In this way, she will be able to meet the increasing demand consistently. She wishes to utilize part of her revenues to increase her business capital.
LOAN_USE: to buy rice, sugar and flour from the market at lower rates.

DESCRIPTION:
Betty (a 33-year-old mother of 2 pictured in her side hustle business) is a hardworking mother who lives in Eldoret. She is very determined and always desires to achieve. Betty has managed to educate all of her children with the profits she makes from farming.

The biggest problem that farmers from her village face is the huge deficit in terms of access to agricultural inputs. Meaning that those farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers from her village like Betty, can now buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Betty is humbly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer to improve her crop farm.

Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and improve the quality of life for her family. Betty hopes to improve the condition of her home.

Help this mother to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Betty (a 33-year-old mother of 2 pictured in her side hustle business) is a hardworking mother who lives in Eldoret. She is very determined and always desires to achieve. Betty has managed to educate all of her children with the profits she makes from farming.

The biggest problem that farmers from her village face is the huge deficit in terms of access to agricultural inputs. Meaning that those farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be. Juhudi Kilimo has partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers from her village like Betty, can now buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms.

Betty is humbly seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer to improve her crop farm.

Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her fill the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and improve the quality of life for her family. Betty hopes to improve the condition of her home.

Help this mother to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan!
LOAN_USE: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer to improve her crop farm.

DESCRIPTION: Cándida, 47 años de edad, originaria de León, madre de tres hijos de 25,22 y 20 años de edad respectivamente, se dedica a la venta de mariscos. Negocio que inicio ayudando a vender a su hermana, ella tenía 17 años de edad. Actualmente sobrevive  con la venta de mariscos en su humilde tramo el cual abre desde muy tempranas horas para recibir a sus clientes en busca de pescado fresco, camarones, conchas de cangrejo que son parte de las variedades de mariscos que vende. \nEstá solicitando el crédito para comprar pescado, cangrejos, conchas, camerones. Ya que entre mayor producto venda mejores serán los ingresos que espera recibir. Pues desea ampliar y mejorar la infraestructura de su local y ofrecer mariscos de calidad.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cándida is forty-seven years old and is a native of León.  She is a mother of three children, ages 25, 22, and 20.  She makes a living in selling seafood, a business that she got involved with at age seventeen by helping her sister make sales.  

Today, she survives by selling seafood in her humble locale, which she opens in the very early hours in order to receive customers who are in search of fresh fish, shrimp, shellfish, and crabs, which are some of the various types of seafood that she sells.  

She is requesting a loan in order to buy fish, crabs, shellfish, and shrimp.  With more and better products, she will be able to receive a greater income.  

She hopes to grow and improve the infrastructure of her neighborhood and to offer high-quality seafood.
LOAN_USE: to buy fish, crabs, shellfish, and shrimp.

DESCRIPTION:
Catherine’s story is that of an honest, single, hardworking warrior woman who gives everything to raise her children. With very few resources, she has pulled through.

Catherine is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from the Chuka area of Kenya. She is involved in dairy and maize/corn farming, and also has a side business. Her work brings home important income. She gets help with the work from her family members.

Catherine is humbly seeking a loan to purchase quality farm inputs. She will use the money to buy important supplies such as quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to manage weeds and preserve harvested produce. She also plans to use part of the money to pay laborers, loaders and transporters.

Catherine is optimistic that this year's harvest will be better than last season's. Income from the dairy business will be used to make the initial loan repayments until the crops are harvested and sold.

Most microfinance organizations, particularly in the Chuka area of Kenya, don’t give loans to smallholder farmers, but Juhudi Kilimo is different. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan smallholder farmers. Be inspired; make a loan!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Catherine’s story is that of an honest, single, hardworking warrior woman who gives everything to raise her children. With very few resources, she has pulled through.

Catherine is a responsible and diligent smallholder farmer from the Chuka area of Kenya. She is involved in dairy and maize/corn farming, and also has a side business. Her work brings home important income. She gets help with the work from her family members.

Catherine is humbly seeking a loan to purchase quality farm inputs. She will use the money to buy important supplies such as quality seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides to manage weeds and preserve harvested produce. She also plans to use part of the money to pay laborers, loaders and transporters.

Catherine is optimistic that this year's harvest will be better than last season's. Income from the dairy business will be used to make the initial loan repayments until the crops are harvested and sold.

Most microfinance organizations, particularly in the Chuka area of Kenya, don’t give loans to smallholder farmers, but Juhudi Kilimo is different. Juhudi Kilimo is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Kenyan smallholder farmers. Be inspired; make a loan!
LOAN_USE: to buy farm inputs such as seeds and quality fertilizers so a zealous mum can use the profits to improve her farm and pay tuition fees for her children.

DESCRIPTION:
Marife works hard to support five children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Marife requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Marife is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marife works hard to support five children. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines.

Marife requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

Marife is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is a very determined and hardworking lady. She is the mother of three children: two daughters and one son. All of her children are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. She operates a clothes-sewing business to pay for the school fees of her children so that they able to study without any difficulty. 

Her husband’s name is B. A. and he is a tailor by profession and runs a tailoring center in the community. Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is applying for a loan to buy another sewing machine so that her husband is able to grow his business.

Umm-e-Kalsoom baji is the group leader of four other women from her locality:

Bushra parveen baji wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop.

Syeda Tahzib baji wants a loan to buy items (table covers, a tent and chairs) for her catering business.

Sugran baji wants a loan to buy items (scissors, chairs) for her salon.

Ghulam Fatima baji wants a loan to buy vegetables to sell.
LOAN_USE: To buy another sewing machine for her husband's tailoring center
BORROWER_NAMES: Umm-e-Kalsoom, Syeda Tahzib, Bushra parveen, Ghulam Fatima, Sugran

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs Ngân is 55 years old and she is married with 4 children. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years. Ngân lives in Cam Thuy district, a mountain town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household, moreover this region often suffers natural disasters such as floods, drought.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a biogas system. But her income is not enough to get one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and the parts to build a biogas system.

This is Ngân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mrs Ngân is 55 years old and she is married with 4 children. She has worked in agriculture, raising poultry for more than 10 years. Ngân lives in Cam Thuy district, a mountain town in Thanh Hoa province. Her family is a low-income household, moreover this region often suffers natural disasters such as floods, drought.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a biogas system. But her income is not enough to get one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and the parts to build a biogas system.

This is Ngân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. Ngân hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sand, cement, brick and the parts to build a biogas system.

DESCRIPTION:
Naomi is a hardworking woman who represents the Noyaa group. She is married with two children.

Naomi sells food and is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as bags of rice, sugar, beans, and cooking oil. She has been in the food business for the past two years.

Both group members are working hard in order to improve their standards of living. With the profits from the business, Naomi would like to reinvest into the business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Naomi is a hardworking woman who represents the Noyaa group. She is married with two children.

Naomi sells food and is seeking a loan to purchase ingredients such as bags of rice, sugar, beans, and cooking oil. She has been in the food business for the past two years.

Both group members are working hard in order to improve their standards of living. With the profits from the business, Naomi would like to reinvest into the business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase ingredients such as bags of rice, sugar, beans, and cooking oil.

DESCRIPTION:
Gaudilia R. is from the village of San Ramon. She is 43 years old. Gaudilia is married and has 1 school-aged child. To make a living, Gaudilia owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gaudilia has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gaudilia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gaudilia is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gaudilia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

DESCRIPTION: Andrés es un joven que vive con su madre y su abuela. Hace algunos meses se dedica a laborar como operario en un taller de confecciones; actividad  que alterna con la venta de productos Amway, con el fin de generar ingresos adicionales para aportar económicamente a su hogar. El cliente es activo, dinámico, enérgico y se proyecta hacia el cumplimiento de sus metas; esto lo motiva para solicitar su primer ciclo de crédito, con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de surtido al por mayor (cremas corporales, shampoo, cremas faciales, suplementos vitamínicos, etc), de esta forma aprovechará los descuentos que obtiene por compras de contado, disminuyendo los costos de los artículos; lo que le permitirá aumentar su margen de utilidades, además tendrá más variedad de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes, lo que conlleva al incremento de las ventas y los ingresos; dándole la oportunidad de avanzar hacia el cumplimiento de su principal deseo, que es estudiar una carrera profesional, que le ofrezca a mediano plazo la posibilidad de labrarse un futuro próspero y exitoso, para seguir ayudando a su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Andrés is a young man who lives with his mother and grandmother. Some months ago he worked as a machinist in a clothing factory, which he alternated with his work selling Amway products so that he could earn an additional wage to financially support his household. He is active, dynamic, energetic and throws himself into achieving his goals. This is why he is asking for his first loan, in order to invest it in buying stock in bulk (body creams, shampoo, facial creams, vitamin supplements etc.). \r\n\r\nWith this loan, he can take advantage of the discounts for paying in cash, reducing the cost of the products, which will allow him to increase his profit margins, and also to have a wider variety of merchandise to offer his customers, which will bring increased sales and income. This will then give him the opportunity to advance towards achieving his biggest wish, which is to study for a professional career, which offers him the possibility in the medium-term to build a prosperous and successful future for himself, and so continue to help his family and improve the living conditions in his home.
LOAN_USE: to buy stock in bulk (body creams, shampoo, facial creams, vitamin supplements etc.)

DESCRIPTION: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 26 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto, el se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 4 años, vende sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de sulfato, semillas, insecticidas, herbicidas, formula, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra la fotografia y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The young man whose face has been pixelated, is 26 years of age and lives in a high risk area. He has earned a living from agriculture for 4 years, he sells his products in the surrounding villages and with his earnings he is able to cover some of the costs of his home. 

He lives in his own house with his life partner, and is asking for a loan to buy sulphate, seeds, insecticides, herbicides, formula etc. to improve his land which is shown in the photograph in order to earn a better income.
LOAN_USE: to buy sulphate, seeds, insecticides, herbicides, formula etc. to improve his land

DESCRIPTION:
Alberto M. is from the village of San Miguel, Manolo Fortich, Bukidnon. He is 36 years old. Alberto is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Alberto owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products and also running a mini-eatery in the local community. Alberto has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5500 PHP a month for these activities.

Alberto joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alberto is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Alberto from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the business.
