DESCRIPTION:
Thuong is 38 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and two children. She is a very responsible woman who, seeking to support her family, works selling tilapia. In addition to this, she works in agriculture, where her principal crops are vegetables that she then sells. These activities allow her to earn the necessary income to support the household.

Thuong, seeking to improve her business, is applying to QBWDF for a loan to invest in sand, cement, and rocks and pay for labor for the construction of a pond in order to increase the number of tilapia and in this way to increase her sales and thus also her earnings.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Thuong is 38 years old and lives in her own home along with her husband and two children. She is a very responsible woman who, seeking to support her family, works selling tilapia. In addition to this, she works in agriculture, where her principal crops are vegetables that she then sells. These activities allow her to earn the necessary income to support the household.

Thuong, seeking to improve her business, is applying to QBWDF for a loan to invest in sand, cement, and rocks and pay for labor for the construction of a pond in order to increase the number of tilapia and in this way to increase her sales and thus also her earnings.
LOAN_USE: to construct a pond to increase the number of tilapia to sell

DESCRIPTION: Mrs. Phi  is 55 years old. There are four people in her family. Fishing and raising chickens and pigs are her main sources of income, and she also has a vegetable garden. She can cover her family’s daily costs and education with her income from raising pigs. With this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mrs. Phi  is 55 years old. There are four people in her family. Fishing and raising chickens and pigs are her main sources of income, and she also has a vegetable garden. She can cover her family’s daily costs and education with her income from raising pigs. With this loan, she will be able to build a hygienic latrine to improve the health of her family members, especially the kids.
LOAN_USE: to build a latrine to improve the health of her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Isaac is 66 years old and has 9 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Sirisia District, Kenya.

Isaac has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely as a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and, although he described his last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Isaac also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Isaac 's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Isaac is 66 years old and has 9 children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 10 farmers in Sirisia District, Kenya.

Isaac has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely as a result of his desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds, and, although he described his last harvest as poor due to bad weather conditions, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund.

Isaac also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Isaac 's Group will be able to receive a total of 6 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
BORROWER_NAMES: Edikai, Bramwel, Rose, Sylvia, Benson, George, Edward, James, Pauline, Isaac
BORROWER_GENDERS: male, male, female, female, male, male, male, male, female, male
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Irina is divorced with two children. She runs a small business selling shoes and leather goods at the central market in Melitopol. She has been in this business for 11 years. Presently her monthly revenue is $900, and her net profit amounts to $370 a month. Her good reputation and customer-friendly service have a very positive impact on her business.

Lending services from “Nadiya Ukraine” have helped promote the growth of Irina’s business. She hasn’t had a single late payment on any loan. Available funding has enabled Irina to increase her business income, allowing her to improve the quality of her family’s life.

Irina is requesting a loan for $400 to purchase an assortment of bags in bulk to sell in her kiosk. She is planning to buy luggage items, handbags, satchels, and purses that are in high demand during this season of vacations. Eventually, Irina would like to use some of her profits to meet a few specific needs for her family. Her responsibility, stable business growth, and prompt payment record characterize Irina as a consistent and serious entrepreneur capable of loan repayment.
LOAN_USE: To increase on stock

DESCRIPTION:
Fiorella Lizbeth es una mujer de 26 años de edad, casada y con 2 hijos. Tiene domicilio en el sector de La Matanza, en la zona urbana. Ella cuenta con buenas referencias personales y laborales.
Se dedica a la comercialización de abarrotes en la bodega que tiene en su casa, para todo el sector de La Matanza y zonas aledañas. Todas las personas que comercializan abarrotes lo hacen en sus casas debido a que no existe un mercado general.
El monto del préstamo solicitado es de 2010 nuevos soles, los cuales se invertirán en la compra de abarrotes como arroz, y muebles para la exhibición de la mercadería, como un andamio y un mostrador, ya que así incitará a los clientes a ir a su bodega ya que con esos muebles y la ambientación correspondiente, se hace más vistosa la visita.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Fiorella Lizbeth is 26 years old, married, and has two children. Her home is in the urban area of La Matanza. She has good personal and professional references.

She sells groceries in the bodega in her house to people throughout La Matanza and the outlying areas. All the people who sell groceries do so from their homes because there is no general market.
 
The amount of the loan she is requesting is 2010 nuevos soles, which she will use to buy groceries, such as rice, and fixtures to showcase her merchandise, such as a shelf and a counter. This will encourage customers to come to her bodega, as the merchandise fixtures and the atmosphere will make their visits brighter.
LOAN_USE: to buy merchandise to expand her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Saran, 53 years old, is a widow and mother of four children living in the Sdok Pravoek Village, Sdok Pravoek Commune, Rokhak Kiri District, Battambang Province. She is a farmer and all her children also help her in her career. The farming business is the main income for her family. Currently, they're earning a net income of about USD 10.50 per day.

Saran wants to build a decent latrine for her daily usage. Based on her income, she cannot afford it. Now she is requesting a loan from Kiva through its partner HKL, which she will use for building the latrine. This first loan will provide good health to her family, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She would like to express her thanks to all lenders for their kindness, sharing their finances with all poor people around the world, especially her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Saran, 53 years old, is a widow and mother of four children living in the Sdok Pravoek Village, Sdok Pravoek Commune, Rokhak Kiri District, Battambang Province. She is a farmer and all her children also help her in her career. The farming business is the main income for her family. Currently, they're earning a net income of about USD 10.50 per day.

Saran wants to build a decent latrine for her daily usage. Based on her income, she cannot afford it. Now she is requesting a loan from Kiva through its partner HKL, which she will use for building the latrine. This first loan will provide good health to her family, and help to lessen environmental deterioration.

She would like to express her thanks to all lenders for their kindness, sharing their finances with all poor people around the world, especially her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a new latrine

DESCRIPTION:
Belinda T. is from the village of Puli, Canitoan, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 50 years old. Belinda is married and has 6 adult children. To make a living, Belinda owns and operates a 'sari-sari' (variety) retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Belinda has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Belinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Belinda is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Belinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional products to sell
TOWN_NAME: Canito-an, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

DESCRIPTION:
Jenelyn, 36, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jenelyn, 36, is a married woman with four children, three of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenelyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years.

Jenelyn requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase groceries to sell in her general store.

In the future, Jenelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to purchase groceries to sell in her general store

DESCRIPTION:
Susan is a widowed woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Susan is a widowed woman. She has 5 children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are the general public. 

She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to excel within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank; her previous loan was repaid successfully.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stock of cereals

DESCRIPTION:
Jane is 44, single in Clarin Tudela. She runs a store that primarily supports her family. Jane is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default.

She took another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jane is 44, single in Clarin Tudela. She runs a store that primarily supports her family. Jane is a full fledged member of PMPC and has took several loans already. She religiously paid her obligations without records of default.

She took another loan to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell. Having enough inventory will mean income opportunities.In the future, she dreams of sustaining her store to continuously provide for her family.
LOAN_USE: to pay for inventories of sugar, milk, oil, noodles to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Sharame works hard to support her family. Sharame is married and has a fish and seafood vending business in the Philippines.

Sharame requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and seafood to sell.

Sharame has been in this business for six years now.

Sharame would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sharame works hard to support her family. Sharame is married and has a fish and seafood vending business in the Philippines.

Sharame requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fish and seafood to sell.

Sharame has been in this business for six years now.

Sharame would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more fish and seafood to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Jemary is 27 years old with two children, aged 4 and 7. Living in Carmen, Cebu, is not easy for her.

She is engaged in weaving abaca fiber to earn a living. While she provides for her family, improving her household has been a challenge for her.

She is asking a loan to buy a toilet bowl, PVC elbow, bamboo, nails, gravel, sand, deformed steel bar, cement, wire, plywood and hollow blocks.

If they can have their own toilet, they will not have to go far to relieve themselves, especially if they are not feeling well. Jemary hopes for this loan so that she can give her family a more comfortable life.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jemary is 27 years old with two children, aged 4 and 7. Living in Carmen, Cebu, is not easy for her.

She is engaged in weaving abaca fiber to earn a living. While she provides for her family, improving her household has been a challenge for her.

She is asking a loan to buy a toilet bowl, PVC elbow, bamboo, nails, gravel, sand, deformed steel bar, cement, wire, plywood and hollow blocks.

If they can have their own toilet, they will not have to go far to relieve themselves, especially if they are not feeling well. Jemary hopes for this loan so that she can give her family a more comfortable life.
LOAN_USE: to buy a toilet bowl, PVC elbow, bamboo, nails, gravel, sand, deformed steel bar, cement, wire, plywood and hollow blocks.

DESCRIPTION:
Cada una de las integrantes de este grupo tienen sus emprendimientos, luchan por sus familias y luchan por salir adelante. Están además dentro del programa de la pobreza.
Entre ellas es digna de mencionar a la señora Benita, quien es una señora ejemplar, trabajadora y de muy buenas referencias, ella se dedica a la producción y venta de leche, tiene sus propios animales y también se dedica a la venta ambulante de todo tipo de productos. Menciona que su trabajo le ha permitido poder ayudar a su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar alimentos para sus animales, para poder seguir con su producción de leche y de esa forma poder seguir con su trabajo.
Obs.: En la foto aparece únicamente una persona, pero este préstamo es grupal, no fue posible la foto grupal para evitar la aglomeración de personas por la pandemia del Covid-19.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Each one of these group members has their own enterprise. They fight for their families and to get ahead. They are also in the poverty program.

It is worth noting Benita from among them, who is an exemplary and hardworking woman with excellent references. She works making and selling milk; she has her own animals. She also works as a mobile vendor, selling all kinds of products. She says that her work has allowed her to be able to help her family and give them a better quality of life.

She is asking for this loan to be able to buy animal feed so that she can continue with her milk production and, in this way, keep her work going.

Note: Only one person appears in the photo, but this is a group loan. A group photo wasn’t possible due to the COVID-19 pandemic, in order to avoid gathering a crowd.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed for animals.
BORROWER_NAMES: Blanca, Daysi, Luisa, Liz, Benita, Noelia, Asuncion, Liz, Romina, Maria, Elsa, Estela, Maria, Noelia, Nancy, Maria
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Rafoat is a hospitable woman. She was born and grew up in a rural area, and now lives in a small town. She is widow and has four children. 

She works as a seamstress. She is a very responsible, brave, patience and cheerful person. 

She requested financial support to buy carpet and blinds. 

Rafoat is thankful for KIVA's support and awaits your mercy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rafoat is a hospitable woman. She was born and grew up in a rural area, and now lives in a small town. She is widow and has four children. 

She works as a seamstress. She is a very responsible, brave, patience and cheerful person. 

She requested financial support to buy carpet and blinds. 

Rafoat is thankful for KIVA's support and awaits your mercy.
LOAN_USE: to buy carpet and blinds

DESCRIPTION:
Elizabeth is 38 years old and has a live-in partner and three children. With two children still in school, Elizabeth works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items, such as canned goods, snack foods, noodles, bread, and coffee.  

Elizabeth has requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell in her general store. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more items to sell in her general store

DESCRIPTION: Jihad, a 26-year-old who lives in Beirut, Lebanon with his wife and their child, has known how to cut hair perfectly since he was 20. Upon seeing that he did it very well, he decided to establish his own barber shop five years ago. In order to open his own shop, he received the help of his father, who has been very supportive. In the future he plans to expand his shop in order to accommodate more customers and earn more. Jihad is now requesting a loan to buy certain products and tools that he needs for his business. This is the first time that he has requested a loan and is happy for the opportunity Kiva lenders are giving him. For the future, he hopes that he can continue improving his business.
LOAN_USE: To buy products and tools.

DESCRIPTION:
Merlinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Merlinda is married and she works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by a fishing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store and raising livestock. Merlinda is borrowing PHP 22,000 through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Merlinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 18 loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

DESCRIPTION:
Allen is 32 years old and lives in the town of Ibanda in the  region of Mbarara in Uganda. She is married and has two children who are currently in school. For the past five years, Allen has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes and materials. 

To help expand her business, Allen has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock and buy more clothes, and will help Allen to generate greater profits and improve her income, which is used for family support and school fees. 

Allen hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a bigger boutique. 

Allen is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Allen who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.
LOAN_USE: to increase her stock and buy more clothes

DESCRIPTION:
Sylvia is 41 years old, married, and has one child in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Sylvia has a variety store business in the Philippines. Sylvia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more goods like canned goods, detergent and other groceries.

Sylvia has been in this business for five years.  In the future, Sylvia would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her child to college and improve her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more goods like canned goods, detergent and other groceries.

DESCRIPTION:
Eva P. is currently in the business of selling charcoal at home and is requesting a loan to purchase more bags of charcoal to sell. Eva is 34 years old and is married with a husband who is a teacher. She has three children and they go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a permanent house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.
LOAN_USE: To purchase more bags of charcoal to sell.

DESCRIPTION: María Esperanza tiene la edad de 44 años, su estado civil es soltera, la actividad económica de Doña María es la venta de refrescos naturales, venta de hielo y venta de gaseosas. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda. Doña María tiene mas de 5 años de dedicarse a este negocio, por lo que inicio con capital propio pero con el paso del tiempo decidió vender gaseosa, hielo y bolsitas. Los propósitos de Doña María son de seguir aumentando la producción de refrescos naturales ya que así dará satisfacción a la demanda de sus clientes. Es por eso que Doña María recurre al financiamiento con la ayuda de Fundación León 2000 para invertirlo en capital de trabajo como frutas, bolsas plásticas, azúcar y la compra de gaseosas. Los deseos de Doña María son de proporcionar estabilidad con su negocio por lo que la situación del país es cada vez más difícil. Es por eso que solicita la cantidad de C$ 3.000 córdobas.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maria Esperanza is 44 years old and single. She sells juices, ice and soft drinks out of her home. Maria has been doing this for more than 5 years. She began with her own capital and with the passing of time began selling soft drinks, ice and bags. Maria plans on increasing her production of natural juices to satisfy the demand for this product. It is for this reason that Maria is seeking a loan through Fundacion Leon 2000, that she will invest in working capital like fruit, plastic bags, sugar and soft drinks. Maria hopes to gain stabaility through her business because the situation in her country is becoming more and more difficult. She is asking for C$3,000 cordobas.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: fruit, soft drinks

DESCRIPTION:
Long is 53 years old and married with three children.

Long lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp for more than 10 years. She is very worried about her profession because her income is very low and she can hardly meet her household expenses.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine, but her income is not enough to get a new one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Long's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Long hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Long is 53 years old and married with three children.

Long lives in Hoang Hoa district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling shrimp for more than 10 years. She is very worried about her profession because her income is very low and she can hardly meet her household expenses.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a latrine, but her income is not enough to get a new one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Long's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

With her business profit, Long hopes to maintain a successful business, for her business to do well, and for her family to be healthy and happy.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sand, cement, brick, and equipment to build a toilet.

DESCRIPTION: Akohodé est née le 28 Avril 1976 et est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Akohodé est mariée à Nazaire. Le couple supporte ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Il y a juste un an que Akohodé et sa famille se sont installés à Ekpè Dandji, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Akohodé n'est jamais allée à l'école. Afin de subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Akohodé vend divers produits (biscuits, etc.) et du charbon de bois à son domicile. Akohodé achète ses produits à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin. Akohodé mène cette activité depuis huit ans et a déjà obtenu deux crédits qui ont été tous bien remboursés auprès de ALIDé. Ce troisième prêt permettra certainement à Akohodé d’élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Akohodé is born April 28, 1976, and is the mother of four children, who all attend school. Akohodé is married to Nazaire. The couple takes care of the various family duties together. Just a year ago, Akohodé and her family settled in Ekpe Dandji, in the township of Seme-Podji. Akohodé never went to school. In order to provide for her needs and those of her children, Akohodé sells various products (cookies, etc.) and charcoal from her home. Akohodé purchases her products in Dantokpa, Benin's international market. Akohodé has been active in this business for eight years, and has already been granted two loans, which both were repaid to ALIDé. This third loan will certainly make it possible for Akohodé to raise her level of activity and better satisfy her customers.
LOAN_USE: to purchase charcoal and various food products (cookies, etc.)

DESCRIPTION: Enma es Lic. en economía, labora en una empresa privada como encargada de compras, es madre de 1 hijo de 2 añitos, Enma  atraviesa con una dificultad el cual es el techo de su vivienda que con las lluvias que están cayendo durante la temporada de invierno el agua se mete al interior de su casa causando molestias e incomodidad, por lo que solicita el crédito para reparar el techo, con esta mejora la clienta considera estar más tranquila junto a su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Enma is a graduate of economics and works in a private company as purchasing manager. She is mother to one child who is just two years old. Enma is facing a problem with the roof of her home. With the rain that falls during the winter season, water gets inside her house, causing annoyances and discomfort. 

For this reason she is requesting a loan to repair the roof. With this improvement, the client believes that she and her family will be more at peace.
LOAN_USE: to buy zinc sheets and purlins.

DESCRIPTION:
Huda makes toys and sells clothes. She is 24 years old and single. Her business is her source of income and she helps her parents with her profits. A portion of her profits are used to buy material for the making of toys.

Her mother taught her how to make toys. Huda makes toys by demand from stores and sells clothes by demand from neighbors and friends. She wishes to open a big store to conduct her business there.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Huda makes toys and sells clothes. She is 24 years old and single. Her business is her source of income and she helps her parents with her profits. A portion of her profits are used to buy material for the making of toys.

Her mother taught her how to make toys. Huda makes toys by demand from stores and sells clothes by demand from neighbors and friends. She wishes to open a big store to conduct her business there.
LOAN_USE: to buy material for her toy making business and clothes to sell to make an income to support her parents.

DESCRIPTION:
Lolita M. is 27 years old.  Her husband Pepito is a construction worker and a farmer. They have two children: Joanna, 22 years old, college under graduate and Jonalyn, 19 years old, a college student taking a biology course. They live in the simple village of Pilitan, Tumauini, Isabela, a place rich in agricultural land and most of their products are corn, tobacco and vegetables. Lolita also shares that her family is doing well despite the hardships that they are experiencing.

Rice mill is their family business.  She helps her husband in maintaining the business to sustain their basic needs and education of their daughter.  With her desire to help her husband in their rice mill, she is borrowing a loan of PHP 3,000.00 that they will use for business operations and buy some spare parts for the machine.  Part of the loan will also be used in her fish vending business.  She plans to buy at least 10 kilos of fish for additional income that will support not only their family needs but also to support their businesses.  

She is hoping that through their income, they can support the education of their youngest child until college.
LOAN_USE: Business operations and for fish vending

DESCRIPTION:
Myrna is 61 years old and married with three children. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Myrna is 61 years old and married with three children. Myrna works very hard to provide for them.

Myrna runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Myrna has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future, Myrna would like to save enough money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more groceries to sell

DESCRIPTION:
El grupo solidario CARIBEAN GIRL está conformado por 3 mujeres emprendedoras (Jeammie Eugenia, Liza Merly y Nora Isabel), viven en la ciudad de Bilwi; se unieron hace 8 meses con el propósito de trabajar de manera solidaria para poder acceder a préstamos en Pana Pana  para poder tener la oportunidad de mejorar sus pequeños negocios de: venta de mariscos, ropa usada y pulperia, mejorar sus ingresos y así mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias.

Con el segundo crédito otorgado por Pana Pana y financiado por Kiva, le permitieron a las 3 integrantes del grupo solidario diversificar la oferta de productos que venden, por ejemplo  a Jeammie Eugenia, compro insumos e ingredientes para elaborar vigoron y comprar mariscos y pescados para incrementar sus ingresos al vender de manera ambulante.

Jeammie Eugenia: Es la coordinadora del grupo solidario, es una joven cordial de 25 años de edad, madre soltera de una pequeña hija de 3 años de edad. Con el propósito de sacar adelante a su familia y contar con su propia fuente de ingresos, desde hace 3 años vende de manera ambulante vigoron, fritos, mariscos y pescados. Solicita financiamiento para diversificar sus productos y comprar en Managua una paca de ropa usada. Su sueño es tener su propia vivienda, actualmente habita en una vivienda de familiares.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The CARIBEAN GIRL group is made up of three entrepreneurial women (Jeammie Eugenia, Liza Merly y Nora Isabel) who live in the city of Bilwi. They formed 8 months ago with the aim of working together to be able to access Pana Pana loans to have the opportunity to improve their small businesses (selling seafood, used clothing and a grocery store), improve their income and thus improve the quality of life of their families.

The second loan granted by Pana Pana and financed by Kiva, allowed the three group members to widen the range of products that they sell. For example Jeammie Eugenia bought supplies and ingredients to make vigoron (a Nicaraguan fast food dish) and buy seafood and fish to increase her income on selling them as a street vendor.

Jeammie Eugenia is the coordinator of the group. She is a friendly young woman, 25 years old, and is the single mother of a small three year old daughter. With the aim of helping her family get ahead and being able to count on her own source of income, for three years she has sold vigoron, fried food, seafood and fish as a street vendor. She is asking for a loan to be able to diversify her products and buy a bale of used clothing in Managua. Her dream is to have her own house, as she currently lives in the house of relatives.
LOAN_USE: to buy a bale of used clothing in Managua.
BORROWER_NAMES: NORA ISABEL, LIZA MERLY, JEAMMIE EUGENIA

DESCRIPTION:
Ruby Ann is 31 years old and has four children. Ruby Ann is a woman and has two children who are still in school.

Ruby Ann is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruby Ann requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ruby Ann has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ruby Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ruby Ann is 31 years old and has four children. Ruby Ann is a woman and has two children who are still in school.

Ruby Ann is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Ruby Ann requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Ruby Ann has been raising pigs for 3 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ruby Ann would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

DESCRIPTION:
Ane is a 61-year-old mother with 8 children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years.

Ane needs a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, chemicals, a bag pack sprayer, to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ane is a 61-year-old mother with 8 children. She runs a small business selling taro and banana in her village to earn a living. She has been doing this for more than 3 years.

Ane needs a loan to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, chemicals, a bag pack sprayer, to help her run the business.

She hopes to use her profit to expand her business and provide for her family's needs. She became a member of SPBD in 2015.
LOAN_USE: to buy taro roots (seedlings), banana tubes (seedlings), a wheelbarrow, a rake, a shovel, a water tank, chemicals, a bag pack sprayer.
TAGS: #Trees, user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset, #Elderly, user_favorite, #Parent, #Woman Owned Biz

DESCRIPTION: Jason es un joven de 26 años de edad, padre de familia y muy trabajador, nos  comenta que su anhelo es reparar su vivenda para evitar el pago de alquiler y aprovechar sus ingresos en otras prioridades, necesita reparar gran parte de su casa, para que quede habitable, debe cambiar el techo,reparar algunas paredes, arreglar el piso, hacer aceras y otros arreglos, para lo0garr easto solicita un millón de colones exactos (¢1.000.000, con este dinero comprará ceemento, zinc. piedra, arena, madera, clavos , etc. Nos cuenta Jason que se siente muy feliz con este financiamiento, ya que le urge repara su vivienda.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Jason is 26 years old and is a father, and a very hard-working one.  Jason tells us that his biggest desire is to repair his home so that he does not have to pay rent and so that his income can be spent on other important things.  He needs to repair a big part of the house so that it can remain habitable.  He must change the roof, repair some walls, fix the floor and pavement and do other bits of work.  For this, Jason is applying for a loan of 1,000,000 Colons, which he will use to buy cement, zinc, stone, sand, wood nails and more.  Jason tells us that he is very happy with this loan as he really needs to do these home repairs.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy building materials.

DESCRIPTION:
Robert is requesting a loan to repair his motorcycle. He rides a motorcycle for transport business. He has been in the business for 4 years.

He started the business to earn a living. He also started raring pigs to earn more income and they are doing well. He dreams of buying more motorcycles to expand his business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Robert is requesting a loan to repair his motorcycle. He rides a motorcycle for transport business. He has been in the business for 4 years.

He started the business to earn a living. He also started raring pigs to earn more income and they are doing well. He dreams of buying more motorcycles to expand his business.
LOAN_USE: to repair his motorcycle.

DESCRIPTION:
Vaituutuu is a 52 year old widow with 5 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 7 years.

She has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Vaituutuu is a 52 year old widow with 5 children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for 7 years.

She has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

She joined SPBD in 2010 to gain access to financial services.
LOAN_USE: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, wooden carved designs and a new tape

DESCRIPTION:
Bibiane is a 41-year-old married woman. She has 8 children with ages ranging from 13 years to 19 years. She describes herself as business minded. 

She will use the KES 26,500 loan to buy a 4000 litre tank for water storage that will benefit 13 people. They will be able to store clean water for domestic use. 

She hopes that in the future she will be a wholesaler. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.
LOAN_USE: buy a 4,000 litre water tank.

DESCRIPTION:
Назгул 39 лет, воспитывает 2 детей.   В поисках дохода для своей семьи, в 1998 году Назгул начала свой бизнес в животноводстве, стартовав с  суммы в 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному и настойчивому труду Назгул, ее хозяйство на сегодня приносит  около 15,000 сом (KGS) ежемесячной прибыли с продажи молочных  и мясных продуктов. 
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Назгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 55,000 сом (KGS)  на покупку скота на откорм и перепродажу. Доходы от кредита Назгул планирует вложить в увеличение бизнеса.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Nazgul is 39 years old and raising two children.  In search of a source of income for her family, she started her own business in animal husbandry in 1998 with an initial sum of 25,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to Nazgul's persistent and hard work, today her business yields about 15,000 som (KGS) in monthly profit from sales of milk and meat products.  In order to further develop her business, Nazgul requested a loan in the amount of 55,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock for fattening up and resale.  She plans to invest the earnings from the loan into expanding her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase livestock

DESCRIPTION: Lydia thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Lydia has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Lydia wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Lydia thought she was in the right place when she joined the microfinance group of Paglaum MPC. She decided to give it a try after she learned she can avail financial assistance for her chosen business. Lydia has maintained her membership in good standing without records of default up to this day. She has taken several loans and all were paid in a timely manner. Recently, she availed a loan to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins for her chosen business. Lydia wishes to continuously manage her business more effectively with the support of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase bags of feed and animal vitamins.

DESCRIPTION:
Ma. Leah works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to invest in a SANITARY TOILET.

Ma. Leah is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ma. Leah works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to invest in a SANITARY TOILET.

Ma. Leah is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Tình is 40 years old and married with two children. She's an ethnic minority living in Nhu Thanh district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province, very far from the center. She speaks ethnic minority languages and rarely goes out of the village, so she has no opportunity to access financial services.

She has farmed\xa0food for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and her work is unstable.

One of the most critical difficulties concerning Tình is that the latrine is not hygienic. But her income isn't enough to get a new one. She's requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house and for her business to do well.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

She has farmed\xa0food for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village, and her work is unstable.

One of the most critical difficulties concerning Tình is that the latrine is not hygienic. But her income isn't enough to get a new one. She's requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

This is Tình's first loan with Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution. Tình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house and for her business to do well.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet.

DESCRIPTION:
Virginia is 65 years old and has eight children. Virginia is a married woman.

Virginia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested an 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virginia has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Virginia is 65 years old and has eight children. Virginia is a married woman.

Virginia is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. Virginia requested an 11000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Virginia has been in this business for 20 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock

DESCRIPTION:
Elma is 43 years old and has three children. Elma is married and has two children who are in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business farming vegetable in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elma is 43 years old and has three children. Elma is married and has two children who are in school.

Elma is in the agricultural business farming vegetable in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Elma has been in this business for 5 years now, and has borrowed 5 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

DESCRIPTION:
Nguyên is forty years old, married and has two children. His family is a low-income household in a rural village in Trieu Son District within Thanh Hoa Province. For the past eight years he has raised poultry to make a living, but his livelihood is not a stable one.

One of Nguyên’s most critical concerns is that the family’s latrine is not hygienic, but his income is not sufficient to build a new one without financial assistance. So he has applied for a 20,000,000 VND loan through Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa to buy sand, cement, bricks and other materials to do so. (This will be Nguyên’s first loan with Thanh Hoa.) He hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, his children to do well in school and to build a new house someday.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nguyên is forty years old, married and has two children. His family is a low-income household in a rural village in Trieu Son District within Thanh Hoa Province. For the past eight years he has raised poultry to make a living, but his livelihood is not a stable one.

One of Nguyên’s most critical concerns is that the family’s latrine is not hygienic, but his income is not sufficient to build a new one without financial assistance. So he has applied for a 20,000,000 VND loan through Kiva's field partner Thanh Hoa to buy sand, cement, bricks and other materials to do so. (This will be Nguyên’s first loan with Thanh Hoa.) He hopes for his family to be healthy and happy, his children to do well in school and to build a new house someday.
LOAN_USE: to buy sand, cement, bricks and other materials to build a hygienic toilet for Nguyên’s family.
TAGS: #First Loan, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Eco-friendly, #Parent, user_favorite, #Health and Sanitation

DESCRIPTION:
Senhora Elisa é casada e mãe de 1 filha independente, é negociante e possui uma boutique e salão de cabeleireiro, importa cabelos da India  para revenda, vive  em casa própria com a sua família.
O montante financiado será aplicado para a compra de cabelos e cosméticos em China para revender no seu estabelecimento.
No futuro pretende abrir um novo salão de cabeleireiro que esta em fase de construção e é mais espaçoso e convidativo.
O seu desafio é de crescer no seu negócio de modo a tornar empresaria neste ramo e liquidar o empréstimo sem entrar em mora de modo a garantir futuros financiamentos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elisa is married and has a daughter who is independent. She is a retailer and has a boutique and hair salon. She imports hair from India to re-sell, and she lives in a house she owns with her family.
The amount financed will be used to buy hair and cosmetics from China to re-sell at her commercial establishment.
In the future she intends to open a new hair salon that is in the construction phase and is more spacious and inviting.
Her challenge is to grow in her business in order to become an established businesswoman in this area, and to pay off the loan without getting behind in her payments in order to guarantee future financing.
LOAN_USE: Elisa to buy hair and cosmetics from China to re-sell at her commercial establishment.

DESCRIPTION: Mirador de San Isidro es un grupo formado por 4 mujeres trabajadores y responsable, coordinado por la señora Raquel  de 35 años que tiene un negocio de venta de fritanga desde hace más de 10 años con ayuda de su mamá y esta es la 10ma vez que hacen un préstamo a los socios de KIVA ya que afirman tener un crecimiento en su negocio y quiere expandirse vendiendo granos básicos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar y de mas para crecer, las demás integrantes son: Yamileth de 50 años que vende ropa, Rosa de 44 años vende comida y Iraida de 44 años vende fritanga y ropa.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
“Mirador de San Isidro” is a group that consists four hardworking and responsible women. The group coordinator is Sra. Raquel. She is 35 years old and has a business of selling fried foods. Raquel has been managing this business for more than 10 years with the help of her mother. This is the second time she has received a loan from the Kiva lenders. She says that her business has grown and now she wants to expand by selling basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, and other products.

The other members are as follows:
•\tYamileth is 50 years old and sells clothes.
•\tRosa is 44 years old and sells food.
•\tIraida is 44 years old and sells fried foods and clothes.
LOAN_USE: to buy basic staples such as rice, beans, sugar, and other products to sell.
BORROWER_NAMES: Iraida Maria , Raquel del Carmen, Yamileth del Carmen, Rosa Maria

DESCRIPTION:
Bình is 28 years old and married with two children. Bình lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling\xa0fish for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to provide comfort in her life.

In 2016, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

The main hardship that Bình faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to obtain fish for sale.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Bình is 28 years old and married with two children. Bình lives in Tinh Gia district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has operated a food stall/restaurant selling\xa0fish for more than 10 years. Her family is a low-income household in the village; moreover, the income from this business is not high enough to do what she really needs to provide comfort in her life.

In 2016, Bình joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid two loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance Institution.

The main hardship that Bình faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan to purchase tools to obtain fish for sale.

With her business profit, Bình hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, to build a new house, and for her business to do well.
LOAN_USE: to purchase tools to obtain fish for sale.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of seven children, Elinita works hard to support her family. She runs a business selling nipa palm mats in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Elinita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF.

Elinita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nipa palm leaves and other needed supplies for her mat vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of seven children, Elinita works hard to support her family. She runs a business selling nipa palm mats in the Philippines and also earns additional income from fish vending. Elinita has been sustaining her business activities through her past loans from NWTF.

Elinita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy nipa palm leaves and other needed supplies for her mat vending business. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy nipa palm leaves and supplies for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Shazia, 32, is married and the responsible mother of two children. The family lives in the region of Lahore, Pakistan.

Shazia’s husband is a factory worker, but he also has cows that produce milk which Shazia sells in her neighborhood. Through breeding his cows, her husband has been increasing his herd over the years. Shazia, however, wants to buy an additional cow so she will have more milk to sell. Due to a lack of capital, though, she is unable to buy one.

So Shazia has now applied for a 80,000 PKR loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy another cow. She hopes that she will be able to see her dairy grow. She wants to give thanks to Kiva’s lenders and BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Shazia, 32, is married and the responsible mother of two children. The family lives in the region of Lahore, Pakistan.

Shazia’s husband is a factory worker, but he also has cows that produce milk which Shazia sells in her neighborhood. Through breeding his cows, her husband has been increasing his herd over the years. Shazia, however, wants to buy an additional cow so she will have more milk to sell. Due to a lack of capital, though, she is unable to buy one.

So Shazia has now applied for a 80,000 PKR loan through Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan to buy another cow. She hopes that she will be able to see her dairy grow. She wants to give thanks to Kiva’s lenders and BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy another cow for the family's dairy so she will have more milk to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Terry is 28 years old and a single young woman with two children. She has a small garden where she grows cabbages, tomatoes, cucumbers, and green beans that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Terry needs a loan to buy rakes, bush knives, seeds, chemicals, and a wheelbarrow. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. Terry will use the profits from her sales to improve her business and support her children's future education.
LOAN_USE: to pay for rakes, bush knives, seeds, chemicals, and a wheelbarrow.

DESCRIPTION:
Maria Shena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails, paint, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Ma. Shena has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Ma. Shena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maria Shena works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials like wood, nails, paint, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat. Ma. Shena has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Ma. Shena would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy materials like wood, nails, paint, etc., for the maintenance of her fishing boat.
TAGS: #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite, #Repair Renew Replace, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
Nemia is 51 years old and married with three children.

Nemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Nemia has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years.

Nemia aspires to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nemia is 51 years old and married with three children.

Nemia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Nemia has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twelve years.

Nemia aspires to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Martha tiene en su casa, una imprenta, en el cual vende útiles escolares de toda clase y actualmente con este crédito espera comprar mayor variedad de artículos y así aprovechar la época que es cuando más vende para ella el crédito anterior le fue de mucha ayuda ya que pudo arreglar su local ahora ya lo tiene como antes y  con este crédito espera surtirlo más, y es por eso que repite su crédito ya que esta es su forma de ganarse la vida.\nEste crédito lo va utilizar en comprar útiles escolares. Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su familia.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Martha has a printing press in her house where she sells school supplies of all kinds and now with this loan she hopes to buy a greater variety of items and thus take advantage of this time when she sells the most. The previous loan was of much help to her as she was able to arrange her workspace.

She now has it as before and with this loan hopes to fill it more, and that is why she is getting another loan as this is her way of making a living.

This loan will be used to buy school supplies. Her dream is to give the best to her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase notebooks, pencils, markers, rulers, foam sheets, and more.

DESCRIPTION:
Regedzai is 27 years old and married with one child. She currently resides in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. 

Regedzai volunteers as Camfed Learner Guide in schools, teaching students valuable life and study skills. She is an inspiring entrepreneur who buys and sells plastic products such as buckets, laundry dishes, and cutlery racks. She also sells clothing accessories such as shirts, skirts, shorts, and towels. She has been running the business for the past four months now, and it has provided her with a stable source of income which enables her to support herself and her child. 
 
With a Kiva loan, Regedzai will expand her business by purchasing green products (plastic products) from recycling companies to promote green living in her community. 

Profits accrued from the business will be used to improve her standard of living, as well as cater to the needs of vulnerable children in the community.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Regedzai is 27 years old and married with one child. She currently resides in the Chikomba West District of Zimbabwe. 

Regedzai volunteers as Camfed Learner Guide in schools, teaching students valuable life and study skills. With a Kiva loan, Regedzai will expand her business by purchasing green products (plastic products) from recycling companies to promote green living in her community. 

Profits accrued from the business will be used to improve her standard of living, as well as cater to the needs of vulnerable children in the community.
LOAN_USE: To purchase more plastic products

DESCRIPTION: Sarah is 40 years old and lives in the town of West Point. She is single and has three children aged 3, 10, and 22. Only the two youngest live with her and are attending school. She sells rice, peppers, oil, Vita, etc. in the local market; she has been doing this for 10 years. She is going to buy additional rice, peppers, oil, Vita, etc. for her business. She says sometimes the business is very good and she has good profits and sometimes it's slow and she doesn't make any money. She likes having customers around. Her plan is to build a house.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional rice, peppers, oil, Vita, etc. for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Zorigt is 55 years old and lives with his wife and two children in their small house in Huvsgul province, Mongolia. His wife Oyun-Erdene is unable to work because of her health condition. His older daughter is a university student and his younger son is enrolling in the university next year.

Zorigt has been driving a heavy truck for years, since he was young, and he started his taxi service business in town in 2005. He is getting older and his ability to work longer hours is getting lower so he has just decided to work at a local driver\'s school as a driving teacher based on his years of experience. He needs his own car to provide the training and is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a secondhand training car to start his business under a licensed driver\'s school. He is a hardworking and diligent man who says, "My children are getting bigger and now enrolled in the university. Thus the family expenses increased, so i need to work hard to make enough to cover my family expenses and children\'s education fees"
LOAN_USE: to purchase a secondhand training car to start his business under a licensed driver's school

DESCRIPTION:
Victoria raises cattle whose milk prodution is sold to PIL Andina (in English, “Andina Milk Industrialization Plant”). She lives in the community of Pucarani, a province located in the Andes, three hours from the city of La Paz. Victoria is married and has three children. She is also the owner of a general store that carries a variety of groceries. The store is in her home that is located in the town.

The loan will be used to purchase cattle to increase the production of milk and thereby raise her income. This is the second loan with Impro. The evaluation that was conducted qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer.

Victoria se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche es comercializada a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Vive en la Comunidad de Pucarani, provincia Los Andes (a tres horas de la ciudad de La Paz). Victoria es casada y tiene hijos. Asimismo, es poseedora de una surtida tienda de abarrotes que esta en su casa, la cuál esta en el pueblo.

El crédito será invertido en la compra de ganado para incrementar su producción de leche y por lo tanto sus ingresos. Es el segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
LOAN_USE: Purchase milk-producing cattle of a better race to increase milk production

DESCRIPTION: Joefiel is single with two children. He lives in Tagudalo, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. He operates a service-based business providing motorcycle transport to make a living. In 2011, he joined Gata Daku MPC and successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used in his business. He borrowed a new loan of 5,000 PHP to repair his existing motor. He wants to improve the general living situation of his family in the future.
LOAN_USE: to repair his existing motor

DESCRIPTION:
Delia is grateful to God that there is Kiva and CCT, who are dedicated in helping small business people like her. She has become a better person as she grew in her relationship with God. Her business has also improved with the continuous assistance by Kiva's lenders.

She trusts that she could again request a 35,000 PHP loan to fill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, beverages and toiletries which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income, which sustained her family's basic needs and in sending her children to school.

Delia prays to God for her store to prosper and enable her to see her children through college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Delia is grateful to God that there is Kiva and CCT, who are dedicated in helping small business people like her. She has become a better person as she grew in her relationship with God. Her business has also improved with the continuous assistance by Kiva's lenders.

She trusts that she could again request a 35,000 PHP loan to fill her store with more quantities of grocery items like rice, coffee, soda, rice noodles, beverages and toiletries which she sells at retail. Her store means a lot to her since it has been her source of income, which sustained her family's basic needs and in sending her children to school.

Delia prays to God for her store to prosper and enable her to see her children through college. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God which she studies.

*All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.
LOAN_USE: to pay for grocery items, beverages, and toiletries to sell at her store.

DESCRIPTION:
Isaac con 51 años de edad,de estado civil casado,vive en casa propia,junto a su esposa,en el distrito de Querecotillo, provincia de Sullana,departamento de Piura,país Perú.Él cuenta con muy buenas referencias tanto personales como laborales por parte de los moradores de la zona.Los habitantes de esta localidad se dedican en su mayoría a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

El se dedica a la agricultura,específicamente al cultivo de uva,mango y papaya, con una experiencia en el rubro desde hace más de 15 años.Solicita préstamo para invertir en la compra de abonos,fertilizantes y pago a sus peones.De esta manera obtener mayores ingresos para él y su familia.

Isaac es socio nuevo para Edpyme Alternativa.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
51-year-old Isaac is in a common-law marriage, and lives in his own house with his wife in the Querecotillo district, Sullana province, Piura department, Peru. He has many good references, personal as well as work-related, from the inhabitants of the area. The people of this area work mostly in agriculture, business, and cattle-raising.

He works in agriculture, specifically in growing grapes, mango, and papaya, with more than 15 years of experience in this task. He is asking for the loan to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, soil amendments, and pay for his workers. In this way he will earn better income for himself and his family. \t
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
Isaac is a new member of Edpyme Alternativa.
LOAN_USE: to invest in the purchase of fertilizers, soil amendments, and pay for his workers.

DESCRIPTION:
Rafia is a 33-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children, two daughters and a son. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband (who is seen in the picture).

Rafia's husband owns a small workshop in which he troubleshoots, renews and then sells sewing machines. He wants to buy new spare parts at cheap rates in order to assemble sewing machines for resell. However, due to financial constraints, he is compelled to receive a new loan. Therefore, Rafia requested a Kiva loan for her husband so that he can be able to buy new spare parts for assembling sewing machines.

Rafia gives thanks to Kiva, Kiva’s lenders and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rafia is a 33-year-old, married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children, two daughters and a son. Her whole family is fully dependent upon her husband (who is seen in the picture).
