DESCRIPTION:
Peris, 40, is a business lady and a mother of one child nine years old. She sells used clothing for a living and enjoys her fast moving business. Her clothes are affordable and trendy and she makes good business in a day.

Due to increased need, she will buy more used clothing that suits her clients' needs. She is an honest lady who will pay her loan with the profit she makes. Her dream is to buy plots to build on and educate her child to university.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Peris, 40, is a business lady and a mother of one child nine years old. She sells used clothing for a living and enjoys her fast moving business. Her clothes are affordable and trendy and she makes good business in a day.

Due to increased need, she will buy more used clothing that suits her clients' needs. She is an honest lady who will pay her loan with the profit she makes. Her dream is to buy plots to build on and educate her child to university.
LOAN_USE: to buy used clothes to grow her business.

DESCRIPTION: Чамшед житель района Кубадиян. Ему 29 лет. Он женат, имеет одного ребенка. У него средне - специальное образование, строитель. Он уже 4 года как занимается строительными работами по найму. Кроме того он занимается растениеводством и садоводством. При доме у него имеется участок земли, где он выращивает овощи. А также у него имеется сад, где он сажает фруктовые деревья. Этим видом деятельности он занимается 6 лет. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений, топлива и семян арбуза.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Jamshed lives in the Qubadiyon area. He is 29 years old, married, and has one child. He has a vocational education in construction.  For four years he has been working as a day laborer doing construction.  He also farms. At his house he has a plot of land where he grows vegetables. He also has an orchard where he grows fruit trees. He has been doing this for six years. He is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds.
LOAN_USE: to buy mineral fertilizer, fuel, and watermelon seeds.

DESCRIPTION: Elixpet invirtió su crédito anterior en la compra unas ollas y víveres en general (legumbres, vegetales, carnes, aderezos, entre otros) y también le ayudó a una hija para los estudios universitarios. Ella logró incrementar sus ventas e ingresos para el hogar, y desde que recibió esta financiación su familia tiene una mejor situación económica y aprendió que a través del acceso al crédito puede superarse. Ella les envió un mensaje a sus financiadores: “Que esta agradecida por el primer crédito recibido, empecé mi negocio con poquitas cosas y espero que sigan apoyándome”. Nuevamente solicitó una financiación para comprar ingredientes para sus comidas, mercancías de temporada (ropa en general) y mejoras a su vivienda para acondicionar mejor su sitio de trabajo. Apóyale en su crédito con el que tendrá éxito por su amplia base de clientes.\t\t\n\t\t\t\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elixpet invested her previous loan in the purchase of pots and assorted food supplies (legumes, vegetables, meats, dressings, among others), and she also helped her daughter with her university studies. She succeeded in increasing her sales and her income for her home. Since she received the financing, her family has had a better economic situation and she has learned that she can get ahead through her access to credit. She sends a message to her lenders: "I am grateful for the first loan that I received. I started my business with just a few things, and I hope that you will continue to support me."

She has again requested a loan to buy ingredients for her foods, seasonal merchandise (clothing in general), and improvements for her home to better set up her workspace. Support her with her loan, which will allow her to have success through her large customer base.
LOAN_USE: to buy ingredients for her foods, seasonal merchandise (clothing in general), and improvements for her home to better set up her workspace.

DESCRIPTION:
Client âgé de 32 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 4 ans et 12 ans, Il est en activite depuis 15 ans.
Il encaisse en moyenne 5000 à 15 000 F CFA par jour. A l’octroie de ce prêt, il va renforcer son commerce en achetant 10 pagnes real pour faire des chemises et ensembles dames, 3 rouleaux de la doublure, 1 rouleau de la vaseline , des bobines de fils à coudre , une machine à coudre.

Avec un bon accueil des clients et une grande publicité, ce client à une bonne réputation dans le quartier , il s’approvisionne auprès des grands fournisseur et fait des benefices enormes,  il travaille aussi avec les jeunes filles meres sur le programme de reinsertion pour les initier a la coupe et couture,  il pense épargner à la longue afin d’ouvrir un grand atelier où il pourra produire en grande quantité et fournir des prêts à porter dans les boutiques. Comme un bon père , il fait face au besoin de sa famille en finançant les études de ses enfants et en initiant sa famille au commerce.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: This client is 32 years old, married, and the father of two children, from 4 to 21 years old. He has been working for fifteen years. He takes in 5,000 to 15,000 francs CFA on average each day. Upon being granted this loan, he is going to bolster his business by buying 10 lengths of Real pagnes (colorful West African cloth) to make shirts and women's outfits; 3 rolls of lining material; a roll of Vaseline; some spools of thread; and a sewing machine. Accommodating his customers well and offering big promotions, this client has a good reputation in his district. He gets his supplies from the major suppliers and makes enormous profits. He also works with young mothers in a jobs program for introducing them to sewing and tailoring. He is thinking of saving money over time in order to open a large workshop where he can have high output and can supply ready-to-wear clothing to shops. Like a good father, he addresses the needs of his family by covering the cost of schooling for the children and introducing his family to commerce.
LOAN_USE: to buy fabrics, Wax-brand cloth, Real-brand cloth, sewing accessories, 'vaseline', buttons, and thread

DESCRIPTION:
Rodelyn is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur.

She requested a PHP 7,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Rodelyn knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rodelyn is a hardworking micro-entrepreneur.

She requested a PHP 7,400 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Rodelyn knows that using the sanitary toilet will ultimately reduce health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Katerinauataliatalosaga L. is 35 and married with 2 children (ages 6 and 10).  She owns a business venture, providing general clothing services to local community members and that is by sewing different kinds of clothes.  Katerinauataliatalosaga has 7 years of experience in this business.  Katerinauataliatalosaga needs a loan of WST $1500 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 500 tala or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Katerinauataliatalosaga joined SPBD.    This is her 2nd loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Katerinauataliatalosaga's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Katerinauataliatalosaga L. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              2 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://partners.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

DESCRIPTION: Narcisa hace 12 años abrió su pequeña tienda en su domicilio el cual está en Vergeles norte de Guayaquil. A sus 55 años vive sola ya que sus hijos son mayores de edad y es divorciada, empezó el negocio porque quería tener un medio de ganar dinero pero sin salir de su casa, así fue cómo surgió la idea la cual hizo realidad con la ayuda de sus hijos. Después de varios años y gracias a otro crédito a podido agrandar su negocio. Trabaja en su tienda todos los días desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche como ahí mismo vive no tiene ningún problema con el horario, en su tienda vende productos de primera necesidad como es arroz, azúcar, granos, enlatados, artículos de limpieza, snacks,  etc. También se ayuda con el alquiler ya que tiene un departamento sin utilizar el cual arrienda. Su mayor temor son las enfermedades ya que no puede atender cuando eso pasa, espera obtener el crédito para poder comprar mercadería sobre todo confetis y lácteos. Le gustaría poder aumentar sus ventas y que su negocio crezca así a futuro poder arreglar su casa.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Narcisa opened her small store 12 years ago in her house, which is in Vergeles, north of Guayaquil. At 55 years old she lives alone, as her children are older and she is divorced. She began the business because she wanted to have a means of earning money, but without leaving her house. So it was that the idea came to her and became reality with the help of her children. After some years, and thanks to another loan, she has been able to expand her business. 

She works in her store every day from 6 in the morning until 9 at night. Because she lives right there, she doesn’t have any problem with the schedule. In her store, she sells essentials such as rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, cleaning products, snacks, etc. The business also helps with the rent, since she has a space without having to lease. Her greatest fear is becoming ill, because she cannot work when this happens. 

She hopes to obtain a loan in order to be able to purchase goods – most of all, sweets and dairy products. She would like to be able to increase her sales and for her business to grow, so that in the future, she can remodel her house.
LOAN_USE: to purchase rice, sugar, grains, canned goods, cleaning products, and snacks.

DESCRIPTION:
Delia is 53 years old and married with 13 children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid off 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Delia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Delia is 53 years old and married with 13 children.

Delia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

She has borrowed and paid off 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Delia aspires to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stock of groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Being a single mother is quite hard especially when all of your children are college-aged according to Milagros. She ended up in this situation when her husband passed away. Despite what happened to her husband, Milagros stood on her own two feet and diverted her loneliness and sadness into running a sari-sari store.

She realized that she needs to be strong and strive hard to sustain the daily needs of her children. She's been running her business for 11 years but there was a time that she was not able to manage her business well due to an accident. At that time, she temporarily closed it, but later when she was fine she continued her business.

Now, she runs her variety store and direct-selling business. With her determination to increase her stocks of grocery items and Avon products, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 8,000. She knows that the additional capital will help with the improvement of her income and sales daily.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Being a single mother is quite hard especially when all of your children are college-aged according to Milagros. She ended up in this situation when her husband passed away. Despite what happened to her husband, Milagros stood on her own two feet and diverted her loneliness and sadness into running a sari-sari store.

She realized that she needs to be strong and strive hard to sustain the daily needs of her children. She's been running her business for 11 years but there was a time that she was not able to manage her business well due to an accident. At that time, she temporarily closed it, but later when she was fine she continued her business.

Now, she runs her variety store and direct-selling business. With her determination to increase her stocks of grocery items and Avon products, she is seeking additional capital of PHP 8,000. She knows that the additional capital will help with the improvement of her income and sales daily.
LOAN_USE: to buy more stocks of grocery items and Avon products to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Samya is a 25-year-old married woman who established a school in a community with low-income individuals. The aim of her school is to educate students in a way that would help them to enter the adult world confidently. She says, “Positive learning culture and ethos are developed among the students, which helps them to meet high expectations in their practical lives.” More students have been enrolled in the school, and now additional furniture and classrooms are required. She has requested an amount of PKR 300,000 to purchase furniture for the classrooms in the school and construct additional classrooms.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Samya is a 25-year-old married woman who established a school in a community with low-income individuals. The aim of her school is to educate students in a way that would help them to enter the adult world confidently. She says, “Positive learning culture and ethos are developed among the students, which helps them to meet high expectations in their practical lives.” More students have been enrolled in the school, and now additional furniture and classrooms are required. She has requested an amount of PKR 300,000 to purchase furniture for the classrooms in the school and construct additional classrooms.
LOAN_USE: to purchase furniture for the classrooms in the school and construct additional classrooms.

DESCRIPTION: Neder es un técnico en refrigeración que durante años laboró con empresas especialistas en la prestación de estos servicios, su experiencia es de 21 años y constantes capacitaciones, lo motivaron a iniciar su propio negocio.  Actualmente ofrece sus servicios a clientes ubicados en el municipio de Soledad y les realiza reparaciones y mantenimientos de aires acondicionados y neveras.  Neder requiere manejar un buen stock de repuestos y comprar nuevas herramientas de trabajo, para ello aplicó a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiación con la que comprará tuberías de cobre, acoples, desincrustantes, un detector de fugas y un equipo de soldadura.  Con estas herramientas garantizará calidad y agilidad en sus servicios. Neder anhela tener un almacén de repuestos de refrigeración.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Neder is a refrigeration technician. For years he worked with a company that specializes in this type of service. His 21 years of experience and continuous training motivated him to start his own business. He currently provides his services to customers located in the Soledad municipality. He does repairs and provides maintenance of air conditioning and refrigerators.

Neder needs to work with a good stock of replacement parts, and he needs to buy new work tools. In order to do so, he applied for his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy copper pipes, adapters, descalers, a leak detector, and welding equipment. With these tools he will guarantee quality and prompt services. Neder yearns to have a refrigeration replacement parts store.
LOAN_USE: to buy copper pipes, adapters, descalers, a leak detector, and welding equipment.

DESCRIPTION: Mean N. was born in 1967 and is a good father to four children. One of them is married, and the other three are single; all are living together in the family home. To help support the family, three of the children are working in a variety of occupations. Mean N. is a motorbike taxi driver who earns around $4 a day for his services. His wife appears in the picture. She owns a store where she sells different kinds of produce items, including vegetables, meats, and some other groceries. Mean N. is requesting a loan to help increase his savings in order to build a new house for his married child to live in.
LOAN_USE: to build a new house for his married child to live in

DESCRIPTION:
Marissa works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.


Marissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.


Marissa is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marissa works hard to support three children. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.


Marissa requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.


Marissa is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environmental protection.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet

DESCRIPTION:
Rhea is a farmer living in the town of Ubay on the island of Bohol in the Philippines. She is a married woman and has been in the farming business for two years now. Rhea helps her husband in tilling and in overseeing their farm, which is their main source of income.

Rhea needs a loan of 5000 Philippines pesos (PHP) to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for the farm. Through this loan, Rhea and her husband will be able to improve their land's productivity.

In the future, Rhea hopes to expand the farm so that it will generate more revenue necessary to sustain the family's basic needs and for the future schooling of her children.
LOAN_USE: to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides for her farm

DESCRIPTION: Акмалджон 29 лет. Женат, имеет большую семью. Живет с родителями. У него трое детей, они еще ходят в школу. Жена работает в столовой. Родители у него пенсионеры. Сам Акмалджон мастер строитель дома. Дополнительно, занимается животноводством. Он хочет купить несколько голов скота и тем самым расширить свой бизнес. Чтобы купить скот у него не хватает денег. С этой проблемой он обратился в МДО "Арванд" за финансовой поддержкой. На полученный кредит Акмалджон купит скот. Он благодарит МДО "Арванд" и КИВА за поддержку.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Akmaljon is 29 years old. He is married and has a big family. He lives with his parents. He has three children who are still attending school. His wife works in a cafeteria. His parents are retired. Akmaljon is a construction foreman. He also breeds livestock. He wants to buy several animals and in doing so, expand his business. He doesn't have enough money to buy livestock. He turned to Arvand for financial support with this problem. Akmaljon will use the loan received to buy livestock. He thanks Arvand and Kiva for the support.
LOAN_USE: to buy livestock to expand his business.

DESCRIPTION:
Beatrice has been a farmer for more than a decade, and this is her sole source of income. She has gained much knowledge, skill, and experience, which is why other farmers seek advice from her about the best planting seasons, crop and animal diseases, and farming methods.

Beatrice lives with the apple of her eye (her handsome husband) and family in a remote village in Kakamega. Although she makes a profit from dairy and crop farming, she is not living comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. Kenya's Kakamega area, one of the country's most populated regions, has a high demand for cereals.

Beatrice is requesting a loan to buy cereals to help satisfy the constantly rising demand. Thanks to hard work and commitment, she is going to make the best of this opportunity and earn more income for her family. Her goal is to earn enough profits to repay this loan and pay her children's school fees.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Beatrice has been a farmer for more than a decade, and this is her sole source of income. She has gained much knowledge, skill, and experience, which is why other farmers seek advice from her about the best planting seasons, crop and animal diseases, and farming methods.

Beatrice lives with the apple of her eye (her handsome husband) and family in a remote village in Kakamega. Although she makes a profit from dairy and crop farming, she is not living comfortably and has always wanted to increase her income by selling cereals. Kenya's Kakamega area, one of the country's most populated regions, has a high demand for cereals.

Beatrice is requesting a loan to buy cereals to help satisfy the constantly rising demand. Thanks to hard work and commitment, she is going to make the best of this opportunity and earn more income for her family. Her goal is to earn enough profits to repay this loan and pay her children's school fees.
LOAN_USE: to buy different varieties of cereals such as lentils, cow peas, maize, and rice to sell in the local market and generate a profit to support her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Anjum is 37 years old and an independent woman. She has three children, and her husband died six years ago. She has been in business, selling clothing at her house, since her husband's death six years ago. This is the only source of income for her family. Due to large household expenses and Anjum being the sole supporter of her family, she is facing a lot of problems in life.

She has requested a loan from Kiva’s partner, BRAC Pakistan. She wants to expand her business by opening a garment shop in the market, because she is not getting enough customers in her house. She would also buy a greater variety of clothing, including shirts and dresses, to attract more customers. This loan could help her to increase her monthly income and savings, for the better future of her children. With the profit amount, she would pay the pending utility bills of her house.

She is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan for helping her.
LOAN_USE: To open her clothing business at the public market, and to buy a greater variety of clothing to sell

DESCRIPTION: Stanley has been selling animal feed to make a living for four years. He had previously requested a loan of 40,000 Kenyan Shillings (KES) from Faulu Kenya which helped him to buy animal feed for his business. He has also improved on his savings because of the training he received in financial management. He dreams of expanding his business in the future. He needs a loan of 110,000 KES to buy more animal feed.
LOAN_USE: to buy animal feed

DESCRIPTION:
Iasha T. is 60 years old. He is married and lives with his wife Naira in the village of Supsa, Lanchkhuti District. Iasha and his wife are engaged in agricultural activities. They have a plot of land where cucumbers are grown. The harvested cucumbers are sold locally. Also, Iasha has a tractor. In case of orders, he tills the plots in his and neighboring villages. He uses his tractor on his plot as well.

With the requested credit, Iasha plans to purchase fuel for his tractor and fertilizers in order to cultivate his land. Afterwards, he will sow the cucumbers. According to Iasha’s estimations, after cultivation he will have more and better quality cucumbers than in previous years, as he hasn’t fertilized the plot for several years. Part of the profit will be reinvested in the business. In addition to the cultivation, he plans to renovate his tractor for the next season. He hopes that some funds will be left for renovation of the house as well.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fuel and fertilizers

DESCRIPTION:
My name is Pauline Dorice Angila. I am a responsible and committed married wife to one husband and God has blessed us with two children all in school. I also have got four orphans that I am paying for their education. I grew up in Vihiga County in a very discouraging and devastated condition. I did not pursue my education as was my wish because of lack of school fees.
I live in Nairobi doing business.
My dreams is to see my children acquire quality education. I also want to see that i have these two orphans receive education up to university level. I have another dream of buying my own stall in order to grow my business.
I was motivated by my friend Caroline Nyangute whom i used to visit at her working place and help her do the business. She later hooked me up and took me to Kikomba to purchase some second hand clothing and start selling. This improved my entrepreneurial spirit into business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
My name is Pauline Dorice Angila. I am a responsible and committed married wife to one husband and God has blessed us with two children all in school. I also have got four orphans that I am paying for their education. I grew up in Vihiga County in a very discouraging and devastated condition. I did not pursue my education as was my wish because of lack of school fees.
I live in Nairobi doing business.
My dreams is to see my children acquire quality education. I also want to see that i have these two orphans receive education up to university level. I have another dream of buying my own stall in order to grow my business.
I was motivated by my friend Caroline Nyangute whom i used to visit at her working place and help her do the business. She later hooked me up and took me to Kikomba to purchase some second hand clothing and start selling. This improved my entrepreneurial spirit into business.
LOAN_USE: purchase second hand clothing and school bags that is highly on demand in the market place.

DESCRIPTION:
Maricel is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and all three of her children are currently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Maricel has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Maricel is 32 years old and has three children. She is married and all three of her children are currently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business of raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock. Maricel has been raising pigs for three years now and has borrowed two times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Maricel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Nhor T. is a villager in Dambong Derk Village in Kampong Cham Province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she cultivates rice. 

Her husband, Mr. Pin Tuong, is a cow breeder. Since his business is going well, he wants to expand it, so Mrs. Nhor T. has decided to ask for a loan to buy one more cow for her husband's business. 

Mrs. Nhor T. is 57 years old and the mother of two children who are employed in a garment factory.
LOAN_USE: To buy another cow for her husband's business.

DESCRIPTION:
Sopheap is a 40-year-old, married farmer with five dependent children, who resides in the Tboung Khmum Province in Cambodia. Sopheap and her husband earn their main source of income from which they can support their family from cassava growing and working as laborers for others. They have been with the cassava farm for more than 19 years. Her two teenagers are farmers and the other three kids are students. Her teenagers can earn approximately $20 per day.

Sopheap is first from the right in the photo. As a group leader, she would like to request a loan as part of the five members and she will use her share to purchase fertilizer and to cover plowing expenses. This loan will help her have enough money to buy fertilizer for cassava cultivation so she will be able to gain better crops to support the family.

For her plans, she wants to expand her farming, save money to build a kitchen room and support her children to earn their bachelor’s degree.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sopheap is a 40-year-old, married farmer with five dependent children, who resides in the Tboung Khmum Province in Cambodia. Sopheap and her husband earn their main source of income from which they can support their family from cassava growing and working as laborers for others. They have been with the cassava farm for more than 19 years. Her two teenagers are farmers and the other three kids are students. Her teenagers can earn approximately $20 per day.

Sopheap is first from the right in the photo. As a group leader, she would like to request a loan as part of the five members and she will use her share to purchase fertilizer and to cover plowing expenses. This loan will help her have enough money to buy fertilizer for cassava cultivation so she will be able to gain better crops to support the family.

For her plans, she wants to expand her farming, save money to build a kitchen room and support her children to earn their bachelor’s degree.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fertilizer and to cover plowing expenses.

DESCRIPTION: Penina buys and rears livestock to sell later at a profit. She does this on her own plot of land. She has been in this business for the last four years and earns an income of KES 2,000 per month. Penina is 46 years old, married and supports six members of her family. \r\n\r\nShe learned about Kiva's partner, KADET LTD, from a member of another registered group and she has never borrowed from any other MFI. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD, with which she plans to buy two goats for fattening and later selling. Penina intends to use the anticipated profits to cover her family's basic needs and save. In the future she hopes to become the leading livestock keeper.
LOAN_USE: To buy two goats for fattening and selling later at a profit

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Pabla G. is 40 years old and is married to Mr.Zacarias Zeballos. They have three children that are excellent students at school.

Pabla is dedicated to dressmaking and tailoring and her husband is a baker. Both of them contribute to the household income and share the expenses. Previously, she used to work as an employee at a dressmaking shop for three years and after saving money, Pabla opened her own dressmaking and tailor shop. Thanks to her hard work she was able to acquire her own house.

The credit that she is asking for will be invested in buying different types of fabrics at wholesale prices like: silk, cotton, lycra, etc. In the future she wishes to expand her shop and be able to offer more products to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Pabla tiene 40 años ella está casada con el señor Zacarías Zeballos y tienen tres hijos todos son excelentes estudiantes. La señora Pabla se dedica a la confección de ropas y el señor se dedica a la panadería, ambos aportan con los ingresos de la casa y comparten los gastos. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como empleada en un taller de costura, hace tres años y luego de juntar unos ahorros, Pabla, abrió su propio taller de costura, y gracias a su trabajo logro obtener su casa propia . El crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de telas de diferentes tipos, seda, algodón, lycra, etc. En el futuro ella desea ampliar su taller de costura y salir con más productos en el mercado.
LOAN_USE: Buying fabrics at wholesale prices.

DESCRIPTION:
Josefina is 64 years old, married and has four children.

Josefina raises pigs in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Josefina has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Josefina is 64 years old, married and has four children.

Josefina raises pigs in the Philippines. Josefina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Josefina has been raising pigs for 15 years now, and has borrowed 20 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Josefina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

DESCRIPTION: Josephine is a hog-raiser who lives in Solana with her spouse and children. She raises and sells hogs for income. She has been in her small business for almost five years and earns about 3,000 PHP for each hog disposal. \r\n\r\nShe wants to raise healthy hogs, but it requires sustenance for feed and vaccines. Because of this, she is asking for 9,000 PHP to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustainability. This will help improve the nutrition of the hogs so she can sell them at profitable cost someday. Additional revenue will be used for her children's education.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed and vaccines for her hogs' sustainability.

DESCRIPTION:
Aleks is 40 years old and a member from the vulnerable Roma community, living in a village of Korca with his family and his elderly mother. His father passed away last month. He is a devoted husband and father to two teenage children and provides for his family thanks to his agricultural activity. He is seen in his apple and pear orchards in the photo.

Aleks cares a lot about his family and tries his best to provide a good home for them. He and his family currently live in a very old house that desperately needs some repairs. He had to cover his father medical expenses until a few months ago, so he hasn't had the opportunity to repair the house.

Aleks wants to take a Kiva loan in order to make some repairs at his old house so that he can make sure his family has secure living conditions. Aleks is very grateful for the support of Kiva lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Aleks is 40 years old and a member from the vulnerable Roma community, living in a village of Korca with his family and his elderly mother. His father passed away last month. He is a devoted husband and father to two teenage children and provides for his family thanks to his agricultural activity. He is seen in his apple and pear orchards in the photo.

Aleks cares a lot about his family and tries his best to provide a good home for them. He and his family currently live in a very old house that desperately needs some repairs. He had to cover his father medical expenses until a few months ago, so he hasn't had the opportunity to repair the house.

Aleks wants to take a Kiva loan in order to make some repairs at his old house so that he can make sure his family has secure living conditions. Aleks is very grateful for the support of Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: a member from the vulnerable Roma community to make some repairs at his house to provide a safer shelter for his family.

DESCRIPTION:
Aneesa is a 29-year-old woman who has been running a low-cost private school which was established by her family 17 years ago.

At present, there are 144 students enrolled in the school and 63% of them are female students. The aim of her school is to implement well-tried and modern teaching methodologies for the under-privileged students as they are deprived of quality education. She says, “By the help of my school I will ensure, opportunities associated with education are equal for all students regardless of their social background”.

She also wants to improve the physical condition of the school. However a shortage of money is the major hindrance. She has requested an amount of PKR. 145,000 for building maintenance and for purchasing furniture for her students.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Aneesa is a 29-year-old woman who has been running a low-cost private school which was established by her family 17 years ago.

At present, there are 144 students enrolled in the school and 63% of them are female students. The aim of her school is to implement well-tried and modern teaching methodologies for the under-privileged students as they are deprived of quality education. She says, “By the help of my school I will ensure, opportunities associated with education are equal for all students regardless of their social background”.

She also wants to improve the physical condition of the school. However a shortage of money is the major hindrance. She has requested an amount of PKR. 145,000 for building maintenance and for purchasing furniture for her students.
LOAN_USE: for building maintenance and for purchasing furniture for her students

DESCRIPTION:
Annet is a married woman with three children, all attending school.

She does farming to supplement her husband's meager income. Annet needs a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation, which she believes will increase yields that she will sell to raise income for the family.

Annet sends her gratitude to the lenders for the financial support that will improve her farming business. Her dream is to educate her children up to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Annet is a married woman with three children, all attending school.

She does farming to supplement her husband's meager income. Annet needs a loan of 2,000,000 UGX to buy fertilizers for her banana plantation, which she believes will increase yields that she will sell to raise income for the family.

Annet sends her gratitude to the lenders for the financial support that will improve her farming business. Her dream is to educate her children up to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers for her farm to improve yields that she will sell to earn a living for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Monica N. is a widow with seven children. She lives in Ntaghem- Nkwen- Cameroon.  Monica and her entire family are living in a house with three rooms. Monica had to overcome some challenges in life such as ill health, difficulties in paying her children's  school fees and the death of her husband. She has fire wood business and also sells food stuffs in order to earn a living.

This will be Monica sixth loan from GHAPE. She has been a member since 2003. She has been quite successful in the past with her business due to the location of her business and her reasonable prices.  Also with her experience, Monica is now receiving good profits from her business. Part of her profits from this loan will be used to take care of her children and to buy necessities for the family and the remainder will be ploughed back part into  her business.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its client
LOAN_USE: Buying of fire wood, yams, potatoes, tomatoes

DESCRIPTION: Lorena de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la venta de refrescos y agua de cocos en las afueras de su casa desde hace mas de 25 años posee mucha clientela por que es un producto muy vendible, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Lorena esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas frutas por mayor, azúcar, hielos, cocos, bolsas, pajillas, etc. todo por mayor ya que le va bien en sus ventas y asi tener mas genancias para seguirle dando a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Lorena, at the age of 42, lives in her own house with her husband and their two daughters, She has been selling refreshments and coconut water outside her home for more than 25 years. She has many customers because they are very marketable products. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to pay some of the household expenses.

Lorena is again applying for a loan to purchase more fruits wholesale, [as well as] sugar, ice, coconuts, bags, straws, etc., all at wholesale, since she is doing well in her sales and thus [hopes] to have more earnings to continue giving her family a better quality of life.
LOAN_USE: to buy more fruits wholesale, as well as sugar, ice, coconuts, bags, and straws, all at wholesale

DESCRIPTION:
Angelica is a married mother with two children. She deals in selling clothes for both children and adults. She started her business in 2011 because she wanted to raise school fees for her children. To supplement her income, she also owns a sewing machine, which helps in the purchase of day-to-day desires.

With the requested loan, Angelica would like to buy more clothes to resell for profit. Her future prospects are educating her children using the profits from the business. She is faced with hardships of limited capital to boost her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Angelica is a married mother with two children. She deals in selling clothes for both children and adults. She started her business in 2011 because she wanted to raise school fees for her children. To supplement her income, she also owns a sewing machine, which helps in the purchase of day-to-day desires.

With the requested loan, Angelica would like to buy more clothes to resell for profit. Her future prospects are educating her children using the profits from the business. She is faced with hardships of limited capital to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more clothes to resell for profit.

DESCRIPTION:
Hira is 24 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six persons.

She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services at her own house to the people.

She needs to purchase another sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the shop, including threads, needles, laces and buttons. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally.

However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Hira is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested.

Hira is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hira is 24 years old. She is a housewife and looks after her family, which is comprised of six persons.

She is well-trained in cloth stitching. She provides stitching services at her own house to the people.

She needs to purchase another sewing machine and a variety of stitching materials for the shop, including threads, needles, laces and buttons. This is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally.

However, due to the lack of money, she finds it difficult. So Hira is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan. BRAC Pakistan issued her loan, as she requested.

Hira is very thankful to Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy another sewing machine and stitching materials for her sewing work.

DESCRIPTION:
Felix, 39, is married with 3 school aged children who range between 5 and 11 years old. 

He requests a loan to buy construction supplies to increase his store's inventory.  He has been in business for seven years.

Felix expects to use the profits from his business to star another business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more construction supplies.

DESCRIPTION:
Mohammad Taleb is a 30-year-old married father of two, who has run his own mini-market since 2005. Mohammad Taleb also works in the construction field to have an additional income. He's putting in much effort to improve his business.

For this reason, he's acquiring a Youth loan product from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with new requested products.

Mohammad Taleb wishes to stay capable of developing his business in a well-managed way to support his beloved family and reply to their increasing living needs.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mohammad Taleb is a 30-year-old married father of two, who has run his own mini-market since 2005. Mohammad Taleb also works in the construction field to have an additional income. He's putting in much effort to improve his business.

For this reason, he's acquiring a Youth loan product from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his business merchandise with new requested products.

Mohammad Taleb wishes to stay capable of developing his business in a well-managed way to support his beloved family and reply to their increasing living needs.
LOAN_USE: to increase his business merchandise with new requested products.

DESCRIPTION:
La señora Dinora pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Paz II”, vive en el pasaje Leoncio Prado s/n – AAHH. Las Brisas del Cumbaza, distrito de Tarapoto, departamento de San Martín. Tiene 22 años y es madre de una niña. Es conviviente, su pareja trabaja como docente quien le ayuda con los gastos del hogar. Con el primer prestamo de S/ 300 decide invertir en un  teléfono para brindar atención de llamadas a los vecinos del lugar. Tiene 2 años trabajando con el banco.

Actualmente cuenta con un locutorio un su propia casa, brinda atención de llamadas a celular y teléfono fijo aprovechando que en el lugar no existe un servicio como este, esto le permite un ingreso diario para poder pagar las cuotas del banco.

Con el prestamo de S/. 1,500 que será pagado en 4 meses comprara tarjetas para teléfono celular  y otro celular que le permita dar mayor atención a sus clientes ya que solo cuenta con uno.

Dinora agradece la oportunidad al Banco Comunal de realizarse como persona y poner su propio negocio.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Dinora belongs to the Community Bank 'La Paz II', and she lives in the pasaje Leonicio Prado s/n - AAHH. Las Brisas del Cumbaza, in the district of Tarapoto, in the department of San Martin. She is 22 years old and she has a daughter. She lives with her partner who works as a teacher and whom she helps with the household costs. With the first loan of 300 soles she decided to invest in a telephone to offer a telephone service to her neighbors. She has been working with the Bank for 2 years.

She currently has a telephone booth in her house and takes calls from cell phones and landlines, taking advantage of the fact that there is no other service like this in the area. This gives her a daily income so that she can pay the Bank's installments.

With the loan of 1500 soles, which she will repay over a period of 4 months, she will buy phone cards for cell phones and another phone which will allow her to serve her clients better as she currently only has one phone.

Dinora is grateful for the opportunity that the Community Bank has given her to fulfill herself as a person and in having her own business.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: To buy cell phone cards and another cell phone which will allow her to serve her clients better as she currently only has one phone/Comprar tarjetas para teléfono celular  y otro celular que le permita dar mayor atención a sus clientes ya que solo cuenta con uno.

DESCRIPTION: Ana tiene un salón de belleza en el que ha estado trabajado por 15 años haciendo lo que le gusta y apasiona. Ella quiere mantenerse siempre a la vanguardia con las distintas tendencias de corte y color porque la competencia siempre es grande. Muchas veces hay hasta 4 salones en una misma calle por lo que debe mantenerse al día para garantizar la satisfacción de sus clientes. Ella está solicitando un préstamo de $15,900 pesos para comprar algunos productos del pelo y equipo electico necesarios para el trabajo que realiza. Ana desea poder llevar siempre un estilo moderno en su salón de belleza y en un futuro poder ampliar el espacio para captar una mayor cantidad de clientes.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Ana has a beauty salon where she has been working for 15 years, doing what she likes and is her passion. She wants to always remain in the forefront when it comes to the various trends for cuts and color, because competition is always great. Many times there are up to four salons on the same street, so she has to keep up-to-date to ensure customer satisfaction.\r\n\r\nShe is requesting a loan of 15,900 pesos, so that she can buy some hair products and electrical equipment that she needs for the work she does. Ana wishes to always maintain a modern style in her beauty salon, and someday be able to expand the space, so that she can acquire a greater number of clients.
LOAN_USE: To buy hair products and equipment.

DESCRIPTION: Karege sells clothes; she also has a stall from which she sells food. She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders’ financial support she received through her previous loan facilitated through Yehu. She is now applying for a 40,000 KES loan to buy more bales of clothes to sell.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Karege sells clothes; she also has a stall from which she sells food. She greatly appreciates Kiva lenders’ financial support she received through her previous loan facilitated through Yehu. She is now applying for a 40,000 KES loan to buy more bales of clothes to sell.
LOAN_USE: to buy more bales of clothes to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Icih Mardiah. She is 42 years old and married with two daughters. Icih Mardiah has been an apparel trader for ten years. Her husband has been working as a laborer in the Pandeglang District for fifteen years. However, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their children.

Icih Mardiah has asked for a loan of 10,300,000 Indonesian Rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to build a healthy toilet for her family. Today, her family has no access to a proper toilet in their home. Her family's income is insufficient to build a toilet but Icih Mardiah will be able to repay the loan received.

Icih Mardiah and her family want to live a healthy life with clean sanitation. Icih Mardiah is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Icih Mardiah. She is 42 years old and married with two daughters. Icih Mardiah has been an apparel trader for ten years. Her husband has been working as a laborer in the Pandeglang District for fifteen years. However, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their children.

Icih Mardiah has asked for a loan of 10,300,000 Indonesian Rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to build a healthy toilet for her family. Today, her family has no access to a proper toilet in their home. Her family's income is insufficient to build a toilet but Icih Mardiah will be able to repay the loan received.

Icih Mardiah and her family want to live a healthy life with clean sanitation. Icih Mardiah is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
LOAN_USE: to build a healthy toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Mashibei is married with four children whom she and her husband support.

Mashibei joined KADET through a credit officer. She is taking a first loan with KADET LTD and is not involved with other Micro-Finance. Mashibei has been in the livestock business for two years. With the loan she intends to increase the number of livestock she has. Mashibei's business is located near a busy market, giving her many customers.

With the extra profits, Mashibei hopes to send her children to university. In the future, she hopes to transport her livestock to Kenya Meat Commission for sale. Mashibei believes she is hardworking.
LOAN_USE: The loan will be used to increase livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Kousar Parveen is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

Her husband owns a boutique. His practice is to buy fabrics from a wholesaler and sell them in the market. He has a lot of customers who like to buy garments from him. Due to new customers, the demand is increasing day by day, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more fabrics.

Therefore, Kousar Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand. She has already taken the loan from BRAC and invested in the business.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Kousar Parveen is a 45-year-old married woman, living in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of three children.

Her husband owns a boutique. His practice is to buy fabrics from a wholesaler and sell them in the market. He has a lot of customers who like to buy garments from him. Due to new customers, the demand is increasing day by day, but he does not have a sufficient amount to buy more fabrics.

Therefore, Kousar Parveen requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan, so that her husband can buy more fabrics to fulfill the demand. She has already taken the loan from BRAC and invested in the business.

She is very thankful to the Kiva and its field partner, BRAC Pakistan.
LOAN_USE: to buy more seasonal fabrics  for her husband's clothing sales.

DESCRIPTION:
La señora Teresa tiene 49 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación  tiene 3 hijos todos ya mayores de edad, su marido es ebanista, ellos viven en Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional.
Ella y  su esposo tienen un taller de ebanistería en su casa, allí el fabrica muebles de todo tipo, así como también puertas camas entre otras cosas, allí ella le ayuda y trabajan de lunes a sábado sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo y mucho más cuando tiene obras por entregar ya que esta es la mejor carta de presentación que él tiene el cumplimiento de sus obras a tiempo.  
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pinturas y  otros materiales necesarios para elaborar los muebles. Sus sueños son tener un gran local para vender los muebles.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Teresa is 49 years old, married and from this relationship she has 3 children, all of legal age. Her husband is a cabinetmaker and they live in Montecristi, a place known for its rich pre-colonial culture and its crafts, which are recognized nationally and internationally.

Teresa and her husband have a cabinetmaker's workshop at their house where they make all kinds of furniture, as well as doors and beds, among other things. She helps him with this activity and they work from Monday to Saturday. Their children help them with their work and with different things when they have a lot of deliveries, since meeting their customers' on-time delivery requirements is their letter of presentation.

This loan will be used to buy wood, paints and other materials that they need to make more furniture. Her dream is to have a big shop to sell their products.
LOAN_USE: to buy wood and paints.

DESCRIPTION: Eunice is a 32 year old married woman. She has 2 children with ages at 6 and 11 years. She describes herself to be hardworking. She operates a retail store where she sells home product such as sugar, wheat flour, cooking fat, salt, sodas etc. She has been involved in this business for 2 years and employs 2 staff members. In addition, Eunice runs an M-Pesa retail business.  Her business is located within a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving the business. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more home product for selling. Eunice's dream and  business goal is to run three other retail store.
LOAN_USE: to buy more home product.

DESCRIPTION:
The woman in this photo is Farogat. She is a very kind and responsible woman. In 1974, Farogat was born into a family of workers in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has two children: a son and a daughter.

Farogat is a responsible, hardworking, and bright person. She deals with buying and selling cattle. She likes her job and does it very well. She has been working for years in this sphere. The main income of her family is from her business.

Farogat has a son who is now sick. Her income is too small for her to save money because she is raising two children and providing them with all necessary things. Providing them with all necessary things, paying house expenses, and paying for education - all this is difficult for her. Her husband deals with construction, repairing houses.

Sadly, Farogat's son needs treatment. She lacks financial support. Farogat wants to treat him at the hospital, so she is requesting a loan from Kiva and IMON.

Farogat is asking for a loan for the first time from Kiva's field partner, IMON. She awaits your kindness.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The woman in this photo is Farogat. She is a very kind and responsible woman. In 1974, Farogat was born into a family of workers in Spitamen, Tajikistan. She is married and has two children: a son and a daughter.

Farogat is asking for a loan for the first time from Kiva's field partner, IMON. She awaits your kindness.
LOAN_USE: to pay her son’s treatment at the medical clinic.

DESCRIPTION:
Concolata is a caring farmer from the Nkubu area, which is a luxuriant maize and dairy-producing region in the Central province of Kenya. She is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and take on new challenges. These qualities have propelled her to become one of the most respected farmers in her village. Concolata has been practicing mixed farming for more than ten years.

Concolata is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she involves herself, dairy farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to milk her cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. She is so keen and close to her cows, that she has named them, which makes her very proud. She feels fulfilled.

Concolata is seeking an educational loan to pay tuition fees for her children, who are still in school. She believes that the knowledge and skills her children will get from school will help them have a brighter future. Through education, her children will secure good jobs and be able to build good modern houses. Contribute $25 or more towards this loan and empower Concolata's children’s lives.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

LOAN_USE: to pay school fees for her children and enable them to gain knowledge and skills to help them have a brighter future.

DESCRIPTION:
Damirbek is a member of this group. He is 31 and married. Together with his wife, he raises his daughter and son. Damirbek works as a loan officer in the financial group “Kompanion.” 

In addition to his job, he also sells foodstuffs to make additional money to meet the family needs. He started this business a year ago with an initial investment of 30 000 soms. He earns an additional 4200 soms per month for this business. 

With the money received from the loan, Damirbek wants to purchase more foodstuffs for resale. In the future he wants to purchase a vehicle with the money gained from the business, and will try to help his brother finish building his house.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.
LOAN_USE: to purchase foodstuffs.

DESCRIPTION: I started my Seed Butter company because a little girl named "Koa" was allergic to peanut butter. Koa\'s mother said one day, " we eat sunflower butter". I began researching stores for seed butters and did not see any pumpkin seed butter, so I created it with minimal ingredients and no processed sugars. In the beginning I wanted to just make something simple for " Koa" to enjoy for a snack. I started out in my home, then selling at farmers market and getting requests for other flavors. I now have three seed butter flavors and three nut flavors. Currently in two rainbow blossom locations and soon to be at Lucky\'s Market and an on-line store. I was a teenage mom at the age of 17 and was told that I would not make it out of high school.\r\nWell, I made it out of high school, graduated college and worked various jobs. I have always had a passion for cooking and experimenting with different recipes. I know that it is in my DNA to be a business owner. It feels right and I Love what I do everyday.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: I started my Seed Butter company because a little girl named "Koa" was allergic to peanut butter. Koa\'s mother said one day, " we eat sunflower butter". I began researching stores for seed butters and did not see any pumpkin seed butter, so I created it with minimal ingredients and no processed sugars. In the beginning I wanted to just make something simple for " Koa" to enjoy for a snack. I started out in my home, then selling at farmers market and getting requests for other flavors. I now have three seed butter flavors and three nut flavors. Currently in two rainbow blossom locations and soon to be at Lucky\'s Market and an on-line store. I was a teenage mom at the age of 17 and was told that I would not make it out of high school.\r\nWell, I made it out of high school, graduated college and worked various jobs. I have always had a passion for cooking and experimenting with different recipes. I know that it is in my DNA to be a business owner. It feels right and I Love what I do everyday.
LOAN_USE: replace household equipment and upgrade to commercial equipment. Increase volume of production per hour and gain working capital for my business.
TAGS: #Biz Durable Asset, #Eco-friendly, #Vegan, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Woman Owned Biz, #Parent, #Repair Renew Replace, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
Jenny es una joven de 22 años, está terminando sus estudios en diseño de moda. Hace un año emprendió su negocio donde brinda el servicio como costurera confeccionando prendas de vestir. Jenny vive con su madre y sus dos hermanas, ella es la mayor y hoy en día es quien ayuda económicamente en su hogar.
El objetivo de Jennny es terminar su carrera y juntar dinero para viajar al exterior a especializarse en diseño de moda para mujeres. Por el momento su objetivo inmediato es terminar su carrera, para ello está solicitando un crédito para el pago de la pensión universitaria y así terminar el último semestre.
Jenny es una chica muy responsable y va estar muy agradecida por su ayuda en este crédito.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jenny is 22 years old, and completing her studies in fashion design. A year ago, she began her business where she provides services as a seamstress making clothing. Jenny lives with her mother and her two sisters. She is the eldest, and right now she is the one that supports the family.

Jenny’s goal is to complete her degree, and save money to travel abroad to specialize in fashion design for women. For the moment, her immediate goal is to complete her degree and, for this reason, she is applying for a loan to pay for college tuition, and thus finish the last semester. Jenny is very responsible young woman, and she is very grateful for your help with this loan.
.
LOAN_USE: to pay for college tuition, and thus finish the last semester.

DESCRIPTION:
Okhunjon is married and a responsible father of his two children. He is a very hardworking and assiduous person. He is 25 years old and lives in DJ. Rasulov, Tajikistan, with his family.

He has dealt with animal husbandry for over five years. He primarily buys and sells cattle and has great experience in this sphere. He knows all aspects of his business and gets good income, which he spends to provide for his family.

Sadly, Okhunjon has become ill and needs treatment to recover his health. Okhunjon is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, IMON, to get a course of necessary medication at the hospital to improve his health.

He hopes to have your support which is very necessary for him!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Okhunjon is married and a responsible father of his two children. He is a very hardworking and assiduous person. He is 25 years old and lives in DJ. Rasulov, Tajikistan, with his family.

He has dealt with animal husbandry for over five years. He primarily buys and sells cattle and has great experience in this sphere. He knows all aspects of his business and gets good income, which he spends to provide for his family.

Sadly, Okhunjon has become ill and needs treatment to recover his health. Okhunjon is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner, IMON, to get a course of necessary medication at the hospital to improve his health.

He hopes to have your support which is very necessary for him!
LOAN_USE: to get a course of necessary medication at the hospital to improve his health.

DESCRIPTION: Elkin  es un hombre de 44 años, siempre fiel a sus principios, una persona que lucha y trabaja por su familia, por sus sueños, por una meta que es gozar de un mejor presente y tener las herramientas para construir un gran mañana. Se dedica a la Cría de Ganado Porcino, negocio que inició en el año 2014, como una alternativa de generar ingresos pues el empleo escasea, actualmente y debido a la falta de capital se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para comprar cuido de levante y cuido de engorde. Espera que con la inversión pueda mejorar los procesos productivos, ventas, ingresos y competitividad en la zona.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elkin is a 44 year old man who is always true to his principles. He is a person who strives and works for his family, his dreams and for the goal of enjoying a better present and having the toolset to build a better tomorrow. He makes his living raising pigs, a business he started in 2014 as an alternative to generate more income as jobs are scarce.

Currently, due to his lack of capital, he is requesting a loan to buy feed for the early growth and fattening stages. He hopes that with this investment he will be able to improve his production process, profits and competitive edge in this area.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed for the early growth and fattening stages of his pigs.

DESCRIPTION: I am Dorcas Kamau. I was born in Murang'a, Kangema division in Central province of Kenya in 1967. I moved from Murang'a and settled down in my new area, Olkalou. I sell improved cook stoves and solar lanterns to the rural people in Olkalou. I am currently selling these products through the network of the Ministry of Agriculture in Olkalou.\r\n\r\nI dream of being a major distributor of energy products in the whole of Nyandarua district. I also hope to open up a production centre for improved cook stoves.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: I am Dorcas Kamau. I was born in Murang'a, Kangema division in Central province of Kenya in 1967. I moved from Murang'a and settled down in my new area, Olkalou. I sell improved cook stoves and solar lanterns to the rural people in Olkalou. I am currently selling these products through the network of the Ministry of Agriculture in Olkalou.\r\n\r\nI dream of being a major distributor of energy products in the whole of Nyandarua district. I also hope to open up a production centre for improved cook stoves.
LOAN_USE: increase stock of improved cook stoves and open one more outlet in Olkalau

DESCRIPTION:
The hardest endeavor of my professional life was launching a cocktail bar in NYC.  The demand on myself and family was tough, but it was also the most exciting and satisfying!  feel blessed to have been able to go after my lifelong dream and achieve it with success. 

I now want to expand on the knowledge of cocktails I gained through the bar and expanding my customer base by putting my cocktails in a can for retail. I hope to be able to bring delicious cocktails to more and more people! I feel there is a great demand for quality cocktails that is ready to be filled and this is a great time to do it. 

My customers at the bar loved the notion of being able to bring the cocktails anywhere and at a better price point than the typical bar or restaurant.  I'm ready to can.. and very enthusiastic about this venture.  I hope to be selling nationally one day!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
