My customers at the bar loved the notion of being able to bring the cocktails anywhere and at a better price point than the typical bar or restaurant.  I'm ready to can.. and very enthusiastic about this venture.  I hope to be selling nationally one day!
LOAN_USE: produce, can and distribute the first batch of Boom Cocktails for sale in the marketplace.
TAGS: #First Loan, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Unique, #Biz Durable Asset, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Parent, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION:
Ever since Marcelina, 40 years old, was very little, she has really liked the art of welding. That is why she thought of having her own business, making gates and windows. Her husband and daughter help her with the business, specifically with customer relations. 

Marcelina does her work with great enthusiasm and dedication. In order to continue with her business, she wants a loan to buy hoses and a welding machine for her welding shop. Her big dream is to have a well-established business and a good quality of life with her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy hoses and a welding machine.

DESCRIPTION:
David is an ambitious small-holder farmer from the Kenyenya area of Kenya, which is an abundant maize-producing region in the Nyanza province of Kenya.

David is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and accept new challenges. These qualities have propelled him to become one of the most respected farmers in his village. He sells milk, bananas, poultry, maize, and vegetables produced on his farm.

Of all the activities in which he is involved, dairy farming is closest to his heart. He enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk his cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. He is so keen and close with his cows that he has named them, which makes David very proud and fulfilled.

David is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for his children. He believes that the knowledge and skills his children will get from school will help them have a brighter future.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
David is an ambitious small-holder farmer from the Kenyenya area of Kenya, which is an abundant maize-producing region in the Nyanza province of Kenya.

David is very passionate, hardworking, and eager to learn and accept new challenges. These qualities have propelled him to become one of the most respected farmers in his village. He sells milk, bananas, poultry, maize, and vegetables produced on his farm.

Of all the activities in which he is involved, dairy farming is closest to his heart. He enjoys waking up every morning to go and milk his cows and feed them with fodder that has high nutrient value. He is so keen and close with his cows that he has named them, which makes David very proud and fulfilled.

David is seeking an education loan to pay school fees for his children. He believes that the knowledge and skills his children will get from school will help them have a brighter future.
LOAN_USE: to pay tuition fees for his children, who are reporting to school this month.

DESCRIPTION:
Merlinda is 47 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Merlinda is 47 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Merlinda runs a business selling charcoal in the Philippines; she has been in this business for 10 years. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

In the future, Merlinda would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Temukisa is a 54-year-old widowed woman with seven children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Temukisa needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to meet her family's expenses every week and expand her business. Temukisa has been a member of SPBD since 2018.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Temukisa is a 54-year-old widowed woman with seven children. She makes and sells ice-cakes in her community to earn a living. She has two years of experience with this business.

Temukisa needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to meet her family's expenses every week and expand her business. Temukisa has been a member of SPBD since 2018.
LOAN_USE: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new chest freezer, Chinese candy and foam cups for her food production business.

DESCRIPTION:
Chariya’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang Province in Cambodia. Chariya makes a living by cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Chariya safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Chariya’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang Province in Cambodia. Chariya makes a living by cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water.

Having a water filter at home will help Chariya safeguard the health of her family, save money on medical expenses, and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
LOAN_USE: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs Nụ is 29 years old and has two children. She lives in Trieu Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry and growing rice for more than five years.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable.

One of the most critical issues that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet which will improve her family's living condition.

Having a hygienic toilet is her dream. She feels happy for this loan and hopes for her business to do well in the future.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mrs Nụ is 29 years old and has two children. She lives in Trieu Son district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province.

She has worked in agriculture raising poultry and growing rice for more than five years.

Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable.

One of the most critical issues that concerns her is the latrine is not hygienic. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet which will improve her family's living condition.

Having a hygienic toilet is her dream. She feels happy for this loan and hopes for her business to do well in the future.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a toilet

DESCRIPTION:
Ebenezer Saving Group is a group of hardworking ladies running different businesses within Kampala city. They formed the group with a desire to acquire funds to develop their personal businesses and supplement the family incomes generated by their husbands. 

Beatrice is a family woman. She has run her grocery store for quite some time and she is so proud of it. Her business has enabled her to take her children to school and provide other basic needs in the home like food and medical services. 

She wants to expand the business by adding stock so as to sell to as many clients as possible. She therefore approached UGAFODE for a loan through the group and is so grateful to Kiva funders for the assistance extended to her.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ebenezer Saving Group is a group of hardworking ladies running different businesses within Kampala city. They formed the group with a desire to acquire funds to develop their personal businesses and supplement the family incomes generated by their husbands. 

Beatrice is a family woman. She has run her grocery store for quite some time and she is so proud of it. Her business has enabled her to take her children to school and provide other basic needs in the home like food and medical services. 

She wants to expand the business by adding stock so as to sell to as many clients as possible. She therefore approached UGAFODE for a loan through the group and is so grateful to Kiva funders for the assistance extended to her.
LOAN_USE: To restock her retail shop to improve sales.

DESCRIPTION: Eva enjoys her farming activities inOroquieta city,Misamis Occidental . At the age of 49, married with 2 children to feed, she labors a lot to provide for their daily needs and for the education of her children. Being a farmer, she earns an average income of PHP 6,000 per harvest. Eva sign-up her membership with PMPC in 2007 and has taken several loans already. For this cropping season, she wants to take out a loan to purchase seeds and farm fertilizers. The profits she earns in her business will be used to invest in a sari-sari store as additional income, and the other funds for the tuition fees of her children.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Eva enjoys her farming activities inOroquieta city,Misamis Occidental . At the age of 49, married with 2 children to feed, she labors a lot to provide for their daily needs and for the education of her children. Being a farmer, she earns an average income of PHP 6,000 per harvest. Eva sign-up her membership with PMPC in 2007 and has taken several loans already. For this cropping season, she wants to take out a loan to purchase seeds and farm fertilizers. The profits she earns in her business will be used to invest in a sari-sari store as additional income, and the other funds for the tuition fees of her children.
LOAN_USE: to purchase seeds and fertilizer

DESCRIPTION: Hawa live in Paynesville, that is one of the most populated areas in Montserrado County.  She is 40 years old, and she is married with four children between 6 and 22 years old.  They are in school and live at home. \r\n\r\nFor the past 20 years she has been selling palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc in the local market.  She started this business with a little amount received from her husband.  She enjoys the buying from her customers and money that she generates from her business.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc to enlarge her business.  In the near future she wishes to have her own house.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more palm oil, salt, onion, vita, etc to enlarge her business,

DESCRIPTION:
Sameer is a 31-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City, West Bank. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Sameer has a plot of land in the village where he grows olive trees to produce oil.

His business is good and provides him a decent income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict. Sameer could not save cash from last season, so he took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some fertilizers and other inputs to care for his olive harvest this season. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his productivity, sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover the expenses for his children.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sameer is a 31-year-old married man from a small village near Jenin City, West Bank. He lives with his family in a small, old house. He is the only breadwinner for his family, and they depend on him for support. Sameer has a plot of land in the village where he grows olive trees to produce oil.

His business is good and provides him a decent income, but the economic situation in the West Bank is bad because of the latest conflict. Sameer could not save cash from last season, so he took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development. This loan will help him to buy some fertilizers and other inputs to care for his olive harvest this season. He hopes that this new inventory will enable him to increase his productivity, sales, customers, and eventually save enough income to cover the expenses for his children.
LOAN_USE: to buy some fertilizers and other inputs for farming olives.

DESCRIPTION:
Get to know Shoira, a kindhearted and honest person from Istaravshan, Tajikistan. She was born in 1977, is widowed, and has a child. She is the main provider for herself and her child and tries to provide him with the best living conditions.

Shoira is a farmer who grows a large quantity of potatoes and corn and sells them at a local market. She has been farming for more than 11 years and so has a great deal of experience. She knows her work well and has a large number of customers. She loves farming very much.

It’s planting season now, and she plans to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her farm to get a good harvest and ultimately improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan from Kiva so as to finance her plans. She is asking for a loan for the second time through Kiva's field partner IMON. She is very grateful for Kiva’s and IMON’s help.

It’s planting season now, and she plans to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her farm to get a good harvest and ultimately improve her living conditions. She is asking for a loan from Kiva so as to finance her plans. She is asking for a loan for the second time through Kiva's field partner IMON. She is very grateful for Kiva’s and IMON’s help.
LOAN_USE: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for her farm in order to realize a good harvest and ultimately improve her living conditions.

DESCRIPTION:
Janet lives in the town of Njeru in the Njeru region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past two years, Janet has been working hard to manage her boutique, which sells clothes.

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sheets and curtains to boost her business and will help Janet to generate greater profits. As Janet realizes more profits from the expanded business, she will be in position to improve on her standards of living and also cater to her children and pay their respective school dues. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to to complete the construction of her house, set up a retail shop, and start a tailoring business as well.

Janet is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

To help expand her business, Janet has requested a loan of 1,100,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to stock more sheets and curtains to boost her business and will help Janet to generate greater profits. As Janet realizes more profits from the expanded business, she will be in position to improve on her standards of living and also cater to her children and pay their respective school dues. Janet hopes that in the future she will be able to to complete the construction of her house, set up a retail shop, and start a tailoring business as well.

LOAN_USE: to stock more sheets and curtains to boost her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Mahbuba needs your help! She is seriously ill and must get a course of medication which is most expensive. She is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner IMON and you are her last hope.

Mahbuba is 56 years old, widowed and mother of 4 children. She is a business lady who sews women’s clothes in the local market. She has a great experience in this sphere. Sadly, because of her illness she is stopping her activity.

She awaits lender’s help!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mahbuba needs your help! She is seriously ill and must get a course of medication which is most expensive. She is asking for a loan from Kiva’s partner IMON and you are her last hope.

Mahbuba is 56 years old, widowed and mother of 4 children. She is a business lady who sews women’s clothes in the local market. She has a great experience in this sphere. Sadly, because of her illness she is stopping her activity.

She awaits lender’s help!
LOAN_USE: to pay for her personal treatment so she will able to recover her health and return to her normal life.

DESCRIPTION:
Yolanda makes a living selling snacks, soft drinks and pastries in the market at Leon. She started the business 20 years ago with savings of C$1,000. It was very expensive to get started because she began as a street vendor, first selling water, then soft drinks as she slowly established a business at the Terminal market across from the local bus station.

It's important to point out that Ceprodel provided financial support to Yolanda for two years with a total of 14 loans that have improved her quality of life and increased her working capital so that she's been able to build a small canteen where she can better tend to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La actividad económica de doña Yolanda es la venta de refrescos, gaseosas y reposterías en el mercado de León. Tiene 20 años de tener el negocio iniciando con un monto de C$1.000.00 producto del ahorro que ella tenia. Como todo inicio le fue muy costoso ya que inició como vendedora ambulante de agua, gaseosas para posteriormente establecer mejor su negocio en el mercado la Terminal ubicada frente a la estación de buses.

Es necesario destacar que Ceprodel le ha brindado apoyo financiero por un periodo de dos años con un total de 14 créditos que han tenido impacto en mejorar su nivel de vida y en el aumento de su capital de trabajo logrando así la construcción de un cafetín en donde atiende a sus clientes con mejores condiciones.
LOAN_USE: Buy merchandise for resale.

DESCRIPTION: Mamdouha is 52, married and has 3 children. She lives in the Egyptian countryside and has a small poultry business that she started in her house in order to have a source of income for her family. She has requested a loan before from TADE and fully repaid all the installments on due dates. She is requesting this loan to buy more chickens in order to expand her business as well as meet the demands of her customer's during Christmas season. She believes that the income after this season would allow her to afford a better education for her children.

She has requested a loan before from TADE and fully repaid all the installments on due dates. She is requesting this loan to buy more chickens in order to expand her business as well as meet the demands of her customer's during Christmas season. She believes that the income after this season would allow her to afford a better education for her children.
LOAN_USE: to buy more chickens

DESCRIPTION:
This is Dilbar, a resident of the Hamadoni district. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of two children. Dilbar is involved in animal husbandry. She has been raising cattle for 4 years already. She is a serious and responsible woman. She has a barn in which she takes care of her domestic animals. At the moment, she has two calves as she sold the others in a cattle market.

Dilbar is taking a loan to buy cattle. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase livestock and further develop her business. In the future, Dilbar is planning to expand her animal husbandry activity. She hopes to receive your support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This is Dilbar, a resident of the Hamadoni district. She is 49 years old, married and a mother of two children. Dilbar is involved in animal husbandry. She has been raising cattle for 4 years already. She is a serious and responsible woman. She has a barn in which she takes care of her domestic animals. At the moment, she has two calves as she sold the others in a cattle market.

Dilbar is taking a loan to buy cattle. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to purchase livestock and further develop her business. In the future, Dilbar is planning to expand her animal husbandry activity. She hopes to receive your support.
LOAN_USE: to purchase cattle.

DESCRIPTION:
La agricultura es una actividad solamente apta para toda aquella persona que ama la tierra como a una madre, como una engendradora de futuros para la vida.  Buenos futuros de esperanzas para generaciones siguientes, de 23 años de edad y con grandes aspiraciones en el futuro, el es un joven decidido a enfrentar la realidad de la vida para tener un futuro mejor en el mañana. 

La actividad que el dignamente realiza bajo un sol agotador es de agricultor, la producción que el realiza es la siembra de cebollas que para el es un buen campo para generar buenos ingresos económicos para el sostenimiento de su familia y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y comunidad el lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 3 años y le ha ido bien en ese negocio en la producción de cebollas. La segunda actividad que realiza es de jornalero en los alrededores de la comunidad.

El uso respectivo que el dará al crédito gestionado es para la compra de  de semillas de cebollas y la compra de fertilizantes orgánicos para así tener una buena cosecha y poner a las disposición sus productos de la mejor calidad a su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de Roberto es la compra de mas terrenos para la aplicación de sus cultivos que el realiza y realizar la construcción de su propio vivienda para así tener las condiciones de vida adecuada.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Agriculture is an activity only suited to people who love the earth as a mother, as an engenderer of future for life. 

With a good future of hope for coming generations, Roberto is 23 years old and has great aspirations for the future. He is a young man determined to face the reality of life for a better future tomorrow.

He farms with dignity under a single farmer. The works he does is the planting of onions, which, because he's a good farmer, earn a good income for supporting his family and improving his family's and community's life conditions. 

He's been doing this work for three years and this onion producing business has gone well. The second activity he does is day labor in the surrounding areas of the community.

The respective use that he will give the managed credit is for the purchase of onion seeds and buying organic fertilizers in order to have a good harvest and make the highest quality products available to his community. 

One of Roberto's aspirations is the purchase of more land for his crops and building his own house in order to have adequate living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to buy onion seeds and organic fertilizers.

DESCRIPTION: Neslie is a hardworking person. She is 48-years of age, has three children and a partner. They have a van transportation business, operating for almost ten years, which gives them their living income. In addition, Neslie wants to start-up a sari-sari (variety) store. She is a good citizen and would like to take a loan of 30,000 PHP, to buy commodities such as rice, eggs, bread, biscuits, condiments, milk, coffee, powder and the like. She is eager to generate more income profit for her family's wealth and future.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Neslie is a hardworking person. She is 48-years of age, has three children and a partner. They have a van transportation business, operating for almost ten years, which gives them their living income. In addition, Neslie wants to start-up a sari-sari (variety) store. She is a good citizen and would like to take a loan of 30,000 PHP, to buy commodities such as rice, eggs, bread, biscuits, condiments, milk, coffee, powder and the like. She is eager to generate more income profit for her family's wealth and future.
LOAN_USE: to buy commodities such as rice, eggs, bread, biscuits, condiments, milk, coffee, powder and the like.

DESCRIPTION: Il y a deux ans et demi que Kidorho exerce le commerce des divers(fils d'attache filets, sucre, lait de beauté, habits, savons, etc).Cette initiative lui est venue du fait que ses amis en avaient déjà fait bon affaire avec ce type de commerce. Aujourd'hui il éprouve le  problème de taux de change et dettes non remboursables dans le délai par ses clients.Il sollicite un prêt pour qu'il soit à mesure de satisfaire sa clientèle et subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.Il est sur la photo avec sa femme qui fait partie du groupe.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Kidorho started selling various products (thread for nets, sugar, beauty lotions, clothes, soap, etc) two years ago. He started it because his friends had good experiences with this type of business.

Today he faces difficulties in connexion with the exchange rate and debts not being reimbursed timely by his customers. He's seeking this loan to meet customer demand and provide for his family's needs.

In the picture, he's next to his wife, who's also a member of the group.
LOAN_USE: to buy various products (beauty lotions, clothes, soaps, rice, sugar, cookies, etc)
COUNTRY_NAME: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

DESCRIPTION:
Adela is a 45-year-old married woman from Getafe, Bohol. 

She raises chickens. She has been raising chickens for almost 10 years. She earns 8,000 PHP a month by doing this poultry business.

She requested a loan of 6,000 PHP to buy additional chickens and feeds. In the future, Adela hopes that she will be successful in her poultry business to improve her family's livelihood status and to save for the future.
LOAN_USE: to  buy additional chickens and feeds.

DESCRIPTION:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SUMAQ BANCO – LIVITACA.

La socia Inocencia tiene 43 años de edad y es casada, la socia se dedica al negocio de venta de salchipollos, la socia espera poder obtener más ganancias con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa,  la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone  cada día  su negocio, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para comprar pollos, aceite, papas entre otros.


Los socios en general agradecen en el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The borrower, Inocencia, belongs to the communal bank Sumaq Banco - Livitaca. She is 43 years old and married. She has a business selling salchipollos [a sausage, chicken, potatoes, onions, and lettuce dish]. She hopes to be able to obtain more earnings with her business which is going well thanks to the effort she puts in each day to her work. She is a responsible and committed person. She has been in business for some time, is doing well thanks to her persistence in daily work, as this is the way she supports her family.

She is requesting the loan to buy chickens, oil, potatoes, among other items.

The general group membership is grateful for the granted loan and promise to complete the payments within the established time frame.
LOAN_USE: to buy chickens, oil, potatoes, among other items.
BORROWER_NAMES: Timoteo, Inocencia, Marisol, Francisca, Crespina, GRINALDO
BORROWER_GENDERS: male, female, female, female, female, male
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION: Susana earns a living through her food-vending business selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her town. Susana is asking for a loan to buy additional ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, cooking oil, milk and other items. With this, she will be able to cook and sell more to the people in her town, thus augmenting her sales and income.
LOAN_USE: To buy additional ingredients like flour, butter, sugar, cooking oil, milk and other items

DESCRIPTION:
Fazliddin is a kind man who was born in 1988 into a worker's family. He is married and his wife is a housekeeper. He is clever and always tries to secure the well-being of his family.

Fazliddin earns a living working at the local market with buying and selling vegetables. He has been doing this for more than four years and does his jobs well, as he is capable. He earns a low income and lives modestly.

Fazliddin needs financial support because his mother is ill. He loves his mother and takes care of her by himself. He must buy medicine for her, and his low income is not enough to have her treated at a medical clinic. Fazliddin is asking for a loan of 5,000 TJS to buy medicine. He is asking for his first loan from Kiva's field partner IMON.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

He is asking for his first loan from Kiva's field partner IMON.
LOAN_USE: to pay for his mother’s treatment at the medical clinic.

DESCRIPTION: Замира жительница города Исфара. Ей 27 лет. Она замужем. Ее муж находится на заработках в Российской Федерации. Сама Змира занимается торговлей фруктов. В этой области она 7 лет. Кредит берет для покупки фруктов.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Zamira is a resident of the city of Isfara.  She is 27 years old, married.  Her husband is in the Russian Federation for work.  Zamira is involved in selling fruits.  She has been in this business for seven years.  She is requesting this loan to buy fruits.
LOAN_USE: to purchase tangerines, kiwi and several varieties of grapes

DESCRIPTION:
Josephine is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Josephine is 48 years old and has two children who are in school.

Josephine has a selling ready to wear items business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional ready to wear items to sell to her customers.

Josephine has been in this business for 10 years. Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

LOAN_USE: to buy additional ready to wear items to sell to her customers.

DESCRIPTION:
Susan has owned a fishing boat for five years now. Her income depends on fishing. Susan lives in the area of Concepcion town. She has 1 dependent child.

Aside from fishing, Susan also caters buying and selling of dried fish, as supplemental income. Her goal is to continue to improve the current situation of her family as well as support the schooling of her child.

To make it happen, Susan has applied for a loan that was used to invest in a fish net and plastic screen that are used for fishing.

Susan is asking your support to carry out her goal.

Susette  is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard  working entrepreneur. 

Susette  has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy piglets, feeds and other items for her pig fattening business.

Susette  has been in this business for 10 years.  In the future, Susette  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

DESCRIPTION: Margaret is 50 years old, married and blessed with three children.  She has been farming for 13 years.  She does livestock farming, rearing poultry, dairy cows and pigs.  She has improved her business since she joined Faulu Kenya because she has been trained on business management skills.\r\n\r\nMargaret hopes to practice large-scale farming in the future.  She has requested for 20,000 KES to buy chicks and chicks mash.
LOAN_USE: buy chicks and chicken feed

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of seven children, Helen works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines. Helen is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Helen has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KSPPS BMI’s clients, Anih who is 38 years-old and married with two sons. Anih is a housewife and stays at home to look after her kid who is young. Her husband works very hard and he has been selling accessories in the Tangerang District for twenty years.

They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy live for their kids. She has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KSPPS BMI. This loan will be used to build a clean water source facility at her home to improve access to a water source for her family. Today her family has no access to a water source in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a water source but Anih will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean water.

She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KSPPS BMI’s clients, Anih who is 38 years-old and married with two sons. Anih is a housewife and stays at home to look after her kid who is young. Her husband works very hard and he has been selling accessories in the Tangerang District for twenty years.

She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders
LOAN_USE: to build a clean water source facility at her home to improve access to water for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Dilafruz is 41 years old, married, and has three excellent children. She is a farmer, which she has been doing for years. Sarvinoz has 6 hectares to sow wheat, onion, sunflower, etc. She earns a low income and lives poorly. She barely provides food and clothing for her family. Her husband's income is not large.

She is sick now and needs to be treated in a medical clinic. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to be treated in a medical clinic. She hopes to be treated and improve her health.

She awaits your kindness and charity!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Dilafruz is 41 years old, married, and has three excellent children. She is a farmer, which she has been doing for years. Sarvinoz has 6 hectares to sow wheat, onion, sunflower, etc. She earns a low income and lives poorly. She barely provides food and clothing for her family. Her husband's income is not large.

She is sick now and needs to be treated in a medical clinic. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders to be treated in a medical clinic. She hopes to be treated and improve her health.

She awaits your kindness and charity!
LOAN_USE: to be treated in a medical clinic and improve her health.

DESCRIPTION:
Suzan is a 49-year-old, divorced woman from Nablus City. She is a mother of one son and she lives with her son in a small house. 

Suzan lives in bad economic conditions, but she has a long experience in sewing where she has worked as a tailor for 20 years. 

Suzan took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN) to buy a new sewing machine.  After she takes this loan, she will increase her production and sales and she will improve her economic situation. 

Suzan appears in the photo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION: Risueñas es un grupo pequeño y emprendedor, compuesto por 5 mujeres que solo quieren alcanzar sus sueños y sacar a sus familias adelante. Lisbeth es una mujer joven de 25 años de edad vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo de 2 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada en mercados rodantes y el crédito la ayudara para comprar mas ropa de temporada de frio. Ella desea tener su propia tienda de ropa en su casa para poder atender su negocio sin tener que descuidar a su hijo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: “Risueñas” is a small enterprising group made up of five ladies who only want to achieve their dreams and get their families ahead.  Lisbeth is a 25 year old young woman who is in a live-in relationship and has a two-year old son.  She sells new and used clothing in the surrounding markets and this loan will help her buy clothing for the cold climate.  She would like to have a store of her own in her home so that she can tend to her business while she cares for her son.
LOAN_USE: Coprar mas ropa de temporada de frio.
BORROWER_NAMES: Rosa Delia, Maria Magdalena, Evangelica, Lisbeth, Mireya Zulema

DESCRIPTION: Yohima del Rosario de 26 años de edad, es habitante de la zona 5 de Nueva Guinea, es madre soltera, comerciante, posee su propio negocio donde ha salido adelante ella sola, este es su tercer crédito el cual necesita para realizar mejora de su vivienda en esta ocasión su dormitorio, por lo que requiere comprar cemento, arena, bloque, piedrín, hierro, alambre y pagar mano de obra y asi darles mejores condiciones a su dos niños menores de edad y mejor calidad de vida, esta agradecida con Afodenic y Kiva, ya que ha salido adelante y mejorado la econimia de su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yohima del Rosario is a 26-year-old single mother who lives in zone 5 of Nueva Guinea.  She is a merchant and has her own business where she has gotten ahead all on her own.  

This is her third loan, which she needs in order to make some home improvements. In this case, she will be making improvements to her bedroom.  She will need to buy cement, sand, concrete block, gravel, iron, and wiring as well as pay for labor.  These improvements will provide better living conditions and a better quality of life for her two school-aged children.  

She is grateful to Afodenic and Kiva because she has prospered and increased her family’s income.
LOAN_USE: to buy cement, sand, concrete block, gravel, iron, and wiring as well as pay labor costs to make improvements to her room.

DESCRIPTION:
Teresita is married and has three children. She is 47 years old and lives in Balili, Kapatagan, Lanao del Norte. 

Teresita owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting corn to sell to earn a living. She has been in this business for six years. Each month, she earns 8,000 PHP doing this type of business. Teresita requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC. She hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fertilizers such as manure.

DESCRIPTION: Nazik lives in Aygestan village with her parents, grandmother and brother. Her grandmother is retired and her mother works at a local municipality. All of the members of the family, including Nazik, are involved in farming. They cultivate cabbage, and grow different fruit trees (apricot, peach, pear, plum and apple). Nazik's father and brother sell the gathered harvest in the local markets to earn income for the family.\r\n\r\nThe requested loan of USD 1,500 is very important for their farm to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, cabbage seeds and to cover watering costs. Nazik and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and they will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain her small business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Nazik lives in Aygestan village with her parents, grandmother and brother. Her grandmother is retired and her mother works at a local municipality. All of the members of the family, including Nazik, are involved in farming. They cultivate cabbage, and grow different fruit trees (apricot, peach, pear, plum and apple). Nazik's father and brother sell the gathered harvest in the local markets to earn income for the family.\r\n\r\nThe requested loan of USD 1,500 is very important for their farm to purchase fertilizer, pesticides, cabbage seeds and to cover watering costs. Nazik and her family highly rely on the goodwill of the lenders, and they will greatly appreciate their support in collecting the needed loan amount to sustain her small business.
LOAN_USE: to pay for fertilizer, pesticides, cabbage seeds and to cover watering costs.

DESCRIPTION:
Luz, is aged 48, married to a village councilor and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost four years, and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income on this business was spent on their daily expenses at home.

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase seedlings of eggplants, string beans, lady fingers, bell peppers and squash to plant.

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively and profitably.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Luz, is aged 48, married to a village councilor and they're blessed with three children. She has owned and managed a vegetable production business in their village for almost four years, and earns a net income of PHP 300 daily. Her net income on this business was spent on their daily expenses at home.

Due to insufficient capital in her business, she would like to avail a loan amounting to PHP 5,000 to purchase seedlings of eggplants, string beans, lady fingers, bell peppers and squash to plant.

She's hoping that her business will continue to grow productively and profitably.
LOAN_USE: to purchase seedlings of eggplants, string beans, lady fingers, bell peppers, and squash to plant.

DESCRIPTION: Chea P., age 26, is married and resides with her husband in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has a child. She is a construction worker, earning approximately US $3 per day. By doing so, she is able to cover her family's expenses, especially those for her children’s education. She has been doing this business since 2009. Her husband is a construction foreman, earning an income of US $7 per day. Their standard of living has improved since P.’s husband has been doing this business, so she wants to have a loan to expand his business. P. is requesting a loan of US $800 to buy more construction tools to expand his business. This is her second loan from CREDIT, a partner of Kiva.
LOAN_USE: To buy construction tools

DESCRIPTION: Justina raises cows. She wants to improve her livelihood to be able to support the needs of her family. Aside from that, she is also managing a barbecue business. She sells barbecue everyday. The income that she earns helps a lot to accommodate the daily needs of her family. She wants to send all her children to school; that is why she wants to have more businesses. She would like to apply for a loan at Community Economic Ventures Inc. to buy chickens for her barbecue, cow feed and vitamins. \r\n\r\nShe hopes to receive a loan from Community Ventures Inc. to help her with her livelihood.
LOAN_USE: To buy cow feed, vitamins & chickens

DESCRIPTION:
Leonora is 42 years old and married with seven children, four of whom in school, Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for 21 years.

In the future Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Leonora is 42 years old and married with seven children, four of whom in school, Leonora works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Leonora has been in this business for 21 years.

In the future Leonora would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

DESCRIPTION: Flavia is a single mother of four children and all her children go to school.  She also takes care of additional family members (her younger brother). She has a retail shop and has been   in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 1,000,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more creates of soda, mineral water, boxes of packed juice and biscuits.  She works at the market six days out of every week. She generates additional income from selling used clothes.  \r\n\r\nFlavia's major business challenges include seasonality and thieves.  She is aspiring of owning a fully stocked retail shop and also buying a plot of land and building a house.  She decided to join MCDT-SACCO because of low interest charged. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity but not to piped water.  Her monthly expenses  includes school fees and rent.
LOAN_USE: To buy more crates of soda, packed juice, boxes of mineral water and biscuits.

DESCRIPTION:
Abubakari is a 35-year-old self-employed man and the breadwinner for a family of 12, comprised of 6 men and 6 women. He heard about Sama Sama Pour Flush Toilets from iDE Ghana’s sales agents and wants to buy one. He wants to own a toilet in his house to avoid the risks of open defecation for his family.

He can’t afford to purchase a toilet outright, so he would like to take a loan to purchase one and repay the loan in installments from his monthly earnings.

Abubakari thinks that having a toilet in his house will improve his family’s health and will be his contribution to the family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Abubakari is a 35-year-old self-employed man and the breadwinner for a family of 12, comprised of 6 men and 6 women. He heard about Sama Sama Pour Flush Toilets from iDE Ghana’s sales agents and wants to buy one. He wants to own a toilet in his house to avoid the risks of open defecation for his family.

He can’t afford to purchase a toilet outright, so he would like to take a loan to purchase one and repay the loan in installments from his monthly earnings.

Abubakari thinks that having a toilet in his house will improve his family’s health and will be his contribution to the family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a Sama Sama Pour Flush Toilet.

DESCRIPTION: Аттокур, 62 года, женат, есть 5 детей. У Аттокура средне-специальное образование, он работает в начальником в районной почте. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством на протяжении многих лет. Благодаря упорному труду Аттокура и помощи его супруги с хозяйством, в его хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 11 коров, 2 овцы и 4 лошади. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства Аттокур обратился в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота, с целью увеличения дохода от откорма и перепродажи. Доходы от кредита помогут Аттокуру расширить его хозяйство и накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Attokur is 62 and married with five children. He has a specialist high school education and works in leadership at the district post office. He has also been working in animal husbandry for many years as an additional source of income for his family. Thanks to his hard work and help from his wife, he currently has 11 cows, two sheep and four horses on his farm.

With the goal of further developing his farm, Attokur has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy livestock to increase his income from fattening and reselling livestock. Income from the loan will help him expand his farm and save toward his son's wedding.
LOAN_USE: to purchase livestock to increase his income from fattening and reselling livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Hope's group is comprised of two young hard working women. Hope is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kasangati region of central Uganda.

She has two children who attend school. For the past two years, Hope has worked hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks.

To help expand her business, Hope successfully completed her first loan and she has requested another loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.

The loan will be used to buy more products like crates of soda, salt and bottled water which will expand her business, and will help Hope generate greater profits.

She will be able to pay school fees for her kids since their father is not that supportive to his kids.

Hope hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger retail store that will provide enough support for her family

Hope is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hope's group is comprised of two young hard working women. Hope is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kasangati in the Kasangati region of central Uganda.

She has two children who attend school. For the past two years, Hope has worked hard to manage her retail shop, which sells soft drinks.

To help expand her business, Hope successfully completed her first loan and she has requested another loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.

The loan will be used to buy more products like crates of soda, salt and bottled water which will expand her business, and will help Hope generate greater profits.

She will be able to pay school fees for her kids since their father is not that supportive to his kids.

Hope hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a bigger retail store that will provide enough support for her family

Hope is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to buy more products like soda, salt and bottled water.

DESCRIPTION:
Cherie works hard to support her family. She's married and has a buy-and-sell feed business in the Philippines.

She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of feed to sell.

She's been in business for five years. Cherie would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cherie works hard to support her family. She's married and has a buy-and-sell feed business in the Philippines.

She requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of feed to sell.

She's been in business for five years. Cherie would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more sacks of feed to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Genalyn is 38 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Genalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Genalyn has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Genalyn is 38 years old and married with six children. With five children in school, Genalyn works very hard to provide for them.

Genalyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Genalyn has been in this business for 17 years and sells a variety of items such as rice, sugar, soap, and other groceries.

In the future, Genalyn would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs Hân is 31 years old and she is married with 3 children.

Hân lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a retail business selling\xa0fish for 8 years. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean toilet to use. But her income is not enough to get a new one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to install a new toilet system.

This is Hân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mrs Hân is 31 years old and she is married with 3 children.

Hân lives in Hau Loc district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province. She has had a retail business selling\xa0fish for 8 years. Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover this job is unstable.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having clean toilet to use. But her income is not enough to get a new one. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to install a new toilet system.

This is Hân first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.

With her business profit, Hân hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.
LOAN_USE: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to install a new toilet system.

DESCRIPTION: Twahirwa, a 32-year-old father of a two-year-old child, is married to a tailor, while he has been selling chickens, goats and eggs for the past six years.  This business has enabled him to feed his family, and he is now requesting a loan to buy more animals such as goats to sell in order to make more profits. Twahirwa plans to better provide for his family with the profits he hopes to make.
LOAN_USE: to buy animals to sell.

DESCRIPTION: Maricel is 35 years old, married, and a resident of Sindangan, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2014 and has taken out three loans. Now she is applying for 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Maricel is 35 years old, married, and a resident of Sindangan, Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have two children, both of whom are in school. Starting with capitalization of 3,000 PHP, she opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefit given by the co-op. She became a member in April 2014 and has taken out three loans. Now she is applying for 15,000 PHP to buy additional stocks for her sari-sari store, particularly basic commodities. In the future, she wants to own a mini-mart someday, and will be fully satisfied if she sees her children finish their studies.
LOAN_USE: to restock her grocery store

DESCRIPTION:
Ma. Christine works hard to support two children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Christine requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Ma. Christine is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ma. Christine works hard to support two children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Ma. Christine requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to invest in a sanitary toilet.

Ma. Christine is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Mary is 34 years old and lives in the town of Makindye in the Kampala North region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past year, Mary has been working hard to manage her clinic, which sells medicine. 
To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2000000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to improve her business, and it will help Mary to generate greater profits and cater for all the basic needs of her family. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to get the drug shop licenses. 
Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.
LOAN_USE: to improve her business

DESCRIPTION:
Lilia is 53 years old, married, and has three children. All of her children are in school, so she works very hard to provide for her family.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, personal care products, and other items to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money in order to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Lilia is 53 years old, married, and has three children. All of her children are in school, so she works very hard to provide for her family.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase canned goods, personal care products, and other items to sell. She has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items.

In the future, Lilia would like to save money in order to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase canned goods, personal care products, and other items to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Nolecar is a mother of five children aged 14, 10, 5, 2 and a 6-month-old baby. She is 29 years old and married to a farmer. She runs a salon and barbershop where she delights in offering grooming services to her clients. She is skilled in giving good looks and everyone enjoys her services greatly. She will buy more shaving machines and a blow dryer to meet the rising needs and create employment.

This is her second loan cycle and she pays on time. She dreams of giving her family a healthy living and a quality education to her children.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Nolecar is a mother of five children aged 14, 10, 5, 2 and a 6-month-old baby. She is 29 years old and married to a farmer. She runs a salon and barbershop where she delights in offering grooming services to her clients. She is skilled in giving good looks and everyone enjoys her services greatly. She will buy more shaving machines and a blow dryer to meet the rising needs and create employment.

This is her second loan cycle and she pays on time. She dreams of giving her family a healthy living and a quality education to her children.
LOAN_USE: to buy blow dryers and shaving machines to create employment.

DESCRIPTION:
Rosalina is a 31-year-old mother of two children. She runs a business making and selling handicrafts in her community to earn a living.

Rosalina requested a loan to buy glue, hooks, and an electronic fan to help her run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2015. She will use her profit to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rosalina is a 31-year-old mother of two children. She runs a business making and selling handicrafts in her community to earn a living.

Rosalina requested a loan to buy glue, hooks, and an electronic fan to help her run the business.

She joined SPBD in 2015. She will use her profit to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy glue, hooks, and an electronic fan.

DESCRIPTION:
Melanie P. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 29 years old. Melanie is married and has two infants. To make a living, Melanie owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, powdered juice, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Melanie's husband is providing motorela or habal-habal services (motorcycles that can handle multiple passengers). Melanie has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Melanie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melanie has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Melanie is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages. This loan will be the sixth loan taken out by Melanie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional canned goods, junk foods & beverages

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Sayohatjon. She is a hard-working and kind woman. She is 42 years old and has two children. She is raising her children alone as her husband migrated abroad to work. She always tries to take care of her children.

For more than 18 years, Sayohatjon works in animal husbandry. She works very hard in order to provide a good life for her family. She knows all of the aspects of her business and has great success.

Unfortunately, Sayohatjon is ill and needs medical treatment. She doesn’t have the money to buy medicines and to pay for her treatment at the medical clinic. With this loan she will improve her health condition and continue her business.

Sayohatjon is a returning borrower and has a positive credit history. She is asking for a loan for the eighth time with Kiva’s partner, IMON, to pay for her treatment at the medical clinic. She needs this financial support and awaits your kindness.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Meet Sayohatjon. She is a hard-working and kind woman. She is 42 years old and has two children. She is raising her children alone as her husband migrated abroad to work. She always tries to take care of her children.

For more than 18 years, Sayohatjon works in animal husbandry. She works very hard in order to provide a good life for her family. She knows all of the aspects of her business and has great success.

Unfortunately, Sayohatjon is ill and needs medical treatment. She doesn’t have the money to buy medicines and to pay for her treatment at the medical clinic. With this loan she will improve her health condition and continue her business.

Sayohatjon is a returning borrower and has a positive credit history. She is asking for a loan for the eighth time with Kiva’s partner, IMON, to pay for her treatment at the medical clinic. She needs this financial support and awaits your kindness.
LOAN_USE: to pay for medical treatment and medicines needed to improve her health.

DESCRIPTION:
Araceli T., a 58-year old married woman who lives in Brgy Talusan, Sagay City, Negros Occidental, earns her living by buying and selling vegetables. Araceli’s husband Mauriceo is 61 years old and works as a coconut sap extractor (Mananggete). They have ten children, eight of whom have their own families while two still live at home but are also gainfully employed and contribute toward the support of their household.

Arceli joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2004 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD she has been able to increase their family income by buying and selling vegetables. Now she earns an average monthly income of Php 10,000 from her business activities.

Araceli is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of Php 19,500 was used to fund her vegetable-vending business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 12th loan in the amount of Php 19,500 to buy more vegetables to resell. Araceli is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
LOAN_USE: To buy more vegetables to sell

DESCRIPTION: La señora Yasohara ya junto a su esposo han trabajado mucho para poder cumplir su mayor sueño tener su casa propia y darles un buen porvenir a sus dos hijos, ella es comerciante y su esposo trabaja en una empresa privado como electricista. Gracias al apoyo que le hemos  brindado ya casi finalizan su meta, con este nuevo credito podran terminar su priorida es relaizar un muro para tener mayor segurida, para eso compraran los siguientes Materiales: Cemento, Arena, Piedras Cantera, Hierro etc.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Yasohara and her husband have worked very hard to fulfill their biggest dream of having their own home and providing the best for their two children. She is a merchant, and her husband works as an electrician for a private company. Thank to the support we have provided them, they are close to completing their goal. With this new loan, they will be able to finish putting up a wall to give them better security. To do this, they plan on purchasing cement, sand, quarry stones, iron and other items.
LOAN_USE: to purchase construction materials (cement, sand, stones and iron)

DESCRIPTION:
Mercel is 32 years old and married with one child.

Mercel works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Mercel has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from fishing and gasoline retailing.

Mercel aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Doaa has 5 children. Her husband works to take care of the family. She herself embroiders and thought it can be a way to provide for her children. She doesn't have the funds to improve her business.

So she is asking for a loan to buy fabric and thread. Then she will use what is left to buy a modern sewing machine. Her ultimate goal is to open a workshop and train others one day.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Doaa has 5 children. Her husband works to take care of the family. She herself embroiders and thought it can be a way to provide for her children. She doesn't have the funds to improve her business.

So she is asking for a loan to buy fabric and thread. Then she will use what is left to buy a modern sewing machine. Her ultimate goal is to open a workshop and train others one day.
LOAN_USE: to buy fabric, thread and a modern sewing machine to make embroidery to sell for an income.

DESCRIPTION:
Segundina is engaged in calamansi (citrus fruit) business.  She plants and sell calamansi in wholesale price.  She has been nine years in the business and she is really enjoying working with the support of her family especially her husband. 

"The power of God within you is greater than the pressures around you”. This quote guides her to live a good life and have patience in order to make her business grow. At present, she wanted to borrow the amount of PHP32, 000.00 to have an additional capital for the maintenance of her business. She hopes that KIVA lenders will grant her request.
LOAN_USE: Additional Capital

DESCRIPTION: DOÑA CELENA KARINA ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA DE 35 AÑOS DE EDAD, EN UNION LIBRE, TIENE DOS HIJOS DE 9 Y 5 AÑOS DE EDAD, SE DEDICA A LA CRIANZA DE POLLOS Y CERDOS PARA ENGORDE DESDE HACE 3 AÑOS, EL CREDITO LO VA A UTILIZAR PARA COMPRAR POLLOS Y COMIDA PARA POLLOS, SU SUEÑO ES CRECER EN SU NEGOCIO.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Celena Karina is a hard-working woman who is 35 years old.  She is in a relationship, and has two children who are 9 and 5 years old.  She has worked for three years raising and fattening up chickens and pigs.  The loan is going to be used to buy chickens and feed for them.  Her dream is to grow her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy chickens and feed for them

DESCRIPTION:
Marites C. is a married woman who lives in Purok Golden Rosary, Brgy. Jonobjonob, Escalante City, Negros Occidental. She operates 2 business ventures: a general store and a pre-paid cellphone E-loading businesses. Her husband, Antony, who is 22 years old, works abroad as an Overseas Filipino Worker (OFW) to support his family. They have a 2-year-old child. 

Marites joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 3 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marites has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 6,000, lifting her family's standard of living.  This time, for her 4th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,000. She intends to use this to purchase dry goods for her store so that she can continue to save up for the future expansion of her business. Marites C. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more stock

DESCRIPTION: Monsieur Libasse est âgé de 33 ans. Il vit au Sénégal, il est marié et père de 2 enfants dont l’âge  varie  entre 2 et 4 ans. Il est enseignant depuis 2006 dans une école privée du quartier ou il habite. Parallèlement  il fait des prestations de service depuis 2008 accès  sur l’organisation de cérémonies comme mariage, baptême, conférence, etc.  Il a choisi ses activités par passion, mais aussi pour subvenir à ses besoins quotidiens. Ce qui lui procure beaucoup de plaisir c’est le savoir qu’il inculque aux enfants. Il est sociétaire d’un des guichets de l’U-IMCEC depuis février 2008. Il a déjà remboursé un crédit antérieur. Il sollicite un prêt  de 400 000 frs. Il sollicite un crédit de 400 000 frs prévu pour l’achat de  certains matériels utilisés pour l’organisation d’événements tels que bâches, tissus de décoration, tapis rouge ce qui lui permettra d’être  bien équipé pour offrir des services de qualité a sa clientèle. Son but est d’accroitre ses revenus et améliorer le bien être  de sa famille.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mr. Libasse is 33 years old and lives in Senegal. He is married and the father of two children, who are 2 and 4 years old. He has been a teacher since 2006 in a private school in the district where he lives. Concurrently, he has worked in the service sector since 2008 organizing events, such as marriages, baptisms, conferences, etc. He chose these kinds of work for the love of them but also for supporting himself from day to day. What makes him very happy is the knowledge he instills in children. 

Mr. Libasse has been an associate of a U-IMCEC branch since February 2008. He has already repaid a previous loan. He is requesting a loan of 400,000 francs to buy certain supplies used for organizing events such as tarps, decorative fabrics, and red carpets that will enable him to equip himself well, so as to offer quality service to his customers. His goal is to grow his revenues and to improve his family's well-being.
LOAN_USE: to buy tarps, decorative fabrics, red carpets, etc. for his business

DESCRIPTION:
Anahit is 28 years old and lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. She is married and has three children. Anahit's husband works abroad and transfers money to provide for his family's needs. She has obtained a higher pedagogical education and specializes in English Language and Literature. For three years, Anahit has worked as a teacher of English Language and Literature at a local school. She also gives paid private courses in her subject and helps a lot of pupils prepare for entrance exams. Anahit is respected and beloved by her pupils and she works with great pleasure and care with all of them.

Anahit is requesting a 600,000 AMD loan to buy a computer and professional literature to develop and enlarge her professional skills.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

DESCRIPTION:
Mrs. Kom Y. is a 45-year-old resident of a local village in Kompong Tom Province. She is a mother of five children, four of whom are single. Her husband Krin is a fisherman, while Kom owns a piece of farmland that she inherited many years ago from her grandparents. She planted rice and vegetable crops two months ago, and her crops are growing well.

Kom presently earns a living raising ducks in a cage behind her house, selling their eggs to people who come to buy in bulk at her house. She is now applying for a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase additional ducks to produce eggs for sale.
LOAN_USE: To purchase additional ducks to produce eggs to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Johny lives in Concepcion, Iloilo, where most communities earn a living through fishing. He is in one of those communities that support their family through this livelihood. He has been doing this for many years now.

Johny wants to improve this livelihood for his children’s education. He and his wife have four children aged between 10 to 20 years old. He wants them all to finish their studies and have better lives someday.

He is asking for a loan that can help him improve his catch. He will use the money to buy a boat engine. In this way, he will be able to increase their earnings as well as their profitability.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Johny lives in Concepcion, Iloilo, where most communities earn a living through fishing. He is in one of those communities that support their family through this livelihood. He has been doing this for many years now.

Johny wants to improve this livelihood for his children’s education. He and his wife have four children aged between 10 to 20 years old. He wants them all to finish their studies and have better lives someday.

He is asking for a loan that can help him improve his catch. He will use the money to buy a boat engine. In this way, he will be able to increase their earnings as well as their profitability.
LOAN_USE: to buy a boat engine.

DESCRIPTION:
Svetlana is a skillful retailer from Ijevan town. Svetlana lives there with her 75-year-old mother and takes care of her. Svetlana retails at the local mall. She mainly sells shoes for children and perfume. Svetlana has enough clients to generate income for proper living. Svetlana, besides retailing business, also provides piano lessons in her house since she is a musician by profession.

Svetlana has applied for this loan to pay for a new stock of children's shoes. Svetlana hopes to attract more client with new winter assortment of shoes. She is so thankful in advance.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
