DESCRIPTION:
Ma. Lyn B. is a married woman who supports her family by selling Ready-to-Wear (RTW) clothes, vegetable vending and doing other networking sales activities. She lives in Brgy. Basak, Cuayan Negros Occidental with her husband and their 6 children.  Her children are 5 to 17 years old; one works and 5 are currently studying and also helping their parents.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 6,000.

Ma. Lyn is now borrowing PHP 20,500 so that she can continue with her multiple business activities, the bulk of which is selling RTW clothes. This will be her 11th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. A previous loan of PHP 20,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Ma. Lyn aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.
LOAN_USE: To purchase additional working capital.

DESCRIPTION:
Maria Lyn P. is from the village of Balulang, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 26 years old and married with 4 school-aged children. Maria Lyn owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products, including fish and shrimp, in the local community. Maria Lyn has been involved in her business for over a year and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Maria Lyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maria Lyn is requesting her first loan from HSPFI, for 5000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional products to sell
TOWN_NAME: Balulang, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Grace is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, and other supplies needed for her food-vending business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of three children, Mary Grace works hard to support her family.

She has a food-vending business in the Philippines, and she also earns additional income from a general store. Mary Grace is borrowing 8,000 PHP through NWTF to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, and other supplies needed for her food-vending business.

Mary Grace has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, and other supplies needed in her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Badal is 29 years old and lives with his mother in the village of Goght of in the Kotayk region.

Badal is a young farmer who actively takes care of his farm cattle and wants to make his farm larger and richer. He has cows, calves, and chickens and, with the help of his mother, sells a large assortment of farm products such as milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, curds, beef, and also eggs. Badal also has plot of land on which he has cherry, apple, nut, and fig trees. Badal sells his entire range of farm products at the city’s wholesale market. In addition to his farm work, Badal also works at the city water-supplying organization as an inspector.

This loan he asks as he wants to buy more calves for his farm and develop meat sales from his farm, which is rather profitable for his family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Badal is 29 years old and lives with his mother in the village of Goght of in the Kotayk region.

Badal is a young farmer who actively takes care of his farm cattle and wants to make his farm larger and richer. He has cows, calves, and chickens and, with the help of his mother, sells a large assortment of farm products such as milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, curds, beef, and also eggs. Badal also has plot of land on which he has cherry, apple, nut, and fig trees. Badal sells his entire range of farm products at the city’s wholesale market. In addition to his farm work, Badal also works at the city water-supplying organization as an inspector.

This loan he asks as he wants to buy more calves for his farm and develop meat sales from his farm, which is rather profitable for his family.
LOAN_USE: to buy more calves for his farm and develop meat sales from his farm, which is rather profitable for his family.

DESCRIPTION: Rosa, se encuentra dedicada a las ventas mediante guías especializadas de productos por catálogos a través de los cuales promueve los artículos de su oferta; inició esta actividad por sugerencia de una amiga, quien la vinculó como consultora de productos de belleza. Diariamente ella se encuentra promoviendo ventas entre sus conocidos y amigos en diferentes barrios del municipio de Arjona.  Sus ventas son estimuladas a través del catálogo que lleva hasta los lugares de residencia de sus clientes, ella ha mantenido un excelente comportamiento comercial y desea ampliar la gama de productos que ofrece, para ello está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de promociones del catálogo: desodorantes, joyas, cremas y demás productos de alta rotación. Esta inversión promete incrementar las ventas y el número de clientes que actualmente atiende. Apóyala.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rosa works in catalogue sales. She began to do this work because a friend of her’s suggested it and helped to set her up as a beauty product consultant. Everyday she can be found selling products to her acquaintances and friends in different neighborhoods in the municipality of Arjona. Her sales are stimulated through the catalogues which she brings to her clients’ homes.

She has maintained excellent commercial performance and hopes to expand the range of products that she offers. Because of this she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo which she will invest in the purchase of catalogue products including deodorants, jewelry, lotions and other high-demand products. This investment promises to increase her sales and the number of clients that she currently serves. Please support her.
LOAN_USE: to buy catalogue products including deodorants, jewelry, lotions and other high-demand products.

DESCRIPTION:
Pacita P. is from the village of Baybay Panalsalan. She is 46 years old. Pacita is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a business cultivating decorative trees for sale. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 1999, Pacita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from PMPC. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the ninth loan taken out by Pacita from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To expand the business

DESCRIPTION:
Edralyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Edralyn has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from fishing.

Edralyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Edralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Edralyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines. Edralyn has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from fishing.

Edralyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her buy and sell charcoal business.

Edralyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. Her dream is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Elmer, es un joven propietario de un equipo de pesca (lancha), tiene 37 años de edad, reside en Usulután, vive con su familia tienen casa propia, el negocio de la pesca lo tiene desde hace 15 años, ha logrado comprar dos equipos de pesca, en el lugar donde viven esta cerca el mar y fuente de empleo para las personas de cerca como Elmer que a través de la pesca a mantenido a su familia por años. 
El está necesitando un préstamo para complementar la cantidad de dinero para la compra de un motor, ya que tiene incompleta una lancha para utilizarla.
Su objetivo es tener en óptimas condiciones su transporte para realizar su trabajo diario, ayudar a su familia y mejorar la calidad de vida de estos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Elmer is a young man of 37 who owns his own fishing equipment (boat).  He lives in Usulután with his family and owns his own house.  He has had his fishing business for 15 years and was able to purchase two fishing boats.  He lives very close to the ocean.  This provides him and other residents in his area with a source of employment and has supported his family for years.  \r\n\r\nElmer has a boat that can't be used because it doesn't have a motor so he is requesting a loan to supplement his own money to purchase one.  His goal is to have his boats in optimal working condition in order to be able to do his job every day, help his family and improve their quality of life.
LOAN_USE: To purchase a motor for his fishing boat

DESCRIPTION:
Elizabeth D. is currently in the business of selling food in a restaurant and is requesting a loan to buy crates of sodas, juice, and water to sell.

Elizabeth is 30 years old and single. She has one child who goes to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to go back to school.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern SuD.. The microfinance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.
LOAN_USE: To buy crates of sodas, juice, and water to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Fe Risalina S. is from the village of Labinay, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental. She is 52 years old. Fe Risalina is widowed and has one grown child. To make a living, Fe Risalina owns and operates a business venture raising crops in the agriculture sector. While it is not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting bananas for sale. Fe Risalina has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Fe Risalina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fe Risalina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from GDMPC. She is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding the business. Fe Risalina will take this loan out from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.
LOAN_USE: To invest in expanding the business raising crops

DESCRIPTION:
Catarina is 32 years old. Her parents gave her the opportunity of studying, but she did not like to study, so she quit at the ninth grade. At the age of 20 she married.

She wanted to initiate her business selling huipiles [a traditional garment]. Since she did not have funds, she began searching for financial institutions and was referred by neighbours and friends to Chajulense Association of Women United for Life. This year, she will receive her sixth loan. Her first two loans were invested in the huipiles-selling business.

She started a commodity store with her third loan, while the fourth and fifth loans were used in the store. With her sixth loan, she will be expanding her store. She will be buying milk, eggs, maize, flour, sodas and snacks.

Catarina says that her husband had an illness, which caused him to go blind. Her store let her help her husband with the illness and now with the support of her family.

Catarina is the leader of Florecitas Group. The group is composed of six women, all from the Ixil Maya ethnicity. The group will use their loan for retail (33%), textiles (17%), food (17%) and agriculture (33%). On average, each member of the group has 2.5 children and the average age of the members of the group is 31 years old. 50% of the members of the group are illiterate, 33% did not finish primary education and 27% finished their ninth grade.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

This year, she will receive her sixth loan. Her first two loans were invested in the huipiles-selling business.

She started a commodity store with her third loan, while the fourth and fifth loans were used in the store. With her sixth loan, she will be expanding her store. She will be buying milk, eggs, maize, flour, sodas and snacks.

Catarina says that her husband had an illness, which caused him to go blind. Her store let her help her husband with the illness and now with the support of her family.

Catarina is the leader of Florecitas Group. The group is composed of six women, all from the Ixil Maya ethnicity. The group will use their loan for retail (33%), textiles (17%), food (17%) and agriculture (33%). On average, each member of the group has 2.5 children and the average age of the members of the group is 31 years old. 50% of the members of the group are illiterate, 33% did not finish primary education and 27% finished their ninth grade.
LOAN_USE: to buy milk, eggs, maize, flour, sodas and snacks to expand her store.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of two children, Maria Cleanor works hard to support her family.

She has an oyster culture business in the Philippines. Maria Cleanor is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her oyster culture business.

Maria Cleanor has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

DESCRIPTION: Sophea’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Sophea’s group lives in a rural village in Battambang province in Cambodia. Sophea makes a living cultivating rice to support her family. In her village there is no reliable access to safe, clean drinking water. Having a water filter at home will help each of these women to safeguard the health of their families, save money on medical expenses and save time collecting fuel and boiling water.
LOAN_USE: to buy a water filter to provide safe drinking water for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Estrella, 67 years old, is married and has seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past fifteen years, Estrella has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from selling fruits and vegetables.

Estrella has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has previously borrowed and repaid seventeen loans from NWTF. Estrella aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

Estrella has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell. She has previously borrowed and repaid seventeen loans from NWTF. Estrella aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

DESCRIPTION:
Rosemarie is married and works hard to support her family. She has a "buy-and-sell" ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ready-to-wear clothing to sell.

Rosemarie has been in this business for five years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

DESCRIPTION:
La Sra. Barbara es casada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” grupo  conformado por 5  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.
Barbara se dedica a la confección y reparación de prendas de vestir este negocio surge a raíz de que su esposo viajo al extranjero para trabajar , es así que con el tiempo su esposo mando un capital y Barbara pone su negocio de costura poco a poco se fue comprando su máquina de coser, para Barbara nada fue fácil por que tuvo que trabajar muy duro y  a su vez cuidar a sus 3 hijos ya que su esposo se encontraba en el extranjero , con el tiempo Barbara cuenta con clientes fidelizados su negocio sigue creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos fueron a la escuela, ha construido su casa, y su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería(telas, hilos, etc.).
La Sra. Barbara  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.

Nota
La señora Cristina es aquella que aparece en la parte superior de la foto con polo blanco, chaleco azul y una gorra.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Barbara is married and has three children.  Currently she is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank, made of up five members who work in various business activities.

Barbara works making and mending clothing.  This business came up as a result of her husband going abroad to work.  In time her husband sent her some capital and Barbara set up her sewing business.  Little by little she bought her sewing machine.  Nothing was easy for Barbara because she had to work very hard and at the same time take care of her three children since her husband was abroad.

Over time, Barbara has loyal customers.  Her business continues growing.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she has received better income.  Her children went to school, she has built her house, and her family has a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow, she has requested a new loan to buy merchandise (fabric, thread, etc.).

Barbara will realize her goals with a lot of work and effort, and the EDAPROSPO loans will help her.

Sra. Cristina is the one who appears in the upper part of the photo in a white shirt, blue sweater, and a cap.
LOAN_USE: to buy merchandise (fabric, thread, etc.).
BORROWER_NAMES: Luzmila, Nora Dina, Barbara Elizabeth, Cristina, Presesntacion

DESCRIPTION:
Annaliza is 32 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc.

Annaliza has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of two children, Emeliana works hard to support her family. She has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming vegetables and a general store.

Emeliana is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase vegetables to sell in her vegetable vending business. Emeliana has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to buy more farm lands.

DESCRIPTION:
La señora Guiselle Elizabeth R. P. Trabaja como Responsable de Sucursal en una Empresa de Acueductos y Alcantarillado desde hace dos años y cuatro meses.

Es casada, de profesión abogada, de 30 años de edad. Tiene una persona que depende de ella menor de edad. Ella vive en la ciudad de Managua en Villa Flor Norte desde hace 27 años.

Ella solicita el préstamo para consumo y poder cubrir unos asuntos personales Este es el primer crédito con CEPRODEL y se encuentra satisfecha por haberle otorgado este préstamo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Guiselle Elizabeth R. P. had worked as the person in charge of the branch at the Nicaraguan Water Supply and Sewerage Company for two years and four months.

She is married, 30 years old, and is a lawyer. She has a dependent who is under 18 years old. She has lived in the city of Managua in Villa Flor Norte for 27 years.

She is requesting the loan for personal use and to cover some personal business. This is her first loan with CEPRODEL and she is happy for having being granted this loan.
LOAN_USE: Consumption, for personal business

DESCRIPTION:
La señora Vicenta Dolores tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 4 hijos, su esposo es comerciante, ellos viven en Picoaza, lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo. 
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora que gracias a los créditos continúa mejorando su negocio y su vida, ella y su marido se dedican a la venta de productos plásticos como tinas, sillas, tarrinas, reposteros, envases plásticos, toldos entre otros productos, mientras el sale por la ciudad y otras ciudades ella desde su  casa vende a clientes que llegan al lugar a comprar, para ella los créditos le son de mucha ayuda y por eso está repitiendo este crédito. 
Con este nuevo crédito comprara reposteros, tachos, toldos, vasos, toldos, etc. Su sueño es tener un local grande con gran variedad de productos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Señora Vicenta Dolores is 50 years old. She is married, and from this relationship she has four children. Her husband is a businessman. They live in Picoaza, a place known for being a very commercial zone and for its traditional festivals of St. Peter and St. Paul.

She is a very hard-working woman who, thanks to the loans, continues improving her business and her life. She and her husband sell plastic products such as tubs, chairs, containers, plastic bottles, and sunshades, among other products. While he goes through the city and other cities, she sells from her house to customers who come to the place to buy. For her, the loans are of much help, and for this reason she is repeating this loan.

With this new loan, she will buy containers, bins, sunshades, cups, etc.

Her dream is to have a big shop with a great variety of products.
LOAN_USE: to buy plastic kitchen containers, bins, glasses, awnings, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
La A.C. “LUZ DE LUNA BRILLANTE” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Collpani, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Alicia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: carpintería, elaboración de herramientas (pico y chuntillo), venta de golocinas, venta de comida, tejido de mantas, elaboración de adornos de goma, tienda de barrio.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Alicia es una integrante, ella indica que desde hace dos ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de golosinas, mismo que aprendió de una amiga a quien ayudaba en la venta, posteriormente ella emprendió su propio negocio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para ampliar y mejorar el negocio (compra de golosinas y harina) que comprará de las ferias de la Ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la preparación  lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta que le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud y crédito y los ahorros.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The Luz de Luna Brillante [Light of the Shining Moon] communal bank will start its third cycle with Pro Mujer as part of the Collpani Focal Center.  It is comprised of nine members, and it is led by a governing board. Alicia is the president. The businesses that the members of the communal bank carry out are varied. Among them are carpentry, making ‘picos’ and ‘chuntillos’ [rustic tools], selling sweets, selling food, weaving blankets, making foam decorations, and a neighborhood store.

The loan they will take out will benefit the small businesswomen in the group, of which Alicia is a member.  She says that she has been a member of Pro Mujer for two cycles.  She joined by invitation from a friend who is a member of the institution.

She currently has a business of selling sweets.  She learned this from a friend who she helped with sales.  Alicia later undertook her own business.  The loan that she will now take out is to expand and improve the business (to buy sweets and flour).  She will make her purchases at the fairs in the city of El Alto.  She will later prepare and sell the sweets at her sales location.  This way of working allows her to generate resources to support her family as much as she can.  She is in a common-law marriage, and she has three children.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the health and loan trainings and the savings.
LOAN_USE: to buy sweets and flour.
BORROWER_NAMES: Maxima\t, Felipa, Celestina\t, Maxima\t, Eleuteria Elena\t, Alicia, Dionicia\t\t, Roxana\t\t, Eva Maribel\t
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Betty, a 67-year-old mom of four with three of them school-going, has dreams of success burning in her heart and mind. She works hard and always keeps her hopes alive because she wants the best for her family. She is a mixed dairy, crop, and tree farmer who leads her family by example. Her sweat and determination have enabled her to pay school fees for her three children.

Unfortunately, the quality of Betty’s crops has declined because of poor farm inputs. This has resulted in low demand for her products and has negatively impacted her sales. To a poor rural farmer, treatment of crop diseases requires an increase in the total operational costs to the extent that, in most cases, the amount of capital invested to produce a desired yield surpasses the value of the output harvested. The remedy is to use certified seeds that are resistant to pests and diseases.

Betty is requesting this loan to purchase farm inputs such as high-nutrient fertilizer and certified seeds. This will enable her to improve her farm yield and increase her sales and profits so that she can better support her family. This loan will surely change her life, as she will be able to produce more and hence, shift her income level. The impact of this loan will show in the smiles on the faces of her children. She thanks Kiva for keeping her hopes of prosperity alive.

To a poor rural farmer, treatment of crop diseases requires an increase in the total operational costs to the extent that, in most cases, the amount of capital invested to produce a desired yield surpasses the value of the output harvested. DESCRIPTION: Albine, 46 ans, est mariée. Elle 5 enfants dont trois sont déjà mariés. Le conjoint tient un stand de vente de produits de première nécessité. Albine, elle, a démarré la vente de sandales depuis une année. Elle pratique cette activité en ambulant. Ses gains consolident le revenu et apporte des améliorations sur le quotidien de la famille. Elle développe aussi l'élevage porcin à la campagne. Elle contracte des prêts chez VAHATRA pour étendre son commerce, elle multiplie graduellement ses marchandises tout en assurant leur qualité pour attirer le plus de clients. Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter une centaine de paquets de sandales nouveau modèle. Au prêt précédent, elle a acquis un poste téléviseur couleur avec ses profits. Son prochain objectif est d'acheter un terrain.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Albine, aged 46, is married and has five children, of whom three are already married. The husband has a stand selling basic necessities. Albine herself started selling sandals a year ago. She operates by going door to door. Her profits bolster their income and have brought improvements to the families day-to-day life. She is also developing a hog farm in the countryside.

She takes out loans at VAHATRA to expand her commerce. She is gradually expanding her merchandise while ensuring quality in order to attract more customers. With this loan, she intends to purchase about 10 packets of sandals of a new style. With the previous loan, she acquired a color TV set using the profits. Her next goal is to purchase a parcel of land.
LOAN_USE: to purchase 100 packets of sandals to resell

DESCRIPTION:
Reynald is 48 years old and still single. He lives in a rural community and engages himself in furniture making business for almost five years.

He aspires to continue and improve this business but he has not enough capital. For this reason,he wants to access a financial assistance of PHP 30,000 to buy wood, plywoods, varnish, glass, mirror and nails.

Through hard work and strong determination, he believes that someday, he will further improve his business and generate a higher income.

DESCRIPTION:
Olive is a 26-year-old married mother of three children. She is the leader of the ABIZERANE Group, a group composed of 10 members. In the photo, she is the woman who is seated in front of the others.

Olive operates a small general retail business. She works hard to support her family and to provide them with a better life. Every morning Olive opens her stand at 7a.m. and works tirelessly until her daily supply is sold. She foresees an unwavering demand which she hopes will allow her to expand her business as she acquires more funds.

Olive is requesting a loan from Kiva via VisionFund Company to buy more Irish potatoes, sugar, salt, etc. to sell to her community.

With the profits Olive will be able to get medical insurance for her family, buy shoes for her children, buy enough food for her children and expand her business as well.

DESCRIPTION: Rhaida is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. Rhaida has a shop that sells RTW's like jackets and raincoats. She has had this business for 12 years. She requested a loan of 17,000 PHP to buy additional stocks of shirts, slippers and raincoats to sell as well as  jackets and t-shirts. She has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Rhaida hopes to improve her business.\r\n\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy additional stocks of different kinds of clothing to sell, like jackets and t-shirts.

DESCRIPTION:
Nancy, 39 years of age, is a woman of beauty and brains. She is the mother of lovely children and is a rural smallholder farmer from the Litein area of Kenya. Nancy is married to a fellow farmer. Her family's main income source is milk from their dairy farm. However, they are also involved in other agricultural activities such as growing bananas, vegetables, fruits and grains. The biggest problem that farmers from Litein face is the huge deficit in terms of access to agricultural inputs, meaning those farmers' yields and incomes are far below what they could be.

Juhudi Kilimo partnered with Kiva to provide financial services to smallholders around Kenya. Through these financial services, farmers from Litein, like Nancy, can now buy productive assets and important agricultural inputs for use on their farms. Nancy is seeking a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides.

Your loan will enable her to improve her production through the use of quality farm inputs. This intervention will help her meet the increasing demand for food in the market and, in the process, generate more income to repay the loan debt and improve her family's quality of life. She also hopes to improve the conditions of her house.

Nancy, her husband and children highly rely on the goodwill of lenders so that they can achieve their dreams. Take action and lend now!

DESCRIPTION:
Dickson is 40 years old, a married father of 2 children who are still in school. He is a retailer and sells different cereals and ingredients in the market. He has been in this business for 6 good years, he normally opens his business from 7 in the morning to 6 in the evening daily and he earns a profit.

This will be Dickson\'s 1st loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. He is applying for this loan to purchase more ingredients for foods and cereals such as maize, rice and beans. His dream is to open branches in the near future.

Dickson will share a portion of this loan with his loan group members of "Mwendokasi-Khm", together they promise to pay back the loan.

DESCRIPTION: Romeo is 54 years old, married to Fredisminda, and they have four children. One of their children is in college. To make a living, the couple provides photo and video coverage services as the source of their income. Aside from their photography business, they also manage a farming business. Romeo hopes for more income, and that is why he is now asking for a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy a new video camera to use in his photography business. The other part of his loan will be used to maintain his farming business.\r\n\r\nRomeo would like to provide good services to all his customers and gain more money to pay for his children's education, as this will lead to good employment someday.
LOAN_USE: To buy a new video camera to use in his photography business

DESCRIPTION: Сановбархон разведенная женщина из города Исфара. У нее нет детей. Сановбархон живет вместе с родителями. Она еще молодая и ей надо устраивать свою жизнь. Сановбврхон на протяжении 18 лет занимается шитьем женской одежды.  У нее большой опыт в данной сфере. Сановбархон для начала хочет построить себе дом и не висеть на шеи родителей. Этот кредит очень важен Сановарбхон. Вы можете помочь этой милой женщине.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Sanovbarhon is a divorced woman from the city of Isfara.  She does not have any children.  Sanovbarhon lives with her parents.  She is still young and she needs to set up her life.  Sanovbarhon has 18 years of experiencing sewing women's clothing.  She has extensive experience in this field.  Sanovbarhon wants to start her life by building a house and not hanging on the necks of her parents.  This loan is very important to Sanovbarhon.  You can help this sweet woman.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to repair and build her home.

DESCRIPTION:

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 10 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of market competition in her business.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase more sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour to sell.

LOAN_USE: to buy abaca fiber and other supplies needed in her business

DESCRIPTION:
Divina is 39 years old. She is a married woman with seven children. The oldest child is 20 years old, and the youngest child is 4 years old.\r\n

\r\nDivina is a farmer who works in the town of Surallah in South Cotabato Province. She and her husband own and till a piece of land where they grow rice and vegetables. Divina works hard to support her family. She applied for a loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies. Divina is hoping to have a better yield and to be able to pay for her children's tuition fees.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies.

DESCRIPTION: Naseem is a 43-year-old woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. \r\nHer husband has been driving an auto rickshaw which did not belong to him. With the help of savings, he wants to buy a used auto rickshaw. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a used rickshaw. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount.  Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a rickshaw and can drive the rickshaw happily. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate constant income. Naseem is very happy after receiving this loan.  She thanks Kiva and field partner, bBac Pakistan.\r\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Naseem is a 43-year-old woman living with her four children and spouse in the area of Lahore, Pakistan. \r\nHer husband has been driving an auto rickshaw which did not belong to him. With the help of savings, he wants to buy a used auto rickshaw. He does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy a used rickshaw. He wants to start driving but is looking for a lump sum amount.  Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan for her husband so he can buy a rickshaw and can drive the rickshaw happily. She hopes that now her husband will be able to generate constant income. Naseem is very happy after receiving this loan.  She thanks Kiva and field partner, bBac Pakistan.\r\n
LOAN_USE: to buy a used rickshaw for her husband.

DESCRIPTION:
Miriam is 40 years old and married with three children.

Miriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as coffee, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, and many more to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Miriam aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Miriam is 40 years old and married with three children.

Miriam works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 23,000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items such as coffee, noodles, shampoo, detergent soap, and many more to sell in her store.

She has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Miriam aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store

DESCRIPTION:
Grace's group has 3 hard working women. Grace is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, which is in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children (1 attends school). For the past 3 years, Grace has worked hard to manage her retail shop which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Grace requests 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to purchase a refrigerator, a sack of sugar, and weighing scales for the shop.  This items will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to own a house. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Grace's group has 3 hard working women. Grace is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kyenjojo, which is in the Mubende region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children (1 attends school). For the past 3 years, Grace has worked hard to manage her retail shop which sells essential commodities. 

To help expand her business, Grace requests 500,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda to purchase a refrigerator, a sack of sugar, and weighing scales for the shop.  This items will help Grace to generate greater profits and improve her family's standards of living. Grace hopes that in the future she will be able to own a house. 

Grace is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a refrigerator, a sack of sugar, and weighing scales for the shop.

DESCRIPTION:
Lilian es una  joven de 19 años,  termino la educación media, gracias al apoyo y sacrificio que hicieron sus padres, para que estudiara. Esta soltera y no tiene hijos. Ella unicamente vive con sus padres y sus dos hermanitas. 

Lilian es una persona humilde, responsable y con muchos deseos de continuar estudiando. Eso la ha llevado, a que coloque una pequeña tienda, en el patio de su casa, y obtener ingresos para ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de la casa y a la vez, tener ahorros para continuar con sus estudios de educación superior en la universidad el próximo año.

  Tiene seis meses de haber iniciado con el negocio, durante este tiempo le ha ido muy bien, pero es importante que continué esforzándose para lograr su meta.

El préstamo sera invertido, para comprar mas mercadería y hacer mas fuerte el negocio. Así se le estará dando la oportunidad a Lilian, de ayudar económicamente a sus padres y a la vez, que ahorre para iniciar con sus estudios el próximo año.

El sueño de Lilian, es graduarse de la universidad en Administración de Empresas. También desea, ayudar a sus hermanitas para que continúen estudiando, y se puedan preparar academicamente. Espera que su negocio aumente, para seguir apoyando a sus padres.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Lilian is 19 years old and lives with her parents and two younger sisters. Thanks to her parents' support and sacrifice, Lilian was able to complete her high school education. Lilian is a very humble, responsible young woman who wants to pursue a college degree next year. In hopes of generating income and savings to put toward her future education and her family's household expenses, Lilian opened a small general store six months ago in the patio of her home. Thanks to her hard work and dedication, business is going well so far. \r\n\r\nWith the support from this loan, Lilian plans to purchase merchandise to stock her general store. She hopes that this investment will help her to strengthen and grow her business and in time allow her to pursue her educational goals. Lilian's dream is to graduate from university with a degree in business administration. She also hopes to support her younger sisters in their studies and goals, as well as continue to help her parents with household expenses.
LOAN_USE: to purchase merchandise to stock her general store.

DESCRIPTION:
Hazel is 28 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Hazel has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hazel is 28 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries.

Hazel has been in this business for 2 years now. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell like canned goods, home care products and other groceries

DESCRIPTION:
Becoming an accountant is Antonia's dream. She is currently attending Tecnologico Tarija, working towards her degree in accounting. She shares that her alternative would be to take time off from school to work and save money until she could return. Antonia shares that it is important to her to graduate on time so she can enter into the job market as soon as possible. 

Antonia plans on spending the money towards purchasing her textbooks. As an added expense, textbooks are often not bought to save money. With them, Antonia hopes to be able to better understand her subjects. With a career in accounting, she expects to earn $20 a day, a substantial increase from before. 

Unfortunately, Antonia's parents never had the opportunity to complete their high school education. Without the opportunity for a higher degree, her parents never had the chance to move up. Growing up, their finances have always been tight.
LOAN_USE: to pay for books and school supplies.

DESCRIPTION:
Amina is in her early 30's, single, and has two children who attend school. She has a food stall where she sells local foods such as soup and chapati. She has had the food stall for about four years, and works from 5:30 am until 10 am and makes a minimal monthly profit. 

This is Amina's first loan from Tujijenge. She plans to use the loan to buy more supplies and ingredients so she can cook more dishes and improve her business. She hopes to earn more profit with this loan so she can continue to pay her children's school fees, and would love to be able to renovate her home. 

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Safari, which consists of six women who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Amina is in her early 30's, single, and has two children who attend school. She has a food stall where she sells local foods such as soup and chapati. She has had the food stall for about four years, and works from 5:30 am until 10 am and makes a minimal monthly profit. 

This is Amina's first loan from Tujijenge. She plans to use the loan to buy more supplies and ingredients so she can cook more dishes and improve her business. She hopes to earn more profit with this loan so she can continue to pay her children's school fees, and would love to be able to renovate her home. 

Amina will share this loan with her loan group, Safari, which consists of six women who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
LOAN_USE: To buy more supplies and ingredients
BORROWER_NAMES: Neema, Enara, Shani, Salome, Amina, Nuru
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Pili is 27 years old and is a single woman with 2 children, ages 8 and 1 years old. Pili sells fish. She started in 2007. Every day, she works from 2am to 9pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $80 from her sales.\r\n\r\n

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup member, Nuruh, who sells food.
LOAN_USE: To buy more fish for her business.

DESCRIPTION:
Luis es padre de 3 hijos de 12, 8, 6 años de edad los cuales tienen estudiando y formándose para buscar un buen futuro, se dedica al negocio de producción agrícola el cual heredo de su padre y empleo pro necesidad económica ya que a sus 20 años ya tenía su primer hijo. 
Luis quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos como abonos y pesticidas para el sostenimiento de sus cultivos, pues es un hombre de bajos recursos que no dispone de mucho capital y se enfrenta a una plaga que afecta la mayoría de sus cultivos y necesita erradicarla rápidamente. 
Con el préstamo espera poder incrementar sus ventas, tener más clientes a quienes ofrecerles y poder algún día entregarle el negocio a su hijo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Luis is the father of three children, who are 12, 8 and 6 years old. They are in school, receiving an education so that they can achieve a better future. Luis works in agricultural production, a business he inherited from his father. He does this work out of economic necessity, since at the age of 20 he already had his first child.
 
Luis would like to request a loan to buy supplies such as fertilizers and pesticides to maintain his crops. He is a person with few resources and does not have much capital, but he is facing an attack of pests affecting the majority of his crops, and he needs to eradicate them rapidly. 

With the loan, he hopes to increase his sales and offer his agricultural products to more customers. He hopes one day to pass on his business to his son.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers and pesticides. Luis has pests threatening his crops, and he has to combat them as quickly as possible.

DESCRIPTION:
LUISA F. M., pertenece al Banco Comunal “LAS CARIBEÑAS” su negocio esta ubicado dentro del Hospital Amazónico, del distrito de Yarinacocha, en la ciudad de Pucallpa, tiene 34 años de edad, 4 hijos, y su esposo es obrero.

Ella se dedica a la venta de libros.  El primer préstamo que obtuvo de Manuela Ramos fue de S/.300.00 Nuevos Soles, con él adquirió pocos libros y los vendió a precio cómodo, con un margen de ganancia baja, pero eso le ayudo a conseguir muchos clientes.

Con este préstamo de S/.2,000.00 Nuevos Soles, invertirá en la  compra de más libros, que está adquiriendo directamente de Lima. 

La ONG. Manuela Ramos me ha apoyado a generar un ingreso más para mi familia, me ha permitido ampliar mi negocio y seguir creciendo y desarrollándome - comentó.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Luisa F. M. belongs to the communal bank "Las Caribenas". Her business is located inside of Amazonico Hospital, in the Yarinacocha district of Pucallpa city. She is 34 years old, and has 4 children with her husband, who is a manual laborer. Luisa sells books for a living. With her first loan of 300 soles, Luisa purchased and re-sold some books, with a low profit margin. However, this helped her attract many clients. With this new loan, Luisa will buy more books directly from Lima. "The NGO Manuela Ramos supported me to generate income for my family, permitted me to increase my business, and helped me grow and develop myself," Luisa commented.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: To purchase books

DESCRIPTION:
Yei is 38 years old, and she lives in Sanniquille, the capital city of Nimba County, which is rich in natural resources and where the living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second most populous county in Liberia. 

Yei did not go to school, and she is married to a local businessman. They both have four children, who are between 8 months and 26 years old. Three of her children are in school, and four live at home. Her husband gave Yei money to start her business. For three years now, she has been running this business selling used shoes. She spends 10 hours on her business, from Monday to Saturday. The problem she faces is that she does not have a shop.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for her business. Her plan is to one day build a modern house.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more used shoes to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
This is Vangie. Her previous loan was a big help for her business, as she bought the ingredients and products she needed and was able to expand her business. Her income from the loan helped her send her children to school. She has had this business for ten years.

Vangie would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed in her business. The profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She is looking forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Vangie dreams for the continuous success of her business and she hopes that her children will complete their education. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her life and business every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.
LOAN_USE: to buy bananas, sweet potatoes, sugar, oil and gas needed in her business.

LOAN_NAME: Let Children Go To School Group
DESCRIPTION:
Ms Bình is raising her hand in the photo; she works in agriculture, farming rice.

In this group, her circumstances are the most difficult as she is a single mom with two children. She has to work hard to support her children and keep sending them to school.

Her family is a low-income household in the village, moreover this job is unstable. The main hardship that Bình faces is lack of capital. In 2014, Bình joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her business. Bình has successfully repaid three loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution. She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, tools, and other supplies for farming rice.

In future, Bình hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Ms Bình is raising her hand in the photo; she works in agriculture, farming rice.

In this group, her circumstances are the most difficult as she is a single mom with two children. She has to work hard to support her children and keep sending them to school.

She is requesting this loan to purchase seeds, tools, and other supplies for farming rice.

In future, Bình hopes for her children to find a good job, for her family to be healthy and happy, and for her children to do well in school.

BORROWER_NAMES: Sáu, Cẩm, Sự, Sáng, Bình, Thăng
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION: Anood is a young girl who is a university student living in Mafraq. Her major is animal production. Being a responsible girl trying to help her parents pay for her expenses, she hopes to get the loan so she can pay for her university semester.
LOAN_USE: to pay for a semester of university.

DESCRIPTION:
Elvira is 51-year-old a married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elvira has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has done for 6 years. Elvira requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Elvira is 51-year-old a married woman with three children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Elvira has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, which she has done for 6 years. Elvira requested a PHP 20000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more dried fish to sell.

In the future, Elvira would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more dried fish to sell

DESCRIPTION:
This is 28-year-old Jenneh. She is living together with her partner along with 2 children; their ages are 4 and 9 years. Both of her children live at home while going to school. Jenneh went to school until 12th grade.

She deals in a business where she sells candy and rice. She started to sell with her own money and also learned how to sell by herself. Jennneh has been doing this business for 7 years now and she described herself as a hardworking business woman. Jenneh uses a car to transport supplies to her business site. She has had no problems with her business. She spends 10 hours at her business site.

To continue selling, Jenneh requested for a loan through BRAC Liberia and Kiva's Field Partner. The loan will be used to buy more candy and rice to sell. She likes her business because it brings in fast money. In the future, she would like to continue her children's education. She wishes to say thanks.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This is 28-year-old Jenneh. She is living together with her partner along with 2 children; their ages are 4 and 9 years. Both of her children live at home while going to school. Jenneh went to school until 12th grade.

She deals in a business where she sells candy and rice. She started to sell with her own money and also learned how to sell by herself. Jennneh has been doing this business for 7 years now and she described herself as a hardworking business woman. Jenneh uses a car to transport supplies to her business site. She has had no problems with her business. She spends 10 hours at her business site.

To continue selling, Jenneh requested for a loan through BRAC Liberia and Kiva's Field Partner. The loan will be used to buy more candy and rice to sell. She likes her business because it brings in fast money. In the future, she would like to continue her children's education. She wishes to say thanks.
LOAN_USE: to buy more candy and rice to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Melinda is a woman and 52 years old, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Melinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melinda has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Melinda is a woman and 52 years old, with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Melinda has a food vending business in the Philippines. Melinda requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Melinda has been in this business for 16 years. In the future, Melinda would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy ingredients for her food production business

DESCRIPTION:
Afaf is 37, married, and has two daughters and two sons.
Both daughters go to school and one of her sons goes to school. Her elder daughter is sick. Her other son left school and works with his father due to the family's economic conditions. Afaf has a small cattle fattening business.

Afaf has requested a loan before and now wants to renew it to buy a head of cattle to expand the business and increase the production and sale of dairy products. She wants to improve the family's standards of living and continue her children's education.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Afaf is 37, married, and has two daughters and two sons.
Both daughters go to school and one of her sons goes to school. Her elder daughter is sick. Her other son left school and works with his father due to the family's economic conditions. Afaf has a small cattle fattening business.

Afaf has requested a loan before and now wants to renew it to buy a head of cattle to expand the business and increase the production and sale of dairy products. She wants to improve the family's standards of living and continue her children's education.
LOAN_USE: to buy a head of cattle to expand the business

DESCRIPTION:
Manuela Carolina tiene 23 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre, tiene un hijo de 11 meses de edad, su marido es chofer, ella vive en casa de sus suegros en el cantón de Jaramijo que es conocido como  caleta de pescadores, donde los turistas tienen diversos lugares para visitar, comenzando por Punta Blanca, playa perfecta para realizar buceos o simplemente tomar caminatas en la tranquilidad de sus orillas.
Manuela es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo y así poder apoyar a su marido a solventar con los gastos del hogar, es por este motivo que hace 3 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de niño y adultos, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, también vende en su casa, deja sus prendas a crédito y cobra cada 8 días, para ella este crédito le ayudara de mucho porque podrá surtirse de mercadería para continuar con su negocio.
Este crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisetas, blusas, vestidos, entre otros. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia y un local para su negocio.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Manuela Carolina, 23, is married with an 11-month-old son. Her husband is a driver. She lives in her in-laws' home in Jaramijo, a community known for fishing, with a variety of tourist attractions, starting with Punta Blanca, a perfect beach for scuba diving or simply for strolling along the shore.

Manuela is a very hardworking woman who likes to earn her own income and help out her husband with their household expenses. For that reason three years ago she began selling clothing for children and adults, going door-to-door, and selling from her home. She sells on credit and collects payments due every 8 days. This loan will help her a great deal because she will be able to restock her merchandise and continue running her business.

This credit will be used to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, dresses, and more. Her goal is to have her own house and a fixed location for her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy pants, t-shirts, blouses, and dresses.

DESCRIPTION: Wambua is a hardworking businessman who is 25 years old. He is married and blessed with two children, one of whom is in school. He runs a retail shop to make a living. He also does farming to increase his income. He has employed one person to assist him in managing the business. Wambua has been able to retain his business because of a good reputation with his customers. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 KES to buy bread, sugar and rice for resale. In the next five years, he wants to expand his business. Thanks to Faulu Kenya, he has been able to adopt the culture of saving.
LOAN_USE: To buy bread, sugar and rice for resale.

DESCRIPTION:
Rosa is a 22-year-old woman living in the town of Asaga.  She is married and has one small child. To make a living, Rosa owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting fruit and vegetables for sale. Rosa  has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 760 WST a month from these activities.

In 2011, Rosa  joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  This is the first time Rosa has requested a loan from SPBD.  She has asked for 1,000 WST which will be used to purchase general farm supplies and equipment. Rosa plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her child.
LOAN_USE: to purchase general farm supplies and equipment.

DESCRIPTION:
Rubi is 38 years old and married. She is a housewife and looks after her family of four.

Rubi is well-trained in sewing. She provides stitching services to her customers from her own house. Now, she needs to purchase a new Juki sewing machine and a variety of sewing materials, including thread, needles, buttons, lace, and cloth. It is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, she finds it difficult. So, Rubi requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Rubi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan!
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rubi is 38 years old and married. She is a housewife and looks after her family of four.

Rubi is well-trained in sewing. She provides stitching services to her customers from her own house. Now, she needs to purchase a new Juki sewing machine and a variety of sewing materials, including thread, needles, buttons, lace, and cloth. It is very important for her to continue her work efficiently and professionally. However, due to a lack of money, she finds it difficult. So, Rubi requested a loan from Kiva partner, BRAC Pakistan.

Rubi is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan!
LOAN_USE: to buy a new Juki sewing machine and a variety of sewing materials.

DESCRIPTION:
Norma is a 46-year-old single woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Norma has been in this business for five years.

In the future Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Norma is a 46-year-old single woman with four children, one of whom is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Norma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 28,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

Norma has been in this business for five years.

In the future Norma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Sapule is a 76-year-old widow with six children. She makes and sells fine mats in her community to earn a stable income. She has been doing this for 20 years.

She needs a loan to buy chicken feathers, rollers, thread, needles, paint, and brushes. She will use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2016 to gain access to financial services.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sapule is a 76-year-old widow with six children. She makes and sells fine mats in her community to earn a stable income. She has been doing this for 20 years.

She needs a loan to buy chicken feathers, rollers, thread, needles, paint, and brushes. She will use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2016 to gain access to financial services.
LOAN_USE: to buy chicken feathers, rollers, thread, needles, paint, and brushes.

DESCRIPTION:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 38-year-old Adama from Moriba town Bo. She is married and has four children between the ages of 3 and 15 years. Three of her children are currently attending school. 

Adama runs a food stand.  She sells rice, flour, and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business for 20 years. She works at the business throughout the week and 10 hours per day.  Adama says that sometimes business is very difficult.

Adama has requested a loan in order to purchase cooking seasonings, rice and oil for sale. The extra income from this loan will allow her to pay her childrens' school fees and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her enterprise more than even. She thanks you for your support!
LOAN_USE: to purchase cooking seasoning, rice and oil for sale.

DESCRIPTION: En la ciudad de Portoviejo, fue afectada por el terremoto el 16 de Abril del 2016, la ciudad es rica en producción de hortalizas, legumbres y frutas tropicales para el consumo interno. Josselyn tiene 27 años de edad, es soltera, no tiene hijos, estudia Administración de empresas en la universidad. Vive en casa de una hermana. Josselyn cuando vivía junto a su madre tenían una picantería y era entrenadora de un gimnasio, ahora se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas, estas las vende en sus horas libres en casa y les lleva a sus familiares, amistades a casa a ofrecer, les deja a crédito y les cobra semanalmente. Con este nuevo crédito comprara ropa. Su sueño es ser profesional y continuar con salud.\n\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
The city of Portoviejo was affected by an earthquake on April 16, 2016. It is rich in its production of vegetables, legumes, and tropical fruits for domestic consumption.

Josselyn is 27 years old, single, and has no children. She is studying Business Administration at a university. Josselyn lives at the home of one of her sisters. When she lived with her mother, Josselyn owned a restaurant and worked as a trainer at a gym. She now sells women's clothes at home in her free time and makes deliveries to the homes of her relatives and friends. Josselyn offers her products on credit and collects payments on a weekly basis.

This new loan will be used to buy clothes. Her dream is to become a professional and continue her good health.
LOAN_USE: to buy clothes to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Rodolfo is 52 years old and lives in the municipality of Turbo. He has four children, a family he’s proud of, and he loves them more than anything. Raising them hasn’t been easy since they live in a post-conflict zone where there are not many job opportunities and there’s a lot of poverty, but he has worked very hard for them.

In 2010 he started a farming business and he has worked very hard to make sure his family can have a good life and to help them have a better economic situation. He would like to invest in the farm to increase his profits and to be more competitive. He’s asking for a loan to pay for some workforce and to buy some fertilizer and herbicide to improve his production.

Remember, the situation the world is living in right now affects the work of many entrepreneurs. Your help will help them get through these difficult circumstances.

Support this loving father and loan now.

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia

DESCRIPTION:
Yona is a 57-year-old maize farmer in South Sakwa, Kenya. He historically struggled to access credit for high quality seeds and fertilizer, which compromised the quality of his harvest. Yona is excited to have access to high quality inputs, advice and insurance from an Apollo Agriculture loan, to increase his yields.

With this bundled package, Yona expects higher profits this season, which he hopes to invest back into his farm in subsequent seasons.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yona is a 57-year-old maize farmer in South Sakwa, Kenya. He historically struggled to access credit for high quality seeds and fertilizer, which compromised the quality of his harvest. Yona is excited to have access to high quality inputs, advice and insurance from an Apollo Agriculture loan, to increase his yields.

With this bundled package, Yona expects higher profits this season, which he hopes to invest back into his farm in subsequent seasons.
LOAN_USE: to access premium seeds and high quality fertilizer for 0.5 acres of maize, in addition to advice and insurance, optimizing for increased productivity and profits

DESCRIPTION:
Philip is a 31-year-old married man from Nyandarua South. He is married to Monicah and they are blessed with four children.

Philip has farmed for many years and has a good income. He has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy seedlings and fertilizer to improve his production.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Philip is a 31-year-old married man from Nyandarua South. He is married to Monicah and they are blessed with four children.

Philip has farmed for many years and has a good income. He has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy seedlings and fertilizer to improve his production.

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.
LOAN_USE: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

DESCRIPTION:
Adelaida is 62 years old, married and has nine children.

Adelaida is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden.

Adelaida has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Adelaida is 62 years old, married and has nine children.

Adelaida is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden.

Adelaida has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Adelaida would like to save enough money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her vegetable garden.

DESCRIPTION:
Flora, who is in her early fifties, is single and the mother of one daughter who is grown. Her daughter is blessed with a child who is at school. Flora also takes care of her sister's child, who is in secondary school. Despite being single, she manages to provide all of her family's needs through her general store and charcoal store businesses. She has been in these businesses for four years and is able to realize a fair profit each month. Flora's businesses operate from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. daily.

This will be her twentieth loan request via Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous credits, since repaid, to expand her business portfolio (when she started selling charcoal) and to replenish her general store. Flora managed to receive an extra income which she used to pay the school fees for her sister's child, who is now at "O" level. She covered her household expenses and bought a plot of land. She desires to be a successful mother and develop her plot with agriculture.

With her new loan request, Flora will use the funds to start an M-Pesa service as another project to maximize her income. She will share this loan with her loan group"Uhuru," which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.
