LOAN_USE: to start M-PESA service as another project to maximize her income.

DESCRIPTION:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the Baptist Secondary School II, in Waterloo small town, where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch.

Baptist Secondary School II was opened in September 2000 by the Executive of the Baptist Convention Sierra Leone to help alleviate the plight of displaced children living in Freetown during the country’s ten year civil war.

These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 10,000,000. With the help of this loan, they will be able to embark on some meaningful projects that they cannot do with their mere salaries alone. Some of them will use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, others to buy housebuilding materials, buy a piece of land, pay school fees for their children, or invest the loan in their business.

Alfred S. K. is the leader of this group. He is age forty and was born in Kamakwe, a town in northern Sierra Leone. He has been a teacher for twenty years now. Alfred is married to a teacher and they have three children.

Alfred will use his share of the loan to buy a generator which he will use to power the refrigerator he uses to sell cold drinks.
LOAN_USE: To buy a generator to power the refrigerator he uses to sell cold drinks
BORROWER_NAMES: John S.Y., Victor E.D., Alimany Azziz, Alfred Sima, Maferh, Jonathan Y., Augustine M.J.
BORROWER_GENDERS: male, male, male, male, female, male, male
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION:
Martina is thirty-eight years old, and she and her partner have four children who go to the university. Martina is a very active businesswoman who struggles to provide a comfortable lifestyle with her children. She says that since childhood, she has learned the price of persistence. Her parents used to force her to work to make a living.

Now, Martina runs a beauty salon that she started ten years ago. She offers services of hair dying, hair treatment, hairdos and so forth. She has a well-established clientele. She has a local salon where she operates the business. Martina plans on enlarging her salon and adding new services so that she can attract new clients.

With her loan, she will purchase goods that are running low in the salon, such as a hairdryer, rinse and shampoo. Martina says that goods are the raw materials with which she runs the business. The entrepreneur hopes her business can grow and she can make more profits in order to keep working for the sake of her family.
LOAN_USE: Martina will use her loan to buy beauty products to keep operating her salon.

DESCRIPTION: El cantón Junín es  productor de caña de azúcar, rubro importante en la economía de esta población, productos a base de la panela y del licor conocido como “Currincho”, elaborado en la zona artesanalmente. Ligia tiene 44 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre, tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos son mayores de edad e independientes y el menor de 8 años de edad, estudia escuela. Su cónyuge es chofer profesional y ebanista. Viven en casa propia. Ligia tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa,  donde vende todo tipo de productos, como arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, legumbres, verduras y frutas,  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde. Con este nuevo crédito comprara galletas, harinas, fideos, sodas, atunes, etc. Su sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Junín canton produces sugar cane which is a very important sector of the economy of the region. Products such as panela (brown sugar loaf) and a liquor known as “Currincho” are made artisanally in the area.

Ligia is 44 years old and is in a common-law relationship. She has three children. Two of them are adults and independent and the youngest, 8 years old, studies at school. Her partner is a professional driver and a cabinetmaker. They live in their own house. Ligia has a small food store at her house where she sells all types of products like rice, sugar, oil, detergent, vegetables, greens and fruits. She works every day from 6 am until 8 pm and sometimes later.

With this new loan she will buy cookies, flour, pasta, soft drinks, tuna, etc. Her dream is for her business to continue growing.
LOAN_USE: to buy cookies, flour, pasta, soft drinks, tuna, etc.

DESCRIPTION: Bakali aged 33 is a married man with three children who attend school. He is a motorcyclist in Jinja town, a business which has been his main source of income for five years. With the money he gets from this business, he provides for his family and also pay school fees for his children. However, his income has become insufficient to finance the ever increasing costs of living due to the fact he does not have any other side business. In a bid to increase his income, Bakali has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from UGAFODE to buy another motorcycle which he plans to hire out for a weekly fee of 60,000 UGX. This extra income will finance the daily family expenses which will better his family's livelihood. Bakali sends his gratitude to the funders for the financial support that will transform his family both economically and socially. He is described as a hardworking man by his friends.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Bakali aged 33 is a married man with three children who attend school. He is a motorcyclist in Jinja town, a business which has been his main source of income for five years. With the money he gets from this business, he provides for his family and also pay school fees for his children. However, his income has become insufficient to finance the ever increasing costs of living due to the fact he does not have any other side business. In a bid to increase his income, Bakali has applied for a loan of 1,800,000 UGX from UGAFODE to buy another motorcycle which he plans to hire out for a weekly fee of 60,000 UGX. This extra income will finance the daily family expenses which will better his family's livelihood. Bakali sends his gratitude to the funders for the financial support that will transform his family both economically and socially. He is described as a hardworking man by his friends.
LOAN_USE: To buy another motorcycle to increase his income.

DESCRIPTION:
María tiene 29 años de edad esta casada y tiene tres hijos en etapa escolar, Maria tiene una casa propia en la ciudad de El Alto - Bolivia. Maria se dedica a la elaboración de mantas de vicuña desde hace 4 años, tiene un horario de trabajo bastatnte sacrificado, Maria empieza a trabajar desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche de lunes a sábado; los días domingos se dedica a la comercialización de su producto en las ferias locales.
Es un trabajo bastatnte artesanal ya que es elaborado a mano, en la sociedad es bastante reconocida por la calidad y el valor por el gran esfuerzo en la elaboración de la manta. Dentro de la cultura boliviana existen bastantes tradiciones dentro las cuales estan las festividades en las cuales realizan bailes folkloricos, entre los cuales se destaca el baile de la morenada en el cual bailan mujeres de pollera que utilizan las mantas de vicuña ya que representa elegancia y formalidad; por lo que la producción de la señora María tiene una demanda muy alta por las fraternidades que bailan en las fiestas locales.
Es la primera vez que María solicita un prestamo y lo solicitó a traves de la Fundación Sartawi con el proposito de realizar la compra de una maquina Hiladora, con la que podrá incrementar su producción y podra minimizar tiempos. 
María tiene la ilusión de generar mayores ingresos para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad devida a su familia y poder brindarles una educación de calidad a sus 3 pequeños hijos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
María is 29 years old, married, and has three children in school. She has her own home in the city of El Alto, Bolivia.

María has been making vicuña blankets for four years. She has a demanding work schedule from 8 in the morning until 9 in the evening from Monday to Saturday. On Sundays she sells her product in the local markets.

It is artisanal work, made by hand, easily recognized in the community for quality and value because of the great effort in the making of the blanket. Within the Bolivian culture there are many traditions in which they perform folk dances, among which stand out the dance of the morenada where women dress in traditional polleras and use vicuña blankets to represent elegance and formality. This is why María’s production is in high demand from the fraternities that dance at local parties.

This is the first time that María has requested a loan. She has requested it through Fundación Sartawi for the purpose of buying a spinning machine with which she will be able to increase her production and save time.

María has a vision of generating more income to be able to offer a better quality of life to her family and to provide a quality education to her three young children.
LOAN_USE: to buy a spinning machine.

DESCRIPTION: Nebi is 42 years old and a refugee from Bilasuvar region. He is married and has a large family. He is the only one working in the family. Nebi is a hardworking man. He is trying to earn enough income by being a farmer who raises cattle and sheep. This way he takes care of his family's needs. He is very energetic and passionate about his job. There are many people in the local market who respect Nebi for his honesty and right principles over doing business. Nebi is a well-known farmer who does great job in meeting his customers' needs. He has a small shop where he brings natural meat to sell in the market. In the local market there aren't many people who can provide the real natural meat, which is why people like buying from Nebi. Due to growing demand in the market, because of peoples' preference to traditional food like kufta and bozbash, which consist of mutton and beef. Nebi is planning to expand. Currently he needs 1,200 AZN loan to buy three calves. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Nebi is 42 years old and a refugee from Bilasuvar region. He is married and has a large family. He is the only one working in the family. Nebi is a hardworking man. He is trying to earn enough income by being a farmer who raises cattle and sheep. This way he takes care of his family's needs. He is very energetic and passionate about his job. There are many people in the local market who respect Nebi for his honesty and right principles over doing business. Nebi is a well-known farmer who does great job in meeting his customers' needs. He has a small shop where he brings natural meat to sell in the market. In the local market there aren't many people who can provide the real natural meat, which is why people like buying from Nebi. Due to growing demand in the market, because of peoples' preference to traditional food like kufta and bozbash, which consist of mutton and beef. Nebi is planning to expand. Currently he needs 1,200 AZN loan to buy three calves. Hopefully Kiva lenders will support him.
LOAN_USE: to buy three calves.

DESCRIPTION: Aba S. is into the production and sale of kenkey at Amoanda near Elmina. (Kenkey is fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves.) She is a divorcee taking care of six dependents. Even though she is separated from her husband, her husband contributes to the education of her children. Her loan will be used to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save towards the university education of her children.
LOAN_USE: to buy more maize to prepare the kenkey she sells.

DESCRIPTION: Bruno a 42 ans. Sa femme travaille comme opératrice de saisie. Le couple a 3 enfants de 16 ans , en classe de première, 7 ans en classe de dixième et le dernier de 5 ans en douzième.\nBruno a comme source de revenu la vente de produits cosmétiques depuis 2012. Compte tenu de ses expériences, il connaît bien les produits les plus prisés par les clients, en outre, la marge bénéficiaire est élevée de beauté. Il est nécessaire de disposer d’un stock suffisant  pour satisfaire régulièrement les besoins des clients d’où l’objet de ce  prêt pour l'approvisionnement.Le but étant le développement de l'activité afin de constituer une épargne.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Bruno is 42 years old. His wife works as a data entry clerk. The couple has three children: the eldest is 16 years old and in first grade, the second seven years old and in tenth grade, and the youngest five years old and in 12th grade.

Bruno has been selling cosmetics to generate an income since 2012. Given his experience, he knows what the most popular products are with his customers, and furthermore, the profit margin for beauty products is high. He needs to have sufficient stock to meet the regular demand of his customers, and hence the request for this loan to get fresh supplies.

His aim is to boost his activity so he can build up some savings.
LOAN_USE: to buy perfumes, deodorants, masks, hair gel, creams and bubble baths for resale.

DESCRIPTION:
Eugenia is 47 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Eugenia has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming ginger.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Eugenia is 47 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of household goods to sell.

Eugenia has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from farming ginger.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy addditional stocks of household goods to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Living in a wooden house located in the Kandal district of Kandal Stoeng province, Ray is aged 62 years and a widow. She has three children.

To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee (as a dishwasher in a restaurant) for 21 years. The current business earns her about 35,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the sixth microloan for Ray with VisionFund. She is forming a new group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use loan portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Living in a wooden house located in the Kandal district of Kandal Stoeng province, Ray is aged 62 years and a widow. She has three children.

To make a living, she has been farming rice and working for others for a fee (as a dishwasher in a restaurant) for 21 years. The current business earns her about 35,000 KHR per day, and she manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day for future needs.

This is the sixth microloan for Ray with VisionFund. She is forming a new group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use loan portion to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to grow her business and earn a larger income to improve her standard of living.
LOAN_USE: to buy pesticides and fertilizers for her farmland

DESCRIPTION: 23 mujeres de Ciudad del Este se unieron con el objetivo de desarrollar el programa de mujeres emprendedoras de la Fundación Paraguaya. Como principal objetivo quieren generar mayores ingresos para sus familias e hijos, ya que la mayoría de las mujeres son madres solteras, jefas de familia. Además de la parte económica desean crecer cambien en lo personal. Actualmente se encuentran en el décimo ciclo, donde todas ellas trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y respeto.\nLA señora Yessica se dedica a la venta de Frutas, por medio de este trabajo puede mantenerse y mantener a su familia y darles así una vida digna y decorosa. Comenta que tiene todo tipo de frutas, por lo que atrae a muchos clientes, lo que por consiguiente le genera muy buenos ingresos. Una de sus metas es tener un propio local donde pueda tener su frutería y de esa forma ir creciendo en el mercado comercial.\nElla solicita el crédito para la compra de frutas, para abastecerse y de esa forma poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Piensa que de obtener el crédito, el mismo le será de mucha ayuda en sus proyectos. Agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le brinda.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
A group of 23 women in Ciudad del Este got together in an aim to develop the women entrepreneurs' program at the Fundación Paraguaya.  Their main goal is to generate more income for their families and children, since most of them are single mothers and heads of family.  Apart from their economic concerns they also want to grow personally.  They are now in their tenth cycle all working in an environment of cooperation and respect.

Ms. Yessica sells fruit and earns a living this way in order to support her family and give them a dignified, proper lifestyle.  She offers all kinds of fruit which attracts many customers, thereby generating a good income.  One of her goals is to have her own fruit shop so she can grow in the commercial aspect.

She is requesting a loan to buy fruit so she can meet customer demand.  The loan will help her greatly with her projects.  She is grateful to the Fundación for this opportunity.
LOAN_USE: To buy fruit to sell.
BORROWER_NAMES: Gilberta, Lice, Yessica Edith, Claudia, Agueda, Adela, Celia, Celia, Judith, Nelly, Daniela, Teodosia, Dionisia, Deolinda, Fátima, Zunilda, Delia, Elsa, Blanca, Alma, Mercedes, María, Rosa
BORROWER_GENDERS: female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female, female
BORROWER_PICTURED: true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, false, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true, true

DESCRIPTION: Daniel is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a taxi where he provides transportation services. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to service and maintain the taxi.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Daniel is a male Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a taxi where he provides transportation services. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to service and maintain the taxi.  He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees.
LOAN_USE: to service and maintain the taxi which he operates.

DESCRIPTION:
Hilola and her husband are pictured in this photo. Hilola is a polite woman. She was born in 1988 in Kanibadam, Tajikistan, is married, and doesn't have any children.

As a farmer she sows onions, potatoes, wheat, cotton and maize. This year she intends to sow onions on a hectare plot of land. She does her work very well and earns a good income. From her farming gains she feeds her family. She also deals in animal husbandry.

Her husband is a very kind man who always helps his wife in all activities. Sadly, Hilola lacks financial support. She has no money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers. She hopes, with support from Kiva lenders, she can fertilize the land for her onions and reap a good harvest close to her goal. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS. She awaits your support and mercy.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hilola and her husband are pictured in this photo. Hilola is a polite woman. She was born in 1988 in Kanibadam, Tajikistan, is married, and doesn't have any children.

As a farmer she sows onions, potatoes, wheat, cotton and maize. This year she intends to sow onions on a hectare plot of land. She does her work very well and earns a good income. From her farming gains she feeds her family. She also deals in animal husbandry.

Her husband is a very kind man who always helps his wife in all activities. Sadly, Hilola lacks financial support. She has no money to buy seeds, mineral fertilizers. She hopes, with support from Kiva lenders, she can fertilize the land for her onions and reap a good harvest close to her goal. With this aim, she is asking for a loan of 15,000 TJS. She awaits your support and mercy.
LOAN_USE: to buy mineral fertilizer and seeds.

DESCRIPTION:
Sulaima is a 32-year-old Syrian refugee. She is a married mother of four children. Sulaima works in preparing Mouneh (food preserved from one year to another).

Like most Syrians, Sulaima was obliged to leave her home country and look for a job to help her husband provide for their family. Today, Sulaima is acquiring a special Syrian refugee loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials to produce Mouneh.

Sulaima wished to expand her home-based business and improve it in a way that guarantees her children a better life.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Sulaima is a 32-year-old Syrian refugee. She is a married mother of four children. Sulaima works in preparing Mouneh (food preserved from one year to another).

Like most Syrians, Sulaima was obliged to leave her home country and look for a job to help her husband provide for their family. Today, Sulaima is acquiring a special Syrian refugee loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua to buy necessary raw materials to produce Mouneh.

Sulaima wished to expand her home-based business and improve it in a way that guarantees her children a better life.
LOAN_USE: to buy necessary raw materials to produce Mouneh (food preserved from one year to another) and sell it.

DESCRIPTION:
This is Sadbargul. She is 47 years old, married and a kind mother of four children. She lives with her family in Sarband district.

Sadbargul is a smart and talented woman. She runs her own business: she sews women\'s clothes and works from orders, at home. Sadbargul takes care of the household and works as a seamstress at the same time. She likes her activity for the daily earnings that it brings. Sadbargul makes her own living and helps her husband to provide for the family.

Nowadays, however, her old sewing machine doesn\'t fulfill some of its functions any more. For this reason, she has decided to take a loan. Sadbargul will use this loan to buy a new "Yamata" sewing machine and, with the rest of the money, some sewing supplies.

She thanks you in advance.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
This is Sadbargul. She is 47 years old, married and a kind mother of four children. She lives with her family in Sarband district.

Sadbargul is a smart and talented woman. She runs her own business: she sews women\'s clothes and works from orders, at home. Sadbargul takes care of the household and works as a seamstress at the same time. She likes her activity for the daily earnings that it brings. Sadbargul makes her own living and helps her husband to provide for the family.

Nowadays, however, her old sewing machine doesn\'t fulfill some of its functions any more. For this reason, she has decided to take a loan. Sadbargul will use this loan to buy a new "Yamata" sewing machine and, with the rest of the money, some sewing supplies.

She thanks you in advance.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a sewing machine and some sewing supplies.

DESCRIPTION: As a parent of two children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new fishing bundles for her fishing business. Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: As a parent of two children, Maricel works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.  Maricel is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy new fishing bundles for her fishing business. Maricel has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream, to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy new fishing bundles for her business.

DESCRIPTION: Mrs. Jesna D. is 44 years of age, married, and a resides in Baybay Triunfo, Ozamiz City. Her husband is presently enjoying his monthly pension, but still, this pension is not enough to support the daily needs of her family. She decided to open a Sari-sari Store to support her husband and children. She started this business with a capital of PHP 1,500 that she borrowed from one of her friends. She has now expanded into another type of business, which is the eatery business. She also owns and operates a motor cab for hire and is engaged in rice trading. She is applying for an amount of PHP 30,000 to add to the capital on her existing eatery, Sari-sari Store and rice trading businesses. Her future dream is to provide a better future for her children and she is planning to improve her business from an eatery to a restaurant.
LOAN_USE: Additional capital for her Eatery, Sari-sari Store and rice trading businesses.

DESCRIPTION:
Cecilia E. is a married woman who lives in Prk. Lerio, Brgy. Vito, Sagay City, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling religious articles, vegetable vending and running a general store.

Cecilia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1998 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 14 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Cecilia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, thus uplifting the family's standard of living.

This time, for her 15th loan, she is borrowing PHP 21,000 which she intends to use as additional capital for her religious articles business. Her goal is to continue to save up for their future, provide a good education for her children and to sustain their daily needs.

Cecilia E. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF:

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (dungganon is a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.
LOAN_USE: Additional working capital

DESCRIPTION:
Hello Kiva community!

Hyrine is a 38-year old mother of two children living in Nyamira, a land of seemingly never ending beauty. She is very progressive and determined to succeed. Through dairy and crop farming, she has been able to support her family. Hyrine has always had a passion for farming. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows that produce 10-15 litres of milk per day.

As a result of the fluctuation of prices for horticultural crops and the change in industrial trends, Hyrine is seeking a way out. She has decided to start selling cereals in her local market. However, with her little savings, she is unable to purchase different varieties of cereals such as maize, wheat, rice, sorghum and millet.

That is why she is seeking this Kiva loan. She promises to repay this loan as soon as her business breaks even.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Hello Kiva community!

Hyrine is a 38-year old mother of two children living in Nyamira, a land of seemingly never ending beauty. She is very progressive and determined to succeed. Through dairy and crop farming, she has been able to support her family. Hyrine has always had a passion for farming. She is a very proud farmer, especially when she is milking her cows that produce 10-15 litres of milk per day.

As a result of the fluctuation of prices for horticultural crops and the change in industrial trends, Hyrine is seeking a way out. She has decided to start selling cereals in her local market. However, with her little savings, she is unable to purchase different varieties of cereals such as maize, wheat, rice, sorghum and millet.

That is why she is seeking this Kiva loan. She promises to repay this loan as soon as her business breaks even.
LOAN_USE: to buy cereals to resell so that she can increase her income level to send her children to school and upgrade her living standards.

DESCRIPTION:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Imelda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF that she will use to buy additional boxes of fish for resale.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Imelda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Imelda requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF that she will use to buy additional boxes of fish for resale.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy fish for resale.

DESCRIPTION: DOÑA LETICIA DEL CARMEN ES UNA MUJER TRABAJADORA DE 58 AÑOS DE EDAD, SOLTERA, TIENE 3 HIJOS, ASALARIADA, EL CRÉDITO LO VA A UTILIZAR PARA REALIZAR MEJORAS EN SU CASA DE HABITACIÓN, SU META ES SER UNA MEJOR PERSONA.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Doña Leticia del Carmen is a hard-working woman at 58 years old.  She is single, has three children, and is a wage-earner.  She is going to use the loan to make improvements to her home.  Her goal is to become a better person.
LOAN_USE: to make improvements to her house.

DESCRIPTION:
Marialyn is 35 years old and married with four children who are all attending school.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marialyn has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marialyn is 35 years old and married with four children who are all attending school.

She earns a living by raising pig in the Philippines. Marialyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marialyn has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from farming rice.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

DESCRIPTION: A 35-year-old hard working woman by the name of Ellen, who attended school up to grade 10, is living together with her boyfriend and their five children. All of her children are in school  and for the past 12 years, Ellen has been selling goods at a  table in the market. According to her, she will use the money to buy rice, bouillon cubes, oil, soap, salt, onions, etc., to sell. She sometimes faces problems like high cost of goods and she transports her goods by bike to her business center and sells 12 hours per day. She started this business from her boyfriend's savings and learned this trade from her friend. She likes her business because it is profitable and she is proud because she is self employed. Her future plan is to have a shop and build a house.  She would like to thank the Brac partner.

She started this business from her boyfriend's savings and learned this trade from her friend. She likes her business because it is profitable and she is proud because she is self employed. Her future plan is to have a shop and build a house.  She would like to thank the Brac partner.
LOAN_USE: to buy rice, bouillon cubes, oil, soap, salt, onions, etc., to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Joel is a happily married man, who lives in Kisumu with his family. He is a pharmacist, who is devoted to his job and likes it. Joel has been operating a pharmacy for the last couple of years, and he has enjoyed its benefits. He sells all kinds of medication and delights in seeing his clients regain their health. He is a pharmacist by profession, and people have faith and confidence in his prescriptions.

Joel wants to grow his business and is requesting a loan of KES 50,000. He is using it to stock more medication to sell at his pharmacy. He will be in a position to serve his clients better and accord them the support they need. He will increase his profit, which he will use to pay back his loan. His dream is to expand his business and sell at wholesale.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

He is a pharmacist by profession, and people have faith and confidence in his prescriptions.

He will be in a position to serve his clients better and accord them the support they need. He will increase his profit, which he will use to pay back his loan. His dream is to expand his business and sell at wholesale.
LOAN_USE: to buy more medication to sell at his pharmacy.

DESCRIPTION: Esther is a single mother of one child and her child goes to school.  She doesn’t take care of additional family members.  She has a business of a beauty salon and has been in this business for 10 years. She has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more hair relaxers, weaves and braids. Her major business challenges include electricity and seasonality. She is aspiring to own a bridal salon and also to buy  aplot of land and build a house.  She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and no to piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

DESCRIPTION:
Meet again Hasmik, 35. Hasmik is from Yerevan town. She lives with her husband and two children (9 and 6 years old). She is involved in providing translation and paper writing work. Mostly, Hasmik receives her orders from students. She asks for her second Kiva loan now to pay for a more powerful laptop needed for writing term papers and translation. The current one she owns is damaged and it is difficult for Hasmik to work.

Hasmik's loan has been approved as a start up loan.
The start-up loan program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International, provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Hasmik hopes to receive lenders' support and continue her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Meet again Hasmik, 35. Hasmik is from Yerevan town. She lives with her husband and two children (9 and 6 years old). She is involved in providing translation and paper writing work. Mostly, Hasmik receives her orders from students. She asks for her second Kiva loan now to pay for a more powerful laptop needed for writing term papers and translation. The current one she owns is damaged and it is difficult for Hasmik to work.

Hasmik's loan has been approved as a start up loan.
The start-up loan program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and SEF International, provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. Hasmik hopes to receive lenders' support and continue her business.
LOAN_USE: to pay for a more powerful laptop needed for writing term papers and translation

DESCRIPTION: Mrs. Quyet is a hardworking woman, 49 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Mrs. Quyet is a hardworking woman, 49 years old. She is married and has four children. Her family’s income is mainly from small business and fishing. She would like to borrow the loan to build a latrine, which can help to improve the health of her family members. With support from her husband, she is able to repay the loan monthly.
LOAN_USE: To build the latrine to improve the health of her family

DESCRIPTION:
A. Abdurakhmon is 48 years old and is married with three children. Abdurakhmon has been a farmer since 2003. He grows vegetables such as potatoes, onions, and carrots. When it is growing season, he works in the field from early morning till late evening. Five years ago, Abdurakhmon started growing vegetables on a plot that was 0.10 hectares (about 1/4 acre). Currently he is growing onions on 0.50 hectares (about 1 1/4 acres). Now, when the business is stable, Abdurakhmon believes that it shall be the main income for him. He foresees additional expenses as his dearest children are growing up, and accordingly their expenses are rising.

\r\nHis beloved wife does whatever she can to help him, and together they have decided to increase the number of crops they plant so that they can generate a larger income. For this reason, Abdurakhmon requests 1000 Somoni (300 US dollars) for the term of 8 months. He is planning to purchase seeds, fertilizer, and combustive-lubricating materials for tools for growing his business. Abdurakhmon thanks everyone who trusts and supports him. He promises to pay the loan in a timely manner.
LOAN_USE: Purchase seeds, fertilizer, combustive-lubricating materials.

DESCRIPTION: I grew up in a family of educators, and came into my own education journey as an accidental educator. I thought I wanted to be a child life specialist, but decided this might not be best, when diagnosed with my own autoimmune issues. I worked in public education for a few years, but ultimately, my health and personal goals did not align well with public school. My favorite thing in my work now is seeing the progress students make in just a short time.  \r\nWhen I started out, I did not ever foresee it would be more than me working in the business, much less with all the services we offer now. I absolutely love creating new learning opportunities, and  seeing my team members now come up with new ideas to support student needs with just as much joy as I have.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: I grew up in a family of educators, and came into my own education journey as an accidental educator. I thought I wanted to be a child life specialist, but decided this might not be best, when diagnosed with my own autoimmune issues. I worked in public education for a few years, but ultimately, my health and personal goals did not align well with public school. My favorite thing in my work now is seeing the progress students make in just a short time.  \r\nWhen I started out, I did not ever foresee it would be more than me working in the business, much less with all the services we offer now. I absolutely love creating new learning opportunities, and  seeing my team members now come up with new ideas to support student needs with just as much joy as I have.
LOAN_USE: to purchase equipment for recording live video lessons, purchasing of editing software, and an accessible portal for families to log in and engage in live lessons, and lastly, pay instructors to create/teach the lessons.
TAGS: user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset, #Technology, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Schooling, user_favorite, #Woman Owned Biz, user_favorite

DESCRIPTION: Verónica, de 29 años está casada con Heber quien es padre de sus 03 hijos, juntos viven en su casa propia. El negocio de Verónica consiste en el alquiler de mototaxis, a diario van a su casa dos personas en busca de alquilarle sus unidades móviles. Lleva realizando éste negocio hace más de 03 años y le ha permitido tener un ingreso adicional ya que también trabaja como personal administrativo en una municipalidad de la ciudad. Le está yendo bien en su negocio y al mismo tiempo en su trabajo ya que percibe dos ingresos y eso le permite tener algunas comodidades en su hogar al mismo tiempo de apoyar a sus hijos quienes aun están estudiando y necesitan de bastantes materiales para poder realizar sus estudios de manera adecuada. Espera poder seguir haciendo éste negocio, para más adelante incrementar su flota con algunos vehículos. Este es su primer préstamo con Kiva, por tanto está muy contenta de saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio.  Además está muy comprometida en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas. Con el monto solicitado de S/.800 soles, comprará piezas y repuestos para el mantenimiento de sus vehículos que se encuentran deteriorados por el uso constante y el paso del tiempo.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Verónica, 29 years old, is married to Heber, who is father of their three children. They live together in their own home. Verónica's business consists of mototaxi rentals. Every day, two people come to her home to rent her vehicles. She has been running this business for more than 3 years, and it has allowed her to bring in additional income, as she also works as administrative staff in one of the city's municipalities. 

It works well for her to have her business and her job at the same time, as her two incomes allow her to have a few amenities in her home at the same time as supporting her children, who are still in school and need quite a few supplies to be able to do their schoolwork properly. She hopes to continue with this business, to later increase her fleet with a few more vehicles. 

This is her first loan with Kiva, and she is very happy to know that she has some financial support, as this way she feels sure she can advance her business. As well, she is very committed to making her repayments. With the requested 800 soles, she will purchase replacement parts for the maintenance of her vehicles, which have deteriorated over time due to constant use.
LOAN_USE: to purchase replacement parts for her mototaxi.

DESCRIPTION: Agnès a 46 ans, elle n'est pas mariée. Elle a un enfant scolarisé à sa charge.\nAgnès vend des vêtements friperies depuis 2013. Le facteur clé de succès de la vente de friperies est l’existence de produits de qualité en quantité suffisante. L’expérience aidant,  elle a acquis des compétences dans le choix des balles. Le présent prêt vise à augmenter le stock des vêtements friperies.Outre la réussite de son enfant,le but étant de pouvoir constituer une épargne .
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Agnès is 46. She is unmarried and supports one school-aged child. Agnès has been selling secondhand clothing since 2013. The key factor in the success of secondhand clothing, is having a sufficient quantity of quality products. Thanks to her experience in this field, she has acquired great competence in the choice of bundles. This loan aims to increase her stock of secondhand clothing. In addition to the success of her child, her aim is to make savings.
LOAN_USE: to buy a bundle of secondhand clothing.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of three children, Lie works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Lie is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of different fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of three children, Lie works hard to support her family. She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store.

Lie is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF to buy additional boxes of different fish to sell for her fish vending business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 26 loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy additional boxes of different fish to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Calal is a 36-year-old married man. He is a refugee and lives in an Internally Displaced Persons settlement. He has been a farmer raising fruit trees and selling fruit at the local bazaar for almost 9 years. Fresh fruits are very useful for people’s health because they include many vitamins. People know this and buy fruit more often than other foods and products. They prepare different sweets, jams, etc.

Calal's monthly income is 230 AZN, but this is not enough for him to make his hard life better. That’s why he works additionally as a laborer when he has the time.

Calal is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops. Vegetable gardening is big business for many rural farmers in this region. Calal grows vegetables on his small farm to sell at one of the roadside markets. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for this loan.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Calal is a 36-year-old married man. He is a refugee and lives in an Internally Displaced Persons settlement. He has been a farmer raising fruit trees and selling fruit at the local bazaar for almost 9 years. Fresh fruits are very useful for people’s health because they include many vitamins. People know this and buy fruit more often than other foods and products. They prepare different sweets, jams, etc.

Calal's monthly income is 230 AZN, but this is not enough for him to make his hard life better. That’s why he works additionally as a laborer when he has the time.

Calal is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN so that he can obtain a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops. Vegetable gardening is big business for many rural farmers in this region. Calal grows vegetables on his small farm to sell at one of the roadside markets. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for this loan.
LOAN_USE: to buy a water pump to irrigate and expand his vegetable crops.

DESCRIPTION:
Jocelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Jocelyn is 37 years old, and all four children are sent to school.

Jocelyn has a fish-vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more fish to sell.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

Jocelyn has been in this business for seven years. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more fish to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Jennifer works hard to support three children. She is single and has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

She is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jennifer works hard to support three children. She is single and has a manicure and pedicure services business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to build a sanitary toilet for her family.

She is aware that by using the sanitary toilet, she is reducing health and hazard risks to her family and neighbors as well as promoting environment protection.
LOAN_USE: to build a sanitary toilet for her family

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Eni, who is a 44-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband sells vegetables. 

Eni has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water sources at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Eni will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KPP-UMKM’s clients, Eni, who is a 44-year-old married woman with one son and one daughter. She is a housewife and her husband sells vegetables. 

Eni has asked for a loan of IDR 5,000,000 from KPP-UMKM Syariah. This loan will be used to build water sources at their home to improve access to water and sanitation for their family. Her family income is insufficient to build toilets and water sources, but Eni will be able to repay the loan received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation and clean water. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
LOAN_USE: to build water sources at her home to improve water access and sanitation for her family.

DESCRIPTION: Miorasoa vous remercie pour le précédent prêt avec lequel elle a pu diversifier les produits dans l'épicerie. Son commerce marche bien et le bénéfice commence à s'accroître. Outre l'épargne constitué,le bénéfice tiré de l'activité a été réinjecté dans l'unité .Afin d'économiser plus de temps lors de l'approvisionnement et d'éviter les fréquents déplacements aux fournisseurs, il est nécessaire d'avoir suffisamment de capital d'où cette demande de renouvellement de prêt. Ce prêt va lui permettre d'acheter divers produits supplémentaires tel que le riz, le sucre et la farine, ainsi que des boissons non alcoolisées.Elle projette acheter un terrain pour plus tard.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Miorasoa thanks you for her previous loan which enabled her to diversify the range of products in her grocery store. Her business is doing well and profits are starting to increase. Beyond the savings amassed, the profits from this business have been re-invested.

In order to save time during procurement and to avoid frequent trips to suppliers, it is necessary to have sufficient capital - thus her request to renew her loan. This loan is going to enable Miorasoa to purchase a variety of additional products such as rice, sugar and flour, as well as non-alcoholic beverages.

Miorasoa plans to purchase land in the future.
LOAN_USE: to purchase non-alcoholic beverages and staple goods.

DESCRIPTION: María tiene 50 años de edad, es casada, tiene 2 hijos de 18 y 8 años. Viven en Pedernales, la mitad de la casa se destruyó, el negocio que tenía era una tienda de abarrotes y perdió la mayor parte los productos que vendía. Están actualmente viviendo en una carpa que arreglaron en el terreno que estaba la tienda. Su esposo está trabajando como mecánico ya que no les alcanza el dinero y han pasado dificultades económicas. Con el nuevo crédito de la Fundación Espoir va a comprar productos para la tienda, así continuar con el negocio y mejorar la economía de su hogar.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: María is 50 years old, married, and has 2 children, ages 18 and 8. They live in Pedernales, half of the house was destroyed, the business that she had was a grocery store and she lost the larger part of the products that she sold. Currently, they are living in a tent that they set up on the land where the store was. Her husband is working as a mechanic since they don't have enough money and they have experienced economic difficulties. With the new loan from Fundación Espoir, she will purchase products for the store, so to continue with the business and improve the household economy.
LOAN_USE: to purchase groceries.

DESCRIPTION:
Oscar es una persona de 30 años de edad, posee cultivos de alimentos, de esta manera ha conseguido los recursos económicos necesarios para sostener a su familia en el municipio de Tierralta. 
Su pujanza y empeño le han permitido salir adelante, aun sobrepasando las adversidades que se le presentan por diferentes factores externos que afectan sus cultivos directamente, en especial cuando hay temporada de invierno que le daña sus cultivos.
 Actualmente solicita el crédito con el fin de invertirlo en la compra de electrobomba, insumos para el cultivo, de esta forma podrá darle continuidad a su labor y podrá obtener una cosecha mucho más productiva, dando como resultado un incremento en sus ventas. 

If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia.
"
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Oscar is 30 years of age. He grows food crops. In this way, he has obtained the financial resources necessary to sustain his family, living in the municipality of Tierralta.

His strength and effort have permitted him to get ahead, overcoming the adversities that he has faced from external sources. These have affected his crops directly, and damage them especially in the winter.

He requests a loan in order to invest in the purchase of an electric pump and inputs for cultivation. In this way, he will be able to continue his work and to be able to obtain a more productive harvest, with a resulting increase in his sales.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
If you want to know more about the entrepreneurs and the loans from Interactuar, you can join the Lending Team called: “Friends of Interactuar Colombia”: http://www.kiva.org/team/interactuar_colombia.
LOAN_USE: to buy an electric pump and inputs for cultivation, to be able to continue with his work.

DESCRIPTION:
Peter is 57 years old. He is married and blessed with 5 adult children. He has been a cash crop farmer for 15 years and it has been profitable.

This is his 5th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

Peter will use his generated profits to pay the college fees for his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business, be financially stable, and have a happy family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Peter is 57 years old. He is married and blessed with 5 adult children. He has been a cash crop farmer for 15 years and it has been profitable.

This is his 5th loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully repaid his previous loans. He will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers for use in his farm and hopes this will enable him to get more farm produce to sell.

Peter will use his generated profits to pay the college fees for his children. His future hopes and dreams are to expand his farming business, be financially stable, and have a happy family.
LOAN_USE: to purchase seeds and fertilizers for use in his farm.

DESCRIPTION: Juana es una mujer con grandes aspiraciones en la vida, ella por muchos años se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa típica por ese motivo ella realizo una inversión en su negocio de ropa, afortunadamente esto contribuyo a mejorar y satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes. Juana con el afán de seguir creciendo con su negocio ahora busca un nuevo crédito que lo invertirá en la compra de más ropa típica como: güipiles, fajas y cortes. El mayor anhelo de Juana es conseguir el préstamo para mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.\n\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Juana is a woman with great aspirations in life. For many years, she has worked selling traditional clothing. For that reason, she made an investment in her clothing business. Fortunately, it contributed to improving her business and better satisfying the needs of her customers.

With the desire to continue growing her business, Juana is now seeking a new loan, which she will invest in the purchase of more traditional clothing, such as blouses, belts, and skirts. Juana’s greatest desire is to acquire the loan in order to improve her family’s living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to purchase and then sell traditional clothing, such as blouses, belts and skirts.

DESCRIPTION: Rachel is 21 years old and single. She sells foodstuffs, and she has requested the loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. With the profits, she will reinvest in the business.
LOAN_USE: To buy more foodstuffs to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
As a married parent of three children, Honey Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Honey Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Honey Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
As a married parent of three children, Honey Jane works hard to support her family.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Honey Jane is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Honey Jane has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF.

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business and to continue to send her children to school.
LOAN_USE: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
María Felicita es una madre de familia de 32 años de edad que vive junto a su familia en el sector Cultambo del distrito de San José, una zona eminentemente agrícola situada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, región La Libertad, ubicada a mas de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas y caballeros en un pequeño establecimiento situado en su domicilio, ella adquiere su mercadería en la capital de su región (la ciudad de Trujillo) y la ofrece en venta a sus vecinos y conocidos, para asegurarse la demanda de sus clientes también trabaja en base a pedidos. Este negocio le sirve para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos familiares ya que los ingresos que percibe como obrero no son suficientes para mantenerlos.

María desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de mas mercadería para poder ampliar sus ventas y percibir mayores ganancias que le permitan sacar a su familia adelante. Para lograr su objetivo ella ha creído pertinente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles.

Ella es una mujer responsable y trabajadora, su mayor anhelo es seguir adelante con su negocio para poder mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. En la zona donde vive ella es muy conocida y respetada.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
María Felicita is 32 years old and the mother. She lives with her family in the Cutambo sector, within the San Jose district. Cutambo is mainly an agricultural zone, situated within the Pacasmayo province, in the La Libertad region, located more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. She sells men’s and women’s clothing in a small shop located within her home. She buys her merchandise in the region’s capital (city of Trujillo) and offers it for sale to her neighbors and acquaintances. In order to ensure that she meets her customers’ needs, she also takes orders. This business allows her to help her husband with the family expenses, because the money he earns as a laborer is not enough to sustain them. María wants to expand her business by buying more merchandise to increase her sales and her income. This will permit her to move her family ahead. In order to meet her objective, she has seen fit to request her first loan of 700 PEN ($250) through Edpyme Alternativa. She is a very hard working and responsible woman. Her greatest desire is to move ahead with her business in order to improve her family’s quality of life. She is very well known and respected within her zone.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer
LOAN_USE: Clothing for resale
TOWN_NAME: Cultambo - San José - Pacasmayo - La Libertad

DESCRIPTION: Анор замечательная женщина из Яванского  района. Она замужем и мать двоих детей. Муж Анор работает учителем в своем районе. Так как его зарплаты не хватает на обеспечение семьи, Анор хочет помочь мужу и внести свой вклад в семейный бюджет. Она хочет приобрести несколько голов скота и начать животноводческий бизнес. К сожалению, у неё нет для этого достаточных денег. Поэтому она обратилась за кредитом и надеется, что ей не откажут. Анор очень хочет поддержать мужа.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Anor is a wonderful woman from the Yavan district. She is married and the mother of two children. Anor's husband works as a teacher in their district. As his salary is not enough to support the family, Anor wants to help her husband and add income into to the family budget. She wants to buy several head of livestock and start a livestock business. Unfortunately, she does not have enough money. Therefore, she has applied for a loan and is hoping that you won't refuse her. Anor very much wants to support her husband.
LOAN_USE: to buy livestock and start a business.

DESCRIPTION: Metohoun est une femme mariée de 37 ans qui vit avec quatre enfants à charge à Vakpossito. Metohoun est une revendeuse de pâte de maïs bandée qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois du nécessaire au marché. Elle revend sa nourriture en face de son domicile . Pour avoir une production importante et maximiser son profit afin de répondre à nombreuse attentes de ses clients, Metohoun sollicite ce crédit pour commander des sacs de maïs, des paniers de piment et des cartons de poisson en vue de gagner des bénéfices pour venir en aide à  son mari aux diverses charges quotidiennes éprouvées par la famille
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Metohoun is a married woman of 37 who lives with her four children in Vakpossito. Metohoun is a vendor of corn mash which she stocks up on twice a month at the market. She resells her food in front of her home.

In order to have a steady production and maximize her profits, and in order to respond to her many clients Metohoun solicits this loan, which she will use to purchase bags of corn, baskets of peppers, and cartons of fish to increase her revenue.

Her profits will allow her to help her husband pay for the daily expenses of the family.
LOAN_USE: to buy 04 bags of corn, 01 basket of peppers, and 01 carton of fish.

DESCRIPTION:
Margie is 39 years old and single. She has two children, who are both in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Margie has been in raising pigs for three years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Margie is 39 years old and single. She has two children, who are both in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Margie has been in raising pigs for three years now, and she has borrowed from NWTF three times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs

DESCRIPTION:
Beatrice lives in a rural setting with her family. She sells second-hand clothes in the open markets, but also has a cow that she milks and sells the milk to the local community for extra income.

The previous loan has improved her business, however, her income streams are still small and she would like to boost her clothes business, so she requested a loan of 600,000 UGX that she will use to purchase a bale of clothes. The proceeds from the sale of clothes will finance her children's education.

Beatrice appreciates the lenders for their financial support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Beatrice lives in a rural setting with her family. She sells second-hand clothes in the open markets, but also has a cow that she milks and sells the milk to the local community for extra income.

The previous loan has improved her business, however, her income streams are still small and she would like to boost her clothes business, so she requested a loan of 600,000 UGX that she will use to purchase a bale of clothes. The proceeds from the sale of clothes will finance her children's education.

Beatrice appreciates the lenders for their financial support.
LOAN_USE: to purchase a bale of clothes to sell to boost her income and support her family.

DESCRIPTION: Rubiel de 48 años de edad, es un campesino, esmerado y pujante. Su familia es su eje central y la razón por la que lucha diariamente a fin de garantizarle mejores condiciones de vida. Se dedica al cultivo de tomate árbol, papa criolla y fríjol, productos que comercializa en la plaza de mercado de su localidad. Hoy se encuentra recurriendo a un crédito con el fin de comprar insumos para el abono de sus cultivos  y químicos como fungicidas e insecticidas para sacar una producción de mejor calidad.\nAsegura que su gran reto es que sus productos permanezcan en el mercado a pesar de las fluctuaciones de los precios, lo que lo ha conllevado a tener pérdidas. Espera mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia y garantizarles a sus cuatro hijos una buena educación.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: 48-year-old Rubiel is a strong, conscientious farmer.  His family are his main focus in life and the reason why he works hard every day, so that he can provide them with better living conditions.  Rubiel grows tree tomatoes, creole potatoes and beans.  He sells these crops in the market square in his town.  He is requesting this loan to buy inputs for his crops: natural fertilizers and also chemicals such as fungicides and insecticides, to ensure a better quality harvest.\r\n\r\nRubiel says that his biggest challenge is keeping his produce in the market in spite of price fluctuations.  This has led to him making some losses.  He hopes to improve his family's quality of life and to guarantee his four children a good education.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers, fungicides and insectides

DESCRIPTION:
Marlita is 57 years old and has six children. Marlita is married and has one child currently in school.

Marlita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marlita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marlita has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Marlita is 57 years old and has six children. Marlita is married and has one child currently in school.

Marlita is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Marlita requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Marlita has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marlita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.
LOAN_USE: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

DESCRIPTION:
Yanci es soltera, vive con su mamá y su hija de un año de edad, la cual es su dependiente. También comenta que si tiene familiares en el extranjero. Yanci tiene un negocio de venta de poleada y atoles. Trabaja de lunes a sábado de 7 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. Dicho negocio lo aprendió de su mamá y lo realiza desde hace 8 años.
El préstamo lo estará invirtiendo en la compra de arroz, azúcar, cacao en polvo, entre otros materiales que necesita para preparar la venta de poleada y atoles. Esta inversión le ayudara a comprar toda la materia prima para la fabricación de sus productos. Con esto busca generar más ventas e ingresos que le ayuden a estabilizar la economía familiar.
Su aspiración es hacer crecer el negocio y tener un local adecuado donde puedan llegar sus clientes a degustar sus productos, también desea dar una mejor calidad de vida a su hija y ayudarle en su educación.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Yanci is single and lives with her mother and one-year old daughter, who is her dependent. She also says that she has relatives abroad. She has a business selling poleada [a hot drink made from milk and flour] and atoles [a thick corn paste-based drink]. She works from 7 am to 6 pm from Monday to Saturday. She learned this business from her mother and has been doing it for eight years.

She will use this loan to buy rice, sugar, cocoa powder, and other ingredients to make and sell poleada and atoles. This loan will help her buy all the raw material she needs to make her products. She is looking to generate more sales and income, which will help to stabilize her household finances.

Her dream is to grow her business and have a suitable shop where her customers can come and try her products. She also wants to give a better quality of life to her daughter and help her with her education.
LOAN_USE: to buy rice, sugar, cocoa powder, and other ingredients she needs to make and sell poleada and atoles.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders!

Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Amimah. She is 46 years old and married with one daughter and two sons. Amimah is a housewife and looks after her three children. Her husband has been working as a fish trader in the Tangerang District for five years. Her husband is the only breadwinner in the family. Still, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create a happy and healthy life for their children.

Amimah has asked for a loan of 1,600,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to build a clean water source facility at her home to improve access to water sources for her family. Currently her family have no access to a water source in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a water source but Amimah will be able to repay the loan received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean water. Amimah is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank to all lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders!

DESCRIPTION: Peter is 56 years old. He is happily married and has been blessed with 4 children. His wife is a dairy farmer while he runs a metal shop to provide for his family. Peter is seeking a loan that will enable him to buy a new welding machine for his metal shop. This will boost his production and boost his profits which will enable him to pay back his loan. Peter is a good steward who has repaid previous loans well. His dream is to educate his children and lift the standard of living for his family.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Peter is 56 years old. He is happily married and has been blessed with 4 children. His wife is a dairy farmer while he runs a metal shop to provide for his family. Peter is seeking a loan that will enable him to buy a new welding machine for his metal shop. This will boost his production and boost his profits which will enable him to pay back his loan. Peter is a good steward who has repaid previous loans well. His dream is to educate his children and lift the standard of living for his family.
LOAN_USE: to buy a new welding machine for his welding shop.

DESCRIPTION:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Aap Afiah. She is 45 years old and married with one daughter and one son. She has been running a grocery shop from home for ten years. Her husband has been working as an entrepreneur in the Pandeglang District for fifteen years. Still, their income is barely enough to provide for their basic needs. They would like to improve their living conditions and create happy and healthy lives for their children.

Today Aap Afiah’s family has no access to a water source in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a water source but she will be able to repay the loan received. Aap Afiah has asked for a loan of 10,000,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to build a satellite pump to get clean water for her family.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Good day lenders! Meet one of KBMI’s clients, Aap Afiah. She is 45 years old and married with one daughter and one son. She has been running a grocery shop from home for ten years.
