They would like to improve their living conditions and create happy and healthy lives for their children.

Today Aap Afiah’s family has no access to a water source in their home and must rely on the river for bathing. Her family income is insufficient to build a water source but she will be able to repay the loan received. Aap Afiah has asked for a loan of 10,000,000 Indonesian rupiahs (IDR) from KBMI. This loan will be used to build a satellite pump to get clean water for her family.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with clean water. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.
LOAN_USE: to build a satellite pump to get clean water for her family.

DESCRIPTION: Sumanben, is a 49-year-old married woman residing in Dahod district, Gujarat. She is engaged in a grocery business. She sells chocolates, biscuits, sugar, rice, pulses, tea, etc. in her grocery store. She has a household of 5 members and a monthly income of 30,000 INR. She wants to purchase more chocolates, biscuits, sugar, rice, tea, etc. to sell in the local market and to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 INR from Prayas, one of Milaap's field partners. She wants to invest the loan amount to purchase more stock of chocolates, biscuits, etc. to increase the sale of products in the local area. She and her family will be thankful to their lenders.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Sumanben, is a 49-year-old married woman residing in Dahod district, Gujarat. She is engaged in a grocery business. She sells chocolates, biscuits, sugar, rice, pulses, tea, etc. in her grocery store. She has a household of 5 members and a monthly income of 30,000 INR. She wants to purchase more chocolates, biscuits, sugar, rice, tea, etc. to sell in the local market and to expand her business. She has applied for a loan of 15,000 INR from Prayas, one of Milaap's field partners. She wants to invest the loan amount to purchase more stock of chocolates, biscuits, etc. to increase the sale of products in the local area. She and her family will be thankful to their lenders.
LOAN_USE: to expand her grocery business by selling more chocolates, biscuits, etc.

DESCRIPTION:
Muzean's husband was a carpenter, managing his own business until health \u200ereasons forced him to stop. Muzean always helped out in the business, located \u200eon the top floor of their home, but then she took the time to learn carpentry skills \u200eand keep working with other larger carpentry and furniture businesses in the \u200earea. These businesses used Muzean's services for certain orders and \u200eproducts. Muzean was determined to keep her business earning money, and \u200ewhile she was known as the lone woman working in a man's business field, \u200eshe has succeeded in continuing services to larger businesses and developing \u200ea private customer base as well.\u200e

Muzean needed this loan to assist in buying a used coloring oven for her \u200epieces.\u200e

Muzean wants to continue to see her business grow. She registered the \u200ebusiness in October of this year and is looking to expand her customer base \u200eand ensure her children each finish their education.\u200e
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Muzean's husband was a carpenter, managing his own business until health \u200ereasons forced him to stop. Muzean always helped out in the business, located \u200eon the top floor of their home, but then she took the time to learn carpentry skills \u200eand keep working with other larger carpentry and furniture businesses in the \u200earea. These businesses used Muzean's services for certain orders and \u200eproducts. Muzean was determined to keep her business earning money, and \u200ewhile she was known as the lone woman working in a man's business field, \u200eshe has succeeded in continuing services to larger businesses and developing \u200ea private customer base as well.\u200e

Muzean needed this loan to assist in buying a used coloring oven for her \u200epieces.\u200e

Muzean wants to continue to see her business grow. She registered the \u200ebusiness in October of this year and is looking to expand her customer base \u200eand ensure her children each finish their education.\u200e
LOAN_USE: to buy a used coloring oven for her \u200epieces
TAGS: user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Biz Durable Asset, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Woman Owned Biz

DESCRIPTION:
María, está acompañada,  actualmente ella vive junto a su compañero de vida y su hija, la cual depende de ella económicamente. María se dedica a la venta de pupusas, negocio que aprendió gracias a su madre, ella atiende su negocio desde las 3:00 p.m. hasta las 7:00 p.m., todos los días de la semana y es de ahí donde ella lleva el sustento a su hogar.
María solicita un crédito para poderlo invertir en la compra de verduras, con el objetivo de ampliar su negocio con la incorporación de un nuevo rubro y atender a nuevos clientes, espera le sea de utilidad para aumentar sus ventas y generara más ganancias para la manutención de su familia.
El sueño de María es poder crecer como microempresaria y cancelar a tiempo la deuda adquirida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
María is in a relationship and currently lives with her partner and their daughter who depends on her economically. María works selling pupusas, a business which she learned thanks to her mother. She runs her business from 3 p.m. to 7 p.m. every day of the week. This is how she supports her household.

María is requesting a loan to buy vegetables. Her goal is to grow her business by incorporating a new menu and acquiring new customers. She hopes that it will increase her sales and generate more earnings to support her family.

María's dream is to keep growing as a small business owner and to pay off the debt that she has acquired.
LOAN_USE: to buy vegetables.

DESCRIPTION:
Justin is a married man and he has two children. He describes himself as self-motivated. Justin operates a horticultural farm where he sells tomatoes and french beans. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

Justin will use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase additional farm inputs. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid his previous loans successfully. Justin will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Justin is a married man and he has two children. He describes himself as self-motivated. Justin operates a horticultural farm where he sells tomatoes and french beans. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

Justin will use this KES 40,000 loan to purchase additional farm inputs. This is his sixth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He repaid his previous loans successfully. Justin will use the anticipated profits to buy a dairy cow.
LOAN_USE: to purchase additional farm inputs

DESCRIPTION:
Godfrey is 35 years old and lives in Kabayanda a village in rural Lyantonde with his family. He has five children who all go to school. Their ages range from 5 to 13.

Godfrey has a shop, but he also supplements his income by growing and selling beans. The sale of beans especially helps him pay school fees. It was very hard for him to pay tuition for his children until he got a helping land from UGAFODE Microfinance, he therefore no longer tampers with his business capita.

Godfrey plans to buy more land with the next loan so that he can plant more beans. 

With the money he gets from this loan, he wants to buy more merchandise for the shop.
LOAN_USE: to purchase more merchandise for his shop.

DESCRIPTION:
La señora Genesis Katiuska y su familia viven en Manta ciudad visitada por muchos turistas que gustan de su deliciosa gastronomía.
Genesis es una joven mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta apoyara a su conyugue con los gastos de la casa, por este motivo  se dedica a venta de productos y zapatos por catálogo, recorre todos los días teniendo clientes fijos dejando a contado y acredito y cobrando semanalmente.
Este crédito es para comprar mercadería. Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Genesis Katiuska and her family live in Manta, a city visited by many tourists who like its delicious cuisine.

Genesis is a young hard-working woman who likes to support her spouse with the house expenses. For this reason she sells products and shoes by catalogue. She travels every day having regular clients who buy using cash and credit. She collects payment weekly.

This loan is to buy merchandise. Her dream is to have her own house.
LOAN_USE: to buy merchandise and thus offer more variety to her customers.

DESCRIPTION:
Mansueta is 38 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 3 children. She has a retail shop that sells a variety of dried fish. She has had this business for 4 years. 

She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy a stock of dried fish to sell. Mansueta is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy a stock of dried fish to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Merly is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Merly is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merly has been farming corn for 26 years and earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Merly is 46 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by farming corn in the Philippines. Merly is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Merly has been farming corn for 26 years and earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly to attain her dream of saving enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

DESCRIPTION: Reinaldo se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde hace 15 años. Su proyecto inició ya que él lo vio como una muy buena fuente de ingresos y también como una buena oportunidad.\n\nSolicita este préstamo para la compra de un terreno en el cual podrá cultivar el almácigo como lo ha venido haciendo pero con la tranquilidad de que lo hará en un terreno propio; con la ilusión de aumentar su producción para obtener un mayor ingreso económico y mejorar la calidad de vida de su esposa, sus hijos y la de él.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Reinaldo has worked in agriculture for 15 years. He began his plan because he saw it as a good source of income and also as a good opportunity.
\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t\t
He requests this loan to buy land in which he can plant a seedling nursery as he has been doing, but with the security of having it on his own land. He intends to increase his production to obtain greater income and to improve the quality of life of his wife, his children, and himself.
LOAN_USE: to buy land to plant a seedling nursery, to improve his harvests, increase his income, and improve his family's quality of life.

DESCRIPTION:
Saret, 45, is pictured first on the right and lives with her husband and two children in the Takeo province, Cambodia.

She is a rice farmer and has been cultivating rice as her main source of income since 1988, while her husband works as a construction worker to make profit. Her family is also supported by one of her children who works in the garment factory and one child who is in construction.

This family typically makes around 9 USD per day.

Due to a shortage of finance, Saret is the group leader of a three-member group that is requesting a loan with Kredit MFI. She will use her portion to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm, a purchase that she believes can increase her daily income.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Saret, 45, is pictured first on the right and lives with her husband and two children in the Takeo province, Cambodia.

She is a rice farmer and has been cultivating rice as her main source of income since 1988, while her husband works as a construction worker to make profit. Her family is also supported by one of her children who works in the garment factory and one child who is in construction.

This family typically makes around 9 USD per day.

Due to a shortage of finance, Saret is the group leader of a three-member group that is requesting a loan with Kredit MFI. She will use her portion to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm, a purchase that she believes can increase her daily income.
LOAN_USE: to purchase fertilizer for her rice farm.

DESCRIPTION: Alba esta solicitando un nuevo préstamo para fortalecer su negocio y mantenerse trabajando por un largo periodo de tiempo. Ella se dispondrá a comprar bebidas embazadas, además de chicharrones, quesillos, aceite, frijoles, para diversificar las especialidades de pupusas que ofrece a sus clientes.\nLos resultados de haber invertido el préstamo anterior en su negocio fueron positivos, debido a que se mantuvo trabajando en su negocio de pupusería, también le fue de ayuda para aumentar sus ventas e ingresos. Su núcleo familiar se mantiene igual y su situación económica ha mejorado.\n
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Alba is asking for a new loan in order to strengthen her business and keep working for a long period of time. She will be able to buy packaged drinks, as well as chicharrones [pork cracklings], cheeses, oil, and beans in order to diversify the pupusa specialties she offers her customers.

The results of having invested the previous loan in her business were positive, due to the fact that she kept working at her business selling pupusas. It also helped her to increase her sales and income. Her family unit is the same and her economic situation has improved.
LOAN_USE: to buy packaged drinks, as well as chicharrones [pork cracklings], cheeses, oil, and beans, in order to diversify the pupusa specialties she offers her customers

DESCRIPTION: Claudine, 30 years old, is married with two children between two months and two years old. They don`t go to school. She has been selling bananas for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for better future of the business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Claudine, 30 years old, is married with two children between two months and two years old. They don`t go to school. She has been selling bananas for the past three years. With the loan, she would like to buy more bananas for sale. The profit from the business will be used to reinvest in the business for better future of the business.
LOAN_USE: To buy more bananas to sell

DESCRIPTION:
Miguel es un padre de familia que en base de mucho esfuerzo ha logrado superarse tiene una linda familia con que vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Él con su deseo de mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia busca un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción pues hasta la fecha su familia no cuenta con un hogar digno, por ese motivo solicita un crédito con el cual comprara materiales como: cemento, cal, arena y block. Su mayor anhelo es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Miguel is the father of a family that, with a lot of effort, has managed to improve himself. He has a lovely family with whom he lives in a community in Solola.

With the desire to improve his family’s living conditions, he is looking for a loan which he will invest in the purchase of construction materials since until now his family has not had a decent home.

For this reason, he is requesting a loan with which he will purchase materials such as: cement, lime, sand, and concrete blocks. His greatest desire is to improve his family’s living conditions.
LOAN_USE: to purchase materials such as: cement, lime, sand, and cement blocks.

DESCRIPTION:
Mirvat is a 33-year-old married woman and is a mother of two beautiful children, who she works hard to provide for with the best living ever. Mirvat has been a hairdresser for 15 years; she is a hardworking woman with a very good reputation. Mirvat is very friendly with her customers; they enjoy her work and insist on supporting her to improve her business as much as she can.

Mirvat is an A. Majmoua borrower for the second time. Her previous loan helped in improving her business and her sociA. and financiA. situations. This time, Mirvat is requesting a loan from Kiva Partner A. Majmoua to make her children's dream come true. She intends to buy them their dream bedroom, instead of having to sleep on a mattress on the floor. She hopes this brings happiness to their hearts. 

Mirvat also hopes to expand her business through opening a speciA. faciA. department, in addition to tattoo and speciA. makeup departments.
LOAN_USE: to buy a bedroom for her children

DESCRIPTION:
Jessica is 45 years old, and married with three children. Jessica works hard to provide for her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and has been running this general store for 20 years. Jessica has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Jessica aspires to save enough money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Jessica is 45 years old, and married with three children. Jessica works hard to provide for her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines and has been running this general store for 20 years. Jessica has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Jessica aspires to save enough money to expand her business.
LOAN_USE: to buy more groceries to sell.

DESCRIPTION:
Leah is in her late 30's, married, and blessed with 1 child. She supports her family by operating a grocery store which sells soft drinks and food items. She's been running this business successfully for 4 years, and is happy that she makes good profit.

This will be Leah's 2nd loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Leah's’s previous loan, all of which has been repaid successfully, allowed her to increase her stock of cartons of soft drinks, and food items such as millet flour, maize flour and buckets of cocking oil for her business to grow. She used the profit earned for loan repayment and to cover household expenses.

Leah is applying for this loan to replenish out-of-stock items in her shop such as crates of soda, cartons of juice and water, ground nuts, beans, and rice.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Leah is in her late 30's, married, and blessed with 1 child. She supports her family by operating a grocery store which sells soft drinks and food items. She's been running this business successfully for 4 years, and is happy that she makes good profit.

This will be Leah's 2nd loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania. Leah's’s previous loan, all of which has been repaid successfully, allowed her to increase her stock of cartons of soft drinks, and food items such as millet flour, maize flour and buckets of cocking oil for her business to grow. She used the profit earned for loan repayment and to cover household expenses.

Leah is applying for this loan to replenish out-of-stock items in her shop such as crates of soda, cartons of juice and water, ground nuts, beans, and rice.
LOAN_USE: to replenish out-of-stock items in her shop such as crates of soda, cartons of juice and water, ground nuts, beans, and rice.

DESCRIPTION:
Mujahed, who appears in the photo, is a 28-year-old from Gaza Strip. He is a single man and lives with his parents. He is trying so hard to provide them all the things they need.

He works in tiles, and he earns a low income, barely enough for basic needs. It's the only source of income for his family.

He is taking a US dollar loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to buy a machine for tile-cutting for his work.

He hopes you will help him and fund his loan. He is very thankful for any help from you.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Mujahed, who appears in the photo, is a 28-year-old from Gaza Strip. He is a single man and lives with his parents. He is trying so hard to provide them all the things they need.

He works in tiles, and he earns a low income, barely enough for basic needs. It's the only source of income for his family.

He is taking a US dollar loan from Palestine for Credit and Development (FATEN) to buy a machine for tile-cutting for his work.

He hopes you will help him and fund his loan. He is very thankful for any help from you.
LOAN_USE: to buy a machine for tile-cutting for his work.
TAGS: user_favorite, user_favorite, user_favorite, #Supporting Family, #Biz Durable Asset, #Single

DESCRIPTION:
Fatima es comerciante en la venta de ropa, frutas y verduras, el cual desde hace once años vende, 
Su esposo tiene un pequeño taller de pintura automotriz, en donde siempre ha apoyado para el bien comun de la familia. cuando inicio su negocio lo hizo con el fin de poder ayudar  a su esposo con los gastos del hogar.
Lograndolo atravez de financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado, en donde el sesenta por ciento ha sido para infraestructura, logrando una mejor vivienda para sus hijos.
Con este nuevo prestamo comprara materiales de construccion para hacer pared del fondo de concreto para ir logrando toda la estructura de concreto. para comenzar la obra comprara: bloques, hierro, arena, cemento. El cual esta contenta por el bienestar y seguridad de su familia.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Fátima is a clothes, fruit and vegetable merchant; she’s been in business eleven years.  Her husband has a small car painting shop.  He has always helped support her for the family’s common good.  When she started the business she did so with the goal of helping her husband with household expenses.  She has attained this through Afodenic loans 60% of which have been for infrastructure attaining a better dwelling for her children.

She will use this new loan to buy building materials and supplies to erect a concrete wall at the rear thus attaining a totally concrete structure.  To start the project she will buy: concrete blocks, iron rods, sand and cement.  She is happy because of her family’s security and wellbeing.
LOAN_USE: to buy building materials and supplies to erect a concrete wall at the rear of her house.

DESCRIPTION:
Meet Fatmata, she is 40 years old, from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 5 children. In 2006, Fatmata established her retails business. She started her retails to create a means of survival. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase food containers, drinks and biscuits to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. Seemingly distinct businesses are often mixed in Sierra Leone, the idea being that a customer will come to purchase one thing but will leave having purchased another.

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Meet Fatmata, she is 40 years old, from Jui eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 5 children. In 2006, Fatmata established her retails business. She started her retails to create a means of survival. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase food containers, drinks and biscuits to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. Seemingly distinct businesses are often mixed in Sierra Leone, the idea being that a customer will come to purchase one thing but will leave having purchased another.

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

DESCRIPTION: Nil is a hardworking and industrious housewife who has sold  towels and placemats.  Sales have been slow because her products are handmade and it is hard for her to buy ready-made products. \r\n\r\nShe will use the loan to buy wholesale products to increase her stock and earn more income.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Nil is a hardworking and industrious housewife who has sold  towels and placemats.  Sales have been slow because her products are handmade and it is hard for her to buy ready-made products. \r\n\r\nShe will use the loan to buy wholesale products to increase her stock and earn more income.
LOAN_USE: to buy products.

DESCRIPTION:
Générose  fait partie du groupe  Tunagurane et  habite à  Bujumbura. Elle a 59 ans et est mariée à Damas, un cuisinier. Ensemble ils ont 7 enfants âgés de 10 à 38 ans, dont  3 étudient.
Elle a sous sa charge son père. 

Elle fait le commerce de tomates, aubergines, céleri  depuis  3 ans. 

Elle est  à son deuxième crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup   de  tomates, des  aubergines et des céleris à revendre pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait  acheter un véhicule, et voir se enfants étudient.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Générose is a member of the Tunagurane Group and lives in Bujumbura.  She is 59 years old and married to Damas, a cook.  Together, they have seven children aged from ten to thirty-eight years old.  Three of their children are still in school.  Générose is also responsible for her father.  

She has been selling tomatoes, aubergines and celery for three years.  This will be her second loan with the field partner, Turame.  It will increase her working capital and enable her to buy many tomatoes, aubergines and celery for resale.

In the coming years, Générose would like to buy a vehicle and see her children study.
LOAN_USE: to buy many tomatoes, aubergines and celery for resale.

DESCRIPTION: Rosa una emprendedora mujer de 50 años de edad soltera que se dedica a la venta de mariscos desde hace 19 años reside en vivienda propia. Con los ingresos de sus ventas ella mantiene su economia y desea seguir creciendo en su negocio e incrementar la cantidad de clientes que hasta la fecha se encuentran muy satisfechos con su servicio y calidad de producto por lo que ella solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: la compra de mas pescado, camarones, langostas, etc. para obtener una mejor calidad de vida.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Rosa is an unmarried female entrepreneur of 50 years of age who has been selling seafood for 19 years in her own dwelling. With the income from her sales she maintains her economy and she wishes to go on growing her business and to increase the number of customers who have been very satisfied with her service and product quality so far.

That´s why she is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in: the purchase of more fish, prawns, lobster, etc. to obtain a better quality of life.
LOAN_USE: to invest in: the purchase of more fish, prawns, lobster, etc. to obtain a better quality of life.

DESCRIPTION: Ricardo vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo, el es empleado de una empresa privada y gracias a lo que obtiene en su trabajo es como logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, el quiere mejora su casa construyendo un cuarto en el lugar que muestra la fotografía pero como no tiene suficiente capital para realizarlo por esa razón solicita un crédito para la compra de hierro, arena, ladrillo, cemento, pago de mano de obra entre otras cosas y asi el y su familia pueden vivir mas cómodos.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED: Ricardo lives in his own home with his wife and son. He is an employee at a private business and thanks to what he earns at his job, he is able to pay for the household expenses. He wants to improve his home by building a room in the area shown in the photograph, but since he doesn't have enough capital to do it, he is asking for a loan to buy iron, sand, bricks, and cement, as well as to pay for labor, among other things. This way, he and his family can live more comfortably.
LOAN_USE: to buy iron, sand, bricks, and cement, as well as to pay for labor.

DESCRIPTION:
Consolate is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 15 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Consolate is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past 15 years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of competition in her business.

With the loan, she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.
LOAN_USE: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

DESCRIPTION:
Cherry is 31 years old and married with two children. With both of her children in school, Cherry works very hard to provide for them.

Cherry runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Cherry has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, beverages, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:
Cherry is 31 years old and married with two children. With both of her children in school, Cherry works very hard to provide for them.

Cherry runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products, and other groceries.

Cherry has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as junk foods, beverages, biscuits, canned goods, etc.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.
LOAN_USE: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, junk foods, home care products and other groceries.

DESCRIPTION:
Eufemia is 37 years old and married with one child.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Eufemia is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Eufemia has been raising livestock for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.
DESCRIPTION_TRANSLATED:

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.
